The authors of the messages were reported to the police by the Hospital.

Narrative_Description: Maduro and regime's number two Cabello declaring Covid-19 was a US bio-plot to slow down Chinese economic growth.
Motive_Description: The Venezuelan government blames the US for the Covid-19 outbreak to undermine the US internationally and side with its historical ally, China.
Source_Description: Nicolas Maduro, Diosdado Cabello (the regime's number two), "Con el Mazo Dando" (TV show), Lechuginos (Mediaoutlet)
Summary: Venezuelan President Maduro and the regime's number two Cabello declared that Covid-19 was a biological attack pushed by the US and western allies to slow down Chinese economic growth. This thought was then spread by some famous TV shows websites, or Mediaoutlets.

Title: Huge text message campaigns spread coronavirus fake news
Narrative_Description: The story says that the US government was going to impose a mandatory two-week quarantine to the entire country.
Motive_Description: The only recognizable goal behind this message is to create panic and fear among US citizens.
Summary: Messages saying the US government was going to impose a two-week quarantine to fight the outbreak of Covid-19 were spread through WhatsApp in the US.

Title: Coronavirus epidemic - mapping outflow of Russian disinformation into Czech cyberspace
Narrative_Description: American, US patent 2003
Motive_Description: Russia spread the story to blame the US for the virus and spark anti-US sentiment in the Czech cyberspace.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Czech Republic, biological weapon, patent
Summary: Starting from an article on the website vipnoviny, an email has been circulating in the Czech cyberspace saying that the US government registered the coronavirus in 2003 and used it to attack China. Russia was behind the attack.

Title: No, una etiqueta del desinfectante Lysol no demuestra que “el coronavirus actual siempre ha existido” como dice un vídeo viral
Narrative_Description: The US is pushing news on COVID-19 to cover up Trump's trial
Motive_Description: Undermine US credibility
Summary: A video circulated in Spain about disinfectant Lysol being able to destroy Coronavirus. This, the man in the video claims, is proof that COVID-19 already existed and that the Mediawas reporting about it to cover up Donald Trump's [impeachment] trial.

Title: ¿El coronavirus se puede curar con un té de plantas medicinales?
Narrative_Description: Drinking herbal tea helps curing COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spread claim about herbal tea curing COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, plantas medicinales, María Alejandra Díaz Marín, biotecnología, frecuencias, Sirio Quintero
Summary: Congresswoman María Alejandra Díaz Marín posted a tweet thread calling Coronavirus 'bioterrorism' and advising medical herbs as a remedy. She cited Sirio Quintero (self-declared nanobiologist) for his studies on how the special frequencies of some infusions are able to cure the virus.

Title: L’audio Whatsapp di 16 minuti sull’origine complottista del coronavirus attribuito a Domenico Biscardi
Narrative_Description: The US and France spread the virus in Italy
Motive_Description: Undermine US and France's credibility
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Francia, America, Wuhan, laboratorio, Domenico Biscardi
Summary: A Whatsapp voice message circulated in Italy spreading conspiracy theories about the origin of Coronavirus. The speaker claimed that the virus was created in a lab in Wuhan, then spread in Italy by a French citizen on behalf of the US. The US would be thus punishing Italy for signing a MoU with China on the Belt and Road Initiative.

Title: The Other viral problem in the COVID-19 pandemic: online misinformation
Narrative_Description: Hairdryers and hot air as an effective measure against the virus.
Motive_Description: Efforts to spread false claims that hot air from hairdryers are effective against the virus.
Summary: Email blast with false remedies on COVID-19. Including "stomach acid kills the virus" and to "reduce alcohol content"

Title: Fact Check: No, clapping together at 5 pm during Janta curfew will not kill coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Clapping during the Janta curfew in India will kill the virus in the air.
Motive_Description: Efforts to spread false explanation of clapping at 5PM during the Janta curfew Modi implemented, where clapping will cause the vibrations to kill the virus in the air.
Summary: Modi implemented a Janta curfew (people's curfew) on Sunday, urged people to clap at 5PM. WhatsApp chain message sent around suggesting this clapping will "create a vibrabration in the air to destroy the virus"

Title: Coronavirus: Beware of false Nostradamus prophecy - THIS quatrain did not predict COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Nostradamus actually predicted the virus, over 400 years ago.
Motive_Description: Efforts to link Nostradamus predicting the virus 400 years ago.
Summary: WhatsApp message and Twitter posts suggesting Nostradamus predicted Coronavirus 500 years ago.

Title: Vegan Instagram accounts spread misinformation about COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Vegan groups or accounts saying the virus originated because we eat animals.
Motive_Description: Effort to push the vegan narrative that it is bad to eat animals, in order to help the vegan group's political battle
Summary: In a post on Instagram, an account called Cowspiracy pushed a message saying that Covid-19, as Ebola, started because we eat animals. The post was also flagged on Facebook. The same message was posted by Ed Winters, a vegan activist in the UK.

Title: Bat soup, dodgy cures and 'diseasology': the spread of coronavirus misinformation
Narrative_Description: Video showing the Chinese celebrity Wang Mengyun eating a bat in a restaurant, the alleged source of the virus
Motive_Description: Effort to discredit the Chinese celebrity Wang Mengyun and blame her for the outbreak of the virus
Source_Description: General public, Paul Joseph Watson (Youtuber), Daily Maily, RT
Summary: A video showing  the Chinese celebrity Wang Mengyun eating a bat in a restaurant was shared, claiming she was eating the bat in a restaturan in Wuhan before the outbreak of the virus, and claiming that was the origin of Covid-19. However, the video, even if real, was filmed in 2016 in Micronesia.

Title: Bat soup, dodgy cures and 'diseasology': the spread of coronavirus misinformation
Narrative_Description: Jordan Sather tweeting that the virus was created by the Gates Foundation and spread to weaken Trump
Motive_Description: Effort to discredit the Bill Gates Foundation and support Trump
Summary: Jordan Sather posted a message on Twitter saying that the outbreak of coronavirus was timed to coincide with the beginning of the Trump presidency. He referred to a coronavirus patent granted to a firm, Pirbright, tied with the Bill & Melissa Gates Foundation.

Title: The Wuhan coronavirus has nothing to do with 5G
Narrative_Description: The virus originated in Wuhan because of the presence of 5G, Stynes Robert shared on Facebook
Motive_Description: Effort to claim that Covid-19 spread where 5G was introduced
Summary: A post was shared on Facebook that the virus originated in Wuhan because of the presence of 5G, which harms the immune system of the citizens.

Title: Bat soup, dodgy cures and 'diseasology': the spread of coronavirus misinformation
Narrative_Description: Anti-vaxxers and natural medicine groups saying that oregano oil, salt water and Vitamin C are good remedies against the virus.
Motive_Description: Effort to claim that some natural remedies are good to fight the virus, pushing a pro-natural medicine idea.
Source_Description: General public (anti-vaxxers and natural medicine groups)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, remedies, oregano oil, vitamin C, salt water
Summary: Posts were shared by individuals from natural medicine or anti-vaxxers groups claiming that oregano oil, vitamin C and salt water are good remedies against the virus.

Title: QAnon-ers’ Magic Cure for Coronavirus: Just Drink Bleach!
Narrative_Description: Some QAnon conspiracy theorists claimed that bleach and 20-20-20 spray are good remedies against the virus
Motive_Description: Effort to spread false story saying that bleach, 20-20-20 spray are good remedies for the virus.
Source_Description: General public (promoters of QAnon conspiracy theory)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, remedy, bleach, QAnon conspiracy theory
Summary: QAnon conspiracy theory supporters have spread messages on different social Mediaregarding magic remedies against the virus (like, bleach, 20-20-20 spray, etc.

Title: Bat soup, dodgy cures and 'diseasology': the spread of coronavirus misinformation
Narrative_Description: An Australian health-related deparment saying that the virus is spread through certain types of food.
Motive_Description: Spreading fake news saying the virus is spread through certain types of food to create panic and fear among people
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Health Department, contaminated food, Australia
Summary: This account pretended to write on behalf of a fake health-related department in Australia and warned people of the risk of being infected from certain specific types of food

Title: Bat soup, dodgy cures and 'diseasology': the spread of coronavirus misinformation
Narrative_Description: Story telling people to stay away from certain Brisbane areas where many Chinese residents live
Motive_Description: Discredit the Chinese population in Brisbane, Australia
Summary: A warning spread on social Mediafrom an account pretending to be the Queensland Health in Australia and telling people to stay away from certain areas in Brisbane where many Chinese residents were living. The MP Duncan Pegg warned on Twitter the news was fake.

Title: Ecco il farmaco anti-Coronavirus che ci stanno nascondendo” fact-checking sul video dell’italiano dal Giappone
Narrative_Description: Avigan cures COVID-19
Motive_Description: Undermine Italy's and pharma companies' credibility
Summary: Facebook video posted by Crisatiano Aresu, an Italian pharmacist living in Japan, shows Tokyo and people living their normal life without any social distancing. Aresu claims that Japan was able to cure Coronavirus-infected people with a drug called Avigan. In Italy, he claims, the drug is still kept secret because pharma companies are still fighting on who will produce and make profits out of it.

Title: La bufala del “contenimento BSL-4”
Narrative_Description: Biocontainment protocol imminent in Italy
Motive_Description: Spread fear of strict anti-infection measures
Summary: Chain message circulated on Whatsapp and Facebook claiming that the Civil Protection department would soon activate a (non-existing) militarized biocontainment protocol in Italy,

Title: Stanziamenti degli Stati per combattere il coronavirus: la Lega sbaglia il confronto
Narrative_Description: Relief funds allocated by the Italian government are insufficient
Motive_Description: Weaken and discredit the Italian government
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italia, Francia, Spagna, Stati Uniti, Germania, Regno Unito, miliardi, governo, Lega, Salvini
Summary: Official Facebook account of Matteo Salvini's Lega posted a picture claiming the Italian has allocated resources to fight Coronavirus one order of magnitude below Other countries. The figures are misleading, because while Italy's number refers only to direct, short-term government investments, for Other countries the post mentions total amounts guaranteed by governments through, for example, credit lines.

Title: Il video complottista che accusa gli americani: «Coronavirus: è stato il “pipistrello”»
Narrative_Description: The US engineered and spread the virus
Motive_Description: Undermine US credibility
Summary: Conspiracy theorist Massimo Mazzuco claims in a Youtube video that Coronavirus was engineered by the US, citing, among Other 'sources', a study by New Delhi University researchers (rejected by peers) and American lawyer Francis Boyle.

Title: Message Claiming Coronavirus Can Last Up To 8 Hours In Air Is Misleading
Narrative_Description: The virus can last up to 8 hours in the air.
Motive_Description: Efforts to spread false claims that the virus can last in the air for 8 hours.
Summary: Chain message spreading about the nature of the virus (i.e. it's airborne, lasts 8 hours in the air)

Title: Coronavirus. Il Governo inglese ha disposto la quarantena ai vaccinati contro l’influenza? Facciamo chiarezza
Narrative_Description: Anti-vaxxer groups spread a message in the UK saying people with influenza vaccine should self-quarantine for 12 weeks
Motive_Description: Efforts to spread a message against the influenza vaccine and push an anti-vaccine rethoric
Key_Words: Coronavirus, governo inglese, quarantena, vaccino per influenza
Summary: A message was spread on WhatsApp saying the UK government was telling people with influenza vaccine to stay in self-quarantine for 12 weeks. This was probably pushed by anti-vaxxers groups.

Title: Coronavirus. La bufala del paziente che in Italia non vogliono curare perché nero
Narrative_Description: A story pushed by the Twitter account @LucksonLK1 saying that black guy who got infected in Italy was not cured by Italian hospitals
Motive_Description: Effort to undermine and discredit the Italian healthcare system by saying doctors don't treat blacks
Summary: A video was shared on Twitter saying a black guy was not cured in Italy when found affected by the virus.

Title: Coronavirus. Il medico israeliano che lavora a Parma e lo stop di cura agli over 60, un caso di disinformazione
Narrative_Description: VoXNews and The Jerusalem Post saying an Israeli doctor reported that in Parma (Italy) people 60 years old or older are not treated.
Motive_Description: Effort to discredit the Italian national healthcare system by saying they don't treat the elderly
Key_Words: Coronavirus, hospitals, over 60, Italy, Israeli doctor
Summary: The website Voxnews and the newspaper The Jerusalem Post have misreported the delcaration of an Israeli doctor claiming that in Parma, an Italian city, doctors were not curing people over 60. They misreported an interview to the doctor, who was describing the possible scenario if hospitals become comepletely full.

Title: La disinformazione Whatsapp del coronavirus che non contagia gli extracomunitari vaccinati contro la TBC
Narrative_Description: A story saying that in Italy no non-European citizens have been infected because they had the vaccine for tubercolosis.
Motive_Description: Effort to spark hatred against non-European citizens who didn't get the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, extra-comunitari, vaccino per tubercolosi, Lombardia
Summary: A WhatsApp message circulated in Italy no non-European citizen was infected by coronavirus in Lombardy, an Italian region, if having the vaccine against tubercolosis.

Title: Coronavirus: Union County warns against scams
Narrative_Description: Phishing and telephone scams of CDC members taking precautionary measures.
Motive_Description: Efforts to spread false claims that CDC personnel are putting the nation on lockdown, individuals trying to profit.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Union country, New Jersey, CDC
Summary: Reports of scam calls, people impersonating relatives asking for emergency money, or CDC officials knocking door-to-door.

Title: Coronavirus, spunta la fake news sulla Madonna di Loreto: nessun pellegrinaggio contro la pandemia
Narrative_Description: A story saying that the Loreto Holy Mary statue was about to fly over Italy on a plane to protect the Italian people from the virus.
Motive_Description: Message falsely saying the Loreto Holy Mary statue will fly over Italy to protect people from the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, pilgrimage, Loreto Holy Mary statue
Summary: A photo circulated on Facebook showing the statue of the Loreto Holy Mary on a plane ready to fly over Italy to protect people from Covid-19. The photo however had been taken two months ago.

Title: Fox's Dr. Marc Siegel says “worst case scenario” for coronavirus is “it could be the flu”
Narrative_Description: Marc Siegel saying COVID-19 is just the like the flu.
Motive_Description: Marc Siegel, on Fox News, downplaying the virus and likening it to the flu.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, flu, Fox news, Marc Siegel
Summary: Marc Siegel downplaying the severity of the virus by claiming that "it's just the flu"

Title: A Fox News coronavirus special featured a quack doctor who told viewers to “conduct your life normally”
Narrative_Description: Steven Hotze saying that people should just "live their lives normally"
Motive_Description: Steven Hotze, on Fox News, downplaying the severity of the virus, telling peope to "live their lives" as usual.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, scare tactics, Fox news, Steven Hotze
Summary: Steven Hotze downplaying the severity of COVID-19, suggesting viewers to just "live their lives"

Title: Sputnik: Coronavirus could be designed to kill elderly Italians
Narrative_Description: Jerry Falwell Jr. reopening Liberty University, saying young people do not have the conditions to be affected by the virus.
Motive_Description: Jerry Falwell Jr. calling on students to return to Liberty University, downplaying the dangers of the virus.
Summary: Jerry Falwell Jr. downplaying the severity of COVID-19. Urges young people do not have the conditions that put them at risk.

Title: Saline solution kills China coronavirus? Experts refute online rumour
Narrative_Description: Salted water kills the virus
Motive_Description: Spread claim that salted water kills the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Zhong Nanshan, saline, salt, solution
Summary: Post circulated claiming that swishing salted water in one's mouth is beneficial against COVID-19

Title: The coronavirus plaguing China was not created by a US government agency
Narrative_Description: Virus created by CDCs in 2015
Motive_Description: Undermine US credibility
Summary: Post (then spread around by Other profiles) claims that the virus was invented and patented by US CDCs in 2015.

Title: Hoax circulates online that applying Vaseline to your nostrils will protect against air pollutants
Narrative_Description: Vaseline in nostrils prevents breathing of air pollutants
Motive_Description: Spread claim about vaseline in one's nostrils preventing the breathing of air pollutants
Summary: Posts claiming that applying vaseline in one's nostrils prevents from breathing air pollutants

Narrative_Description: Sputnik Latvia provides mulitple explanaitions about who might benefit from creating the virus, including green activists (to promote green agenda), Beijing (to quel Hong Kong protests), or Latvia (to delay elections)
Motive_Description: Sputnik disseminating multiple contrasting stories that all identify potential poltiical benefactors
Summary: Corona was created and it is important to trace who benefits from it

Title: Coronavirus created in a laboratory
Narrative_Description: Sputnik Armenia argues that the corona virus cannot occur in nature and suggests that an American lab based in Georgia may be the source; quotes an expert calling for investigations into the lab
Motive_Description: Promote a narrative that the US is behind the virus
Summary: US is likely behind the design of corona

Title: Coronavirus is a classic example of hybrid warfare
Narrative_Description: Sputnik Armenia describes coronavirus as a classic example of shadowy 'centers' of influence to expand their power in the world
Motive_Description: Promote a narrative about secret/shadow elites being behind the virus without identifying any particular one
Summary: Secret elites created corona

Title: Coronavirus is a Western tool to attack Chinese economy
Narrative_Description: Sputnik Belarus explains that the US and the UK, motivated by their national interests regarding US-China and Brexit negotiations, respectively, have likely created corona and are hyping it up to hurt China
Motive_Description: Effort to undermine the US and the UK as being behind the creation of corona
Key_Words: Coronavirus, invented, US, UK, China, economy
Summary: US and UK created and promote corona to hurt China

Title: Neither doctors, nor food supplies in Lithuania
Narrative_Description: A narrative on how the complete failure of Lithuania's response to corona confirms it failed as a state after democratization
Motive_Description: Effort to undermine Lithuania as a failed state
Source_Description: Analysis and commentary site connected with the Kremlin
Summary: Lithuania failed to respond to corona because it is a failed state

Title: Swedish oligarchs impede the introduction of quarantine measures
Narrative_Description: Swedish oligarchs, in cahoots with the authorities, refused to introduce quarantine measures to avoid financial losses
Motive_Description: Effort to undermine Sweden as failing to respond to corona because of oligarch influence
Source_Description: Analysis and commentary site connected with the Kremlin
Summary: Swedish oligarchs block quarantine to protect own wealth

Title: The coronavirus pandemic is the ruling elites' alternative to a world war
Narrative_Description: The ruling elites promote panic about the virus to claim more power for themselves, in a way they would use war before
Motive_Description: Spreading conspiracy about the origin of the virus as a tool of the shadowy ruling eltes
Source_Description: Analysis and commentary site connected with the Kremlin
Summary: Ruling elites replaced war with virus as a method of retaining and expanding own power

Title: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Quote card of Robredo wanting to free prisoners to ‘prevent spread of COVID-19 in jails’ NOT TRUE
Narrative_Description: Philippine Vice President Robredo claimed of wanting to "free prisoners to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in jailes"
Motive_Description: Weaken and discredit Philippine VP Robredo, by misattributing a quote.
Summary: Altered graphic misatrributing a quote to Philippine VP Robredo, claiming she wants to free prisoners to prevent the spread in jails.

Title: FALSE: SSS 'approves P20,000 aid for every member' due to coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Philippine President Duterte supposedly approved financial aid via the Social Security System.
Motive_Description: Help political standing of President Duterte by claiming he is providing financial assistance to Filipinos.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Duterte, Philippines, SSS, financial aid
Summary: Altered graphic misattributing a quote to President Duterte, claiming he approved 20,000PhP worth of financial aid for constituents.

Title: Facebook post: graphic claiming China tried to cover up the COVID-19 outbreak
Narrative_Description: Facebook post circulating around Philippine groups, claiming China failed to contain the COVID-19 outbreak.
Motive_Description: Weaken and discredit China, suggesting they failed to cover up the COVID-19 outbreak, and created conspiracies blaming the West.
Summary: Graphic post claiming China tried to cover up the outbreak, saying they are hiding things from the rest of the world.

Title: El bulo del vídeo sobre COVID-19 "la verdad sobre el coronavirus": no hay ninguna prueba de que fuese creado en un laboratorio en 2013
Narrative_Description: A video affirming that the virus was patented by the Pibright Institute, which works with the Gates Foundation, in 2014
Motive_Description: Blame the Gates Foundation for the outbreak of the virus to discredit the institution
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Pribright Institute, Gates Foundation, laboratorios, patente
Summary: A video circulated on different Mediasaying that the Gates Foundation, through the Pirbright Institute, was responsible for the creation of the virus in a bio informatics laboratory in 2014.

Title: No hay pruebas de que practicar sexo al menos cada dos días prevenga la infección por coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A person saying that having sex helps mitigate the effects of the virus
Motive_Description: A video saying that having sex mitigates the effects of the virus, probably pushed for the sake of it
Summary: A video circulated on Facebook filming a girl saying that having sex mitigates the symptoms resulting from the virus.

Title: El bulo del vagón de tren con la inscripción "COVID-19"
Narrative_Description: A photo showing a train in Texas with the label "Covid-19" and affirming that the train is carrying biological material
Motive_Description: The goal is to hint to the fact that the virus is a biological weapon used by the US, given that it is said the train is in Texas
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vagon cisterna, Texas, materiales biologicos
Summary: A photo was posted on Facebook showing a train with the label "Covid-19". The post was saying this was a train in Texas carrying some biological material.

Title: No, Putin no ha liberado a 700 leones para mantener a la gente en sus casas por el coronavirus: es una imagen de 2016 en Sudáfrica
Narrative_Description: A photo showing lions in the street and the post claiming that Putin unleashed them to keep people in their houses
Motive_Description: The goal is to discredit the Russian government accusing it to do an absurd policy against its citizens
Summary: A photo circulated on social Mediashowing lions in the streets and saying these were unleashed by Putin to keep people in their houses. However, the photo was real and was taken in 2016 in Johannesburg, South Africa.

Title: Ni hay pruebas de que el brote del nuevo coronavirus haya sido creado en un laboratorio ni los coronavirus en humanos son recientes
Narrative_Description: A video in which a girl affirms that the virus was patented by the Pirbright Institute in 2014 (linked to the Gates Foundation)
Motive_Description: The goal is to discredit the Gates Foundation in the US
Summary: A video in which a girl affirms that the virus was patented in 2014 by the Pirbright Institute (linked to the Gates Foundation) and claiming that the outbreak was a planned biological attack.

Title: No, no hay pruebas de que Bill Gates haya escrito una carta en la que diga que el coronavirus es "el gran corrector" y que "está aquí para enseñarnos unas lecciones que parece hemos olvidado"
Narrative_Description: A message allegedly by Bill Gates saying that there is a spiritual reason behind the outbreak of the virus and that the virus is the "great corrector"
Motive_Description: The goal is to discredit Bill Gates by making him appear to say absurd statements
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Bill Gates, propósito espiritual, gran corrector
Summary: A message was shared, saying it was by Bill Gates, saying that there is a spiritual reason behind the outbreak of the virus and that the virus is the "great corrector" and will teach us somethign we appear to have forgotten

Title: No, this video shows a market selling wild animals in Indonesia’s Sulawesi island
Narrative_Description: Images of a market where the virus allegedly started
Motive_Description: Spread images about virus origin
Summary: Video posted on Facebook claiming to show a market in Wuhan where bats, rats, snakes, etc. are sold, claiming that's the origin of the virus. The maket shown is in Indonesia’s Sulawesi island.

Title: Doctors have not projected 11 million people quarantined in Wuhan, China, will die from coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Virus is capable of killing all 11mln inhabitants of Wuhan
Motive_Description: Spread fear about lethal potential of the virus
Source_Description: Facebook pages Life - ජීවිතය ", Tak Tik, Our Economics, නැවියා - Naviya
Summary: Posts in Sri Lanka claiming that doctors predicted that the 11 million people in quarantine in Wuhan would all be killed by COVID-19

Title: This photo is a stock image of a building that has circulated online since at least January 2019
Narrative_Description: In China they were able to build a hospital in shorter than a day
Motive_Description: Extoll Chinese response
Source_Description: Lijian Zhao (deputy director general for China’s Information Department and Ministry of Foreign Affairs), People’s Daily (Chinese-State owned newspaper), Other individuals
Summary: A (fake) picture circulated claiming that it was a hospital built in Wuhan in a matter of hours

Title: China coronavirus: health experts refute misinformation about how to wear face masks
Narrative_Description: Ways to wear face masks
Motive_Description: Spread (unverified) claims about the right way to wear face masks
Source_Description:

Title: Sri Lankan authorities say this man suffered from a condition unrelated to novel coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Video showing a man passing out and claiming it's because of the virus

Source_Description: Youtube channels Pasindu Akash and RA sports & Entertainment production, Facebook profile Rasa - රස

Source_Description: Facebook profile Lita Jugo, Lilli Porcadilla, Project inspired .com, Wheng Precones Tolentino

Title: Novel coronavirus: Australian authorities refute hoax about 'contaminated' foods and locations
Narrative_Description: Virus can be transmitted by some (infectable) food
Motive_Description: Spread fear about contagion comig from certain products
Source_Description: Facebook profiles Latifa Dee, Charmoon Tumupu, Naomi Brandt
Key_Words: Coronavirus, infected, Australia, Sydney, Wuhan, products
Summary: Posts claiming certain products (made near Wuhan) could transmit infection

Title: Novel coronavirus: Australia refutes claims that a travel warning was issued for Queensland suburbs
Narrative_Description: Fake screenshot of a warning from health authorities in the Australian state of Queensland alongside a claim that the government issued an advisory against travel to Wuhan
Motive_Description: Spread claim about government action
Source_Description: Facebook profiles Sunshine coast and Regional Indian People Community, Callum Tapp, Maria Nguyen, Alanah May, Wendy Lam, Tong Newspaper, George Luu
Summary: Picture circulated in a Facebook group (Punjabi Brisbane Wale) and on Other profiles looking as a screenshot of authorities' website with a warning from health authorities in the Australian state of Queensland alongside a claim that the government issued an advisory against travel to Wuhan

Title: Singapore denies it closed a subway station after novel coronavirus discovery
Narrative_Description: Claim that Singapore closed a subway station due to suspected Coronavirus case
Motive_Description: Spread claim about Singapore closing a metro station due to suspected Coronavirus infection
Source_Description: Facebook profiles SK Sirajul, Har ZiZar AC
Summary: Posts claimed that Singaporean government shut down a subway station (Woodlands Mrt) due to a suspected infection case

Title: Novel coronavirus: Pakistani officials deny they issued warning over dangers of eating goat meat
Narrative_Description: Punjab Food Authority issued a warning on eating goat meat
Motive_Description: Spread claim about warning on goat meat
Source_Description: Facebook profiles Islamic page, Anas Dar, Zahid Akhter Qureshi, ‎Irfan Bashir‎, خریدوفروخت منڈی بہاوالدین
Summary: A fake screenshot by the Punjab Food Authority circulated in Pakistan claiming that eating goat meat was to be avoided in Punjab

Title: Chinese ‘spies’ did not steal deadly coronavirus from Canada
Narrative_Description: Canada created the virus and Chinese spies brought it to China
Motive_Description: Undermine Canada's and China's reputation
Source_Description: Websites Vlad Tepes, Journal on Geopolitics and International Relations, Kyle Bass (American hedge fund manager), Facebook profile DaWei Leigh
Summary: Claims that the virus was engineered in Canada and then brought to China

Title: This is a 2014 photo of people participating in an art project in Frankfurt, Germany
Narrative_Description: Picture showing people lying on the ground, claim that they died from COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spread fear about lethal potential of the virus
Source_Description: Facebook profiles Yed Felistinesia, Rommy Indra Jaya, Abdulracman Dimapinto Dipatuan
Summary: A picture was posted showing people on the ground, and claiming that they were people dying of COVID-19 in China. Posts were in Indonesian and Tagalog.

Title: Australian health officials dismiss hoax report about new novel coronavirus case outside Sydney

Summary: Noveleta Mayor Dino Reyes Chua and vloggers under fire for purposely spreading false reports of COVID-19 related patients and deaths in their town.

Title: Qué sabemos del vídeo de un supuesto transportista que denuncia que se lleva a Francia material sanitario: los paquetes que enseña son de folios

Motive_Description: Effort to undermine the Spanish government saying that it doesn't pay for medical equipment

Title: No, no es cierto que el Gobierno no esté comprando test para detectar el coronavirus a la empresa Genomica, cuya directora es hermana de Cospedal*
Narrative_Description: A message saying that the Spanish government is not buying tests from the famous company Genomica but from a Chinese ghost company because the Genomica's CEO is called Rosario Cospedal (last name is C-hospital in English).
Motive_Description: Effort to discredit the Spanish state by saying that the tests purchased are inaccurate
Summary: A message spread on WhatsApp saying that the government is buying inaccurate tests from a Chinese ghost company and not from the famous company Genomica just because Genomica's CEO is called Rosario Cospedal (the last name is literally Chospital in English).

Title: This video shows a former Malaysian prime minister praying in a Beijing mosque in 2004

Source_Description: Facebook profiles Khan Shahbaaz Ali Khan, Dawood Ali AIMIM (Indian regional politician), Khankah rahimiya jaipur, Dawood Ali Sam, Twitter profiles @Maheen83086711, @clarkthomas6291
Summary: Video circulated along with a claim that it captured "China PM" praying in a mosque after Coronavirus outbreak.

Title: No, no hay pruebas de que el COVID-19 haya salido de un laboratorio de Fort Detrick (Estados Unidos)
Narrative_Description: A message saying that the virus was created by the American army in a laboratory in Fort Detrick, Maryland, to stop the development of the 5G technology and eliminate some elderly people.
Motive_Description: Effort to discredit the US Army and the US by blaming them for the spread of the virus
Summary: A story saying that the virus was created in a laboratory of the American Army in Fort Detrick, Maryland with the objective to stop the development of 5G technology. It was spread on the Kit Radio Internacional website.

Title: Cuidado con el supuesto correo de CaixaBank que pide la verificación de la cuenta por los cambios en el protocolo debido al estado de alarma por el coronavirus: es 'phishing'
Narrative_Description: A phishing email sent with the email address of the Spanish bank CaixaBank where it is asked to access a link to verify your personal bank account credentials as part of an emergency response due to the virus
Motive_Description: Effort to try to extract bank account credentials to access to the accounts and steal money
Summary: An email was sent pretending to be the Spanish bank CaixaBank and asking to access a link to verify your personal bank account credentials as a part of an emergency protocol due to coronavirus outbreak with the goal to extract information and steal money.

Title: He is not a doctor: Beware of the video in which a man claims with no evidence that respirators are taken off elderly COVID-19 patients in Spain

Summary: A video where a self-proclaimed doctor says that over 65 Covid patients are taken off respirators to give them to the younger since there is a shortage in Spainsh hospitals. There is no evidence he is a doctor and there is a lack of respirators.

Narrative_Description: A WhatsApp message saying how you shouldn't take certain medicines (ibuprofeno, Naproxeno, Voltarene, etc)
Motive_Description: People trying to help but falling into the trap of spreading misinformation
Summary: A WhatsApp long message telling how people should not take iburpofen (and Other anti-inflamatorios) and only take paracetamol. They said young people in France and Italy had died because of complications related to the intake fo these medicines. They also advise in favor of drinking water regularly. They have a link to French goverment website that informs about the use of ibruprofen (among Other things). The information provided in this website is in French and the contect is way milder than what the message reports.

Summary: A message was spread on WhatsApp falsely claiming that the Italian government was going to give 1000 euros to each family every month from now until the end of the coronavirus emergency.

Summary: A message was spread on WhatsApp saying that John Hopkins discovered that the virus is not RNA but rather DNA, maybe to create confusion among people.

Title: Non, ce scientifique américain n’a pas été arrêté pour avoir vendu le Covid-19 à la Chine

Title: Un test du vaccin contre le Covid-19 sur des enfants au Sénégal ? Que montre vraiment cette vidéo ?

Title: Non, le FBI n'a pas saisi des masques de protection dans un "temple juif" de New York

Title: Non, les Italiens ne jettent pas de l’argent par les fenêtres car “il ne sert à rien contre le Coronavirus”

Title: 熏醋可以预防新型冠状病毒

Title: 省中医预防药房

Title: 开暖气或是空调可以杀死病毒
Narrative_Description: Claims turning on the heater and the air condition can kill the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spreads false claims that turning on the heater or the air conditioning can kill the coronavirus

Summary: Rumors claimed turning on the heater or the air conditioner can kill the coronavirus, but Guangzhou Daily News refuted the claims

Title: 狗能感染新冠并传染给人？

Title: #英国疫情# 疫情面前，有时候智商无下限，引用了部分BBC的总结，英国医学家辟谣了以下几种常见防疫行为，你中招了吗？1. 吃大蒜

Motive_Description: Spreads false claims that eating onions can prevent the coronavirus

Title: Fake News über Zusammenhang von 5G und Corona sorgen für Unruhe
Narrative_Description: Rumors spread that coronavirus was caused by creation of 5G cellphone network

Title: Nein, Covid-19 ist, anders als von Rolf Kron behauptet, nicht nur ein harmloser Schnupfen

Title: Coronavirus: Nein, aktuelle PCR-Tests haben keine Fehlerquote von 30 bis 50 Prozent
Narrative_Description: Claims that PCR tests used to check for coronavirus give 30 to 50 percent false positives

Summary: Three different Youtubers posted videos regarding the coronavirus which included claims about wildly high false positive rates for PCR tests

Title: Michael Spitzbart liegt falsch – das Coronavirus ist aktuell nicht mit Grippevirus vergleichbar

Title: Coronavirus: Nein, Aussagen zu Erntehelfern belegen nicht, dass Asylbewerber mehr Geld bekommen als Rentner

Summary: A Whatsapp chain letter was spread condemning the German government for allegedly granting asylum seekers greater monthly payments than pensioners

Title: أوضح دليل منظمة الصحة العالمية الخاص بنظم مكافحة العدوى والتعامل الآمن مع جثث الموتى:
Narrative_Description: Rumors on social Mediaclaims that people are infected by exposure to the dead bodies of those who died from Covid-19 disease

Summary: Rumors circulating widely on social Mediaclaim that one could be infected with Covid while buring someone who has died after contacting coronavirus. WHO denied these claims and stated that until now, there is no evidence that people have been infected by exposure to the dead bodies of people who died from Covid-19 disease.

Title: This false claim about a brothel quarantined in Europe originated on a satirical website
Narrative_Description: Claim that a brothel was quarantined in Europe

Title: This report is a hoax -- the video was filmed one year before the novel coronavirus outbreak

Title: Donating blood in US does not get you a novel coronavirus test

Key_Words: Coronavirus, US, plasma, blood, donate, donation

Title: World Health Organization refutes viral claims that holding your breath can test for COVID-19

Summary: Fake claim circulated that holding one's breath for 10 seconds is a good procedure to figure out whether one has coronavirus

Title: This video has circulated online more than one year before COVID-19 was first detected

Motive_Description: Ridicule curative efforts

Title: False claim circulates online that certain countries in Asia are using helicopters to spray 'COVID-19 disinfectant'
Narrative_Description: Governments in Philippines and Sri Lanka intended to use the air force to spray pesticide disinfectants and thus people should stay inside at night

Source_Description: Facebook account Namal Disanayaka (Sri Lanka), Facebook account Macario Patoltol Postrano (Philippinnes)
Summary: Facebook posts and information shared via WhatsApp in the Philippines and Sri Lanka claimed that respective militaries would be spraying pesticide disinfectants at night and thus residents should stay indoors; both governments denied this

Title: This footage of looting was filmed years before the pandemic
Narrative_Description: Video purporting to show a live looting spree in response to COVID-19 quarantine in Mexico
Motive_Description: Incite fear about crime in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic
Summary: Multiple Facebook accounts live streamed a video claiming to show a looting spree in Veracuz, Mexico, and the video was reposted on Facebook and Youtube; this was actually a looped video from Mexico in 2017

Title: Experts say eating garlic does not prevent COVID-19 -- and onions are no cure either
Narrative_Description: Garlic, onion, and lemon can help prevent COVID-19
Motive_Description: Promote false cures

Title: These photos show the coffins of victims of a boat disaster in 2013
Narrative_Description: Italy running out of space and coffins to handle the influx of COVID-19 fatalities
Motive_Description: Incite fear about the potential fatalities associated with COVID-19

Title: 我们群里，有个重庆老乡，说重庆市周围全部大量囤积米面油，商铺都抢完了，我怀疑有人在造谣

Narrative_Description: Rumors claimed people stopped eating bananas to prevent the coronavirus

Summary: A twitter user claimed people stopped eating bananas to prevent the coronavirus

Title: No, US and UK have not selected PM Modi to lead a coronavirus task force
Narrative_Description: Misreporting a news bulletin on India's reponse to COVID-19 and framing it to advance PM Modi's image as a leader on a global COVID-19 "task force"

Title: False: Rahul Kanwal’s claim about Trump suggesting early access of COVID-19 vaccine to India

Title: Disaster Management Act does not prohibit coronavirus posts on social media

Title: Indians do not have genetic protection against coronavirus, published research incorrectly interpreted
Narrative_Description: Indians have immunity against the coronavirus

Title: No, Indian army has not built 1000-bed quarantine facility for coronavirus patients

Title: No, Dr Ramesh Gupta’s zoology book DOES NOT mention a cure for novel coronavirus
Narrative_Description: The coronavirus is not a new virus and a cure for the virus already exists

Title: 穿防静电服能隔绝新型冠状病毒

Title: Did a man in Goa come up with an innovative way to make people stay indoors ?

Title: Photo of a COVID-19 diagnosis kit is viral as a coronavirus curing vaccine being launched on Sunday.

Narrative_Description: A Herbal Cure has been made by a Doctor named Khalid Butt

Narrative_Description: CBS falsely reported that Prime Minister Abe would need to declare a national emergency to give governers of prefectures power to enforce mandatory lockdowns
Motive_Description: Attempt to report informative story on COVID situation in Japan
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Japan, CBS, Abe, mandatory lockdown
Summary: CBS falsely reported that Shinzo Abe would need to declare a national emergency to give prefectural governers power to enforce mandatory lockdowns. Under Japanese law, any lockdowns are merely recommendations, as they can't be enforced by penalties.

Title: 「感染者が出た」新型コロナのデマ情報がＳＮＳで拡散　商業施設「売り上げ減った」　沖縄県内で実害
Narrative_Description: Tweets that several businesses in Okinawa prefecture have coronavirus cases
Motive_Description: Scare people from going to local businesses
Summary: Twitter user falsely claimed that coronavirus was detected at several businesses in Okinawa

Title: Nein, Alkohol zu trinken tötet das Coronavirus nicht ab
Narrative_Description: Rumors spread that drinking a lot of alcohol would prevent coronavirus because of the disinfectant properties of alcohol
Motive_Description: Transmit message that coronavirus can be cured/prevented with ordinary means
Summary: Whatsapp message spread that falsely claimed drinking alcohol excessively (around 5 beers a day) would disinfect/prevent coronavirus

Title: Biowaffe aus den USA? Wolfgang Gedeon verbreitet irreführende Theorie zu Coronavirus in Landtag
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that the US was behind the creation of the coronavirus and designed it as a bioweapon
Motive_Description: Generate anti-American sentiment
Summary: AfD politician made claims in the Baden-Wuerttenberg state parliament that the coronavirus was designed by the US in laboratories

Title: Nein, in Hongkong wurde kein 5G-Mast wegen Coronavirus zerstört – das Video entstand vor der Pandemie
Narrative_Description: Video "evidence" spread that a 5G cell tower in Hong Kong was taken down by protestors because of its supposed relation to the coronavirus outbreak
Motive_Description: Imply a connection between 5G towers and coronavirus; show evidence of violent public response
Summary: Whatapp message spread containing video "evidence" of a 5G cell tower being broken down by protestors in Hong Kong because of supposed relation to coronavirus - video actually dates from August of 2019

Title: Nein, mit Klicks auf das Youtube-Video von Roby Facchinetti wird nicht an ein Krankenhaus in Bergamo gespendet
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that clicking on a Youtube video would automatically donate money to a hospital in Bergamo treating coronavirus patients
Motive_Description: Generate greater publicity and profit for the Youtube video through false claims to a well-intending public
Summary: Whatsapp chain message spread containing a link to Faccinetti's song written for coronavirus victims, with claims that clicking on the link would generate automatic donations to a hospital in Bergamo

Title: Nein, Angela Merkel wusste nicht schon 2013 von der aktuellen Coronavirus-Pandemie
Narrative_Description: Political website spreads claims that coronavirus was intentionally released to weaken Germany's economy, and that Angela Merkel was in on it since 2013
Motive_Description: Undermine public image of Chancellor Angela Merkel
Summary: MZW-News spread claims that Angela Merkel has known of a plot to use coronavirus as a tool to weaken the economy since 2013

Title: Video einer Frau in Italien schürt Panik mit überspitzten Behauptungen über das Coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Advice spread that when coming indoors, you should take your clothes off outside and immediately wash them to prevent bringing the coronavirus in
Motive_Description: Overexaggeration of methods needed to stay safe, exaggerates properties of the virus
Summary: Woman in Italy claims to be giving tips to the German population to wash all clothing immediately if outdoors because coronavirus can spread through wind and can stay on surfaces for 9 hours

Title: No, esta imagen panorámica de Madrid 'sin contaminación' no ha sido tomada durante el confinamiento por el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A photo showing Madrid without air pollution, and saying that it is thanks to the Covid-19 emergency that the situation is like this
Motive_Description: Effort to advocate to a reaction to fight climate change even after the Covid-19 emergency
Summary: A photo showing Madrid without air pollution was spread saying that thanks to the Covid-19 emergency, things are getting better with climate change and that we should keep working in this sense afterwards. However, the photo had been taken two years ago and has nothing to do with the coronavirus emergency

Title: ¿Ha publicado el BOE que te pueden "expropiar" una vivienda? El Gobierno indica que el programa no permite la expropiación de viviendas*
Narrative_Description: A message was spread saying that the government was ready to expropriate houses to help some groups of individuals as a response to the COvid-19 crisis
Motive_Description: Effort to spark fear and panic among people saying the government was ready to expropriates houses
Summary: Messages were spread on WhatsApp and Instagram saying that the Spanish government had written in the official BOE (official government document) that it was ready to expropriate houses so as to help some groups of individuals in difficulty because of the coronavirus pandemic. However, nothing about expropriating houses was written in the BOE, even though the document was actually released by the government.

Title: کورونا وائرس:امید کی کرن نظر آنے لگی
Narrative_Description: Falsely claiming that hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin is a possible cure for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Trying to undermine the severity of the issue by claiming that a cure has been found
Source_Description: "Siasat.pk/" Well known news website in Pakistan
Key_Words: Hydroxychloroquine, azithromycin, cure, Pakistan, French Clinical Trial
Summary: The article citing a interview of a famous Pakistani scientist (interview embeded on the page) claims that  Hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin as a cure for covid-19. The scientist cites a french clinical trail as the basis for the information. The trial has been discredited by mainstream French academic community.

Title: کورونا وائرس کے علاج کے حوالے سے اچھی خبر
Narrative_Description: Falsely claiming that hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin is a possible cure for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Trying to undermine the severity of the issue by claiming that a cure has been found
Summary: Article claims that reserach shows that Hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin as possible cures for covid-19. The article fails to cite the reserach.

Title: Coronavirus. Il vaccino e il fantomatico microchip sottocutaneo dei complottisti
Narrative_Description: A story claiming that the virus was introduced by the Gates Foundation with the objective to later give a vaccine to the whole population which has the effect of making a quantum tatoo on the skin.
Motive_Description: Trying to undermine Bill and Melissa Gates saying they are the creators of the virus
Summary: A story saying that the virus was designed by the Gates Foundation with the intent later on to give a vaccine to everybody in the world to install a quantum tattoo on their skin

Title: No, este vídeo en el que un hombre se corta el cuello no se ha grabado ni durante la cuarentena por el coronavirus ni en España
Narrative_Description: A video showing a man on the street surrounded by police and cutting his neck, claiming that the covid-19 lockdown is making people crazy
Motive_Description: Effort to spark fear among people showing a man cutting his neck on the street because he became crazy because of the lockdown
Summary: A video showing a man cutting his nech while on the street and surrounded by police and claiming he turned crazy because of the prolonged lockdown. However, the video was real but referred to an episode in Serbia.

Title: Chine : un médecin atteint du coronavirus s’évanouit dans un hôpital de Wuhan ? Attention, intox !
Narrative_Description: Videos of a doctor in a Wuhan hospital fainting while performing an operation, supposedly because of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fear by showing the conditions of those affected by coronavirus
Summary: Videos spread of a doctor in Wuhan fainting "because of coronavirus", while the hospital had clarified it was because of hypoglicemia

Title: 「安倍首相が給与30％返納」ネットで称賛も、新型コロナと無関係。2012年から実施していた
Narrative_Description: Shinzo Abe lowered his own salary by 30% in response to COVID
Motive_Description: Portray Shinzo Abe as a charitable prime minister
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Shinzo Abe, Prime minister, pay cut
Summary: Chief of Cabinet Secretary Suga said the prime minister has already cut his salary by 30%; claims spread on Twitter that the cut was in response to COVID but it has been in place since the 3/11 disaster in 2011

Title: 熊本副知事、「コロナ病床は満床」のデマ拡散…ラインで
Narrative_Description: Hospital beds for coronavirus patients are full
Motive_Description: Vice Governer of Kumamoto prefecture spread message without fact checking in attempt to notify government officials
Source_Description: Kumamoto prefecture Vice Governor Toru Tajima
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Kumamoto, vice governer, Toru Tajima
Summary: Vice governer of Kumamoto received and spread false message to prefectural executives that hospital beds for coronavirus patients are full

Title: [新型コロナFactCheck] ｢PCR検査した検体は全て破棄し､陰性と通知｣との”病院関係者”情報は虚偽
Narrative_Description: PCR test samples are being destroyed by hospitals and all test results are reported to patients as 'positive'
Motive_Description: Effort to undermine trust in hospitals and tests
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Japan, PCR test, sample, destroy
Summary: Tweet claiming that a hospital is destroying all samples of PCR tests and telling patients they tested positive

Title: 医師名かたる新型コロナチェーンメールに注意　日本赤十字社医療センター「当センターで発信したものではない」
Narrative_Description: Japanese hospitals are overwhelmed doctors are considering scenarios of medical system collapse
Motive_Description: Sow fear among population that medical system facing collapse
Summary: Chain messages claiming to be from Japan Red Cross Center doctor that hospitals are overwhelmed and are considering scenarios of medical system collapse

Title: 新型コロナウィルス感染防御に関するチェーンメールについて
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus spreads during meal times, and Other information in infection prevention 'manual' claimed to be authored by Keio University professor
Motive_Description: Spread preventative measures supposedly from a credible source
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Japan, Keio University, manual, Hideyuki saya
Summary: Chain message manual on how to prevent infection supposedly written by Keio University professor Hideyuki Saya

Title: Gefälschter „Focus“-Artikel: Nein, die Supermärkte in Deutschland schließen nicht an vier Wochentagen
Narrative_Description: Rumors spread that all supermarkets in Germany would be closed except for two days a week in response to the outbreak
Motive_Description: Create panic among general population
Summary: Screenshot of a fake Focus article was spread on Whatsapp, claiming that all major supermarket chains in Germany would close except Mondays and Fridays in response to coronavirus

Title: Nein, es wurden keine Asylbewerber „heimlich“ während der Corona-Maßnahmen nach Görlitz gebracht
Narrative_Description: Rumors spread that asylum seekers were secretly brought to Goerlitz, implication that they are bringing the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Generate xenophobic feelings among general public
Summary: Post on Facebook spread claims that despite measures to slow spread of coronavirus, asylum seekers have been secretly bussed to Goerlitz; post implies that they are bringing the virus to Germany

Title: Nein, 29.000 US-Soldaten sind nicht immun gegen das Coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that US soldiers are secretly marching through Europe while Europeans are distracted by the coronavirus; these soldiers are allegedly immune to the virus
Motive_Description: Generate anti-American sentiment
Summary: Post on Facebook spread rumors that the American army is secretly deploying 29000 troops on European soil, all of whom are immune to the virus

Narrative_Description: Virus in religious (Islamic) terms, as reconcilation of the West with God (Islam)
Motive_Description: Coronavirus as means of restoring faith/piety of Western countries
Key_Words: Coronavirus, US, West, Europe, Iran, Islam
Summary: Dubbed video with imagery that points to resurgence of Islamic practices/teachings with coronavirus

Title: Coronavirus : le piège des rumeurs « validées par un médecin »
Narrative_Description: Claims Chinese doctors in Italy encourage people to drin water every 15 minutes to prevent the virus from entering the lungs
Motive_Description: Spread the practice of drinking water as a way to prevent coronavirus, despite it being untrue
Summary: A French doctor's email account was hacked and used to spread the rumor, also through Whatsapp and Facebook, that Chinese doctors in Italy encourage people to drink water often to protect themselves against coronavirus

Title: Fake US hospital letter says alcohol reduces COVID-19 risks
Narrative_Description: Drinking alcohol reduces the risk of infection by Coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread (funny) claim about alcohol being effective in preventing infection
Source_Description: Facebook account Alak Pinas Pinalaka, Dampa Sa Cauayan
Key_Words: Coronavirus, alcohol, beverages, vodka, Saint Luke’s Hospital, Kansas city
Summary: Claim circulated (supported by a fake message from Saint Luke’s Hospital in Kansas City) that alcoholic beverages help reduce the risk of infetion by Covid-19

Title: There have been no deaths from the novel coronavirus in South Africa (as of March 12, 2020)
Narrative_Description: Family of three died of coronavirus in Mpumalanga province
Motive_Description: Spread fear about coronavirus in South Africa
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mpumalanga, family, three, die, South Africa
Summary: An online article (shared thousands of times) claimed that a family of three had died of Covid-19 in the Mpumalanga province in South Adrica

Title: This video has previously circulated in reports about a free vegetable giveaway in Wuhan
Narrative_Description: People line up in Wuhan to get death certificates
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the serious death potential of the virus
Source_Description: Twitter accounts @sadir_Palwan, @naochashu, @2mmbPkM00IJwIUV, @Kitty_yanli, @lanews2020, Facebook account 韩荣利
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Wuhan, queue, death, certificate, vegetables
Summary: Video (taken from a different context) circulated alongside the claim it shows people in Wuhan lining up to receive death certificates.

Title: No, this is a magnified photo of a weevil
Narrative_Description: False picture of the virus
Motive_Description: Spread unpleasant (fake) picture of coronavirus
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Ashari Helmy, Luqman Hidayat, EVE Baby, YouTube channel Shic Shoup, Twitter account @Mhamad5500
Summary: Picture (of a weevil) circulated alongside claims that it showed a magnified picture of the novel coronavirus.

Title: False claims that drinking water with lemon can prevent COVID-19 circulate online
Narrative_Description: Claim that drinking warm water with lemon protects against the novel coronavirus.
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim about preventative measure, help
Source_Description:
Facebook accounts Confession of Nepalese in Australia, Kashmir News Highlights, Qaphile Kamahlangu Putsoane, Gala Kolebi, Elio Guzman, Twitter account @IzahSchwartz_
Follow Follow @IzahSchwartz_
Key_Words: Coronavirus, lemon, water, Laila Ahmadi, Zanjan University
Summary: Claim was spread about water with lemon being effective against coronavirus

Title: This video has circulated online since 2017 about a hotel demolition in China’s Jiangsu province
Narrative_Description: Building hosting covid patients in Wuhan has collapsed
Motive_Description: Show and spread misleading video
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Miu Jamie, Vajra Amonym, 真相2.0, Georgie Tse, YouTube channel 吴戈, Twitter account @nitamasn
Key_Words: Coronavirus, building, collapse, Wuhan, Zhonglian Hotel
Summary: Video showing the demolition of a hotel circulated alongside the claim that it showed a building hosting Covid-19 patients collapsing in Wuhan.

Title: Non, il n’est pas recommandé de se raser la barbe pour lutter contre le coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claims authorities have encouraged shaving as a good practice against coronavirus
Motive_Description: Urge people to shave as a way to prevent coronavirus from spreading
Summary: 2017 recommendations by the American CDC encouraging health workers to shave were taken out of context to claim authorities had encouraged shaving as a way not to be infected by coronavirus

Title: Le CHU de Toulouse dément une rumeur évoquant « quatre cas graves de coronavirus » touchant des jeunes
Narrative_Description: Claims a doctor in Toulouse has warned about 4 young people being in serious conditions after getting Covid-19 and taking anti-inflammatory drugs
Motive_Description: Avoid the use of anti-inflammatory drugs to cure coronavirus
Summary: A doctor in Toulouse was falsely quoted as claiming that 4 young people had been admitted to hospital in serious conditions after taking anti-inflammatory drugs against coronavirus

Title: Coronavirus : combien de temps reste-t-il infectieux sur des surfaces ?
Narrative_Description: Recommendations to leave shopping bags in the car for 1h30 after doing the shopping and to clean everything that was touched by Others with diluted bleach
Motive_Description: Excessively encourage people to take precautionary measures against coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, shopping bags, bleach, clean, leave
Summary: Messages circulating telling people it is necessary to leave shopping bags in the car for 1h30 after doing the shopping and to clean everything with diluted bleach, despite authorities carifying it is enough to keep social distance and wash hands

Title: Non, Franceinfo n’a pas annoncé un « décret de confinement total »
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that the French government was about to implement a "total confinement" with curfew at 6pm all over the country
Motive_Description: Spread panic by claiming the French government was about to implement "total confinement"
Summary: A photomontage showed a tweet by Franceinfo communicating a "total confinement" with curfew at 6pm was about to be implemented in all of France

Title: Non, le gouvernement n’a pas décrété le « stade 4 » et « la mise en quarantaine de toutes les villes »
Narrative_Description: Rumor the French government was about to begin "stage 4" of the response to the epidemy, implying quarantine for all French cities starting 16 March
Motive_Description: Use sensasionalist tones to spread the fear that the government has already announced the beginning of quarantine for all of France
Summary: A fake news article spread quickly, claiming the French government had moved to "stage 4" of the emergency on 16 March without announcing it (while "stage 4" implies going back to normal, and the government moved to "stage 3" on 17 March after announcing it the day before)

Title: Le coronavirus à l’heure des rumeurs par messagerie instantanée : « C’est la mère de ma femme qui me l’a dit »
Narrative_Description: Claim the virus was accidentally released by China while it was storing it as a defense weapon for WWIII
Motive_Description: Blame China for the spread of coronavirus, while warning the population of its danger
Key_Words: Coronavrus, France, Pasteur Institute, China, weapon, WWIII
Summary: A man claimed in an audio message circulating in France that an acquaintance at the Pasteur Institute had heard of the coronavirus being a weapon accidentally released by China but originally intended as a defense mechanism for WWIII, and invited people to stay home warning that national lockdown was about to be implemented

Title: India TV uses 2017 video to falsely claim Islamic preacher provoked Jamaatis to ‘spit’
Narrative_Description: Spreads the rumor that Muslims in India were deliberately spreading the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Stoke communal tensions in the country
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Muslims, Tablighi Jamaat, Corona Jihad
Summary: There have been numerous rumors and false news reports associated with the common narrative that Muslims in India, especially those associated with the super spreader Tablighi Jamaat gathering, are spreading coronavirus deliberately in the country

Title: Non, la Fédération de la pêche n’a pas les compétences pour interdire la pêche
Narrative_Description: Rumors the French National Fishing Federation has forbidden fishing as an emergency measure against coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread the false news that fishing is forbidden in France during the coronavirus emergency
Summary: A Facebook post falsely claimed that the French National Fishing Federation had banned fishing in the context of the emergency, while fishing is still allowed under certain conditions and the federation does not have the power to do so anyway

Title: Coronavirus : non, il n’est pas interdit de prendre la voiture à plusieurs pendant le confinement
Narrative_Description: Claims that if more than one people are in a car, they will be fined for 135 euros
Motive_Description: Inform that if two or more people are in the same car, they will be fined
Summary: A Facebook post claimed that, during confinement in France, a car can only be used by one person each time, or the passengers will be fined 135 euros (while there is no such measure in place)

Title: Non, les vacances scolaires n’ont pas été reportées au 31 juillet
Narrative_Description: Claims schools in France will postpone summer vacation to make up for wasted time during the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Spread the news that schools will be open in summer, with delayed summer vacation, to make up for lost time
Summary: The news spread (through a fake "official document" by the Ministry of Education) that French schools would postpone summer holiday to the end of July as a way to make up for lost time during the coronavirus emergency

Title: Fake Newspaper Clipping Claims Coronavirus Found In Poultry In Bihar
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus was found in poultry in Bihar, India
Motive_Description: Make people believe that poultry has the coronavirus
Summary: A falsified news article from a Hindi newspaper (Dainik Jagran) was distributed across social Mediaclaiming that poultry in Bihar was found to have the coronavirus

Title: Les vacances scolaires d’été raccourcies ? Poisson d’avril !
Narrative_Description: Claims summer holiday for French students will be reduced to just one month
Motive_Description: Spread the news that summer holidays will only last one month for French students as a result of the coronavirus emergency
Summary: Not for the first time, a fake official document by the French Ministry of Education seemed to show that summer holiday for French students would be reduced to just one month

Title: Did An American CEO Draw This Map To Praise Indian Govt.'s COVID-19 Response?
Narrative_Description: Claimed that an American CEO praised PM Modi for his response to the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Try to laud PM Modi for his efforts in combatting the coronavirus
Summary: Rumors circulated an old map of India, with its states marked by countries whose populations matched that of the state, to imply that PM Modi was handling the coronavirus at a magnitude much higher because India's population was equivalent of that of many nations combined

Title: Este vídeo con bolsas negras de cadáveres no es del Palacio de Hielo de Madrid, es Guayaquil (Ecuador)
Narrative_Description: A video showing a lot of dead bodies in a building and claiming it is the Palacio de Hielo in Madrid
Motive_Description: Effort to spark panick among people showing dead bodies in an important building in Madrid
Key_Words: Coronavirus, cadaveres, Palacio de Hielo, Madrid
Summary: A video was posted on Youtube showing dead bodies in a building and claiming that is Palacio de Hielo in Madrid. However, the video was filmed in the Hospital General Norte IESS Los Ceibos in Guayaquil (Ecuador).

Title: Coronavirus : la carte de France annonçant des dates de déconfinement par régions est un faux
Narrative_Description: A document showing the dates for the end of the lockdown in the different French regions
Motive_Description: Spread a fake plan concerning the procedure to end the lockdown for the different regions of France
Summary: A fake official document showing a map of France and indicating the dates for the end of the lockdown for the different regions circulated on several social Mediaand was even shown on TV

Title: ¿Qué sabemos sobre la supuesta cita de la hija del presidente del Banco Santander en Portugal, fallecido por coronavirus, en la que dice: 'Somos una familia millonaria, pero mi papá murió solo y sofocado, buscando algo tan simple como el aire. El dinero se quedó en casa'?
Narrative_Description: A message was spread saying that the daugher of the Portugal Santander Bank's President, António Vieira Monteiro, said that even though they are millionaire, her dad died alone and money were left in the house
Motive_Description: Effort to weaken the  family of the Portugal Santander Bank's President saying that money is left in the house where he died because of the virus
Summary: A message saying thta the daughter of Antonio Vieira Monteiro, Portugal Santander Bank's President, who recently died because of the virus, died alone in his house even though they are millionaires and that a lot of money is left at his house.

Title: Mock Drill Video From Bihar On COVID-19 Preparedness Shared As Real
Narrative_Description: A policeman had contracted the coronavirus in a Bihar jail
Motive_Description: Spread fear among people about new cases of the virus
Summary: A video from a coronavirus preparation drill was shared as a rumor of a police offer falling sick due to the coronavirus and Others running to help him

Title: War Veteran's Image Shared As Recovery Of Old Man From COVID-19 In Italy
Narrative_Description: An old man in Italy had recovered from the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Instill false sense of hope along with sentimental value
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, recovery, war veteran, Bill Moore
Summary: A war veteran's video was circulated as the video of an old Italian man who recovered from the coronavirus and was crying over 'being able to breathe again'

Title: رونمایی از دستاورد جدید سپاه پاسداران در زمینه مقابله با #کرونا
Narrative_Description: Novel invention that detects COVID-19 infections up to 100m away
Motive_Description: Make Iranian government look responsive, innovative
Summary: IRGC unveiling and promoting novel tech they designed to detect COVID-19, modeled off fake prototype and met with ire

Title: Iran parl. body rejects fake coronavirus tolls reported by foreign media
Narrative_Description: Denial of foreign Mediareporting COVID-19 numbers
Motive_Description: Downplay extend of impact internationally
Source_Description: Iranian health ministry, news media, research tanks
Summary: Iran denies numbers reported by foreign Mediaoutlets

Title: ترافیک در تمام جاده‌های کشور «روان» است
Narrative_Description: Aftermath of virus -country returning to normal
Motive_Description: Show Iran is recovering
Summary: State Mediareoprts all roads/traffic being smooth

Title: hilippine Department of Health refutes hoax warning about visiting shopping malls and hotels during coronavirus epidemic
Narrative_Description: Philippine government issued advisory listing malls and hotels to avoid during the Covid-19 outbreak
Motive_Description: Spread fear of contagion in certain public places
Source_Description: Facebook accounts DU30 MediaNetwork, Trixtan Na Malupet, Marvin Anora, Twitter accounts @sophieyahh11, @davidabordo
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Philippines, advisory, government, malls, hotels
Summary: Picture showing a fake government advisory circulated in the Philippines alongside the claim that it listed a number of malls and hotels to avoid due to the risk of infection by coronavirus.

Title: This doctored image contains a 2015 photo of Tom Hanks and the ball in the movie 'Cast Away'
Narrative_Description: Fake picture of Tom Hanks during quarantine
Motive_Description: Spread fake picture of public personality during his quarantine
Source_Description: Twitter accounts @Doogsta, @zaibatsu, @NeuroticCircus, @HappeningNow__, Facebook accounts Ben Musick, 迷因翻譯, Instagrm profiles nerdnook, old_school_punk, bob_the_campervan, robby.christie.3, futboltotal_mx, cinecafofo, geekone_, Weibo account 游戏没有图,
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Tom Hanks, quarantine, volleyball, Cast Away
Summary: Picture (taken from a differnt context) circulated alongside claim that it showed Tom Hanks during his hospital quarantine with a volleyball donated to him by doctors.

Title: Employer did not hide advice to skip work on COVID-19 poster
Narrative_Description: Employer covered up part of a Covid-19 advice poster recommending to stay home if sick
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim about exploitative employer
Source_Description: Facebook pages The Other 98%, Inhumans of late capitalism, Coalition for a Fair Ontario, Yellow Vest Ireland - Cork
Summary: Picure circulated alongside the claim that it showed a Covid-19 advice poster, part of which was covered by an employer because it recommended not going to work if one's sick

Title: Costco is not recalling bath tissue due to novel coronavirus contamination
Narrative_Description: Toilet paper was recalled because it was produced in China and was thus infected
Motive_Description: Spread fear of infection from toilet paper
Source_Description: Facebook profiles Kendra Ruhl, Cameron Brown, Raven Montgrand
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Costco, Kirkland Signature, bath tissue, recall
Summary: Fake message from Costco Wholesale was shared with claim that the retailer had recalled a certain brand of toilet paper (Kirkland Signature) because it was produced in China and thus infected.

Title: The incident happened in anOther part of South Africa long before the novel coronavirus outbreak
Narrative_Description: Monkeys invade hospital in South Africa during coronavirus outbreak
Motive_Description: Question the readiness of South Africa's health care system to face the Covid-19 threat
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Simon Koch, South Africa Live
Key_Words: Coronavirus, hospital, monkeys, South Africa, Pretoria, Durban
Summary: Video (taken from a differnt context) circulated alongside claim it shows monkeys invading a hospital in South Africa, thus questioning the preparedness of the South African healthcare system

Title: Consuming silver particles will not prevent or treat novel coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Colloidal silver
Motive_Description: Advertise colloidal silver products
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Sister Solutions, Heather Fair, Health Forum with Doc Atoie
Summary: False claim circulated about colloidal silver being a good preventative measure against coronavirus, often with links to website selling the substance.

Title: False COVID-19 hotline number shared on Facebook in Ontario
Narrative_Description: Ontario instituted a public health hotline
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim about hotline number
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Paul Costa, ТРОЙКА, 5AAB TV, الجاليه العربيه في لندن اونتاريو
Summary: Claim circulated that people could call 811 in Ontario as a hotline for public health needs.

Title: The last day South African schools will be open is Wednesday, March 18; they will be closed thereafter
Narrative_Description: South African schools will close sooner than the true date
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim about schools closing
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Africa, DBE, schools, close
Summary: Claim (documented by fake communication by the Department of Basic Education) circulated about schools in South Africa closing starting from Monday, March 16, 2020 (instead of the true date Wednesday, March 18).

Title: 蒙古国捐赠给中国抗击疫情的3万只羊自己走过境？
Narrative_Description: Mongolia reportedly donated 30,000 sheep to fight the Chinese epidemic
Motive_Description: Efforts to weaken humanitarian efforts and relations between China and Mongolia
Summary: Social Mediaspread false claims that Mongolia sent 30,000 sheep to help China fight the epidemic

Title: 厕纸和口罩使用相同材料？卫生纸遭抢购
Narrative_Description: Toilet paper and face masks use the same material
Motive_Description: Compels people to buy toilet paper if face masks ran out
Key_Words: Coronavirus, toilet paper, face masks, material
Summary: Social Mediaspread false claims that toilet paper and face masks were made of the same type of material

Title: 网传俄罗斯专家认定新冠病毒是人工合成？

Facebook accounts මාධ්යවේදියා (FB page of news website Madyawediya), තට්ට මාමා - Thatta Maama, ආතල් විතරයි Athal vitharai
මාධ්යවේදියා,
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Sri Lanka, supermarket, empty, shelves

Summary: Claim (supported by out-of-context picture) circulated about vegan foods being overlooked by customers even during panic-buying in the times of coronavirus.

Key_Words: Coronavirus, inphographic, Information is beautiful, fatality rate
Summary: Infographic was published and shared showing that coronavirus has much lower fatality rates than Other diseases that have always existed. This approach, experts say, is misleading and pushes peope to underplay the real severity of the virus.

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Cristiano Ronaldo, hotels, hospital,  Pestana CR7
Summary: False claim circulated about Cristiano Ronaldo converting his hotels into hospitals to help fight coronavirus.

Summary: False claim was spread about smoking being considered by the WHO as a preventative measure against coronavirus.

Title: Articles spread Tim Hortons closure hoax in Canada
Narrative_Description: Canada's Tim Hortons stores closing
Motive_Description: Misreporting information about a Canadian coffee shop chain that could potentially hurt businesses
Summary: Two identical articles falsely reported that Canada's Tim Horton shops would be closing completely in response to COVID-19, and this information was shared over 150,000 times on Facebook; Tim Hortons actually remains open for drive-thru, takeout, and delivery

Title: This video has circulated online about a prank staged in Brazil in 2019
Narrative_Description: Malaysia used drones to shoot fireworks at those who violated the lockdown
Motive_Description: Stoke fear about lockdown enforcement in Malaysia and Indonesia
Summary: A video of a firework prank that occurred in Brazil in July 2019 was dubbed with a Malaysian voice and posted on Facebook claiming that the Malaysian government was shooting people with drones if they violated the lockdown; this was also shared on Twitter and Youtube

Title: Australia's Department of Health did not issue a warning that 'using petrol pumps can spread COVID-19'
Narrative_Description: COVID-19 is spreading via petrol pumps in Australia
