Summary: A widely shared Facebook post claimed that an Australian hospital had advised people to use gloves or paper towels at Australian petrol stations because COVID-19 was spreading rapidly via the pumps

Title: ¿El coronavirus ataca a la hemoglobina de la sangre y no a los pulmones como asegura esta cadena de WhatsApp? A día de hoy no hay evidencias de que sea verdad
Narrative_Description: A message saying that an American doctor said that the virus doesn't harm the lungs but rather hemoglobin present in the blood and multiple organs
Motive_Description: Spread a message saying that the virus doesn't harm the lungs but Other organs probably since the senders believed in this message
Summary: Message spread on WhatsApp saying that a US doctor said that the virus doesn't harm the lungs but it does harm hemoglobin in the blood and multiple organs. However, there is no evidence of this and the virus definitely harms the lungs

Title: No, este no es un documento oficial para la desescalada del estado de alarma por el coronavirus que plantea el Gobierno: es un documento de un economista y plantea su opinión personal
Narrative_Description: A message spread with a document and saying that was the official document written by the government on how to de-escalate the state of alarm in Spain
Motive_Description: Spread a message saying that that document was the official one by the government to organize phase 2 after the lockdown, probably by mistake
Summary: A document was spread saying that that was the official plan by the government on how to de-escalate the state of alarm in Spain. However, it was a proposal put forward by the economist Alfredo Galàn on LinkedIn.

Title: Coronavirus : peut-on vraiment dire que le Covid-19 n’est qu’un « gros rhume monté en épingle » ?
Narrative_Description: Claims there was too much, unjustified, talk about coronavirus, as it only causes a normal flu
Motive_Description: Reduce the perceived threat concerning Covid-19 by comparing to a cold
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, flu, cold, serious, hippos
Summary: Several posts claiming that Covid-19 is much like "normal flu" or a "cold people talk too much about" went viral on social Mediain France

Title: Une vidéo de cohue dans un supermarché en Allemagne qui n’a rien à voir avec le coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A video showing a crowd rushing into a supermarket in German, supposedly because of the panic resulting from the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Spark fear by showing to French viewers that the situation in Germany has quickly become very chaotic as a result of the coronavirus emergency
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Germany, supermarket, crowd, chaos
Summary: A video dating back to 2011 and showing a crowd rushing into a supermarket in Germany was taken out of context and linked to the coronavirus emergency in the country

Title: Cette photo montrant des cercueils en Italie n’a rien à voir avec l’épidémie de Covid-19
Narrative_Description: A picture showing a big hall in Italy packed with coffins, with the claim that those people had died because of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spark fear by showing how extreme the coronavirus emergency has become in Italy
Summary: A photo dating back to 2013 and showing a big hall in Italy packed with coffins was taken out of context to claim that those deaths were caused by coronavirus (while it was linked to the migration crisis)

Title: Non, une épidémie mortelle ne « nettoie » pas la Terre tous les cent ans
Narrative_Description: Rumors the virus is part of a wave of deadly epidemies that "cleanse" the Earth every century
Motive_Description: Spread the idea that the virus is part of a wave of deadly epidemies that happen every 100 years
Summary: Posts and articles claiming that a deadly epidemy "cleanses the Earth" every 100 years went viral in France, using past epidemies as evidence (but ignoring Others) and falsifying dates

Title: Ces photos montrent-elles une hausse spectaculaire du prix des pommes de terre chez Carrefour ?
Narrative_Description: Pictures of the price of potatoes in a Carrefour supermarket show a huge rise in their price in just a week, attributing it to the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Spark the fear of a huge rise in prices due to the coronavirus emergency
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, potatoes, supermarket, Carrefour, price
Summary: A picture of the price of potatoes in a Carrefour supermarket in two different weeks was modified to show a big rise in their price and link it to the coronavirus emergency

Title: Non, Emmanuel et Brigitte Macron ne font pas de Jet-Ski pendant le confinement
Narrative_Description: Pictures showing Macron jet-skiing in the Mediterranean despithe the confinement measures in place in France
Motive_Description: Discredit French President Macron by showing that he is on vacation in the Mediterranean instead of managing the coronavirus emergency
Summary: Pictures dating back to 2018 were taken out of context to show that Macron was on vacation in the Mediterranean instead of handling the coronavirus emergency in France

Title: This video has been doctored -- scientists have not found bananas prevent coronavirus infection
Narrative_Description: Bananas prevent infection
Motive_Description: Spread false claim about bananas preventing infection
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Angel&Kimark, GM Properties, YouTube channel Mary Hope, Twitter account @_AEBE_, Philippine presidential spokesperson Salvador Panelo
Summary: False claim (documented by doctored video showing Australian ABC News) circulated about eating bananas being a good preventative measure. The fake news was taken up (reasonably by mistake) by Philippine presidential spokesperson Salvador Panelo.

Title: The video has circulated in Mediareports about coronavirus deaths in Iran
Narrative_Description: Video shows dead bodies being carried iin bags in Italy
Motive_Description: Spread fear of coronavirus's consequences
Source_Description: Facebook account Ling Lau, Amy Pua, Twitter account @baobaobilly, YouTube channel 镜心lost
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, dead bodes, bags, Iran, Qom
Summary: Video (actually taken from Iran) circulated alongside claim it showed dead bodies (due to COVID) being carried in bags in Italy.

Title: Hoax claim circulates online that Israel has no COVID-19 cases after it developed a 'cure'
Narrative_Description: Israel created the virus and thus has a cure and no cases.
Motive_Description: Spread claim about the virus being created in Israel, mistake

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Israel, n cases, cure, create
Summary: False claim circulated about Israel having no covid cases because it created the virus and thus possesses a cure too.

Title: Hoax claim circulates online that Israel has no COVID-19 cases after it developed a 'cure'
Narrative_Description: Australian goverment is about to implement a national shutdown
Motive_Description: Spread concern for imminent lockdown
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Geelong Underground Inc., Samantha Rayn Bachman, Talk back To Me with Marcus Paul, Kuini Walker, Crissi Carvalho, Allure by Beautederm Australia, SerGe Kacic, Trish-Anne Ward, alpine.org.au
Summary: False claim circulated bout the Australian government being about to implement a national 14-days lockdown.

Title: Nigeria is not paying citizens for staying at home amidst coronavirus pandemic
Narrative_Description: Nigeria paying citizens 8,500 naira per month to encourage staying at home
Motive_Description: Asks people to input sensitive Nigerian identity number
Key_Words: Nigeria, pay, Coronavirus, stay at home
Summary: A post originally from the site Mc Ebisco claimed that Nigeria had promised to give 8,500 naira to all citizens to encourage staying at home and encouraged inputting a Nigerian Identity Number; this spread via web posts, Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp groups

Title: Reopening date for South Africa’s schools has not been announced
Narrative_Description: South Africa will not reopen schools until September 10th
Motive_Description: Fear about extension of the lockdown, students having to repeat grades
Source_Description: Facebook account "Tsi E Tsi", Other Facebook users
Summary: A message circulated on Facebook claiming that South Africa had extended the date of school closure until September and that all students would have to repeat grades; the South African government has not announced a school reopening date

Title: This video does not show Saddam Hussein making a reference to COVID-19
Narrative_Description: The U.S. created COVID-19 and threatened to spread it in Iraq in the 1990s
Motive_Description: America is using COVID-19 to target Other countries
Summary: A video of Saddam Hussein was dubbed over to make it seem that Hussein was saying the U.S. had threatened to spread coronavirus in Iraq in the 1990s; this video was shared with claims that COVID-19 is the "American virus"

Title: Singapore’s Ministry of Health says it did not issue these COVID-19 'guidelines'
Narrative_Description: Singapore's Ministry of Health released a day-by-day COVID-19 checklist
Motive_Description: Falsely attributed diagnosis procedures from Singaporean officials
Summary: A post originally in Thai claimed that Singapore's Ministry of Health released a day-by-day checklist for COVID-19 symptoms, and this was circulated on Facebook and Twitter in Thai and English; the Singaporean government denied making this claim

Title: No evidence drinking tea can cure or relieve symptoms of COVID-19, doctors say
Narrative_Description: Drinking tea can help cure and relieve symptoms of COVID-19
Motive_Description: COVID-19 can be treated with tea
Summary: A message circulated largely in Sri Lanka on WhatsApp and in various languages on Twitter claimed that a doctor in China had found that tea could relieve the symptoms of and cure COVID-19

Title: Health experts warn against mixing rum, bleach and fabric softener to make 'hand sanitiser'
Narrative_Description: Rum and bleach can be used to make homemade hand sanatizer
Motive_Description: Potentially harmful information about creating hand sanatizer
Summary: Multiple videos circulated on Facebook and Youtube in the Philippines demonstrating the creation of "hand sanatizer" with rum and bleach, which will not actually prevent COVID-19 and could be hazardous to health

Title: World Health Organization refutes misleading claim it increased Thailand's 'pandemic level' for COVID-19
Narrative_Description: WHO raised Thailand's pandemic stage to "level 4"
Motive_Description: Inciting fear about the severity of COVID-19 in Thailand
Summary: Using a photo of WHO rankings of country preparedness for COVID-19, a message circulated on Facebook, Twitter, and Line that the UN raised Thailand's pandemic severity to "level 4;" this ranking is actually set by Thailand's government and is at level 1 or 2 across the country

Title: 网传“尼日利亚公民在广州遭不当对待”？
Narrative_Description: Netizens claim “Nigerian citizens are treated improperly in Guangzhou”
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of racism in China
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed Nigerians were treated improperly in Guangzhou, China

Title: 有核电厂因疫情影响导致暂时停堆或关闭？
Narrative_Description: Have nuclear power plants temporarily shut down due to the impact of the epidemic?
Motive_Description: Spreads false claims that nuclear power plants have temporarily shut down
Key_Words: Coronavirus, nuclear, power, plant, shut down, temporarily
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed nuclear power plans temporarily shut down due to the coronavirus

Title: 大庆4月17号要封城？大庆让胡路区人民医院隔离12个外国人？
Narrative_Description: Daqing will be closed on April 17th? Daqing let Hulu District People's Hospital isolate 12 foreigners?
Motive_Description: Spreads false claims that undermine city authority and suggest foreigners are housed in hospitals
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed the city of Daqing might close and a Daqing hospital housed foreigners

Title: 哈尔滨将封城，高速禁止通行？
Narrative_Description: Harbin will be closed to the city and high-speed traffic is prohibited
Motive_Description: Undermines Harbin authority and claims high speed traffic is prohibited
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Harbin, close, high-speed, traffic, prohibited
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed the city of Harbin will be closed and high-speed traffic is prohibited

Title: 河北巨鹿要封城？
Narrative_Description: Julu City in Hebei Province wants to close the city?
Motive_Description: Undermines the Julu City authority in Hebei
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed the city of Julu in Hebei will close

Title: 美国用最先进显微镜看到空气中全是病毒？
Narrative_Description: The US uses the most advanced microscope to see that the air is full of viruses
Motive_Description: Spreads fear that the coronavirus is everywhere in the air
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed the US used an advanced microscope to see that the air was full of viruses

Title: 俄罗斯飞满洲里的飞机在二连浩特降落，有病的旅客在二连浩特酒店隔离？谣言
Narrative_Description: Russia's aircraft flying to Manchuria landed in Erenhot and sick passengers were isolated at Erenhot hotel
Motive_Description: Spreads fear that sick passengers on a Russian aircraft was isolated at Erenhot hotel
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Russian, aircraft, Erenhot, hotel, isolated
Summary: Rumors on Wechat claimed sick passengers aboard a Russian aircraft were isolated at the Erenhot hotel

Title: 乐清市人民医院确诊14列新型冠状病毒感染病例？谣言
Narrative_Description: 14 cases of new coronavirus infection diagnosed in Yueqing People's Hospital
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of new confirmed coronavirus cases
Summary: Rumors on Wechat claimed 14 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed at Yueqing Hospital

Title: 抚顺市望花区新增两例新冠肺炎确诊病例？谣言
Narrative_Description: Two new confirmed cases of coronavirus in Wanghua District, Fushun City
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of new coronavirus cases
Key_Words: Coronavirus, confirmed, cases, Wanghua District, Fushun City
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed there were two new cases of coronavirus at Wanghua District, Fushun City

Title: 北京爬山收到河北短信，回家后被隔离？
Narrative_Description: A person who climbed a Beijing mountain received a text message from Hebei Province and was isolated after returning home
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of a new coronavirus infected person
Key_Words: Coronavirus, man, Hebei Province, Beijing, mountain, text, isolated, home
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed a man climb a Beijing mountain and received a text from Hebei province, then was isolated after returning home

Title: 邯郸丛台区发现一确诊病例？
Narrative_Description: There is a confirmed case found in Congtai District, Handan
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of a new coronavirus case
Key_Words: Coronavirus, confirmed, case, Congtai District, Handan
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed there was a confirmed case of coronavirus found in Congtai District, Handan

Title: 成都市成华区有新冠确诊病例偷跑回家跳楼？
Narrative_Description: After a person was confirmed of the coronavirus in Chenghua District, Chengdu, the person ran home and jumped off the building
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of a confirmed patience who committed suicide
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Chenghua District, Chengdu City, ran, home, jumped, building
Summary: Rumors on Wechat claimed a person confirmed of the coronavirus in Chenghua District, Chengdu City ran home and jumped off a building

Title: 受疫情影响，外资要全面撤离中国？谣言
Narrative_Description: Affected by the epidemic, foreign capital will all be withdrawn from China
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of foreign capital all leaving China
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed foreign capital was all leaving China because of the coronavirus

Title: 北京西站出现大量白衣人，疑似疫情大爆发？
Narrative_Description: There are a large number of people in white in Beijing West Railway Station, therefore an outbreak might happen
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of people dressed in white entering the Beijing West Railyway Station and claims there might be a potential outbreak
Source_Description: Beijing West Railway Station photo caption
Key_Words: Coronavirus, white, Beijing West Railway Station, suspected, outbreak
Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaimed that a photo in the Beijing West Railway Station had a caption that said men dressed in white appeared in the station and an outbreak was suspected

Title: 目前已有专门预防和治疗新冠病毒感染的药物？谣言
Narrative_Description: There are currently special drugs to prevent and treat new coronavirus infections
Motive_Description: Spreads False Hope that a cure to the coronavirus exists
Key_Words: Coronavirus, special drugs, prevent, treat, infections
Summary: Rumors claimed there are special drugs available to prevent and treat new coronavirus infections

Title: 重庆渝中区朝天门出现疑似病例？谣言
Narrative_Description: There are suspected cases in Chaotianmen, Yuzhong District, Chongqing
Motive_Description: Spreads fear of a new coronavirus case in Chongqing
Key_Words: Coroanvirus, suspected, cases, Chaotianmen, Yuzhong District, Chongqing
Summary: Rumors claimed  there are suspected cases in Chaotianmen, Yuzhong District, Chongqing

Title: 丹阳六中出现学生无症状感染者？谣言
Narrative_Description: There are asymptomatic students in Danyang No. 6 Middle School
Motive_Description: Spreads fear that there are asymptomatic students in Danyang No. 6 Middle School
Key_Words: Coronavirus, asymptomatic, students, Danyang No. 6 Middle School
Summary: Rumors claimed there are asymptomatic students in Danyang No. 6 Middle School

Title: This video was filmed in 2011, nearly a decade before the novel coronavirus outbreak
Narrative_Description: People are stockbuying in supermarkets
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim about population response to the emergency in Germany
Source_Description: Twitter accounts @_____Tweety____, @NizarKadi, @For_bearance, @Xy5Z89, @FrankKhalidUK, @prakashmgurnani, YouTube channels Rimo TV, Videos Club, OPUS MAGNUM WORLD
Summary: Video (taken from a differnt context) purports to show people massively crowding the entrance of a supermarket to stockpile due to the coronavirus emergency.

Title: Manufacturers say 'free baby formula' offer is a hoax, after coronavirus sparks panic buying
Narrative_Description: Baby formula is being given out for free by calling a specific number
Motive_Description: Help parents in hardship
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Emma Dickinson, Joanne Muscat, Denica Monique, Devonport Tasmania Thumbs Up Thumbs Down Locals., Demi Evans, Julia Da Silva, Tahlia Speers, Jade Gidley, Sarah Chisnall, Melzie Jade, Nicole Crawley
Summary: Claim circulated that baby formula was being given out for free by producers by just calling the number on the formula packages.

Title: Health experts warn using water in an ablution ritual alone cannot kill the novel coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Muslim ablution ritual kills coronavirus
Motive_Description: Extol Islam
Source_Description: News websites Gosulsel.com,  Koran Seruya, Asianmuslim.com, Facebook accounts Belajar Hidup, Hy13n, Zana Gaming, Twitter accounts @Etam394, @dakwahpost, @AntonPr12594871
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Indonesia, ablution, ritual, wudu, Luthfi Parewangi
Summary: Claim (supported by the opinion of "Dr. Luthfi Parewangi") circulated that muslim ablution ritual wudu kills coronavirus.

Title: This video shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in Brazil
Narrative_Description: Italian police forcefully arrested those who defied the lockdown
Motive_Description: Highlight potential for a similarly severe response in Pakistan and elsewhere
Summary: A video of a knife-wielding man being arrested in Brazil in March 2020 was posted on Facebook and Twitter with a description claiming that the video showed Italian police enforcing the COVID-19 lockdown

Title: Thailand’s emergency decree to combat COVID-19 did not include a curfew in March 2020
Narrative_Description: Thailand imposing a curfew as part of the national lockdown
Motive_Description: Inciting concern amongst Thai citizens about lockdown restrictions
Summary: Posts on Facebook and Twitter claimed that Thailand was imposing a curfew as part of the country's COVID-19 lockdown, which was not a part of the government's official response

Title: Buckingham Palace did not say the Queen tested positive for coronavirus
Narrative_Description: The Queen of England has been diagnosed with COVID-19
Motive_Description: Pomote false information about the status of Queen Elizabeth
Source_Description: Sites including "South Asian Monitor," "Standard Daily Times"
Summary: Multiple news sites in Nigeria and elsewhere posted stories claiming that the Queen of England had tested positive for COVID-19, and these articles were shared on Facebook

Title: Spanish politician misidentified in posts saying soccer players should find novel coronavirus cure
Narrative_Description: A Spanish biological researcher claimed that famous soccer players should find a cure to COVID-19 because they make so much more money than academics
Motive_Description: Stoke anger about COVID-19 research; promote false quotes
Summary: Posts on various social Mediaplatforms claimed that a "Spanish biological researcher" had tasked soccer players Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi with finding a cure to COVID-19 with enormous salaries; this quote was fake, and was actually attached to a photo of a Spanish politician taken in April 2018

Title: This video has circulated in Mediareports about an incident in Thailand
Narrative_Description: A man in Hong Kong was intentionally contaminating an elevator with his sweat
Motive_Description: Create fear about sanitation in Hong Kong and the behavior of individuals
Key_Words: Hong Kong, Kai Tak Garden, bacteria
Summary: On Facebook, multiple posts claimed to show a video of a man carrying sexually transmitted diseases rubbing his sweat on the buttons of an elevator in Hong Kong; the video actually came from Singapore in March 2020

Title: This photo shows people participating in an art project in Germany
Narrative_Description: Posts claimed that a photo depicted the bodies of COVID-19 victims in the street in Italy
Motive_Description: Fear about the potential severity of COVID-19 and the lack of resources
Source_Description: Facebook accounts including "Ashwani Kashyap Bharatiya," "Harpreet Mehra," Twitter accounts including "Ritesh Mishra"
Key_Words: Coronavirus, bodies, Italy, stay at home
Summary: A photo circulated on Facebook and Twitter claiming to show the bodies of COVID-19 victims littering the streets in Italy and warning people to stay at home; the picture is actually from an art installation in Frankfurt, Germany in 2014

Title: Hoax circulates on social Mediathat Australian supermarket worker has tested positive for COVID-19 in New South Wales suburb
Narrative_Description: A trolley collector at a Woolworths grocery store in Australia tested positive for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Incite fear amongst local residents/shoppers in New South Wales
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Woolworths, New South Wales, Australia
Summary: Posts on Facebook claimed that a "trolley collector" at various Woolworths supermarkets in New South Wales, Australia had tested positive for COVID-19; Woolworths reported that no workers in the stores have tested positive

Title: Police dismissed the claims as a hoax, which were based on an old story
Narrative_Description: Dozens died after a South African pastor encouraged congregation to drink disinfectant as a COVID-19 preventative measure
Motive_Description: Fear about an extreme response taken by individuals in response to COVID-19
Source_Description: News sites including "Kenya Today," "Your Black World"
Key_Words: Coronavirus, church, dettol, South Africa, disinfectant
Summary: Multiple news outlets and Facebook posts claimed that dozens of South African church members had died after drinking disinfectant as a COVID-19 preventative measure; the incident actually occurred in December 2016 and was not linked to any fatalities

Title: China sent medical supplies, not doctors, to help Malaysia combat the COVID-19 pandemic
Narrative_Description: China sent doctors to help fight COVID-19 in Malaysia
Motive_Description: Thanking China for sending doctors to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 in Malaysia
Source_Description: Facebook accounts including "Pkhsee Pkh See," "Liz Phoon," Twitter account "Daniel See Kim Leong"
Summary: Facebook and Twitter posts showed an image of people in Malaysia holding a banner thanking China for cooperating on fighting COVID-19 and claimed that China had sent doctors to help fight COVID-19 in Malaysia; in fact, China sent medical supplies but not doctors to Malaysia

Title: Non, le Maroc n’a pas guéri cinq malades du coronavirus grâce à la chloroquine
Narrative_Description: News article claiming 5 people in Morocco have healed from Covid-19 thanks to the use of chloroquine
Motive_Description: Spread the idea that definitive evidence for the effectiveness of chloroquine against coronavirus exists already
Key_Words: Coronavirus, chloroquine, Morocco, Mauritania, France, cure
Summary: A news website in Mauritania falsely reported that 5 people in Morocco had been treated with chloroquine and healed from coronavirus, and the news spread quickly through Facebook also in France

Title: Coronavirus : le prince Charles, une guérison rapide qui n’a rien d’exceptionnel
Narrative_Description: Facebook post shared several times suggesting Prince Charles had healed from coronavirus thanks to some secret vaccine
Motive_Description: Spread the rumor that a vaccine for coronavirus already exists and has been used
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Prince Charles, UK, France, vaccine, heal
Summary: A Facebook post suggesting prince Charles had healed from coronavirus thanks to a secret vaccine (thus also confusing vaccine and treatment) was shared thousands of times in France

Title: Coronavirus : Agnès Buzyn a-t-elle interdit la vente libre de chloroquine en pleine épidémie ?
Narrative_Description: Claims a link exists between the coronavirus emergency and the decision by the former French Health Minister to stop free sale of chloroquine
Motive_Description: Discredit former French Health Minister by suggesting she was part of some plot against the population
Summary: Rumors spread that former French Health Minister had stopped free sale of chloroquine precisely at the beginning of the coronavirus emergency (while the decision was taken months earlier and concerned hydrochloroquine, free sale of chloroquine was banned in 1999)

Title: Non, le Covid-19 n’est pas une « combinaison du SRAS et du sida »
Narrative_Description: Rumors the virus was artificially created in a lab starting from the HIV
Motive_Description: Spread the rumor that the vrius was, for some reason, artificially created
Summary: Rumors spread that the new form of coronavirus is too similar to HIV and that the virus was indeed created in a lab starting from HIV

Title: Cette archive du « Parisien » ne concerne ni le coronavirus, ni un laboratoire de Wuhan
Narrative_Description: Rumor the virus was artificially created in Wuhan, and that a Parisian newspaper had reported its creation already in 2013
Motive_Description: Suggest that the virus is China's fault, as it was created and then released there
Key_Words: Coronavirus, China, design, Wuhan, Le Parisien
Summary: A 2013 article by French newspaper "Le Parisien" reporting that a virus had been created in China, was taken out of context to claim that it was referring to coronavirus and Wuhan (while it was not)

Title: Corona-Krise: Nein, Deutschland lehnt nicht jegliche Hilfe aus China ab
Narrative_Description: Claims spread online that Germany has refused all help from China in light of the coronacrisis
Motive_Description: Desire for public to misconstrue actions/intentions of German government
Source_Description: RT Deutsch, offshoot of Russian channel RT
Summary: An article recently published by the German subsidiary of a Russian foreign Mediachannel claims that the German government has refused any help from China in confronting the coronavirus

Title: Keine Belege dafür, dass das Coronavirus „bei Hitze“ nicht länger als vier Minuten überlebt
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that the coronavirus can only survive 4 minutes in high heat
Motive_Description: Suggest that the virus is not as strong/severe as it is and that warmer countries will not be impacted by the pandemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, heat, Brazil, Gubio Soares
Summary: An article published on a German blog cites a Brazilian doctor, claiming that the virus can only survive 4 minutes in heat, which is why countries with warmer climates are less impacted

Title: Todeszahlen durch Grippe und Coronavirus lassen sich nicht vergleichen
Narrative_Description: Graphic posted online compares death rates due to flu and coronavirus in Germany in recent years, showing the flu death rate to be multiple times higher
Motive_Description: Suggest that the measures taken to contain the pandemic are exaggerated and unnecessary
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, flu, death rate, mortality
Summary: A graphic posted on Facebook compares the number of deaths in Germany from 2017-18 from flu to the current death rate from coronavirus, implying that the coronavirus is much less severe - figures are severely misleading

Title: Rechtsmediziner Klaus Püschel hat nicht gesagt, dass „nie“ ein gesunder Mensch am Coronavirus gestorben ist
Narrative_Description: Post on Facebook claims that a coroner said that no healthy person can die of coronavirus, everyone dead had preexisting conditions
Motive_Description: Suggest that healthy people who are not currently suffering from a medical condition have nothing to fear from the coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Hamburg, coroner, Klaus Puschel
Summary: An image posted on Facebook cites Klaus Puschel, a coroner from Hamburg, as saying that healthy people with no preexisting conditions cannot die from coronavirus; this statement is false, also he did not make this statement

Title: Nein, die Bundesregierung zahlt keine Prämie für das Zuhausebleiben während der Corona-Pandemie
Narrative_Description: Multiple claims made on Facebook that the German government is paying people to stay home
Motive_Description: Deceiving people into believing that staying home will be rewarded financially by the government
Summary: Multiple posts on Facebook have made claims that the German government is paying all its citizens in a one time monetary award to stay home

Title: Heißes Bad gegen Coronavirus? Andres Bircher stellt bei TV-Interview falsche Behauptungen auf
Narrative_Description: German doctor made claims that the coronavirus can be cured through baths and excessive sweating
Motive_Description: Imply that coronavirus can be cured very easily and therefore is not a great concern
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Andres Bircher, fever, bath
Summary: In an interview with Doctor Andres Bircher, he makes claims that hot baths will do wonders to cure the coronavirus and that with each degree of higher body temperature, the immune system doubles in strength

Title: Nein, die Netflix-Serie „My Secret, Terrius“ sagte 2018 nicht die Corona-Pandemie voraus
Narrative_Description: Claims made that the Korean drama, My Secret, Terrius, from 2018 predicted the coronavirus pandemic
Motive_Description: Arouse suspicion that the coronavirus pandemic is not accidental, but planned and predicted
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Netflix, My Secret, Terrius
Summary: A post on Facebook features a clip from the Korean series, My Secret, Terrius, that is from 2018 and talks about the coronavirus - the poster claims that this is proof that the series predicted the outbreak of the virus

Title: Coronavirus: Nein, Grundnahrungsmittel werden in Deutschland aktuell nicht knapp
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that the supply chain for supermarkets in Germany is disrupted and food necessities are becoming scarce
Motive_Description: Cause panic in reaction to supposed food supply chains running dry
Summary: Message spread through Whatsapp warning people to make a run for the supermarkets because there is danger that all German supermarkets are low on food staples

Title: South African health authorities urge public not to share hotline graphics with false information
Narrative_Description: COVID-19 hotline was created in South Africa
Motive_Description: Spread fake hotline number
Key_Words: Coronavirus, hotline, number, Institute for Communicable Diseases
Summary: Infographic circulated in South Africa about a hotline number to call if one experiences COVID-19 symptoms

Title: This video has circulated online since November 2019 -- weeks before the COVID-19 outbreak
Narrative_Description: People are stockbuying in the US
Motive_Description: Spread fake (funny) video about people stockbuying in the US
Source_Description: Facebook accounts 李力持, ธีรยุทธ ชูธนสุนทร, นอนเต็มหลับขยับจะเป็นสุข, YouTube channel 修齊治平天命, news websites Caymans, British Virgin Islands
Summary: Video (taken from a different context) circulaated alongside claim it showed people stockbuying in the US in the midst of the coronavirus emergency

Title: False posts claim COVID-19 existed before 2019, use animal vaccines as proof
Narrative_Description: The virus existed before 2019
Motive_Description: Spread a fake conspiracy theory
Source_Description: Facebook accounts NaDean NaDean, Karl Faucher, Marvin Original C, Lisa Woodrow-Presley
Key_Words: Coronavirus, US, America, vaccine, cattle, canine
Summary: Claim (supported by pictures of animal vaccine labels) circulated about coronavirus being in circulation already before 2019, given that animal vaccines already existed.

Title: Hot air from saunas, hair dryers won’t prevent or treat COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Breathing hot air kills coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread false claim about remedy
Source_Description: Facebook accounts David Lambert, Morathi Howie, David Frost, YouTube channels Julius Ngwendson, Faiza Mohamed
Key_Words: Coronavirus, hot air, sauna, hair dryer
Summary: Video circulated showing that coronavirus can be killed by breathing hot hair (e.g. in a sauna or from a hair dryer)

Title: This video was made by a UK public hospital trust in 2010 about infections in hospitals
Narrative_Description: Video shows how coronavirus is transmitted
Motive_Description: Spread fake claims about virus transmission mechanisms
Source_Description: Facebook accounts 疫の元素Immunity Element 代理商, Kangen Angel's, Jiekai Pab, Twitter account @Andy0qi, YouTube channel 華人自由燈塔
Summary: Video (attributed to Canadian health authorities, while it was shot in Britain under different circumstances) circulated alongside claim that it showed how coronavirus is transmitted in hospitals.

Title: Red soap, white handkerchiefs': experts refute misleading coronavirus prevention 'tips'
Narrative_Description: Red soap, white handkerchiefs and specific types of light bulbs prevent coronavirus infection
Motive_Description: Spread fake claims about preventative measures
Source_Description: Facebook account මායාවී - mayavi, Galigamuwe Gnanadeepa Thero, Reliance Channeling Center, Bhagya Hettiarachchi
Key_Words: Coronavirus, red soap, white handkerchiefs, CFL bulb, China, doctors
Summary: Claim (supported by the opinion of "Chinese doctors") circulated that red soap, white handkerchiefs, and CFL bulbs are helpful in preventing coronavirus

Title: The Indian government said there is no free mask scheme in place -- the claim was published on a fraudulent website
Narrative_Description: Indian government implemented a free face mask scheme
Motive_Description: Obtain people's data
Source_Description: Facebook account Munnu Mandal, Satya Maurya, Md Parwez Alam, Twitter accounts @manishsuvarna15, @rajsain05285299
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Narendra Modi, face masks, free, program
Summary: Posts, redirecting to https://www.narendrmodiawasyojna.in/, were spread claiming that the Indian government was implementing a free-face-masks program and that people needed to fill their personal data in the website in order to receive the masks

Title: Beijing coronavirus reports does not include foreigners
Narrative_Description: Falsely claims that Beijing's coronavirus reports does not include foreigners
Motive_Description: Cause panic about Beijing's reports on the numbers of infected by coronovirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Beijing, report, foreigners, 26, cases, not, included
Summary: Rumors claimed that Beijing's reports on the numbers of people infected with coronavirus does not include foreigners

Title: Coronavirus is a man made American virus with the ultimate goal tracking all the people through the vaccine
Narrative_Description: Whatsapp message clamining that the Virus has been made by the US govt and with the aim of tracking everyone through the vaccine
Motive_Description: The US is trying to track everyone using the covid-19 vaccine and they created the virus for this purpose
Key_Words: Bill Gates, Donald Trump, Manmade, Bio weapon
Summary: Whatsapp message claiming that the US Govt is behind the virus and they already have the vaccine. The vaccine contains a microchip through which they will track people.

Title: FALSE: P57 billion 'balance' in DSWD subsidy even if all families get coronavirus cash aid
Narrative_Description: Facebook post claiming the "math doesn't add up" on an emergency response the Philippine government was distributing, saying there was still more to spare
Motive_Description: Claiming that the Department of Social Welfare and Development in the Philippines is not using its resources properly, to undermine them
Summary: Facebook post claiming the math doesn't add up with a COVID-relief fund from the Department of Social Welfare and Development in the Philippines

Title: FALSE: Photo of Duterte doing the rounds during coronavirus pandemic
Narrative_Description: Reused photo from 2017 of Duterte in full gear claiming despite his old age and health he was still making rounds to keep Filipinos safe amidst the COVID pandemic
Motive_Description: Attempts to bolster Duterte's status, by claiming he was making rounds to make sure Filipinos are safe
Summary: Facebook post with photo of Duterte from 2017 in full army gear, claiming he was still making rounds to ensure the safety of Filipinos

Title: FALSE: Bills for March and April 2020 now free – Meralco
Narrative_Description: Video appearing to be a "breaking news" headline claiming the Philippine utilities company, Meralco, was waiving all bills for March and April
Motive_Description: The post appears to be "breaking news" with no particular intent but to provide "useful information"
Summary: Facebook post of a video appearing to be "breaking news" claiming Meralco, a Philippine utilities company, was waiving all fees for March and April

Title: No, no es un político español fichando por otros en el Congreso por las dietas: es Ucrania
Narrative_Description: A video showing an MP voting in the Parliament with an ID and claiming this new identification method has been implemented because of the Covid-19 crisis
Motive_Description: Effort to attack the political class in general by saying they imposed a wrong security measure to vote in the Parliament
Summary: A video was shared on social Mediashowing an MP using an ID to vote in the Parliament and accusing politicians to have implemented a wrong security policy to fight the crisis. However, the video, while real, refers to the Ukraine Parliament

Title: No, el producto ‘Covid-19 IgM/IgG’ no es una vacuna ni cura el coronavirus: es un test que detecta si el cuerpo está produciendo anticuerpos para luchar contra el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A message saying that Covid-19 IgM/IgG is a vaccine against the virus and that Trump said Roche is going to launch the product next Sunday
Motive_Description: Effort to claim that a vaccine has been found by Roche and that it is going to be launched soon
Summary: A message was spread saying that Covid-19 IgM/IgG is a vaccine and that Trump said it will be launched soon by Roche. However, this is not a vaccine but rather a test to see whether the body is developing anti-corps to fight against the virus

Title: ¿Qué sabemos sobre la autoría del audio que habla del confinamiento y que se atribuye al magistrado de Tarragona Ángel Martínez Sáez? Él asegura que no es suyo
Narrative_Description: An audio message was spread saying it was by the magistrate Ángel Martínez Sáez and claiming the police cannot fine people for going out on the street
Motive_Description: Effort to discredit the magistrate Ángel Martínez Sáez by attributing an audio message to him
Key_Words: Coronavirus, magistrado, policìa, Ángel Martínez Sáez
Summary: An audio message was spread saying it was by the magistrate Ángel Martínez Sáez and claiming the police cannot fine people if they go out on the street. However, there is no proof that the recording was by the magistrate

Title: Corona-Verschwörung: Leichenberg stammt aus Walking Dead
Narrative_Description: A photo of a man walking over a mountain of corpses, which spread with claims that it was of the government euthanizing elderly people to contain the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Depict current coronavirus situation as fearful with gruesome imagery
Summary: A photo spread on Facebook of a man walking over a mountain of corpses, saying it was a result of the government euthanizing elderly people to contain the virus - the photo is actually from the Walking Dead

Title: Nein, UV-Strahlung hilft nicht gegen Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Multiple messages spread with claims that UV radiation can prevent/serve as a cure for coronavirus
Motive_Description: Give people impression that UV radiation alone can help against coronavirus
Summary: Many messages from ambiguous sources spread, claiming the effectiveness of UV radiation against coronavirus - debunked by German Bundesamt fuer Strahlenschutz

Allegations were false as they had not spat on anything; they had not knowingly dropped the currency bills; and they did not have Covid-19.

Title: 有患者從感染到發病到死亡，體溫都正常⋯⋯所以量體溫查不出來！

Motive_Description: Claims temperatures cannot be checked on the patients who have coronavirus

Summary: For coronavirus patients their body temperatures can't be checked from infection to morbidity to death

Title: This video shows pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong in August 2019

Title: This video of an orangutan has circulated in reports since November 2019, months before the novel coronavirus pandemic

Source_Description: Twitter account @RexChapman, Facebook page for Mediacompany ATTN:

Motive_Description: Create fear that lockdown enforcement could become more intense in India

Title: This video shows a Belarusian band singing a Chinese song before the COVID-19 outbreak

Summary: Chinese-language social Mediaposts included a video of a group singing a traditional Chinese song, claiming that Italians recorded the song to thank China for COVID-19 aid; the video is actually of an a capella group from Belarus in 2019

Title: The doctor interviewed in this report did not say he was involved in the development of COVID-19 test kits

Summary: Sri Lankan Facebook posts manipulated a video interview and claimed that a Sri Lankan doctor had invented the COVID-19 rapid test kit; the doctor did not invent the kit, only commented on its significance

Title: This CNN broadcast has been doctored, Nigerian leader did not test positive for coronavirus

Title: CEOs of these companies did not all step down during novel coronavirus crisis

Title: Misinformation circulates online about COVID-19 cases and lockdown measures in Asia

Title: Attention à cette photo prétendant montrer des morts d'un vaccin du Covid-19 au Mali

Title: Des Masaï pour faire respecter le confinement au Kenya ? Non, un sketch pour sensibiliser au Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Claims the government in Kenya has hired Masai hunters to force people to respect confinement measures

Summary: Some pictures were taken out of context to claim that Masai hunters, known for hunting lions, were being sent in the streets by the Kenyan government to beat up people who did not respect confinement measures

Title: Non, personne ne fait du porte-à-porte pour vous proposer des masques imbibés de produit anesthésiant (lien signalé sur Facebook)

Title: Non, une enseignante de 42 ans n'est pas morte du Covid-19 après avoir gardé des enfants de soignants

Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, professor, Alsace, children, doctors
Summary: The rumor spread that a professor had being infected by coronavirus after taking care of doctors' children at school in Alsace and later died, but the professor mentioned turned out to be alive

Title: Pourquoi ces comparaisons entre les prix des masques français et espagnols n’ont aucun sens

Motive_Description: Criticize the government by claiming that it has not set the price of masks in France at a low level as Other European countries have
Summary: Some pictures comparing the price of masks in France to that of neighboring countries such as Spain and Switzerland, claiming that it was much lower there, circulated on social media, while they were actually comparing very different types of masks

Title: Vrai ou fake : les personnes âgées sacrifiées dans cette crise du coronavirus ?
Narrative_Description: Claims that French hospitals have received order to prioritize younger patients, thus sacrificing the elderly who are covid positive

Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, elderly, Gilles Lebreton, RN, Rassemblement National

Title: وزارة الصحة والسكان تنفي صلتها بما يتم تداوله على وسائل التواصل الاجتماعي من قيام فرق بالمرور على المنازل

Summary: Rumors on social Mediaclaim that teams from the Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population are visiting people's home to check their tempretures and test them for coronavirus. The misitery denied the claims on facebook

Title: شريحة سيحقن بها كل البشر تحت مسمى لقاح كورونا لتتبعهم وتتحكم بهم – زائف

Summary: Post on Facebook claims that Bill Gates created the virus and has a vaccine, and that the vaccine is a microchip implant which will be used to steal people's information

Summary: False job posting for workers to disinfect Costa Atlantica, a cruise ship docked in Nagasaki harbor where a cluster was found

Title: The World Bank did not praise Tanzania’s anti-coronavirus policies

Title: This broadcast first aired on an Albanian TV channel years before the COVID-19 pandemic

Title: COVID-19: hoax circulates that viral outbreaks are linked to new telecommunication technologies

Title: Youtube-Video: Nein, das Infektionsrisiko für Covid-19 steigt nicht durch das Tragen von Mundschutz

Title: Corona-Kettenbrief: Nein, Aspirin kann Covid-19 nicht heilen und nicht alle Patienten sterben an einer Thrombose

Title: Kontaktverbot: Nein, für Muslime gelten keine anderen Regeln

Source_Description: Facebook page The CL Bryant Show; America 1776
Key_Words: Coronavirus, reporter, bio gear, hype, media
Summary: A photo of a reporter in a biohazard suit and a camerman in plain clothes circulated on American political Facebook pages, claiming that the American left and Mediawere hyping up the severity of COVID-19. The photo is actually a Lebanese reporter in Beirut, reporting on the new suits being produced by a factory

Title: Stimulus Checks Won’t Reduce Future Tax Refunds
Narrative_Description: U.S. COVID-19 economic stimulus payments will reduce future tax refunds or have to be repaid
Motive_Description: Stoke fear about the potential need to repay stimulus checks
Summary: A video on TikTok and Facebook along with Facebook posts falsely claim that the $1200 stimulus checks part of the U.S. emergency response to COVID-19 will either have to be repaid or will be deducted from future tax refunds, criticizing the government's lack of clarity

Title: Conspiracy Theory Misinterprets Goals of Gates Foundation
Narrative_Description: Bill Gates will implant microchips to track people who have been tested or vaccinated for COVID-19
Motive_Description: COVID-19 vaccines could come with microchips that track people
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Bill Gates, microchip, tracking, vaccine, test
Summary: Facebook posts circulated a Youtube video and article claiming that Bill Gates intended to implant microchips in people to track COVID-19 testing and vaccination. Gates actually proposed digital certificates to track testing locations, and unrelated to COVID-19, previously proposed an invisible dye to keep track of vaccinations

Title: False Claim of Deadly Coronavirus Vaccine Trial in Africa
Narrative_Description: A COVID-19 vaccine trial in Senegal killed 7 children
Motive_Description: COVID-19 vaccine trials may be killing people
Summary: A story circulated at least in the US and Ghana claiming that a COVID-19 vaccine was tested in Senegal and instantly killed 7 children, with some linking to a video dubbed over with the claim in French. Senegal is not conducting any vaccine trial

Title: Senegalese children did not die from a coronavirus vaccine (which does not yet exist)
Narrative_Description: Children died after being injected a vaccine for coronavirus.
Motive_Description: Raise fears of (yet nonexistent) vaccination
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Prince Amaku Ugochukwu, Manu Ndoumbe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, die, seven, children, Senegal
Summary: False claim circulated about seve children having died in Senegall after being injected a vaccine against coronavirus.

Title: Claim Nigeria spent 1 billion naira on COVID-19 text messages came from fabricated tweet
Narrative_Description: Nigerian government spent 1 billion Naira to promote a COVID-19 text message awareness campaign
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim about NCDC action
Source_Description: News websites Reporters Press NG, Facebook account Metro Daily Nigeria (Facebook page), Facebook accounts Emmanuel Ikechukwu Uzor, General News, Codex news, Instagram account oyemykke, Twitter account @AdefilaDarey
Key_Words: Coronavirus, NCDC, campaign, SMS, educate, Nigerians, 1, billion, naira
Summary: Claim circulated that the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control spent 1 billion Naira on a COVID-19 text message awareness campaign.

Title: This video has circulated online since at least 2016 about a prank in Brazil
Narrative_Description: Brazilian/Italian authorities are using ghostlike drones to scare away people during the lockdown
Motive_Description: Spread "funny" video about spooky drones
Source_Description: Facebook account 羅衍雲, YouTube channel ExploreNews TV, Twitter accounts @YRanaraja, @skumar176, @russian_market
Key_Words: Coronavirus, drone, spooky, ghost, Italy, Brazil
Summary: Video (really showing a prank) circulated alongside the claim it showed a ghostlike drone being employed in Italy/Brazil to scare away people during the lockdown.

Title: नेपाल से भारत में कोरोना फैलाने की साजिश किसकी?

Motive_Description: Spreading fear among Indian population
Summary: Tweet of a news segment from Indian channel TV9 Bharatvarsh regarding a conspiracy theory that Nepal is spreading coronavirus to India

Title: The corona Virus travelled entire world from Wuhan but it did not reach Beijing and Shanghai... can anybody put light?

Motive_Description: Stoke fear about the nature of and "purpose behind" the virus
Summary: Conspiracy theory on a "Students of Nepal" facebook group that  China had a master plan to spread coronavirus around the world

Title: Corona! Virus? or Bio warfare weapon?
Narrative_Description: Conspiracy theory that coronavirus is a Chinese bio warfare weapon
Motive_Description: Stoke fear about the origin of and "purpose behind" the virus

Summary: Conspiracy theory on a "Students of Nepal" facebook group that coronavirus is a Chinese bio warfare weapon

Summary: Speculation by the Korean public that Asiana airline are flying people in from China that are seeking medical treatment for the coronavirus in South Korea.

Title: [팩트체크] 예배 제한 행정명령, 위헌적 종교탄압?

Title: [팩트체크] 미 의회가 '한국 코로나 검사' 의문 제기? 전체 맥락 확인해보니
Narrative_Description: US rejects South Korean Covid-19 because they are inaccurate
Motive_Description: Criticize US for claiming that South Korean tests are inaccurate

Summary: South Korean Mediafalsely reports that US claimed that their test kits are inaccurate.

Title: Reports Didn’t Misrepresent One Man’s Death as Two
Narrative_Description: A COVID-19 related death was reported as two separate deaths, demonstrating that fake news is overcounting fatalities and spreading fear
Motive_Description: Fake news may be overcounting COVID-19 deaths and trying to stoke panic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Milwaukee, Memphis, fake news, scamdemic
Summary: A meme circulated on Facebook showing side-by-side stories reporting the death of one man as a retired Milwaukee police chief and as a University of Memphis professor, claiming that this was fake news and the liberal Mediatrying to spread fear; the stories did not double-count one man, but reported on different aspects of his career

Title: TV News Report Prompts Unfounded Attacks on Michigan Governor
Narrative_Description: Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed an order imposing a fine for violating social distancing in a crowded ceremony
Motive_Description: Discredit and criticize Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer
Source_Description: General public, Twitter account of Senator Ted Cruz
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Michigan, Gretchen Whitmer, Governor, social distancing, fine
Summary: Social Mediaposts claimed that a photo showed Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer signing an order imposing a fine for those who violated social distancing at a crowded ceremony and criticizing the governor; the photo is actually from an earlier event in January 2019

Title: South Africa’s education department says the 2020 school year can still be saved
Narrative_Description: South Africa canceled the school year and pushed students to the next grade
Motive_Description: Students may be pushed ahead in school without proper education
Summary: South African Facebook posts falsely claimed that the remainder of the school year had been canceled and students would be pushed ahead to the next grade

Title: This video shows a rally in Hamburg -- it has circulated online since at least January 2020

Motive_Description: People in Italy are turning to Islam for help during COVID-19
Summary: A video circulated in Indonesia with the claim that it showed Italians chanting Allahu Akbar on the streets during the COVID-19 lockdown; the video actually comes from a Uighur demonstration in Hamburg, Germany in January 2020

Title: This video has circulated in reports since at least February 2020, weeks before the incident at a coronavirus quarantine facility in India
Narrative_Description: A man in India spit on a police officer in the midst of a COVID-19 quarantine
Motive_Description: People in India may be purposely spreading COVID-19
Summary: A video of a man in India spitting on a police officer circulated with the misleading suggestion that it occurred around the time of scuffles at a COVID-19 quarantine facility; the video is actually from February 2020, prior to the quarantine

Summary: facebook post of a video of an alleged doctor claiming that the infection dose for coronavirus is 70 billion. One has to be infected with 70billion viruses to contract coronavirus

Summary: Multiple news website claim that Turkey created a masks that kills coronavirus

Title: Non, cette lettre de Madame de Sévigné décrivant une épidémie en 1687 n'est pas authentique

Summary: Some Facebook posts and tweets claimed that the crew of the military ship "Charles de Gaulle" had been cured from coronavirus using chloroquine, which was untrue and debunked by the military

Title: Désintox. Non, la première volontaire à avoir testé le vaccin contre le coronavirus en Grande-Bretagne n'est pas morte.

Summary: A Congolese Facebook page known for spreading fake news claimed professor Jean-Jacques Muyembe Tamfum criticized covid-organics as an effective treatment for coronavirus, while he had not said anything on the purpose

Title: Baseless Attack on News MediaOver Photo of Coffins
Narrative_Description: Mainstream Mediais claiming that a photo of coffins from a 2017 movie is actually from Italy during COVID-19
Motive_Description: Mainstream Mediamay be misleading public about severity of COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, mainstream media, Italy, coffin, movie
Summary: A Facebook post circulated largely by conservative American accounts claimed that the mainstream Mediawas using a photo of coffins from a 2017 movie in reporting on deaths in Italy due to COVID-19 and misleading the public; there is no evidence that American Mediaoutlets have used this photo

Title: Union’s Search for Face Masks Gets Twisted Online
Narrative_Description: Suggests a California union may have stockpiled 39 million face masks
Motive_Description: Californian union SEIU-UHW may have hoarded face masks
Key_Words: Coronavirus, SEIU, Barr, face masks, stash
Summary: A meme circulated on Facebook as well as in online stories falsely suggesting a connection between an announcement by Attorney General Barr that the Justice Department would pursue those hoarding medical supplies and California union SEIU's finding a face mask supplier, indicating SEIU was secretly stashing supplies

Title: Social MediaPosts Make Baseless Claim on COVID-19 Death Toll
Narrative_Description: The U.S. may be inflating COVID-19 death counts
Motive_Description: Suggest U.S. COVID-19 death toll should be far lower
Summary: A photo on Facebook falsely claimed that in the U.S., anyone who didn't die of "gun shot wound or car accident" would be counted as a COVID-19 fatality, and thus U.S. COVID-19 numbers were overstated

Title: Walmart Hasn’t Adopted ‘Staggered Shopping’ Based on Age
Narrative_Description: Walmart will limit each age group to shopping one day a week
Motive_Description: Grocery stores may impose much stricter limitations
Summary: A photo on Facebook falsely claimed that Walmart was introducing a shopping schedule limiting each age group to one day per week. Although Walmart created special shopping hours for seniors, this claim is completely false

Title: Fact Check: Kennedy Center Did NOT Give DNC $5M After Getting $25M In Relief From Coronavirus Stimulus
Narrative_Description: The Kennedy Center donated $5 million to the DNC after getting COVID-19 relief funds
Motive_Description: COVID-19 relief money for nonprofits is being donated to the DNC
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Kennedy Center, DNC, democrats, relief
Summary: A post on Twitter and Facebook claimed that the Kennedy Center donated $5 million to the DNC a day after receiving $25 million from the COVID-19 stimulus package and that the Kennedy Center "launders taxpayer money for the Democrats." While the Kennedy Center did receive money, it did not donate to the DNC

Title: This graphic with a purported quote from a top administration official in the Philippines has been doctored
Narrative_Description: A spokesperson for the president of the Philippines said the poor are to blame for being unprepared for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Target Salvador Panelo, chief legal counsel for the Philippine's President Duterte
Source_Description: Facebook account Rosana Anub, Jacquilyn Echavez Kitoy
Summary: A photo on Facebook claimed to include a quote from Philippine's presidential spokesperson Salvador Panelo saying that the poor are to blame for being unprepared for COVID-19; the quote is fake

Title: This photo has circulated in reports since 2017 about Rodrigo Duterte visiting Marawi
Narrative_Description: Filipino President Duterte is going around the country in army fatigues to ensure the country is safe
Motive_Description: Praise the COVID-19 response of Filipino President Duterte
Summary: A photo of Philippines President Duterte in army fatigues circulated on Facebook with a claim that he was making the rounds to ensure the security of the country in the midst of COVID-19; the photo is actually from 2017

Title: A French hospital authority said this video shows French-made medical gowns that were damaged in storage
Narrative_Description: Medical gowns produced in China and used in France were defective and falling apart
Motive_Description: Medical supplies produced in China may be defective

Summary: A video of French medical workers trying to put on medical robes that fell apart circulated on social Mediawith a message that the gowns were produced in China; the gowns were actually made in France and defective due to improper storage

Title: This footage shows people praying in Brazil during the COVID-19 pandemic

Summary: News Mediapublished misleading article based on report from Chiba University that found correlation, not causation, between testing rates and death rates

Title: [新型コロナFactCheck] モーニングショー 岡田教授の｢療養ホテルに医師はいない｣発言はミスリード

Title: [新型コロナFactCheck] ｢日本の警察官73名が遺体取扱いで新型コロナに感染｣との台湾紙報道は誤り
Narrative_Description: 73 police officers in Japan got COVID from contact with infected dead bodies
Motive_Description: Taiwanese Mediamisinterpreted connection between two unrelated news reports in Japan, then did not fact check

Summary: Japanese police reported that 73 officers were infected, and that they dealt with 15 bodies. Liberty Times Net combined the unrelated stories and reported that officers were infected from bodies

Title: Factcheck : faux, le gouvernement kenyan n’a pas interdit les rapports sexuels pour lutter contre la Covid19
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the

Summary: A Congolese news website spread the rumor that the Kenyan Government had banned all sexual relations to prevent the spread of coronavirus, and the news was shared on Facebook and WhatsApp while no such inititative had been taken by Kenya

Title: Coronavirus : faux, Emmanuel Macron n’a pas appelé les africains à boire du Covid-Organics malgache
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: Claims that French President Macron has travelled to Madagascar and invited Africans to use Covid-organics as a treatment for Covid-19, while calling for resignation of WHO officials
