Motive_Description: Attempt to downplay the truth of how many  infected patients Nepal's public health infrastructure can realistically handle
Source_Description: Dr. Khem Karki, Expert Advisor of Nepal's Ministry of Health
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Nepal, Expert, Ministry of Health, one lakh infected people
Summary: Expert Advisor of Nepal's Ministry of Health falsely claims that the government is in a position to manage one lakh infected people

Title: 떠도는 '31번 확진자 사진'은 거짓... "중간 유포자도 엄벌"
Narrative_Description: Photo falsely identifying patient 31
Motive_Description: Spread fear by identifying patient 31
Summary: Photos falsely identifying patient-31 in South Korea to spread fear

Title: 뜨거운 물 마시고 해 쬐면 코로나19 예방 가짜 권고안 주의
Narrative_Description: Claims from fake Korean Medical Association that drinking hot water and sunbathing will kill of virus
Motive_Description: Spread hope by claiming heat, through hot water and sun, is a cure for the virus
Summary: False claims that drinking hot water and sunbathing will kill off virus from a source claiming to be the Korean Medical Association

Title: "콧물 나면 코로나19 아냐" 카톡서 도는 의협 권고안은 '가짜'
Narrative_Description: Claims from fake Korean Medical Association stating that runny nose is not a symptom of covid-19
Motive_Description: Spread hope by claiming that runny nose is not a symptom
Summary: False claim that runny nose is not a symptom of covid-19 from a fake source claiming to be the Korean Medical Association

Title: नझुक्किनुस्, कोरोना संक्रमित र मृतकको नाम खुलाउन सूचना आयोगले आदेश दिएको छैन
Narrative_Description: Incorrect news that the Nepal's Information Commission ordered the disclosure of the names and addresses of those infected and killed by the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fear that people's rights to privacy will be infringed by the Information Commission's order
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Nepal, National Information Commission, Disclosure
Summary: Incorrect news that the Nepal's National Information Commission ordered the disclosure of the names and addresses of those infected and killed by the coronavirus

Title: Pastor in Nepal accused of spreading misinformation for saying God has power over coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Pastor in Nepal spreading misinformation that God has power over coronavirus and that the virus has spiritual origins
Motive_Description: Spread False Hope that God will cure coronavirus for Christians who seek to be healed
Summary: Pastor in Nepal spreading misinformation that God has power over coronavirus and that the virus has spiritual origins

Title: أدوية و مسكنات محظور استخدامها تسبب تنشيط فيروس كورونا.. زائف
Narrative_Description: Post claims that certain perscription drugs  and medicine activates coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fear about medicines and certain drugs
Summary: Post of facebook claims that WHO has specified certain medicines and drugs that activates coronavirus

Title: دونالد ترامب مصاب بفيروس كورونا حسب قناة فوكس نيوز … خبر زائف
Narrative_Description: Fox news allegedly claim that Trump tested positive for coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread false claim that Trump has gotten infected with coronavirus
Summary: Post on facebook claims that Fox News has annouced that Trump has coronavirus. Fox News claimed that his valet was tested positive for coronavirus

Title: الحائز على جائزة نوبل في الطب تاسوكو هونجو يصرح بأن فيروس كورونا مصنع بالصين..خبر زائف
Narrative_Description: Nobel laureate scientist, Tasuku Honjo, has allegedly claimed the Corona virus was completely manufactured in China and that Wuhan laboratory scientists have either been executed or hidden.
Motive_Description: Spread conspiracy that Corona virus was manufactured in China
Summary: A post on Facebook claims that Nobel laureate scientist, Tasuku Honjo, has allegedly claimed the Corona virus was completely manufactured in China and that Wuhan laboratory scientists have either been executed or hidden. Tasuku Honjo has denied claims against him.

Title: الصحة العالمية الكحول لا يقتل فيروس كورونا المُستجد.. زائف
Narrative_Description: WHO allegedly claimed that alcohol doesn't kill the virus on surfaces
Motive_Description: Spark fear that alcohol is ineffective in killing coronavirus
Summary: A post on Facebook claimed that WHO announced that alcohol is ineffective in cleaning surfaces and killing the virus

Title: FALSE: Robredo says the virus, not people, should be restrained
Narrative_Description: Posts misattributing a quote to Vice President Leni Robredo, mocking her response to the virus
Motive_Description: Attempt to discredit VP Leni Robredo's position and response to the virus
Summary: Post claiming VP Leni Robredo said "it's not people that we should regulate, it's the virus" in an attempt to question her intelligence

Title: FALSE: 'Clean semen a cure for COVID-19'
Narrative_Description: Youtube video from a doctor claiming drinking "clean semen" is a cure for the virus
Motive_Description: Attempts to help from this doctor, by suggesting a "proven cure"
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Dr Anacleto Belleza Millendez, Youtube, clean semen
Summary: Youtube video from Dr Anacleto Belleza Millendez, claiming that drinking clean semen is a proven cure to the virus

Title: FALSE: 6 senators refuse to give coronavirus aid
Narrative_Description: Facebook post claiming 6 Philippine senators had refused to give COVID aid to constituents. Senators are not in Duterte's party.
Motive_Description: Attempts to discredit political standing of these 6 senators, who are not in Duterte's party.
Summary: Post claiming 6 Philippine senators - all of which are not in the same party as Duterte - were refusing to give COVID aid to their constituents.

Title: Fake hiring phone numbers shared online in US as unemployment surges
Narrative_Description: Provide phone numbers for various companies looking to hire new workers
Motive_Description: Major US companies may be looking to hire new workers in the midst of layoffs
Source_Description: Facebook account Nora Falls, Instagram account djgregstreet
Summary: Social Mediaposts included phone numbers, supposedly linked to job opportunities at FedEx, Home Depot, UPS, Verizon, and Staples; these numbers were fake or unrelated to hiring

Title: This photo shows Australia’s Bondi Beach in 2013
Narrative_Description: South Africans flocked to a beach in spite of the COVID-19 lockdown
Motive_Description: South Africans are ignoring the lockdown and going to beaches
Source_Description: Facebook account Chris Genade, NJ Van Heerden
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Africa, beach, party, lockdown
Summary: A photo of people on a beach was doctored to look like South African news reporting on the COVID-19 lockdown, and captions claimed that people were ignoring lockdown orders; the photo is actuall from Australia in 2013

Title: This photo has circulated in reports about a market in Myanmar during the COVID-19 pandemic
Narrative_Description: Vendors at a street market in Sri Lanka are maintaining social distance in response to COVID-19
Motive_Description: Street vendors in Sri Lanka are setting an example of proper social distancing
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Sri Lanka, vendor, social distancing
Summary: Sri Lankan Facebook accounts claimed that a photo showed a market in Sri Lanka where vendors are social distancing; the photo and market actually come from Myanmar

Title: False claim circulates that Pakistani plane transported Sri Lankan students home after COVID-19 lockdown
Narrative_Description: Pakistan flew Sri Lankan students home during the COVID-19 lockdown
Motive_Description: Praise the actions of the Pakistani government and criticize the Chinese government
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, flight, students
Summary: Posts claimed that while China would only use Sri Lankan flights to repatriate students, Pakistan used their own flights; Sri Lankan students actually returned from Pakistan on Sri Lankan flights

Title: Unrelated video falsely claimed as hospital murders patient to show surge in coronavirus deaths
Narrative_Description: Hospitals killing patients to show a surge in coronavirus-related deaths
Motive_Description: Attempts to downplay the deaths caused by the virus
Summary: Viral Facebook posts claimed that hospitals were deliberately killing patients in order to show a surge in Covid-19 related deaths

Title: Video of DTC personnel complaining about lack of social distancing in Delhi bus is from March
Narrative_Description: Public transport personnel and passengers were not adhering to social distancing norms
Motive_Description: Attempts to discredit the Delhi Chief Minister and his response to the coronavirus
Source_Description: BJP Delhi, Parvesh Sahib Singh, Congress, Ajay Maken
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Arvind Kejriwal, Delhi, DTC, BJP, buses, social distancing, Congress
Summary: Various accounts linked to the BJP and Congress tweeted an old video claiming that public buses' passengers and personnel were not following social distancing protocols post reopening of Delhi's lockdown and blamed Delhi Chief Minister, Arvind Kejriwal

Title: Did UP govt issue order restricting samaritans from helping migrants workers?
Narrative_Description: Police were prosecuting locals for distributing food and water to migrants traveling home
Motive_Description: Attempts to discredit the police force of the a district
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Yogendra Yadav, Bulandshahr, police, migrants
Summary: Political leader Yogendra Yadav tweeted the claim that the Bulandshahr (Uttar Pradesh) police was prosecuting people for distributing food and water to travelling migrant workers because this violated lockdown rules

Title: Fake message claims labourers working between 1990 to 2020 will get ₹1.2 lakh benefits
Narrative_Description: Government of India was giving INR 1.2 lakh to Indian laborers as part of the economic relief package
Motive_Description: Spread fake news about economic relief for laborers
Summary: Fake WhatsApp forwards invited users to check if they were eligible for receiving INR 1.2 lakh as part of the Government's economic relief package by directing them to a fake website

Title: False quote attributed to WHO claims no vegetarian has been affected by coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Vegetarians are immune from the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread false claim that vegetarians are safe from contracting Covid-19
Summary: False claim circulated on social Mediastating that the WHO had said vegetarians cannot contract the coronavirus

Title: Fake message attributed to ICMR lists 21 dos and don’ts post lockdown
Narrative_Description: A list of do's and don't's for post-lockdown was released by the ICMR
Motive_Description: Attribute a fake list of do's and don't's to the Indian Council of Medical Research
Summary: A fake list of do's and don't's was circulated on WhatsApp, attributed to the ICMR

Title: Viral message falsely claims Mumbai and Pune to be under military lockdown, CM debunks rumour
Narrative_Description: Maharashtra cities, Pune and Mumbai, would be under a military-supervised lockdown
Motive_Description: Spread fear among citizens of the two cities
Summary: Fake forwards on social Mediaclaimed that Pune and Mumbai would be on a military-supervised lockdown and no supplies, except for milk and medicines, would be available for the lockdown period

Title: Video from Pak viral as Air India flouts social distancing norms, overcharges passengers
Narrative_Description: Air India, the national airline of India, had overcharged passengers for repatriation flights but were not maintaining social distancing protocols
Motive_Description: Discredit Air India
Summary: A video from Pakistan was claimed to be a video of Air India not following social distancing protocols on a repatriation flight

Title: Images from Myanmar viral as social distancing in Mizoram vegetable market
Narrative_Description: Posts lauded social distancing protocols in a market in Mizoram
Motive_Description: Laud social distancing efforts in an Indian state
Source_Description: Shobha De, Shunali Shroff, Danish Manzoor, Anil Chopra
Summary: Pictures from Myanmar were shared as those from a market in Mizoram where social distancing protocols were being followed well

Title: False quote suggests Japanese Nobel laureate Tasuku Honjo said coronavirus is man-made
Narrative_Description: Japanese Nobel laureate said the coronavirus was man-made
Motive_Description: Use a credible immunologist to discredit China and propagate the conspiracy theory that the coronavirus is man-made
Summary: Fake WhatsApp forwards claimed that the Japanese Nobel Laureate, Tasuku Honjo, had said the coronavirus was man-made in China

Title: Old video falsely viral as US students sing Indian national anthem to thank India for HCQ
Narrative_Description: Students from the US sang the Indian national anthem to thank India for supplying HCQ to the US
Motive_Description: Laud the Indian government for supplying HCQ to the US
Summary: Fake videos and images have been circulated to praise India's efforts to provide HCQ to the US

Title: Old, unrelated image from Malaysia shared as migrants stranded in Gujarat due to lockdown
Narrative_Description: Migrant laborers in Gujarat have been stranded without food and the Mediaisn't covering this news adequately, focusing instead on stoking communal tensions
Motive_Description: Blame Mediafor not covering news of stranded migrants and show their plight
Summary: Images were circulated with the claim that they were of migrants stranded in Gujarat without food and that the Mediawas ignoring this news while focusing on stories about the Tablighi Jamaat instead

Title: Désintox. Non, Agnès Buzyn n'a pas soigné certaines personnes avec de la chloroquine
Narrative_Description: Rumors that former French Health Minister Agnès Buzyn cures people with hydroxychloroquine in hospitals
Motive_Description: Discredit former French Health Minister Agnès Buzyn
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, hydroxychloroquine, Agnès Buzyn, hospital, cure
Summary: The news spread that former Health Minister Agnès Buzyn was curing some priviledged people with hydroxychloroquine in the hospital where she now works, despite having banned its free prescription in January (both info are untrue)

Title: Désintox. Confinement : non, la mortalité début 2020 n'est pas inférieure à celle des années passées.
Narrative_Description: Claims that the government emergency response to coronavirus are exaggerated, as mortality in France in the first months of 2020 is lower than in the past few years
Motive_Description: Show that coronavirus has not increased mortality in France and should therefore not be seen as a big threat
Summary: Data for mortality in the first months of 2020 that were not up to date were taken out of context to show that mortality is actually lower than in the same period for past years, and that coronavirus has not had such a big impact

Title: Non, le FMI ne propose pas de taxer 10% de l’épargne mondiale pour faire face à la crise du coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Rumors that the IMF has encouraged countries to take 10% of people's savings to pay back debt due to the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Discredit the IMF by claiming it wants to increase taxation in a time of deep crisis
Summary: The rumor spread, following the intervention on TV of a French economist, that the IMF was proposing to use 10% of people's savings to pay back the debt caused by coronavirus, while the suggestion dated back to 2013 and concerned potential responses to the 2008 financial crisis

Title: Vrai ou fake : les contrevérités du web
Narrative_Description: Claims that the coronavirus crisis has been exaggerated and that the virus is not such a big threat
Motive_Description: Downplay the danger posed by coronavirus by saying that mortality is not high and that a healthy immune system is the only thing needed to heal
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, YouTube, cure, mortality, flu
Summary: 4 French Youtubers, already known for spreading health-related fake news to make more views, released a video where they downplayed the severity of the coronavirus emergency, by falsely claiming the virus kills less tha seasonal flu and that a healthy immune system is just enough to survive

Title: Désintox. Non, l'artemisia n'a pas été reconnu comme remède contre le Covid par l'OMS
Narrative_Description: Claims that artemisia has now been officially recognized by WHO as a remedy against coronavirus
Motive_Description: Show the political victory of African countries and their traditional medicine against Western medicine
Key_Words: Coronavirus, artemisia, Covid-organics, Madagascar, Guinea, cure
Summary: The news spread in Guinea and Other francophone African countries, through Facebook groups, that artemisia had officially been recognized by WHO as a cure against COVID-19, while it has not

Title: Désintox. Mortalité et Covid-19 : les chiffres trompeurs de Vikash Dhorasoo
Narrative_Description: Claims that emergency measures implemented all over the world as a reaction to the COVID-9 emergency are exaggerated, as it has a low number of deaths worldwide compared to Other diseases
Motive_Description: Show that the virus is not as deadly as it would seem using data from the beginning of the epidemy
Source_Description: Vikash Dhorasoo (LFI candidate for the role of Paris major)
Summary: Former footballer and candidate for the role of Paris major Vikash Dhorasoo criticized coronavirus emergency measures while claiming that Covid-19 is only 17th in the world for number of daily deaths, citing data from the beginning of the epidemy

Title: Désintox. Non, le gel hydroalcoolique n'est pas explosif
Narrative_Description: Rumors that hand sanitizers can explode if left in a car and reaching high temperatures
Motive_Description: The rumor was spread with the precautionary message that people should be careful about leaving hydroalcoholic solutions under the sun, unattended
Key_Words: Coronavirus, gel, hydroalcoholic, hand-sanitizer, explode, burst, car
Summary: The rumor spread in Brazil, France and Other countries that hydroalcoholic gels left unattended in a car might reach a high temperature and explode, as they are inflammable

Title: Vrai ou fake : le futur vaccin contre le coronavirus contiendra de l’aluminium ?
Narrative_Description: Rumors that a future vaccine protecting against COVID-19 will contain aluminium and will therefore be dangerous for people's health
Motive_Description: Undermine trust in a future vaccine and in the ability of researchers and pharmaceutical companies to tackle the coronavirus emergency
Summary: While no research on a coronavirus vaccine is currently using aluminium, the rumor spread that aluminium is being used for such a vaccine and that it will therefore be dangerous for people's health

Title: Didier Raoult a-t-il annoncé qu'il quittait la France pour la Chine?
Narrative_Description: Claim that French researcher Didier Raoult has decided to leave France for China to do research there
Motive_Description: Spread the rumor that professor Didier Raoult has decided to leave France for China
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Didier Raoult, France, China, research, leave
Summary: The news spread that French professor Didier Raoult had decided to leave France for China after problems with the Government and the international community regarding its approval of the use of hydroxychloroquine, but it was denied

Title: Le gouvernement a-t-il fait voter un amendement lui permettant une «auto-amnisitie» ?
Narrative_Description: Rumors the French Parliament was about to approve (and then approved) a law granting amnisty for any responsibility in the mismanagement of the COVID-19 crisis
Motive_Description: Discredit the French Parliament and specifically the parliamentary majority by accusing them of having approved a law to avoid responsibility in the crisis and act undisturbed
Summary: The rumor spread that French parliamentary authorities had approved a law granting them amnesty for any mismanagement occurred among public authorities during the emergency, while the law was not changing any existing rule

Title: FALSE: Brown sugar cures coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Posts claiming brown sugar a is a remedy against coronavirus.
Motive_Description: Posts claiming "traditional medicine" was effective, and to consume brown sugar as a treatment
Summary: Post claiming brown sugar was a proven treatment for coronavirus.

Title: FALSE: FBI arrests Bill Gates for creating coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Fake news post claiming Bill Gates was arrested for manufacturing COVID-19 as a bioweapon.
Motive_Description: An attempt to undermine and stoke uncertainty on Bill Gates
Summary: Fake news post claiming Bill Gates was recently arrested on charges of biological terrorism.

Title: FALSE: Coronavirus sticks faster on men with shaved heads
Narrative_Description: Fake news post claiming Coronavirus sticks faster to bald men as a diagnostic procedure/warning
Motive_Description: An attempt to spread "useful" information among the general public
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Philippines, bald men, Department of health
Summary: Fake news post claiming Coronavirus stuck to bald men faster, as a warning and diagnostic procedure.

Title: 이 병원에 코로나 의심자 입원 가짜뉴스 유포자 2명 재판에
Narrative_Description: Two men were charged after spreading false information that coronavirus patients were admitted into certain hospitals
Motive_Description: An attempt to spread fear by claiming there are patients in certain hopsitals
Summary: Two men were charged after spreading false information regarding the virus including one narrative claiming there wre patients in a specific hospital

Title: “헤어드라이어로 코로나 죽여” 대학총장 인터넷 글은 ‘가짜’
Narrative_Description: False claim that hair dryer kills coronavirus spread by using a university president's name
Motive_Description: Rumor spread that heat from a hair dryer can kill coronavirus germs and used name of university president
Summary: False image and note spread claiming to be written by a university president that the heat from a hair dryer can kill coronavirus germs

Title: [용인시] 코로나19 첫번째 확진자 가족은 음성... 동선자료는 가짜
Narrative_Description: False tracking information released about the first coronavirus patient in Yongin City
Motive_Description: Spread fear by releasing false tracking information of first patient in Yongin city
Summary: False tracking information about first patient in Yongin city spread

Title: 코로나19 접촉자 여수에 왔다"..여수시 경찰에 수사 의뢰
Narrative_Description: False image spread showing that coronavirus patients came to Yeosu
Motive_Description: Spread fear by falsely claiming that coronavirus had entered Yeosu
Summary: False image and message spread on social Mediaclaiming that a coronavirus patient had entered Yeosu

Title: 청주 코로나피싱 당했다 확산…충북경찰 '허위사실 주의'
Narrative_Description: False messages spread about covid-19 related phishing messages
Motive_Description: Spread fear by spreading fake messages about covid-19 related phishing in Cheongju
Summary: Fake messages spread that covid-19 messages were phishing scams in Cheongju

Title: 드라이기로 옷 소독하면 바이러스 죽는다? 코로나 가짜 예방법 기승
Narrative_Description: Image spread claiming that a Korean pharmacy was selling preventative medicine
Motive_Description: Sell fake preventative medicine
Summary: Image spread of pharmacy claiming to sell preventative medicine

Title: Misinformation on COVID-19 Death Protocols in New York
Narrative_Description: Claim that bodies of COVID-19 victims belong to the state in New York and will be incinerated without memorials
Motive_Description: Fear that families of COVID-19 victims in New York may not be able to hold memorials
Key_Words: Coronavirus, New York, bodies, incinerator, memorial
Summary: An image on Facebook falsely claimed that the bodies of COVID-19 victims would belong to the state in New York and would be incinerated without the opportunity for memorial services

Title: Hoax Letter Stirs Confusion About Missouri Schools
Narrative_Description: An April Fool's joke claiming that students in Missouri would have to repeat grades spiraled into a fake news story
Motive_Description: Fear that students in Missouri may have to repeat grades as a result of COVID-19
Summary: A picture of an April Fool's letter circulated on Facebook claiming to be from the Missouri Department of Education and stating that students who did not complete exams would have to repeat the grade; some were deceived by the letter and the state had to officially respond

Title: Lemon Juice Tea Does Not Cure COVID-19 in Israel, or Anywhere Else
Narrative_Description: Lemon and baking soda tea can cure COVID-19 and has prevented any related deaths in Israel
Motive_Description: Report false cures for COVID-19 and downplay the severity of COVID-19 in Israel
Key_Words: Coronavius, lemon, Israel, cure, baking soda
Summary: An image circulated on Facebook and WhatsApp falsely claiming that there have been no COVID-19 deaths in Israel and that a mix of lemon, baking soda, and hot water is a cure for COVID-19

Title: No, states like Illinois and California aren’t banning alcohol sales
Narrative_Description: Some US states are going to ban the selling of alcohol as part of COVID-19 lockdowns
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the inability to purchase alcohol
Summary: Posts on Facebook with the appearance of blog posts or Mediaheadlines falsely claimed that various states, particularly Illinois and California, would be banning the sale of alcohol as part of the COVID-19 lockdown

Title: False Claim of Congressional Pay Raises in Stimulus Bill
Narrative_Description: The U.S. economic relief package will give pay raises to members of Congress
Motive_Description: Criticize U.S. Congress for using emergency relief money to increase congressional salaries
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Congress, salary, stimulus, CARES Act
Summary: Various posts on Facebook falsely claimed that the U.S. CARES Act would include pay raises for members of Congress

Title: فتيات بحرينيات يهربن من الحجر الصحي بسبب فيروس كورونا … عنوان مضلل
Narrative_Description: Photo of Bahraini women allegedly escaping from quarantine
Motive_Description: Fear that a number of women have escaped quarantine
Summary: Post circultaling, with a photo of women running in the street, and claiming that they are escaping quarantine

Title: [新型コロナFactCheck] ｢(5月11日)東京は病床がひっ迫 使用率8割超え｣NHKが誤報 実際は5割未満
Narrative_Description: Hospital beds in Tokyo are at 80% capacity due to coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fear that hospital beds will not be enough
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Japan, Tokyo, hospital beds, capacity
Summary: NHK News reported on May 12 that hospital beds in Tokyo are at 80% capacity

Narrative_Description: LINE is sending messages chain messages to users to assess the risks of COVID
Motive_Description: Spread a chain message as far as possible
Summary: User posing as LINE is sending chain message to LINE users asking them to send to 20 Others to confirm the risks of COVID

Title: Britain’s first coronavirus vaccine volunteer has not died after trial jab
Narrative_Description: Claims that first volunteer for a COVID-19 vaccine trial in the UK died
Motive_Description: COVID-19 vaccine trials may be deadly
Summary: Posts around the world falsely claimed that the first person to be part of a vaccine trial in Oxford died

Title: Posts misrepresent eligibility for US COVID-19 stimulus payments
Narrative_Description: Claims Americans married to immigrants will not be eligible for the U.S. stimulus check
Motive_Description: Criticize Trump and McConnell for the rollout of the stimulus
Summary: Facebook and Instagram posts claimed that Americans married to immigrants would not be eligible for the coronavirus stimulus check and criticized Trump and McConnell; this is misleading, Americans are only ineligible if one partner does not have a social security number

Title: Nein, dieses Video zeigt keine Corona-Proteste, sondern eine Demo in Chemnitz 2018
Narrative_Description: Video circulating suggests that there are mass protests in Chemnitz against the coronavirus regulations
Motive_Description: Create resentment towards government for denying people "freedom" during the pandemic
Summary: A Facebook user posted a video, claiming that it shows a current protest against the government's responses to the pandemic - the video is, however, 2 years old

Title: Corona-Kettenbrief enthält mehrere Falschaussagen und unbelegte Behauptungen zu China
Narrative_Description: Claims circulating that China's major cities were often not impacted by the virus at all and that Chinese created coronavirus to sink oil prices and improve their own economy
Motive_Description: Create greater mistrust of Chinese government/generate greater speculation around the origins of the virus
Summary: A Whatsapp chain message suggests that the Chinese economy is profiting greatly from the coronavirus and that the coronavirus was created by the Chinese for this purpose

Title: Youtube-Video von „Coach Cecil“: Falsche Aussagen über das RKI, die Corona-Sterblichkeit und Bill Gates
Narrative_Description: Youtuber makes multiple claims, including that Bill Gates is the primary sponsor of WHO, that coronavirus death tolls are hugely overreported and inaccurate, and that no one has died of coronavirus, but rather of Other causes while also contracting the virus
Motive_Description: Generate feelings that general public is being deceived when it comes to coronavirus stats, that virus is actually not as serious
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Coach Cecil, Bill Gates, mortality rate
Summary: A Youtube video from "Coach Cecil" makes claims that coronavirus death rates are misrepresented, implies that Gates has some greater control over WHO, and claims that most people who are recorded as coronavirus deaths actually die from Other causes

Title: Nein, in SARS-CoV-2 wurden nicht im Labor Sequenzen von HIV eingefügt
Narrative_Description: Claim spread, derived from miscontrued quote from Luc Montagnier, that sequences from HIV are being inserted into coronavirus in labs
Motive_Description: Suggest that there are controlling powers that are intentionally designing the virus in a specific way
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Sputnik-News, Luc Montagnier, HIV, labs
Summary: News article published in Sputnik-News is one of many to misinterpret Luc Montagnier, citing that he states sequences from HIV are being inserted into coronavirus in laboratories and intentionally spread

Title: Michael Spitzbart verbreitet falsche Behauptungen über Bill Gates
Narrative_Description: Doctor spreads false claims about Gates, saying that he has left thousands in India paralyzed after failed vaccine attempt and that Gates says a coronavirus vaccine will hurt thousands
Motive_Description: Generate mistrust towards vaccines/Gates
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Gates, vaccine, India, Germany, Spitzbart
Summary: Doctor Michael Spitzbart made claims on Instagram and Facebook that Bill Gates said that 700000 people will be harmed in the creation of the coronavirus vaccine, also makes claims that Gates left thousands of children in India paralyzed in a previous vaccination attempt

Title: This story was originally published on a satirical website
Narrative_Description: New York funeral home accidentally cremated an exhausted employee
Motive_Description: Fear that an overworked employee in a New York funeral home was accidentally cremated
Key_Words: Coronavirus, New York, cremate, accident, employee
Summary: A story originating on a U.S. satirical website circulated on social Mediafalsely claiming that a New York funeral home accidentally cremated an exhausted worker who fell asleep

Title: Viral videos of Africans attacked in China were filmed years ago
Narrative_Description: Africans are being beaten by Asian people in China
Motive_Description: Fear that Africans are facing discriminations and abuse
Key_Words: Coronavirus, African, China, violate, torture, humiliate
Summary: Facebook and Twitter posts circulated videos claiming to show Africans being beaten in China during the COVID-19 pandemic, but the videos were filmed years earlier

Title: This video shows the Philippine National Police conducting a training exercise
Narrative_Description: A man was shot at a COVID-19 quarantine checkpoint in the Philippines
Motive_Description: Criticize the Philippine National Police and opposition political party

Title: الشاي بالليمون وحبة البركة يوميًّا هو علاج فيروس كورونا والفواكه ترفع المناعة.. زائف جزئيًّا

Summary: News websites Al-Arabiya and Roya claimed that aerobatics drawing the colors of the Italian flag is because Italy was celebrating lifting travel restrictions and recording zero new deaths. The aerobatics drawing the colors of the Italian flag was to celebrate the 74th anniversary of the Italian Republic Day on June 2.

Summary: Pro-Assad news websites have shared false claim that WHO declared Syria safe from coronavirus. WHO has refued the claim with a tweet.

Title: هل أطلقت روسيا أسوداً في شوارعها لإجبار الناس على الحجر المنزلي بسبب (كورونا)؟

Title: This video shows a lodging facility that was converted into a COVID-19 quarantine centre

Source_Description: Facebook accounts Venkatesh Varadhachary, నవ భారతం, భారతీయ హిందూ శక్తి, Twitter accounts @spsridevi714gm1, @ReportHinduphob

Summary: Video (really showing a lodging facility near a temple) circulated alongside a claim that it showed a Hindu temple being converted to a covid quarantine center, with explicit reference to the fact that churches and mosques should receive the same treatment.

Title: This video shows a protest in New York City in 2017

Title: This is an old picture taken before the pandemic

Source_Description: Facebook accounts Stuart England, AkPraise.Com, Instagram account celebsocialfeed, online newspaper Tunde Ednut (Twitter account @TundeEdnut and website), former World Bank managing director Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala (on Facebook by mistake)

Summary: Picture (taken from a different context) circulated alongside the claim it showed food supplies provided for by Paul Kagame for the Rwandan families, with an explicit reference to the fact that Nigerian leader Muhammadu Buhari should do the same. Former World Bank chief Ngozi Okonjo-Iweal too shared the news by mistake.

Title: Dans le Brésil de Bolsonaro, la théorie des "cercueils vides" veut minimiser la pandémie de Covid-19

Summary: The news spread that the Mediaare showing images of coffins that are in fact empty just to amplify the perception of the crisis, while it is much less serious than people would believe

Summary: A challenge spread on social networks encouraging people to blow the flame of a lighter while wearing a mask to test for its efficacy, while this is in no way a testing method

Source_Description: Sama Thapa, AP One Television journalist

Summary: Sama Thapa, AP One Television journalist, writing a factually incorrect statement about the role/ability of a private hospital (Patan Grandi Hospital in this case) in using expensive PCR technology

Title: No truth to report about robbers posing as coronavirus testers

Title: HOAX! 12 Orang Positif Covid-19 di Tenggiri Gang 12

The message include some photos of officers spraying the area -- which was a preventative measures instead of treating the dozen who are reportedly sick.

Title: Kabar Pasien Covid-19 di Cimahi Kabur Dipastikan Hoax

Title: Benarkah Ini Foto-foto Malaysia yang Sapu Habis WNA Termasuk TKI Saat Pandemi Covid-19?

Motive_Description: Spread fear that relatives or friends of immigrants in Malaysia might be deported from the country
Summary: A facebook post showing a number of photos of SouthEast Asian looking people are being put in a truck and boats, and a room with a number of personnel gurading these people. The message is that these people are immigrants in Malaysia that are being deported in a way to curb coonavirus in the country. In fact, the photos are taken during raids for illegal immigrants that conducted regularly in Malaysia.

Title: Message Claiming Coronavirus Can Last Up To 8 Hours In Air Is Misleading
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus is airborne and can survive in the air for 8 hours or more
Motive_Description: Spread fear that coronavirus can be spread through the air for hours

Summary: An order on movement restrictions due to Covid-19 in Malaysia was shared on Indian social Mediaas an order for Indians by the PMO India

Motive_Description: Spread fear that India will be extending its lockdown
Summary: A morphed and fake graphic purporting to be from India Today claiming the ongoing 21-day lockdown set to end on April 14 has been extended to May 4, 2020 was circulated widely.

Narrative_Description: Murmuration of birds in Ahmedabad occuring due to covid-19 lockdown
Motive_Description: Make people think that natural phenomena were occuring due to Covid-19
Summary: A video of birds flocking together in Ahmedabad earlier this year was falsely linked to the COVID-19 lockdown and the subsequent movement of wildlife in human habitats.

Summary: The English edition of Marathi daily Lokmat published an article falsely claiming that a Chinese intelligence officer had leaked details on how the coronavirus outbreak was supposedly caused by a bioweapon.

Motive_Description: Spread fear that babies could be born with coronavirus; make people think that the baby gave a cure to the coronavirus
Summary: Pictures of a stillborn baby with anencephaly were circulated with two separate false claims: one, that the baby was born with coronavirus and two, that the baby gave a solution to end the Coronavirus outbreak and then died shortly after

Motive_Description: Criticize the government for poor handling of patients with Covid-19
Summary: A video of a man gasping for breath while lying on a stretcher was circulated online with false claims calling him a COVID-19 patient fighting for his life in a hospital in India.

Summary: Fake claims spread on Facebook and WhatsApp in Ecuador that the first cases of coronavirus had been detected in the country asof the end of January

Motive_Description: Spread weird story about coronavirus

Summary: Fake screenshot of tweet by Brazilian newspaper O Globo circulated claiming that a coronavirus patient in the US bit his doctor on the jugular.

Title: This bill was for medical services unrelated to COVID-19 treatment, the hospital said
Narrative_Description: Claims a COVID-19 patient in a Singapore hospital faced an enormous medical bill
Motive_Description: Stoke fear about the potential medical costs associated with COVID-19 treatment in Singapore
Summary: Posts claimed to show the hospital bill for a COVID-19 patient in Singapore; the bill was actually for treatment unrelated to COVID-19

Title: Misleading mask graphic claims to show exact chance of COVID-19 spread
Narrative_Description: Graphics claim to provide the exact probability of spreading COVID-19 depending on mask usage
Motive_Description: While the graphic tries to encourage mask usage and broadly understands risks, there is no proof of the given probabilities
Summary: A graphic claimed to provide the exact probability of spreading COVID-19 depending on mask usage, and while the ordering of risk is correct, there is no evidence for the given numerical probabilities

Title: This video of Boris Johnson has circulated in Mediareports since August 2018
Narrative_Description: Claims a video showed Boris Johnson offering tea to reporters after recovering from COVID-19
Motive_Description: Promote the health and kindness of Boris Johnson
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Boris Johnson, tea, recover, home, UK
Summary: Posts claimed a video showed Boris Johnson bringing tea to reporters at his home after recovering from COVID-19; the video is actually from 2018

Title: This video shows a gathering at a mosque in Maharashtra before India announced a nationwide COVID-19 lockdown
Narrative_Description: Claims Muslims gathered at a mosque in India in defiance of the COVID-19 lockdown
Motive_Description: Incite fear about gatherings at mosques despite the lockdown
Key_Words: Coronavirus, India, mosque, Muslim, Gujarat, lockdown
Summary: Posts claimed a video showed a gathering at a mosque in April 2020 in violation of the COVID-19 lockdown; the video actually came from before the lockdown

Title: These photos show the Philippine capital Manila, not Sri Lanka’s capital Colombo

Motive_Description: Misrepresents the location of skyline photos

Summary: A series of photos were said to show the skyline in Colombo, Sri Lanka with the air quality improving as a result of the COVID-19 lockdown; the photos are actually from the Philippines

Title: Corona Impfung und Schwangerschaftshormon gegen Schwangerschaft: Fake!

Motive_Description: Spark fear by making women believe that a potential vaccine against COVID-19 will prevent them from bearing children
Summary: The rumor spread in Austria and Germany that one of the vaccines against COVID-19 contains a hormone that makes women infertile, while this is untrue and no vaccine has been created yet

Title: Merkel ohne Maske, jedoch mit gefälschtem Datum!
Narrative_Description: Claims that Angela Merkel and Other politicians fail to follow the emergency measures they have implemented (i.e. wearing sa mask in public)
Motive_Description: Discredit Angela Merkel and her government

Summary: A picture was manipulated to show that Angela Merkel was in public and not wearing a mask beginning of May 2020, while the original picture was taken in 2019

Title: Giuseppe Conte did not have dinner with Other MPs at the Parliament's restaurant in spite of emergency measures
Narrative_Description: Picture showing Italian PM and Other MPs supposedly having dinner together and without following security norms at the Parliament's restaurant
Motive_Description: Discredit Italian PM Giuseppe Conte and Other MPs

Summary: Picture taken out of context and circulating in Italy depicting Italian PM Giuseppe Conte supposedly having lunch with people at the Parliament's restaurant, while he was actually visiting a plant in the North of Italy and eating with workers, before the coronavirus outbreak

Title: Coronavirus. Il complottone di Google che vi installa l’App di tracciamento Immuni senza il vostro consenso

Title: El clorito de sodio no cura el coronavirus y es peligroso para la salud

Title: No, este vídeo de un mercado no está grabado en Wuhan (China) ni es el escenario donde se ha "propagado el coronavirus": el vídeo está grabado en Indonesia y es de julio de 2019

Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Africa, cigarette, fine, police
Summary: While selling tobacco products is currently outlawed in South Africa, posts and a WhatsApp message falsely claimed that people could be fined 1500-5000 Rand if the police catch them in posession of cigarettes

Title: “국내 사망자 수천명” 가짜뉴스로 호소...국격 깎아먹는 ‘무개념 해외여행 환불족’
Narrative_Description: False posts saying that there are more death caused by covid-19 in South Korea than reported by the government in posts on how to get refunds for travel
Motive_Description: Spreading false news about covid-19 deaths in South Korea so people can get refunds on travel bookings
Summary: Posts on blogs and social Mediaclaiming that there more covid-19 deaths in South Korea and that people should use false assertion to get travel refunds

Title: Food parcels in South Africa’s coronavirus lockdown? Ignore fake messages, call 0800 601 011 instead
Narrative_Description: Claims South Africans can apply for government food parcels by giving personal information to various telephone numbers
Motive_Description: Collect personal information from South Africans

Summary: The South African government has been distributing food parcels during the COVID-19 lockdown, but Facebook posts provided fake phone numbers, claiming that people should call and provide personal information to apply for food parcels

Title: No, South African police did not confiscate food donated to white people

Motive_Description: Accuse South African police/government of racial bias against white South Africans
Source_Description: Facebook account Deel gerus / Please share
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Africa, food, donation, police
Summary: A widely shared Facebook post falsely claimed that the South African police had confiscated food being donated by a church to a poor white community because donations were not allowed for whites, including photos of children who were actually from Syria and the US

Title: No, Shoprite, Checkers supermarkets not facing food shortages
Narrative_Description: Claims certain supermarket items may become scarce over the next month
Motive_Description: Incite fear about grocery shortages in South Africa
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Africa, shortage, food, Shoprite, Checkers
Summary: Afrikaans-language Facebook posts falsely claimed that the supermarkets Shoprite and Checkers would face shortages in certain food items and washing powder in South Africa

Title: No high court ruling to ‘partially reopen’ Kenya’s churches
Narrative_Description: Claims the Kenyan high court ordered churches to be partially reopened
Motive_Description: Create False Hope surrounding the reopning of churches in Kenya
Summary: An article shared on Facebook falsely claimed that the Kenyan high court ordered the partial reopning of churches; Kenya has actually banned religious gatherings in response to COVID-19

Title: Unilever, Sasko, Tastic NOT closing, still making food during South Africa’s coronavirus lockdown
Narrative_Description: Claims food production companies are shutting down in South Africa and people should stock up
Motive_Description: Incite fear about the potential for food shortages in South Africa
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Africa, food, close, shortage
Summary: Fake messages and posts claimed that a "friend in Durban" told posters that food production companies would be shutting down in South Africa and that people should stock up

Title: #Verificamos: Empresa china con logo ‘inspirado’ en el juego Resident Evil no tiene relación con el coronavirus

Summary: Fake story circulated in Brazil that the virus was weaponized by a company with the same logo as that of the Umbrella Coroporation from videogame Resident Evil.

Title: El coronavirus no ha llegado a Cúcuta
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus got to Cúcuta, Colombia
Motive_Description: Inform Other users (the article was misanderstood)
Source_Description: Twitter accounts @myriam_charry, @oscarnicolasupm, @enid_romanat, Facebook account Enfoque 365 - Cúcuta
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, Cúcuta, Luis Guillermo Vélez, La República, cases
Summary: Fake story circulated about coronavirus cases having been detectd in Cúcuta, Colombia as of January 29, 2020. The story originated from the satirical article written by Luis Guillermo Vélez, which was misunderstood due to its ambiguity.

Title: 上海玉佛城小區發現台灣確診病例

Motive_Description: Raise fear that places in the southside of Taiwan is restricting entrance due to around 700 confirmed cases
Key_Words: Coronavirus, confirmed cases, south, Taiwan, frogs, restrictions
Summary: Rumors claimed a person sent frogs to Taiwan and there were around 700 cases in the south of Taiwan

Title: 謝和弦散佈假消息「大麻可殺死武漢肺癌病毒」

Summary: An article claimed Taiwanese singer and actor, Hsie He Hsian, was trialed for spreading rumors on Instagram that weed kills off the coronavirus

Title: 台南男傳疫情假訊息 刑事局依法送辯

Summary: A news article justifies that a 50 years old man spread rumors on a fake Facebook account that students who were once tested positive have returned back to school campus under the protection Chinese policemen

Title: 【新聞】轉傳 「蔡當局燒死疫情患者」 假訊息宜警速逮造謠者
Narrative_Description: Spread rumors that Taiwan's coronavirus is out of control; the military is taking control, and authorities of Tsai Ing-wen burn infected COVID-19 victims' bodies in public
Motive_Description: Spread rumors that Taiwan's government has lost control of the coronavirus situation
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Tsai Ing-wen, lost, control, military, Taipei, burn, bodies, public,victims
Summary: 25-year-old man falsely claimed that Taiwan's coronavirus is out of control

Title: Keine Sonderregeln im Ramadan
Narrative_Description: Claims that Muslims in Germany were exempt from corona restrictions during Ramadan
Motive_Description: Generate animosity towards government and towards Muslim population

Summary: Information spread by an alleged Berlin and Brandenburg Crisis Center states that Muslims in Germany are allowed to gather for Ramadan - this is not true and no religions are given special exemption from emergency measures

Title: Aspirin ist kein Mittel gegen Covid-19 und das Virus kein Bakterium
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that the coronavirus is actually a bacteria and can be combatted with aspirin
Motive_Description: Encourage the view that the coronavirus is nothing to worry about and has an easy cure
Summary: Claims spread online through Facebook and through Telegram messaging that the coronavirus is actually a bacteria that can be treated effectively with aspirin, claims stemming allegedly from an Italian health center

Title: Zensur in Dänemark eingeführt?

Motive_Description: Raise fears about how government is taking away personal liberties in the name of coronavirus measures
Summary: Claims spread through a website that the Danish government will not allow any coronavirus related news to be published unless it is government sponsored - this is not true and extrapolated from government's increased anti-fake news measures

Title: Impfzwang-Faktencheck: Keine Corona-Impfpflicht in Deutschland beschlossen
Narrative_Description: Rumors spread online that from May 15th, mandatory vaccinations would be put in place in Germany
Motive_Description: Generate animosity towards government and animosity towards vaccination
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, vaccination, Youtube, Corwin von Kuhwede
Summary: Video on Youtube asserts that the German government is enforcing a mandatory vaccination law starting May 15th, claims are false

Title: Video im Faktencheck: Prof. Sucharit Bhakdi kritisiert Corona-Maßnahmen
Narrative_Description: Claims spread through a video online that coronavirus is much less severe and was only made worse in hard hit places by poor air conditions
Motive_Description: Generate confidence in general public to flaunt safety measures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Sucharit Bhakdi, emergency measures
Summary: Professor Sucharit Bhakdi argues on Youtube that Emergency Responses in Germany have been too severe, that the coronavirus is not dangerous and that places like north Italy and China were only harder hit because of poor air conditions

Title: No, ni una dieta alcalina previene el coronavirus ni lo ha dicho el TEC de Monterrey
Narrative_Description: A message saying that following an alkaline diet is good to prevent the virus
Motive_Description: Infom Other users that some experts have found out that an alkaline diet is a good measure to prevent the virus
Summary: A message was spread on WhatsApp saying that some experts in Monterrey, Mexico, have found out that following an alkaline diet is a good measure to prevent the virus

Title: #CoronavirusEnEcuador
Narrative_Description: A photo with a message saying that classes in the area of Sierra and Amazonia are suspended due to the discovery of the first case of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread a message to spark fear by saying that after the first detected case, schools are going to be closed
Summary: A photo was spread with a message saying that after the first case of Covid-19 detected in the area, classes will be suspended in the area of Sierra y Amazonìa. However, this was debunked by the page Ecuador Chequea

Narrative_Description: A message saying that the Ministry of Health confirmed that the second case of coronavirus in Ecuador was detected in the city of Latacunga
Motive_Description: Effort to spark fear among people by claiming that after the first case, the second case of Covid-19 had just been detected
Key_Words: Coronavirus, segundo caso, Ministra de Salud
Summary: A message was spread by the Mediaoutlet El Comercio saying that the Ministry of Health confirmed that the second case of coronavirus was detected in Ecuador in the city of Latacunga. However, it was later confirmed by the health authorities that only one case had been detected

Title: No, no hay pruebas de que este vídeo sea de un médico desmayándose "mientras opera al coronavirus"
Narrative_Description: A video was shared showing a doctor curing a Covid-19 patient who passed out immediately since the patient immediately transmitted the virus to the doctor
Motive_Description: Effort to spark fear saying that the virus is transmitted instantaneously from patients to doctors
Summary: A video was spread showing a doctor treating a Covid-19 patient and passing out immediately since the virus is transmitted immediately from patients to the doctor. However, there is no evidence this is true.

Title: #NoComasCuento

Motive_Description: Effort to spread fear by saying that a new case of Covid-19 was found in a new city
Summary: A message was spread saying that a new patient was found in the province of Santa Elena, in Ecuador. However, it was not confirmed by the health authorities

Title: Le gouvernement de la RDC n’a pas acté la réouverture des bars, églises, frontières lors du 33e conseil des ministres

Summary: The rumor spread that deceased Eusebe Mputu died of COVID-19 and was an Advisor to the Congolese President (according to some Other rumors, he worked for one of the ministries) while he was not involved with political institutions and the causes of his death have not been confirmed

Title: حقيقة مايتداول عن تفعيل مخالفة عدم لبس الكمامة عبر كاميرات الرصد الآلي

Title: 내일 만우절…가짜뉴스 장난치면 최대 징역형

Title: ‘제주모녀가 중기부 차관 딸’ 허위사실…중기부, ‘법적 조치’

Summary: An image of Italian President crying because of a matter unrelated to coronavirus is falesly claimed to be crying because Italy os out of burial sites for its coronavirus patients

Title: لا صحّة لعدم خضوع 15 أردنيّاً قدِموا من سويسرا إلى الحجر

Title: 한국은 호구다？...'외국인 퍼주기' 논란 팩트체크

Summary: Fake information spread about South Korean government's response to testing and treatment for foreigners to attack the current political party in power. Claims made that they treat foreigners for free, house them in quarantine, and that due to the policies there has been an influx of foreigners.

Title: 蚊で感染？一生ウイルス残る？　新型コロナ、デマを検証: ①外国からの輸入品にウイルスが付着？
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus can be spread from imported goods
Motive_Description: Spread fear that goods imported from foreign countries are dangerous
Summary: Claims spread online that imported goods from foreign countries can spread coronavirus.

Title: 蚊で感染？一生ウイルス残る？　新型コロナ、デマを検証: ③感染すると一生体内にウイルスが残る

Summary: False claim that coronavirus particles stay in your body for as long as you are alive.

Title: Beware! World Vision Kenya not offering free water tanks

Title: Covid-19 test doesn’t cost N1.2 million (US$3,200) in Nigeria – it’s free

Title: No, China not seeking court’s approval to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients

Motive_Description: Incite fear about potential killing of COVID-19 patients

Title: No, no hay pruebas de que haya "más de 1.500 muertos" por el coronavirus iniciado en Wuhan (China), a fecha de 31 de enero de 2020

Summary: Chain message circulated on WhatsApp about a man returning from Shanghai to Spain having revealed that, as of January 31, 2020, there had been more than 1,500 deaths due to coronavirus in China.

Title: Es falsa la cadena del Departamento de Salud de Canadá sobre cómo prevenir el coronavirus

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que el té de anís puede usarse como tratamiento contra el nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Anise infusion is an effective treatment against coronavirus

Summary: Claim circulated that anise infusion can be an effective treatment against coronavirus, as it is made of the same substance as anti-fever drug Tamiflu.

Title: Jumlah Penganguran Terus Meningkat dan Tertinggi Dalam Sejarah

Motive_Description: Attacking the current government
Summary: False Reporting of the unemployment number in Malaysia in an attempt to undermine the current government. The post falsely claimed that the unempolyment number in Malaysia has reached the highest in history in at 2.05 million.

Title: Pengunjung pasar raya Giant di Seksyen 13 Shah Alam di arah untuk lapor diri ke Kementerian Kesihatan untuk menjalani ujian saringan kesihatan

Motive_Description: Trying to help with contact tracing effort
Summary: Spreading of untrue order allegedly from the Ministry of Health asking for visitors who had been to a supermarket which had been ordered to temporarily close due to inadherent to standard of procedure, to report to hospitals and undertake covid-19 test, when no suh order had been given

Title: Pemberian elaun sebanyak RM3,000 kepada sesiapa yang diberhentikan kerja semasa tempoh Perintah Kawalan Pergerakn (PKP)
Narrative_Description: Use of untrue pandemic-related stimulus to steal data
Motive_Description: To steal data
Summary: An email about a made-up stimulus package for workers who lost their job due to the pandemic was circulated to manipulate vulnerable people into giving up their data. The email asked for personal data including account number to supposedly help process the application of the said stimulus.

Title: 선거 앞두고 검사 줄였다? 실제로 따져보니…

Summary: Fake social Mediaposts and video spread that the Korean government was limiting testing to reduce the number of new cases before the election. Kim Jong-in, Chairman of Future United Party also made a statement.

Title: 기무라 타쿠야, 마스크 2천 장 기부→네티즌 비난→"가짜뉴스" 일축 [MD재팬]
Narrative_Description: False news spread that Japanese actor, Kimura Takaya, donated 2000 masks on set

Title: 신현준 "코로나19는 위대한 교정자"…알고 보니 가짜뉴스

Title: 체력 소진된 기업들, 근거 없는 가짜 뉴스에 휘둘려

Title: Faux: il n’existe aucun message du pape François interdisant l’utilisation des probables vaccins contre le corona virus.
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: A message supposedly coming from Pope Francis invites African people to mistrust vaccines coming from Europe or the US

Title: Faux, la division provinciale de la santé n’a pas nié les deux cas de Covid19 enregistrés à Bukavu

Title: Faux, il n’existe aucune liste des pays africains choisis par l’OMS pour l’essaie du vaccin contre le Covid19
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: Claims that WHO has published a list of African countries that will be used to test the vaccine against COVID-19
Motive_Description: Undermine WHO's authority by suggesting it is imposing to African countries the risks associated with testing a new vaccine
Summary: A message became viral on Facebook and WhatsApp, containing a fake list of African countries WHO had supposedly selected as places to test the new vaccine against COVID-19

Title: Faux: un cheveu retrouvé à l’intérieur de la Bible ne soigne pas le COVID19
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: Audio message claiming that in order not to be infected, people should take their Bible, look for a hair inside the book and drink water with the hair in it
Motive_Description: Spread the false rumor that because of a prophecy a hair contained in the Bible will save people's lives from coronavirus
Summary: An audio message in Swahili went viral: it invited people to look for a hair in their Bibles that, thanks to a prophecy, would save them from COVID-19

Title: 팩트맨]‘중국인 돌 맞아 숨져’ SNS 글, 사실일까?
Narrative_Description: Fake videos spread depicting violence towards a Black man in Guangzhou and a Chinese woman in Kenya
Motive_Description: Raise fear about racial violence stemming from covid-19
Summary: False videos depicting violence towards a Black man in Guangzhou and a Chinese woman in Kenya spread on YouTube and Other social Mediachannels

Title: FactCheck : Il n’y aura pas d’année blanche dans les universités Congolaises suite au COVID19
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: Rumors that the Minister of Education has declared the academic year 2019-2020 a "année blanche" (a lost year) for universities in the DRC
Motive_Description: Spread the false rumor that university students will lose an entire year because of COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, university, students, education, lost, year, Minister
Summary: The rumor spread that the Congolese Minister of Higher Education and University had declared academic year 2019-2020 a "année blanche" (lost year) because of the health emergency

Title: Científicas italianas no fueron las primeras en aislar el coronavirus en Europa #Datoscoronavirus
Narrative_Description: Two Italian scientists were the first ones to sequence the genome of covid-19
Motive_Description: Mistake
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Concetta, Francesca, sequence, genome, first, Italian, scientists
Summary: Claim circulated about two Italian scientists (Concetta Castilletti and Francesca Colavita) having been the first ones to sequence the genome of covid-19.

Title: No, el Ministerio de Sanidad no ha enviado una cadena de WhatsApp con recomendaciones contra el coronavirus que pide protegerse con mascarilla
Narrative_Description: A message by the Ministry of Health was spread on WhatsApp listing some good measures to prevent the virus, such as avoiding mass gatherings
Motive_Description: Effort to help friends and family members by telling them emergency measures outlined by the Ministry of Health
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Ministerio de Sanidad, salvar vidas
Summary: A message was spread on WhatsApp saying it was by the Ministry of Health and giving some advice on how to prevent the virus, such as avoiding mass gatherings. However, the Ministry of Health did not send any WhatsApp message

Title: No, tanque de Postobón no se infectó con coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A Postobón (soft drinks brand) container was infected with coronavirus
Motive_Description: Discredit the company
Source_Description: Twitter accounts @Z4taNiK0, @HijueputaCasa, Facebook account Alejandro Tristancho Polo
Summary: A fake claim circulated in Colombia about a container by Postobón (soft drink brand) got infected with coronavirus.

Title: Cuidado con el audio que alerta sobre la presencia de '3.000 ilicitanos' en la feria del calzado de Milán: no hay ningún caso confirmado de coronavirus en Elche y Sanidad no ha emitido ninguna alarma al respecto, a fecha del 02/03/2020
Narrative_Description: An audio message on WhatsApp said that 3000 illegal visitors from Milan were in Elche, Spain, and had fever and perhaps the virus
Motive_Description: Effort to spark panick in the city of Elche by saying 3,000 from Milan were there illegaly and had fever
Summary: An audio message circulated in Spain on WhatsApp saying that 3000 visitors from Milan were illegally in Elche, Spain, and many of them had fever, thus risking to have the virus.

Title: No, no hay un "primer caso de coronavirus" en el barrio de La Hispanidad (Huelva) a 10 de febrero de 2020
Narrative_Description: First case of coronavirus in Huelva, Spain
Motive_Description: Spread fear of imminent contagion in Spain
Summary: A doctored news broadcast image circulated alongside the claim that it was proof of the fact that the first case of coronavirushad been detected in Huelva, Spain, as of February 4.

Title: Es falso que beber agua caliente previene el coronavirus Covid-19
Narrative_Description: A message suggested that an Italian doctor coming from Shenzen said it is advisable to drink hot water in order to prevent the virus
Motive_Description: Effort to help friends and family members by telling them a preventive measure that the sender believes it is true
Summary: A message saying that it is advisable to drink hot water since an Italian doctor from Shenzen said it is. However, the source does not exist

Title: Por qué sí hay peligro de transmisión del coronavirus si besas la mano de una virgen o santo
Narrative_Description: A report said that it was impossible to transmit the virus by kissing the statue of the Holy Mary in Sevilla, Spain
Motive_Description: Effort to support the idea that religion is stronger than the virus
Summary: A report was issued by a website saying that kissing the statue of Holy Mary in Sevilla cannot transmit the virus. However, this is not confirmed by evidence which underlines that it is possible to transmit the virus through saliva

Title: No, "un vecino de Noia" no ha sido contagiado por el coronavirus, a fecha de 10 de febrero: no es un contenido real de 'La Voz de Galicia' y en España por el momento sólo se han detectado dos casos de contagio, uno en La Gomera (Canarias) y otro en Mallorca
Narrative_Description: A coronavirus case was diagnosed in the municipality of Noia, Spain
Motive_Description: Spread fear of contagion in the area
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, Galicia, Noia, case, La Voz de Galicia
Summary: A fake screenshot of an article from local newspaper "La Voz de Galicia" circulated alongside the claim that a case of coronavirus had been diagnosed in the town of Noia, Spain.

Title: No, los pedos detectados por cámaras térmicas en este vídeo viral sobre el coronavirus no son reales: han sido añadidos digitalmente
Narrative_Description: Infrared thermometers in public places can detect farts
Motive_Description: Mistake, spread a funny story
Source_Description: Chinese newspaper Global Times, general public on social media
Key_Words: Coronavirus, thermometer, infrared, detect, farts, sensor
Summary: A fake claim circulated about infrared sensors (used during the covid emergency to check people's temperature) being able to spot farts.

Title: Lelaki Didakwa Positif COVID-19 Terbaring Di Hadapan Kedai Sebenarnya Sakit Jantung
Narrative_Description: A video of a man falling ill due to a hearth attack was wrongly attributed to Covid-19

Summary: A video of man who fell ill in from a heart attack was spread around on social Mediaunder the false pretense that he is ill because of Covid-19

Title: Brickfields: Behind YMCA has been cordoned off. 4 Positive Cases of Covid-19 Coronavirus.

Motive_Description: Spreading fear about the apprently dire situation of the pandemic in Malaysia
Summary: A social Mediapost, with an accompanying video showing a man being carried into an ambulance, falsely reported that an area in Kuala Lumpur called Brickfields will be put under Enhanced Movement Control Order (EMCO) by the Malaysian government

Title: Temporary don’t eat KFC , Texas chicken , Nando as this factory ( new cluster in Pedas , 60 infected ) provide chicken to these outlet

Motive_Description: Spread untrue infromation about outbreak of covid-19 among the workers of a food processing factory.
Summary: A social Mediapost warning people not to eat from several restaurant chains or buy chicken from several supermarkets as it has been supplied by a factory where there is an outbreak of Covid-19 among its worker.

Title: 프란치스코 교황 中 방문설에 관련자들 “가짜 뉴스다”

Title: Nigeria’s health minister studied medicine – not law
Narrative_Description: Claims Nigeria's Minister of Health, who is leading the response to COVID-19, studied law, not medicine
Motive_Description: Undermine the credibility of Nigeria's Minister of Health

Summary: Posts falsely claimed that Nigeria's Minister of Health, who is leading the government response to COVID-19, actually studied law instead of medicine

Narrative_Description: Claims the Nigerian state Kano has no functional isolation centers and that COVID-19 is a lie
Motive_Description: Claim that the COVID-19 outbreak in Nigeria is a lie

Summary: A video was filmed in an isolation center in the Nigerian state of Kano that is currently under construction, claiming that it proved the coronavirus outbreak was a lie and that Kano had no people in isolation; Kano already has four isolation centers in operation

Title: False claim: Family of COVID-19 victim broke into morgue to find her still breathing inside body bag
Narrative_Description: Claims a video shows a COVID-19 patient who was reported to have died being found alive in a body bag

Narrative_Description: A message saying that doctors of the hospital Alcivàr lied about the first recorded case of coronavirus in Ecuador
