Motive_Description: Effort to spread fear
Summary: A lie was spread to convince people that Pope Francis had coronavirus in order to create fear

Title: Remedio casero para el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A fake cure for coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim
Summary: A recipe was spread on WhatsApp for a remedy that would cure coronavirus using ginger, garlic, and honey. However it is a fake and useless recipe.

Title: Israel encontró la cura para el COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Israeli institue MIGAL announced it had a cure for coronavirus, this was false.
Motive_Description: Spread False Hope
Summary: A fake claim that Israel had identified a vaccine was spread on Latin American social media

Title: Yaku Pérez busca curar el coronavirus con medicina ancestral
Narrative_Description: A lie was spread that Yak Pérez, an indegnous leader in Ecuador, was trying to cure coronavirus using ancient medicine
Motive_Description: Effort to slander/undermine the indigenous leader Yaku Pérez
Summary: A fake claim was spread that Yaku Pérez was trying to cure coronavirus using ancient medicine

Title: Quito es la segunda cuidad con mas alta probabilidad de contagio
Narrative_Description: A story was spread that Quito had a high risk level of coronavirus which is not true
Motive_Description: Effort to frighten residents of Quito
Summary: A fake claim that Quito had a high risk of infection

Title: En redes sociales circula una noticia en la cual manifesta que ladrones disfrazados de médicos de las Cruz Roja Ecuatoriana usan el #COVID-19 como excusa para entrar a las casas y robar
Narrative_Description: A report said people were dressing up like Red Cross members and robbing homes
Motive_Description: Effort to frighten
Summary: A fake story was spread that robbers were dressing as red cross doctors and stealing

Title: PM makes unfounded claims about PCR test rate, virtues of Nepali diet
Narrative_Description: Prime Minister Oli makes unfounded claims about PCR test rate, and virtues of a Nepali diet in making Nepalis have stronger immunity
Motive_Description: False Hope that Nepal's PCR test rate if high and and Nepali immunity is strong to combat the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Nepal, PCR test rate, diet, immunity
Summary: Prime Minister Oli makes unfounded claims about PCR test rate, and virtues of a Nepali diet in making Nepalis have stronger immunity

Title: Warga asing solat jemaah ketika PKP berita palsu
Narrative_Description: Migrant workers are said to have broken the lockdwon rule by congregating for prayers
Motive_Description: Spreading panic
Summary: A video from 2018 showing migrant workers praying together allegedly during lockdown when it is not allowed

Title: وزير التعليم المصري: 5 ألاف جنية تعويض لأسرة أي طالب يتوفى بكورونا .. زائف
Narrative_Description: Egyptian Education Minister promises 5,000 pounds to the family of any student who dies from the virus
Motive_Description: Spread hope that families will be compensated for deaths
Summary: Facebook post claims the Egyptian Minister of Education promised 5,000 pounds to the family of any student that dies of the coronavirus - this is unsubstantiated and has been denied by the Ministry of Education

Title: Kota Bharu tutup selepas 1 tengah hari adalah palsu: Polis
Narrative_Description: Kota Bharu is going to impose curfew
Motive_Description: False news about curfew in a town
Summary: False Facebook posts and WhatsApp messages about a curfew that will be imposed in a town in Malaysia.

Title: حقيقة تبرع 200 الف مصري ببلازما المتعافين من كورونا
Narrative_Description: 200,000 recovered Egyptians have donated plasma
Motive_Description: False Hope that many have recovered from the coronavirus and of the possibility of a breakthrough in the research for a cure
Summary: Facebook post claims 200,000 Egyptians have recovered from the coronavirus and donated their plasma - refuted by the Health Ministry

Title: 可惡！台灣當局連疫情通報都敢造假
Narrative_Description: Taiwan authorities have been delaying the return of Tawainese due to previously misreported cases of COVID 19
Motive_Description: Claim that Taiwan has no confirmed cases and delay Taiwanese returning back to Taiwan
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Taiwan, authorities, delay, return, misreported cases
Summary: A news report claims Taiwan authorities have been delaying the return of Taiwanese due to previous cases claiming that Taiwanese who return have been confirmed with the coronavirus.

Title: 中國網軍玻璃心 買不到台灣口罩竟崩潰狂發假訊息（圖）
Narrative_Description: Chinese Mediastarted a series of serial attacks on the credibility of the Taiwanese government during COVID 19
Motive_Description: Start serial attacks on Taiwan's government
Key_Words: Mask, prohibited, China, credibility, Taiwan, Tsai-ing wen, weak
Summary: News report claims that Chinese citizens are angry that the Chinese has prohibited exporting masks and also started a series of attacks on the credibility of Tsai Ing-wen

Title: 台湾专家：根据一篇论文可以得出新馆病毒源头是美国
Narrative_Description: Taiwan expert claims that the origin of the coronavirus is the US
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the US is the origin of the coronavirus and not Wuhan
Key_Words: US, origin, Taiwan expert, research paper, discovered, bacteria family, five
Summary: Taiwan expert claims that the US is the origin of the coronavirus after observing a report that claims the US has five of the thirteen bacteria families of the coronavirus whereas China only has one

Title: 稱鮭魚感染源陸斷進口！挪威7成轉銷台灣
Narrative_Description: Salmon infected with the coronavirus and 70% of Salmon has been imported into Taiwan
Motive_Description: Spread fear that salmon infected with the coronavirus has been imported in Taiwan
Key_Words: Coronavirus, salmon, infected, 70%, imported, Taiwan, Norway
Summary: A news article claims that salmon has been detected with the coronavirus and 70% of Norway's salmon has been imported into Taiwan

Title: [新型コロナFactCheck] ｢PCR検査は風邪も検出｣と誤った主張の動画が拡散
Narrative_Description: The PCR test used to diagnose COVID-19 will also test positive for the common cold
Motive_Description: Imply that the number of actual COVID cases are much lower
Key_Words: Japan, YouTube, PCR test, common cold
Summary: Takeda Kunihiko uploaded a video on YouTube in which he claimed that PCR tests used to diagnose COVID-19 will also return positive for the common cold.

Title: Coronavirus conspiracies amplified on social Mediaby fringe South African political party
Narrative_Description: Promote conspiracy theories related to Bill Gates, Trevor Noah, and the testing of vaccines in Africa
Motive_Description: Target South African President Ramaphosa, try to force him to address conspiracy theories
Source_Description: South African party African Transformation Movement (ATM)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Africa, Ramaphosa, Bill Gates, Conspiracy
Summary: A South African political party published a letter asking President Ramaphosa to address various COVID-19 conspiracy theories on social media, notably giving credence to a theory that Bill Gates and Trevor Noah were conspiring about testing a COVID-19 vaccine in Africa

Title: [팩트체크] 개학해도 에어컨 못 켠다? 떠도는 '공문' 확인해보니
Narrative_Description: False news spread that reopened schools will not permit the use of AC
Motive_Description: To make policies more strict in response to reopenings
Summary: False news spread that AC would not be permitted when schools reopen

Title: [팩트체크] 신종 코로나, 황사 바람 타고 중국서 넘어온다?
Narrative_Description: False information that covid-19 is spreading from China to South Korea through dust storms and fine dust
Motive_Description: Spread fear that covid-19 can spread through dust and was travelling into the country
Key_Words: Coronavirus, dust storm, China, South Korea
Summary: False news spread that covid-19 was travelling to South Korea from China through dust storms

Title: [팩트체크] 신종 코로나 때문에 음주단속 안한다?
Narrative_Description: Fake information spread that due to covid-19 police were no longer monitoring drunk driving
Motive_Description: Spread fear that drunk driving is not being managed due to covid-19
Summary: Fake news spread that police were no longer monitoring drunk driving and pulling people over

Title: Cadena en WhatsApp asegura que el médicos italianos recomiendan quitarse los zapatos al llegar a casa
Narrative_Description: Chain message that taking shoes off in the house prevents the virus
Motive_Description: False remedy
Summary: Chain message on WhatsApp that Italian doctors recommended taking shoes off when you get home to prevent spreading the virus

Title: No existen casoss de contagio en Israel porque toman bebidas calientes
Narrative_Description: Drinking hot drinks can prevent coronavirus
Motive_Description: False remedy
Summary: Chain message that Israel has no cases of coronacirus beccause they drink lots of hot beverages

Title: La Feria Nacional de San Marcos 2020, celebrada en abril en México, no ha sido cancelada por el nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: National holiday was canceled in Mexico due to coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fear of seriousness of coronavirus
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Ultimas noticias de Aguascalientes, Miguel Moonts, Chaska Noticias, Aqui puras Norteñas aguascalientes Oficcial
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mexico, San Marcos, holiday, Aguas Calientes, canceled
Summary: Claim circulated in Mexico that the national holiday of San Marcos was canceled due to mounting coronavirus cases.

Title: Respirar al aire de Guayaquil provoca contagio de COVID19
Narrative_Description: Fake story that anyone who walks through Guayaquil will get coronavirus
Motive_Description: Fear mongering
Summary: False claim circulated that anyone who breathed any air in Guayaquil would contract the virus.

Title: Lenín Moreno se niega a pedir ayuda a China
Narrative_Description: Claim the Lenín Moreno would not ask China for help in addressing coronavirus
Motive_Description: Discredit Lenín Moreno
Summary: False claim that Moreno refused to seek help from China, when he in fact did.

Title: This photo shows a Pakistani chief minister at iftar in Pakistan in 2018
Narrative_Description: Claims a Pakistani Chief Minister violated COVID-19 lockdown measures by attending iftar
Motive_Description: Criticize a Pakistani Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah
Summary: Posts claim that a photo shows a Pakistani Chief Minister flouting his own COVID-19 lockdown measures to attend a party; the photo is actually from 2018

Title: ‘Plandemic’ video peddles falsehoods about COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Promote various conspiracy theories related to the origins and responses to COVID-19
Motive_Description: Incite fear about the potential origins of COVID-19
Summary: A video called 'Plandemic' which interviewed former research scientist Judy Mikovits circulated widely on social media, promoting various COVID-19 conspiracy theories about the origins and treatments for the virus

Title: Facebook Post showing the Chief Minister of Sindh province of Pakistan violating social distancing rules set by him
Narrative_Description: False information implying that Govt officals themselves are violating social distancing guidelines set by them
Motive_Description: Imply that Government officials themselves are not following the SOPs set by them
Summary: A facebook user uploaded a old picture showing the Chief Minister of the Sindh province of Pakistan at a religious procession in order to point out that Govt officials are not following the SOPs themselves and also to target the sect of the people of the religious procession as the people who are spreading the virus in Pakistan

Title: Dakwaan Kononnya Terdapat Pesakit COVID-19 Lari Dari HKL Adalah Palsu
Narrative_Description: Falsely reporting that a patient who ran away from a hospital in Kuala Lumpur is suffering from Covid-19
Motive_Description: Spreading panic amongst the populace that there is a Covid-19 patient on roaming around the city
Summary: Twitter feed reporting that a Covid-19 patient has ran away from quanrantine in the hospital in Kuala Lumpur

Title: कोरोना रूघाखोकीजस्तै हो, हाच्छ्युँसाच्छ्यूँ गरेर तातोपानी खाएर उडाइदिनु पर्छ: प्रधानमन्त्री
Narrative_Description: PM Oli falsely claims that coronavirus is like a common cold where you just sneeze and can get rid of it by drinking hot water
Motive_Description: Trying to keep people's "morale high" by spreading this type of very clear misinformation
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Nepal, PM Oli, Cold, Hot water
Summary: PM Oli falsely claims that coronavirus is like a common cold where you just sneeze and can get rid of it by drinking hot water

Title: 孟加拉反台灣夫妻說謊？民眾爆料：他們未穿防護衣在機上還咳不停
Narrative_Description: Bengal couple return to Taiwan and does not wear protective clothing as they coughed nonstop on the plane
Motive_Description: Spread fear that couple from Bengal cough on plane returning back to Taiwan without protective clothing
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Bengal, couple, no protective clothing, Taiwan, cough, plane
Summary: A news article claims that a couple from Bengal returning to Taiwan did not wearing protective clothing as they coughed on the plane

Title: Borang Permohonan Bagi Golongan Yang Tidak Menerima Sebarang Bantuan Dari Pakej Rangsangan Ekonomi Di Pulau Pinang Dan Perlis Adalah Palsu
Narrative_Description: Fake google docs for small businesses who have yet to receive government aid to fill
Motive_Description: Steal data
Key_Words: aid, small businesses, google docs, form, data,
Summary: Facebook post with google docs link for small businesses to leave their details in if they have not received any governtment help. No such thing was authorised by the government

Title: Dakwaan Mesej Kononnya Hospital Sultanah Nora Ismail Kekurangan Alat Penyukat Suhu ‘Infrared Thermometer’ Adalah Tidak Benar
Narrative_Description: False Reporting about lack of thermometer at a district hospital
Motive_Description: Spread panic about the ability of the health facility to cope with the virus
Summary: Chained message with false report about a district hospital not having enough thermometer

Title: Dakwaan Bekalan PPE Di Hospital Sultan Ismail Hampir Kosong Adalah Tidak Benar
Narrative_Description: False Reporting about lack of PPE in a specific district hospital
Motive_Description: The person who spread the message wanted to help source PPE
Summary: Chained message with false report about lack of PPE at a district hospital, asking for source of PPE

Title: Borang Berbentuk Google Forms Kononnya Dari JAKIM Untuk Tabung Musaadah COVID-19 Adalah Palsu
Narrative_Description: Fake google docs for people to apply for special fund from the religious authorities
Motive_Description: stealing data
Key_Words: aid, fund, google docs, form, data, religion
Summary: Google docs link for individuals to fill in a fake form to apply for emergency aid from the religious authority.

Title: Tiada Keistimewaan Untuk Pihak Tertentu Bagi Melakukan Sebarang Perjalanan Tidak Wajar Dalam Tempoh PKP
Narrative_Description: False Reporting about special priveleges given by acquiantances of the head of the police to get exemption from lockdown rules.
Motive_Description: show that the police is corrupt
Summary: A tweet suggesting that someone is allowed to travel (despite lockdown guideline) because of their relationship with the head of the police

Title: ماذا عن قرار حظر تجول شامل في تونس توقياً من فيروس كورونا؟
Narrative_Description: Health Ministry official reported to announce a mandatory 72 hour quarantine going into effect in Tunisia
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the extreme measures taken to combat the virus
Summary: Health Ministry official's statements are misinterpreted to mean a 72 hour quarantine would go into effect immediately. The actual statement does not rule out the possibility of tightening response measures, but says that a decision will be made in 72 hours regarding the future course of action

Title: ماذا عن مستشفى صفاقس بعد إصابة مريض بقسم الإنعاش بفيروس كورونا؟
Narrative_Description: Claims of a patient treated without proper protective tools
Motive_Description: Spread fear about possible exposure to the virus due to the absence of proper precautions
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Tunisia, Sfax, hospital, patient, protection
Summary: Claims that a patient who tested positive for the coronavirus was treated without proper protection in a hospital in Sfax, Tunisia - denied by the regional health director

Title: هل يُعتبر فيروس هانتا كورونا جديدا؟
Narrative_Description: Claims the emergence of a hantavirus in China is a new form of the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the emergence of a new virus
Summary: False claims that a new hantavirus, similar to the coronavirus, has been registered in China - actually, the hantavirus is not new, and differs in symptoms and methods of transmission from COVID-19

Title: هل يخضع وزير السياحة السابق روني طرابلسي إلى غيبوبة اصطناعيّة؟
Narrative_Description: Former Tunisian Minister of Tourism, René Trabelsi, is an induced coma following his COVID-19 diagnosis
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the health condition of a public figure
Source_Description: Facebook user claiming to be a friend of the Minister
Key_Words: René Trabelsi, Tunisia, Minister of Tourism, induced coma, France
Summary: Claim that René Trabelsi is in an induced coma in France after his COVID-19 diagnosis - refuted by his brOther and the current Tunisian Tourism Minister, who confirmed he is "stable" and "recieving treatment"

Title: ماذا عن رفع الحجر الصحي تدريجيا في 20 أفريل؟
Narrative_Description: The quarantine will be slowly lifted, beginning on April 20th
Motive_Description: Imply the country is slowly returning to normal by spreading the news of a gradual lifting of the quarantine
Summary: Claim that Tunisia will begin reopening slowly on April 20th, citing specific sectors. This was refuted by the Prime Minister's Mediaadvisor, who stated there was an ongoing evaluation of when to lift quarantine measures and no date had been set yet

Title: No, no se ha confirmado un caso de nuevo coronavirus en Andorra a 9 de febrero de 2020: no es un artículo real de 'La Vanguardia'
Narrative_Description: First case of coronavirus was diagnosed in Andorra
Motive_Description: Spread fear of contagion
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Andorra, first, case, La Vanguardia
Summary: False screenshot of newspaper La Vanguardia's page circulated showing that the first case of coronavirus had been found in Andorra as of February 9, 2020.

Title: No, no hay un niño que viene de China que ha dado positivo en coronavirus en un hospital como dice este audio en gallego (a 12/2/20)
Narrative_Description: Chinese kid tested positive to coronavirus in Galicia, Spain
Motive_Description: Spread fear of contagion in the region
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Galicia, Chinese, kid, test, positive, hospital
Summary: WhatsApp audio in Galician circulated claiming that a Chinese kid had tested positive in a hospital in Galicia, Spain.

Title: Audio sobre avión en cuarentena por COVID-19 en Guaviare es falso
Narrative_Description: A plane was quarantined in an airport of the Colombian district of Guaviare
Motive_Description: Spread fear of contagion in the region
Key_Words: Coronavirus, plane, quarantine, Guaviare, Colombia, captain, Andrés Vargas
Summary: A fake audio circulated in Colombia claiming that an entire plane landed in the department of Guaviare had been quarantined due to coroanvirus cases on board.

Title: No, un portal de noticias chino no ha filtrado que hay más de 24.000 muertos por coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Chinese government is underreporting case count, Tencent revealed
Motive_Description: DIscredit China, mistake
Source_Description: Website Viralistas, online newspapers Daily Mail, India TV News, Taiwan News
Key_Words: Coronavirus, China, Chinese, government, underreport, cases, 24,000, Tencent
Summary: Fake claim circulated (also, mistakenly, thanks to online Mediaoutlets) about Chinese company Tencent having revealed that coronavirus deaths in China totalled 24,000 as of February 1, 2020, contrary to lower official figures.

Title: False: Queensland issued travel warning for Wuhan and Chinese-populated areas in Australia.
Narrative_Description: A purported screenshot of a warning from health authorities in the Australian state of Queensland for the novel coronavirus has circulated on Facebook alongside a claim that the government issued an advisory against travel to the Chinese city of Wuhan
Motive_Description: Imply Queensland will pause travel from Wuhan
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Queensland, travel, warning, Wuhan, Australia
Summary: Queensland issued travel warning for Wuhan and Chinese-populated areas in Australia

Title: False: Food and locations are contaminated in Australia.
Narrative_Description: Multiple Facebook posts shared hundreds of times purport to show a list of foods and locations in Sydney, Australia which have been contaminated by a new strain of coronavirus that originated in the Chinese city of Wuhan
Motive_Description: Spread fear that multiple cities in Australia have the coronavirus
Summary: Food and locations are contaminated in Australia

Title: FALSE: Post claims food products such as rice, fortune cookies, mi goreng noodles, ice tea and “Chinese red bull” are contaminated with coronavirus in Australia. Also some areas of Sydney are supposedly identified as contaminated
Narrative_Description: Post claims food products such as rice, fortune cookies, mi goreng noodles, ice tea and “Chinese red bull” are contaminated with coronavirus in Australia. Also some areas of Sydney are supposedly identified as contaminated
Motive_Description: Spread fear that products and Sydney are contaminated with the coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, food, fortune cookies, mi goreng noodles, ice tea, “Chinese red bull,” contaminated, Australia, Sydney
Summary: Claims spread that food products such as rice, fortune cookies, mi goreng noodles, ice tea and “Chinese red bull” are contaminated with coronavirus in Australia. Also some areas of Sydney are supposedly identified as contaminated

Title: False: A Saudi Arabian study for a MERS vaccine is linked to the outbreak of coronavirus.
Narrative_Description: A Saudi Arabian study for a MERS vaccine is linked to the outbreak of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Make false claim that the outbreak is linked to a Saudi MERS vaccine study
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Saudi Arabian, study, MERS, vaccine, outbreak
Summary: False news: A Saudi Arabian study for a MERS vaccine is linked to the outbreak of coronavirus

Title: False: A “Wuhan super virus” was created in a Chinese biosecurity lab and has infected more than 100,000 people in Wuhan.
Narrative_Description: A “Wuhan super virus” was created in a Chinese biosecurity lab and has infected more than 100,000 people in Wuhan.
Motive_Description: Blames the origin of the coronavirus on a Chinese lab
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Wuhan, super virus, Chinese, biosecurity, lab, infected, Wuhan
Summary: Rumor spread that a “Wuhan super virus” was created in a Chinese biosecurity lab and has infected more than 100,000 people in Wuhan

Title: False: The Dettol disinfectant label says COVID-19 was tested.
Narrative_Description: An image of a Dettol label that touts the disinfectant's ability to kill the "coronavirus" stands alongside a claim that the product’s maker may have been aware of the coronavirus before it broke out in China in December 2019
Motive_Description: Spreads false claim that a Dettol label disinfects the coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Dettol, label, disinfectant, product, maker
Summary: Dettol label claims disinfectant abilities to kill the coronavirus and product's maker was aware of the coronavirus before it broke out

Title: Wabak COVID-19 Di Daerah Ranau Bukan Berpunca Daripada 14 Individu Kluster Tabligh
Narrative_Description: WhatsApp message falsely claiming that the outbreak in Ranau district originated from  a group of religious gathering
Motive_Description: Falsely claim that a group of religious muslim was a source of outbreak in a district
Summary: Viral message falsely claiming that an outbreak in Ranau district originated from people who went to an Islamic gathering

Title: ¡Atención¡ El Eucalipto no cura el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Eucalyptus can cure / is beneficial in fighting against COVID-19
Motive_Description: False remedy
Source_Description: Video by Dr. Ruth Mari Calderón, Facebook page “Noticia pal mundo NF”
Summary: A video circulated on Facebook, spreading false info. that eucalyptus is beneficial in fighting COVID-19, and stating that this info. is backed by "studies on the benefits of eucalyptus" carried out in (unnamed) "prestigious unviersities" in NY.

Title: Ministro Cárdenas no dijo que estudiantes repetirán el año

Title: 病毒零下20度可存活20年并非指新冠病毒！

Motive_Description: Clarifies the nature of the coronavirus
Summary: The virus can survive for 20 years at minus 20 degrees, not the new coronavirus!
Distrib_Channel: official press conference: anti-epidemic experience exchange conference held by hangzhou customs

Title: 上海地铁11号线因有新冠患者突然暂停？
Narrative_Description: Sudden suspension of Shanghai Metro Line 11 due to new patients with the coronavirus

Source_Description: Shanghai Municipal Health Commission, General public
Key_Words:
Coronavirus, suspension. Shanghai, Metro, Line 11, new, patients
"

Summary: Henan residents infected with new coronavirus

Title: 南昌自来水加大氯气注入 需静置两小时以上再用？

Summary: Outbreak in Baotou Yi Market

Title: الدكتورة دهروف الروسية مخترعة لقاح فيروس كورونا (صورة) – مضلل

Summary: Chain mesage spread a number of false claims. Included: (1) that covid-19 was created by the Chinese Communist Party to lower the population, (2) the virus is a mixture of HIV and tuberculosis, (3) it has an incubation period of 27, instead of 2-14, days, (4) that it survives up to 9 days on surfaces, (5) that it infects seven people on average, and (6) that it is at a "dangerousness level 5" on a scale of 1 to 5, even though there are only 4 levels of biosecurity or biological containment (NCB).

Motive_Description: Spread fear that doctors will falsely diagnosed people with covid-19 during the pandemic
Summary: A facebook user uploaded a photo of a doctor's pescription for his dad. It is written CVD, and he interpreted it as COVID and therefore claimed that doctors these day will tell patients that they have Covid-19 no matter their real illnesses is. CVD is not covid, but short for Cerebrovaskuler disease.

Summary: A twitter user uploaded a passage from Iqro - a guidance on how to read the Koran - in Arabis. He claimed that the reading means "qorona is made during an era filled with lies". Apparently the word qorona is not the virus and the book was first released in early 90s, way after the first coronavirus (HCoV-229E) was diagnosed.

Motive_Description: Spread fear by saying that the virus can be spread to dogs
Summary: A message saying that the first dog with the virus was found in Hong Kong. However, it did not have the current coronavirus, but a different and previous version

Title: No, no hay pruebas de que "enjuagarse la garganta con agua salada" antes de ir a lugares públicos prevenga el contagio del coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A message saying that Zhong Nanshan, a famous doctor who fought against SARS in 2003, said that drinking salty water helps prevent the virus
Motive_Description: Spread information containing possible preventative measures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Zhong Nanshan, agua salada, garganta
Summary: A message saying that Zhong Nanshan, a famous Chinese doctor who fought against SARS in 2003, said that drinking salty water is good to prevent the virus. However, he later denied this on Weibo

Title: Cuidado con el PDF de una patente que circula relacionada con un coronavirus: es del SARS, no del COVID-19
Narrative_Description: A pdf was spread showing a patent related to coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread information showing a patent to protect against coronavirus
Summary: A message showing a 72-page pdf of a patent against Covid-19. However, the patent was against SARS, not Covid-19

Title: ¿El coronavirus se puede curar con un té de plantas medicinales? #DatosCoronavirus
Narrative_Description: A message was spread on Twitter saying that natural herbs can prevent the virus
Motive_Description: Spread a natural cure to prevent the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, plantas medicinales, Diaz Marin, curar
Summary: A message was spread by a Spanish MP saying that Covid-19 can be prevented by using natural herbs.

Title: El SNS envió un e-mail anunciando que la vacuna para el coronavirus llegará a Portugal en los próximos días?
Narrative_Description: The Chinese Defense Department announced the discovery of a vaccine for which one can sign up
Motive_Description: Phishing
Key_Words: Coronavirus, email, SNS, China, vaccine, sign up, Portugal
Summary: Email circulated in Portugal claiming that the Defense Department of China had announced the discovery of a vaccine for coronavirus, for which people could now sign up. The email also had an attachment, supposedly a list of facilities in which it is possible to take the shot.

Title: ¿Las epidemias de Covid-19, MERS y H1N1 coincidieron con la instalación de redes 5G, 4G y 3G respectivamente?
Narrative_Description: Various epidemics, including the most recent one, coincided with the introduction of 5G, 4G, 3G, and so on
Motive_Description: Spread catchy conspiracy theory
Summary: Fake claim circulated that Covid-19, MERS, H1N1, coincided with the introduction of 5G, 4G, 3G respectively.

Title: La hidroxicloroquina “cura la Covid-19”, pero ¿hay una conspiración de Gates y Fauci para prohibirla?
Narrative_Description: There is a conspiracy by Bill Gates and Anthony Faucy against hydroxichlorquine
Motive_Description: Discredit Gates and Fauci
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Hydroxichloroquine, Anthony Fauci, Bill Gates, conspiracy, profit
Summary: Fake claim circulated on social Mediaabout a conspiracy headed by Bill Gates and Anthony Faucy against the use of hydroxichlorquine (which is allegedly effective against coronavirus), so that they can sell their harmful treatments later on.

Title: 达赖喇嘛办公室：武汉疫情期间加以谨慎，切勿听信谣言

Summary: Rumors on WhatsApp, Facebook, and WeChat spreads claims that the Dalai Lama recits mantras and recommends tea as a preventative measure

Claims food vouchers are being granted, nationwide, in Spain, the UK, Italy, and France. A similar, but separate, chain circulated in Argentina.

Title: Video ini telah beredar di laporan tentang prosesi pemakaman komandan militer di Iran di bulan Januari 2020
Narrative_Description: A video posted in Facebook showing a huge mass. The video flasely claimed that it was a BLM protest in the US.
Motive_Description: Make people doubt if coronavirus is real.
Summary: An aerial video posted in Facebook showing a huge mass, which is claimed as from the BLA protest in the US. The post intrigued its followers to question if the number of deaths in the US is not significantly spiked, then the crisis might not be real. The aerial video turns out is a video of Iranian military leader, Qasem Soleimani in Jan 2020.

Title: الصين لم تقتل الخنازير خوفاً من فايروس كورونا

Summary: Claims that an epidemic arises every hundred years on the twentieth year and that has been the case for the past 300 years - false claim made by ignoring a lot of historical data that proves Otherwise

Title: Kaesang Mampu Tangani Virus Korona jika Menjadi Gubernur DKI Jakarta? Ini Faktanya

Title: Cek Fakta: Petugas Dalam Video ini Bukan PKI yang Menyamar Sebagai Dokter

Title: Benarkah Virus Corona Covid-19 Tidak Bahaya dan Tidak Sebabkan Kematian?

The interviewee claimed that covid-19 virus is not lethal, and it may go away soon if poeple regularly wash hand and sanitise. The interview was misleading, and the video argued that poeple get panic of the virus too easily because of lack of information.

Title: Coronavírus: decreto de 'feriado nacional' de sete dias é pegadinha

The doctor advised inhaling the steam from boiling water for about 5 minutes, 3-4 times a day, to eliminate covid-19.

Title: El padre de Pablo Iglesias no está ingresado el Hospital Clínico de Salamanca, la foto es de 2016

Summary: A false claim circulated in Spain that Pablo Iglesias was pictured visiting his father, Javier Iglesias , at the Clinic of Salamanca. The post claimed that Javier Iglesias was transferred to an individual hospital room after Pablo Iglesias visited, painting it as a use of priviledge. The photo of Pablo Iglesias at the Clinic was from 2016.

Title: Coronavirus: Ambev desmente suspensao de producao de cerveja por pandemia

Title: Covid-19: plus de 200 chinois n’ont pas violé l’état d’urgence sanitaire en rentrant en RDC
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the

Those people, however, had undergone many controls and were people working in the Congo, so they could come back and were not violating any rule.

Title: Covid-19 : faux, les récentes guérisons ne sont pas le fruit du protocole de Jérôme Munyangi

Summary: The news spread in the DRC that the recent spike in people healing from COVID-19 in the country was due to the protocol created by Congolese Dr. Jérôme Munyangi, based on artemisia (a plant that grows in that region of Africa) and that the nation should be proud

Title: Coronavirus. Zaccarelli dello Spallanzani dice che è meno pericoloso di un’influenza? Assolutamente no!

Summary: Location and bluetooth do not need to be activated, the COVID-19 Exposure system is an already downloaded system in the android phones.

Title: ¿Personas con sangre tipo A son más propensas al COVID-19?

Summary: Several Mediaoutlets all over the world spread the claim that people having type A blood are more vulnerable to coronavirus, although the piece of information comes from a preliminary, non-peer-reviewed study conducted in China.

Title: إصابة محمد بن زايد بكورونا.. خبر زائف

Summary: Claim that the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, Mohammad Bin Zayed, had been infected with COVID-19 and is in isolation

Title: لم تنجح فلسطين أو مصر أو لبنان في ابتكار علاج كورونا

Title: هل رفع السيسي أعداد المصابين بكورونا في مصر طمعاً بمليارات البنك الدولي؟

Title: ترامب: شركة روش السويسرية اكتشفت علاج لـ كورونا.. ترجمة زائفة

Summary: Posts falsely claimed that the UK Control of Diseases Act was amended on the 27th of April (it was amended on March 25) and that people can now be forcibly vaccinated, which is not true

Title: ¿Un médico egipcio elaboró un suero para tratar el COVID-19?

Title: ¿Unicef decretó a Maracaibo como ciudad libre de coronavirus?

Title: #NoComaCuento: Imagen que circula en redes sociales usa datos falsos para afirmar que contagios en Costa Rica por covid-19 están peor que en Italia y España

Summary: Fake infographic circulated claiming that the infection rate of coronavirus in Costa Rica was much higher than in Spain and Italy, inviting the population to be cautious in order to avoid contagion in a "poor" country like Costa Rica.

Title: NADA DE DYLAN COVID: NO BAUTIZARON A NINGÚN NIÑO COMO EL NUEVO CORONAVIRUS
Narrative_Description: Newborn was named after coronavirus

Title: COVID-19: Skydiving Video Viral As Mexico Dumping Dead Bodies Into Sea

Summary: A video of skydiving from Russia was shared as a video of Mexico dumping bodies of people who died from coronavirus into the sea on social media.

Title: Never Said Coronil Can Cure Corona: Patanjali CEO Makes False Claim
Narrative_Description: Patanjali CEO claims that Coronil was never pitched as a cure to COVID-19

Summary: Patanjali CEO said they never pitched Coronil as a COVID-19 cure. This is a lie since Patanjali founder and yoga guru, Baba Ramdev, had previously claimed and called the medicine a cure.

Title: No, 169 Residents Of A Mumbai Apartment Have Not Tested COVID-19 Positive

Summary: A false message spread on WhatsApp claiming that 169 residents of the building had tested positive for the virus.

Narrative_Description: Hospital in Hyderabad had bodies of patients who died due to COVID-19 stacked inside the premises.
Motive_Description: Criticize hospital management and also spread fear among people.
Summary: A six-and-a-half year old disturbing video showing piles of corpses stacked against a wall is being shared with a false claim that it shows COVID-19 deaths at Osmania General Hospital in Hyderabad, Telangana.

Title: Video Shows Hospital Overwhelmed By COVID-19 Cases In Pakistan? Not Quite
Narrative_Description: A hospital in Lahore, Pakistan was overwhelmed by COVID-19 patients
Motive_Description: Criticize Pakistan's response to COVID-19 and their healthcare system
Summary: A video showing patients being evacuated after a fire broke out at a hospital in Lahore is being peddled with a false claim it shows the hospital overwhelmed by the number of COVID-19 patients in Pakistan.

Title: FactCheck: Audio Message Claims Steam Inhalation Kills COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Inhaling steam can kill coronavirus
Motive_Description: Make people think a simple step like inhaling steam can help kill coronavirus in bodies
Summary: A viral WhatsApp audio clip presumed to be the voice of a Mumbai-based doctor, falsely claims that the use of steam inhalation can kill COVID-19.

Title: Video Of Ajmer Police's COVID-19 Awareness March Shared With False Claim

Summary: A video showing a flag-march by the Ajmer Police in Rajasthan to raise awareness about the coronavirus is being shared with a false claim that the police force had visited the Ajmer Sharif Dargah to pay their respects.

Title: شركة فرنسية تنتج أول دواء لكورونا.. خبر مضلل

Summary: Various news sites circulated the misleading news that the French company, Sanofi, has announced their anti-malaria drug, Plaquenil, to be the first treatment for the coronavirus

Title: فيديو لامرأة تسقط في مدينة جدة، هل السبب فايروس كورونا؟

Summary: Fake claim spread saying that animals have already been infected by Covid-19, and the dog in Hong Kong was not the first case. However, the virus these messages talk about is a former coronavirus, which affected animals

Summary: A fake claim said that the newspaper El Deber reported that the Ministry of Foreign Relations Karen Longaric said that the virus cannot hit bolivian people since they are not Chinese. However, neither the newspaper article nor the statement were true.

Summary: A fake claim saying that measures to suspend working activities in some cities in Spain will be taken by the government in order to spark panick among people.

Summary: Fake messages saying that Marcelo Tinelli and Federico Bal, two Argentinian actors, got the virus. However, they later issued a statement saying it was not true.

Summary: Video accusing the French Pasteur Institute of helping China create, patent, and treat the coronavirus in 2004 and concealing the vaccine for financial gain

Title: Fact Check: CDC Testing Kits For COVID-19 NEVER Risked Lives
Narrative_Description: Claims federal officials confirmed that the CDC sent out COVID-19 test kits "seeded with the virus"
Motive_Description: Incite fear about the potential risks of COVID-19 tests
Summary: Posts on Facebook and Instagram claimed that "Covid-19 test HAS the virus" and that the CDC sent out test kits "seeded with the virus." In fact, a batch of contaminated test kits was recalled, but the people being tested were never at risk of infection and nobody contracted COVID-19 as a result of this incident

Title: Fact Check: There Is NOT A Spike In Coronavirus Cases Just Because There's An Increase In Testing
Narrative_Description: Claims the spike in cases of COVID-19 is a result of increased testing capacity
Motive_Description: Attempt to downplay the severity of the spike in COVID-19 cases in the U.S.
Summary: Facebook posts misleadingly claimed that the spike in US COVID-19 cases related to an increase in testing; in fact, the US has seen a rising percentage of positive tests

Title: Fact Check: CDC Did NOT Say The Common Cold Is Counted As A Positive COVID-19 Result
Narrative_Description: Claims the CDC said the common cold will count as a positive COVID-19 result
Motive_Description: Claim that a positive COVID-19 test may indicate only the common cold
Key_Words: Coronavirus, CDC, test, positive, common cold
Summary: An article spread on social Mediafalsely claimed that the CDC said a common cold will result in a positive COVID-19 test result. In fact, the CDC said that a positive antibody test may result from Other coronaviruses such as the common cold

Title: Fact Check: NO Evidence San Francisco Hospital Faked Positive COVID-19 Tests
Narrative_Description: Claims a hospital in San Francisco faked positive COVID-19 tests
Motive_Description: Claim that positive COVID-19 test numbers are being inflated
Key_Words: Coronavirus, San Francisco, hospital, test, positive, fake, manipulate
Summary: Facebook posts falsely claim that a hospital in San Francisco has been faking false positives on COVID-19 tests. There is no evidence of faking positive tests anywhere in the US

Title: Misinformation circulates about Japan’s plan to subsidise tourism after coronavirus lockdown is lifted
Narrative_Description: The government of Japan is rumoured to be offering discount for tourists when tourism to Japan reopen again
Motive_Description: It's a travel website hence probably tryin to make people book holidays based on this misinformation
Summary: Multiple online articles and social Mediaposts published in May 2020 claim the Japanese government is set to subsidise trips for foreign tourists visiting the country by up to half of the cost after it lifts its coronavirus lockdown. The claim is misleading; on May 27, 2020, the Japanese government clarified the plan will only apply to Japanese residents making domestic travel, adding the details of the policy are still being finalised

Title: This video shows a swarm of birds in Texas in 2016

Video shows thousands of crows coming to Texas, America
After attacking Wuhan, China

Summary: A video claim it shows crows “coming to Texas” after “attacking Wuhan, China”. The claim is false; the video shows black birds swarming the US state of Texas in December 2016; the audio of the video in some of the posts has been manipulated.

Title: Misinformation circulates about financial assistance for Rohingya refugees in Malaysia
Narrative_Description: Post claiming that the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) gives a daily allowance of 35 Malaysian ringgit to Rohingya refugees who registered with the agency. The claim is misleading
Motive_Description: The individual responsible wants to fan anti-refugee/migrant sentiment in Malaysia
Summary: A claim that the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) gives a daily allowance of 35 Malaysian ringgit to Rohingya refugees who registered with the agency. The claim is misleading; the UN agency said it provides financial assistance “under exceptional circumstances to a refugee or a refugee family with special needs” for a “limited time”, adding that the amount of money given varies on a “case-by-case basis”

Summary: A claim that an overworked employee at a funeral home in New York City was accidentally cremated while taking a nap during the COVID-19 crisis. The story is false.

Key_Words: Coronavirus, treatment, Egypt, women, honey, beeswax, olive oil
Summary: A video of two women with one of them claiming that she had a dream in which she saw the treatment for the coronavirus to be honey with beeswax and olive oil

Title: المستشار “تركي ال شيخ” يتبرع ب1000 سيارة بسبب شفاء والدته من فيروس كورونا.. زائف
Narrative_Description: Claim that "Turki Al-Shaikh" would donate 1,000 cars because his mOther had been cured of COVID-19, accompanied by a link that people could use to enter a competition to win a car
Motive_Description: Profit off of people who believe the competition is real
Key_Words: Turki Al-Shaikh, mOther, recovery, competition, cars, Toyota
Summary: A Facebook post claiming to be from Turki Al-Shaikh, announcing a donation of 1,000 Toyota Land Cruisers because his mOther recovered from COVID-19, and accompanied by a link to enter a competition for one of the cars

Title: سبوتنيك وشام إف إم تروّجان لأرقام مضللة عن كورونا في إدلب
Narrative_Description: Claims that there were 12 cases of COVID-19 in northern Idlib, and 14 in northern and western Idlib, with rumors of infected people escaping from hospitals
Motive_Description: Spread fear by exaggerating the number of COVID-19 cases and possibility of exposure to the virus
Source_Description: Sputnik Arabic and Radio Sham FM
Summary: Claims on Russian propaganda site and an Arabic radio Facebook page that there are more cases of COVID-19 in the Idlib province in Syria than were officially recorded, along with false rumors of infected patients escaping from hospitals

Title: "الطّاعون يتفشّى في الصّين" ... عدم دقّة وتهويل
Narrative_Description: Claims that the bubonic plague is spreading across China
Motive_Description: Exaggerates to spread fear of anOther, worse outbreak following the COVID-19 pandemic
Source_Description: Ammon News, Jordan Zad, Roya News, Al-Wakeel News
Key_Words: China, bubonic plague, Black Death, outbreak, spreads
Summary: Misleading and exaggerated claims of an "outbreak" of the bubonic plague spreading across China have been reported in several news oulets

Title: دولة الاحتلال ليست الأولى عالمياً في عدد فحوصات كورونا للفرد
Narrative_Description: Claims made by the Deputy Health Minister of Israel that Israel has the highest rate of coronavirus testing in the world
Motive_Description: Helps Israel's global political standing by highlighting their COVID-19 testing measures
Source_Description: Israeli Deputy Health Minister Yoav Kisch
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Israel, tests, Yoav Kisch, Deputy Health Minister
Summary: Incorrect claim made by Yoav Kisch, the Deupty Health Minister of Israel, that Israel is leading the world with the most per capita COVID-19 tests

Title: فيديو مفبرك لوزيرة الصحة الفلسطينية حول عدم الالتزام بارتداء الكمامة
Narrative_Description: Fabricated video showing Palestinian Minister of Health, Mai Alkila, upset and speaking rudely about the failure to wear a mask
Motive_Description: Video discredits and pokes fun at the Palestinian Minister of Health
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Palestine, Health Minister, Mai Alkila, mask, insults
Summary: Video is edited to make it appear as though Palestinian Health Minister, Mail Alkila, is speaking rudely and insultingly because of the coronavirus outbreak

Title: No ha sido aprobado el ‘medicamento nosodes para COVID-19 desarrollado en Barranquilla'
Narrative_Description: A medication has been approved to treat COVID-19 in Baranquilla
Motive_Description: Instill hope in people that there is a cure for the virus
Summary: Picture being shared showing a supposed image of a medication that has been created that cures coronavirus

Title: ¿Fake news o denuncia? Aparece autor del video donde se habla de un caso de Covid-19 en La Paz
Narrative_Description: Patient tested positive and was transfered in a hospital in La Paz
Motive_Description: Spread fear of contagion
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Bolivia, La Paz, Franz Bustos Gutiérrez, Hospital Obrero, patient, positive
Summary: Fake claim was spread that a patient in Bolivia had tested positive for coronavirus and he was transfered to the Hospital Obrero in La Paz.

Title: #Verificamos: Ambev entregará alcohol en gel a los hospitales y no a la población
Narrative_Description: Ambev (alcohol producer) will distribute alcohol hand sanitizer to the population
Motive_Description: Misunderstanding
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Ambev, alcohol, hand sanitizer, distribute, population
Summary: Fake claim circulated that Ambev (alcohol producer) would be distributing hand sanitizer to the population in Brazil (the company was really going to do so to hospitals).

Title: #Verificamos: Es falsa la nota de Petrobras que anuncia el cierre de refinerías por el Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Petrobras (oil producer) will shut down its refineries due to the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim about a decision of Petrobras
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Petrobras, oil, refinery, shut down, emergency, Roberto Castello Branco
Summary: Fake note by Petrobras's president Roberto Castello Branco claiming that the company will shut down its refineries during the coronavirus emergency.

Title: #Verificamos: Uber no va a suspender sus operaciones en Brasil por Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Uber will suspend its service for ten days due to the coronavirus outbreak
Motive_Description: Discredit the company
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Uber, suspend, service, 10 days
Summary: Fake screenshots of Uber app circulated in Brazil showing that the company was going to suspend its services for ten days due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Title: Benarkah Presiden Jokowi Akui Gagal Pimpin Negara?
Narrative_Description: Misleading article about the president admitted his failures in handling coronavirus
Motive_Description: A website without much credibility published a story about the Indonesian president admitted his failures in handling coronavirus
Summary: A misleading article quoting a political scientiest saying that the Indonesian president is concealing his failures in leading the country. But the president himself did not say anything about his failures in leading the country, like what the article's headline is suggested.

Title: Anggota parlemen Brazil itu marah karena rumah sakit baru untuk pasien COVID-19 belum beroperasi
Narrative_Description: A video posted in Facebook showing a man enraged in a hospital. the caption says that he was upset to find out that no one is treated in the hospital dspited the news saying that there are 5,000 patients there
Motive_Description: A FB post claiming that coronavirus is a high-level conspiracy among countries. Cases is not real, showed by the video finds an empty hospital in Brazil
Summary: A video in FB showing a guy inspected an empty hospital in Brazil that is reported to treat 5,000 coronavirus patients. The caption questioning the empty hospital and  claiming that coronavirus is only a high-level conspiracy to get funds from the WHO. AFP found that the guy is a Brazilian politican that is upset from a delay in hospital opening.

Title: Beredar Video Raja Thailand Berdoa dengan Cara Islam agar Pandemi Covid-19 Segera Berakhir? Ini Faktanya
Narrative_Description: A false video of Thai king doing Islamic prayer asking for corona to disappear from the world
Motive_Description: Using religion (Islam) as the cure for coronavirus.
Key_Words: Thai, king, Islamic praying, Coronavirus, end
Summary: A video in FB falsely claiming that the Thai King praying in Islamic way asking that the coronavirus to end. In reality, the video is when the king hosted an Islamic event in Thailand in April 2019

Title: إحصائية: أفضل 40 دولة واجهت “كورونا” خالية من العرب – زائف
Narrative_Description: List of the 40 best countries to respond to COVID-19 according to the World Health Organization does not include any Arab countries
Motive_Description: Undermines Arab countries for failing to have a good response to COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, response, Arab, World Health Organization, Deep Knowledge Group, statistic
Summary: List allegedly released by the World Health Organization ranking 40 countries with the best COVID-19 response does not include any Arab countries - the list is false, originating from the Deep Knowledge Group website, not the WHO, and does include four Arab countries

Title: [新型コロナFactCheck] 麻生大臣の国会発言 ｢民度の違い｣を理由に｢死亡者数が欧米より少ない｣はミスリード
Narrative_Description: Deputy Prime Minister Aso Taro said the reason Japan has a low COVID death rate is due to a high degree of social and cultural "level" of the people
Motive_Description: Paints Japan as culturally and ethnically superior
Summary: Taro Aso, Deputy Prime Minister, misleadingly claimed that the low COVID death rate in Japan can be attributed to a higher "level" (mindo) of sociocultural status of the Japanese.

Title: 高知のコロナ感染｢看護師自殺｣はデマ　院長が否定､ネットで悪質投稿拡散｢放置できない｣
Narrative_Description: Rumors that a nurse who got infected with COVID was fired and committed suicide
Motive_Description: Provokes unncessary fear and sympathy over false news of suicide
Summary: Rumors spread on Twitter that a nurse in Kochi prefecture who contracted COVID was fired from her job and later committed suicide over her firing.

Title: Falschnachricht eines angeblichen WDR-Mitarbeiters über einen „zweiten Lockdown“ verbreitet sich in Sozialen Netzwerken
Narrative_Description: Rumors spread that WDR broadcasting station was instructed to report inaccurately high corona case numbers because of the gov't's planned second lockdown
Motive_Description: Create feeling that government is lying and abusing its power; that statistics associated with the virus cannot be trusted
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, WDR, second lockdown, zweiter Lockdown
Summary: Information spread through Facebook and Whatsapp was shared originally by a person who claimed to work at the news broadcaster WDR and said they'd been instructed to report higher coronavirus cases in preparation for a second lockdown

Title: Nein, RKI bestätigt nicht eine Covid-19-Sterblichkeitsrate von 0,01 Prozent in Deutschland
Narrative_Description: Claims spread online that the RKI affirmed that the death rate due to the coronavirus in Germany is 0.01 percent
Motive_Description: Completely quell worries about coronavirus and give impression that Germany has 'solved' coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Corona Transition, RKI, death rate, Sterblichkeitsrate
Summary: A blog, 'Corona Transition' published an article that allegedly says the RKI affirmed that the death rate due to coronavirus in Germany was down to 0.01 percent

Title: Nein, dieses Foto zeigt keinen Handschlag zwischen Merkel und Macron Ende Juni
Narrative_Description: Image spread that allegedly depicts Merkel and Macron shaking hands in June
Motive_Description: Portray these two European leaders as inept or unable to follow social distancing protocols
Summary: A photo spread on Facebook allegedly shows Merkel and Macron flaunting safety protocols and greeting one anOther with a handshake in June - photo is actually from Jannuary

Title: Gefälschter Aushang: Aldi Süd ruft nicht dazu auf, auf tierische Produkte zu verzichten
Narrative_Description: Image spread online of a poster apparently from Aldi-Sud, asking customers to avoid animal products because pandemics arise from human-animal contact
Motive_Description: Ambiguous, potentially undermine Aldi-Sud and their profits
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Aldi-Sud, animal products, pandemic
Summary: An image posted on Facebook depicts an apparent Aldi-Sud poster that asks its customers to avoid animal products because of the relation between human-animal contact and rise of pandemics - the poster is fake

Title: Corona: Nein, Angela Merkel hat Ursula von der Leyen nicht kürzlich getroffen, ohne Abstand zu halten
Narrative_Description: Image posted online depicts Merkel and von der Leyen walking arm and arm
Motive_Description: Undermine Merkel and von der Leyen, potential misogynistic intentions
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Angela Merkel, Ursula von der Leyen, social distancing
Summary: An image posted on Facebook showing Angela Merkel and Ursula von der Leyen embracing and walking arm in arm is not from the summer, but from January

Title: Kreis Gütersloh zählt mehr als drei symptomlose Corona-Infizierte
Narrative_Description: Claims spread that Gutersloh lockdown was an overreaction, that hundreds of thousands were locked down because of three infected people
Motive_Description: Criticize the lockdown set in place as a reaction to the Tonnies outbreak
Summary: A post written on Facebook made claims that the lockdown in Gutersloh was a complete overreaction, and that hundreds of thousands of people were placed on lockdown because of three asymptomatic infected people

Title: No, video no confirma caso de Coronavirus (Covid-19) en Cali
Narrative_Description: A video confirmed the first case in Cali, a city in Colombia
Motive_Description: Spark fear by saying that the virus is spreading also in Colombia
Summary: A video on Facebook confirmed that the virus got to Cali where the first patient was found. However, it was fake news that some patients were found in Cali

Title: No, no han cerrado el ambulatorio de El Cachorro de Sevilla por un posible afectado por coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A message saying that the hospital El Cachorro in Sevilla was closed because one Covid patient was found
Motive_Description: Effort to spark fear claiming that a hospital was closed in Sevilla
Key_Words: Coronaviurs, El Cachorro, Sevilla, patient, hospital
Summary: An article saying that the hospital El Cachorro in Sevilla was closed because a Covid patient was found. However, it is not true it was closed

Title: Bolsonaro publica video en Twitter con información falsa sobre el desabastecimiento de Ceasa en Minas Gerais
Narrative_Description: Video of empty CeasaMinas unit advancing that there was a shortage of supply
Motive_Description: Effort by Bolsonaro to criticize social isolation measures taken by governors by highlighting fake shortage in Ceasa unit.
Summary: Jair Bolsonaro posted a video on Twitter showing an empty Ceasa unit at the Minas Gerais Supply Center in Contagem, in which a man claimed the unit was empty due to a shortage of supply. Bolsonaro implies in his caption that social isolation measures of governors are to blame, criticizing them and praising himself. In reality, the unit was empty because it was being cleaned, the company claimed there was no shortage of supply, and Bolsonaro removed the tweet 5 hours later.

Title: En Twitter, Osmar Terra publica información falsa sobre Covid-19 en los Países Bajos
Narrative_Description: Claim that cases in the Netherlands were dropping without measures enforcing a quarantine or the closing of businesses
Motive_Description: Downplay the need for quarantine measures through misinformed comparison to the Netherlands
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Osmar Terra, Netherlands, quarantine, closing, end of epidemic
Summary: Osmar Terra (federal deputy & former Minister of Citizenship of Brazil) tweeted that the Netherlands, without restricting population movement / business operations, was experiencing a drop in COVID cases and was moving toward "the end of the epidemic". Included a graph (incorrectly interpreted) that displayed a gradual drop in the number of cases in the Netherlands.

Title: Covid-19: Moro cita caso não confirmado de preso solto que voltou ao crime...
Narrative_Description: An inmate who was released from prison because of the Covid epidemic was subsequently found with a stock of weapons and drugs
Motive_Description: Used an unconfirmed claim to argue that prisoners shouldn't be released indiscriminately due to the pandemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Sergio Moro, prisoner, released, risk
Summary: An unconfirmed claim circulated social Mediathat a detainee, who was released from prison due to the COVID-19 pandemic, was found with a large supply of drugs and weapons after his release. Minister of Justice and Public Security, Sergio Moro, then cited this case (acknowledging it needed to be confirmed) at a press conference, using it to argue that detainees shouldn't be released indiscriminately due to COVID. It turns out the detainee had finished serving his sentence, and was not released due to the pandemic.

Title: #NoComaCuento: Masticar jengibre no impide el contagio de covid-19
Narrative_Description: Chewing ginger decreases the probability of one becoming seriuosly ill from Covid-19
Motive_Description: False Hope that ginger can prevent serious covid-19 related illness
Summary: Fake Remedy spread around Whatsapp/social Mediaclaiming that chewing ginger can prevent the spread of Covid-19, because doing so "produces salivary enzymes that contain a compound that decreases one's probability of becoming seriously infected or suffering from Covid-19". The statement was falsely attributed to the Peruvian Ministry of Health, and the discovery of this "remedy" was falsely attributed to the WHO.

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que el Ejército hizo 2 mil lechos para pacientes de Covid-19 en 48h
Narrative_Description: The Brazilian army constructed 2,000 hospital beds for Covid patients in 48 hours
Motive_Description: Falsely comparing Brazilian army competency / Covid response to that of China
Summary: A false post was shared on Facebook claiming that the Brazilian army made 2,000 hospital beds in 48 hours, while China made 1,000 beds in 10 days. The Brazilian army was working with Other organizations to set up screening tents & field hospitals, and to provide beds to Covid-19 patients, however, at the time of posting, this was an ongoing process and the number of beds to be created and supplied was not 2,000.

Title: Ucapan Terima Kasih Xi Jinping ke Jokowi karena Kurangi Pengangguran di Tiongkok? Ini Faktanya
Narrative_Description: False news of Xi Jinping thanked Indonesian president for helping restoring China's economy
Motive_Description: Portraying that the Indonesian president is a Chinese puppet
Key_Words: China, unemployment, Xi Jinping, Joko Widodo, president
Summary: A FB post falsely claim that China's Xi Jinping thanked Indonesian's president for helping out China's economy. The post imitated a news article saying that Xi Jinping thanked Joko Widodo for cooperating in combating coronavirus

Title: Sebut Tenaga Medis Sengaja Sebarkan Korona, Akun FB Dilaporkan ke Polisi
Narrative_Description: A rumor that doctors injecting lethal substances and claiming that patients died from coronavirus
Motive_Description: Portraying that doctors are the perpetrators behind coronavirus and that they profiting from it
Key_Words: Sampang, East Java, doctors, inject, Coronavirus
Summary: A conspiracy that doctors are injecting lethal substances to patients and then claim that they died from coronavirus. Also, doctors are profiting from the practice.

Title: [SALAH] Video Doa Imam Besar Masjidil Haram Mekah Assyeikh Sudais terhadap Musibah Virus Corona
Narrative_Description: A misleading video posted in FB claimed that the Chief Imam of The Great Mosque of Mecca is praying for the end of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Asking people to pray for the end of coronavirus
Key_Words: Masjidil Haram, Mecca, Chief Imam, Assyeikh Sudais, praying, Coronavirus
Summary: A misleading content saying that the Chief Imam of Great Mosque of Mecca is praying for the end of coronavirus and so the Other Muslims should follow suit. The video is from 2007 when the Imam led a prayer in Lahore, Pakistan

Title: Kementan Produksi Massal Kalung Antivirus Corona Bulan Depan
Narrative_Description: A false policy by the Indonesian minister to mass produce a necklace to fight coronavirus
Motive_Description: False cure for coronavirus, using ointment oil in a necklace
Key_Words: Agriculture Ministry. mass produce, necklace, anti Coronavirus
Summary: A minister saying that his minister will mass produce a necklace containing ointment oil that can fight off coronavirus. The statement is later corrected saying that it cannot fight off the virus, but can help easing the breathing from the eucalyptus essence.

Title: No, wearing a mask doesn’t void concealed-carry permit
Narrative_Description: Claims wearing a mask voids concealed-carry weapon permits
Motive_Description: Target lawmakers imposing mask-wearing rules
Key_Words: Coronavirus, mask, concealed-carry, permit, gun, weapon
Summary: Facebook posts falsely claimed that wearing a mask makes concealed-carrying of weapons unlawful

Title: Claim that Democratic leaders aren’t using masks based on old picture
Narrative_Description: COVID-19 is being overblown by democrats as a political tactic
Motive_Description: Target House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Other democratic lawmakers
Key_Words: Coronavirus, mask, democrat, pelosi, Trump, political
Summary: A Facebook post claims to show a photo of Democrats not wearing masks or social distancing "in private" and comments on COVID-19 being used as a political tool, but the photo is actually from before the pandemic

Title: No, the CDC is not on the verge of lifting 'epidemic' label for COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Article says The CDC may have to stop calling COVID-19 an ‘epidemic’ due to a remarkably low death rate
Motive_Description: Claim the 'epidemic' label may be lifted from COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, epidemic, CDC, death toll, rate
Summary: An article shared on Facebook falsely claimed that the CDC may have to lift the 'epidemic' label from COVID-19 because of the dropping death rate

Title: No, the US is not alone in facing a possible second wave of COVID-19 infections
Narrative_Description: The "second wave" of COVID-19 in the US is a political ploy
Motive_Description: Blame Trump critics for manufacturing the idea of a COVID-19 "second wave"
Key_Words: Coronavirus, second wave, President, Trump, November, unseat
Summary: A Facebook post suggests that Other countries are not experiencing a second wave of COVID-19 because it is a political ploy to unseat President Trump. In fact, Other countries have also seen a surge in cases

Title: Painting of Children in Masks Isn’t a 1994 Airport Mural
Narrative_Description: A 1994 mural of children in masks proves that COVID-19 was planned
Motive_Description: Promote the idea of COVID-19 as a planned event
Summary: Social Mediaposts falsely claim that a 1994 mural of children in masks in the Denver airpot prove that COVID-19 was planned. The mural is not in the Denver airport and seems to have been created in 2020

Title: Is This Obama, Fauci, and Gates at a Wuhan Lab in 2015?
Narrative_Description: Suggest Obama, Fauci, and Melinda Gates were involved in a conspiracy to design COVID-19 in a Wuhan lab
Motive_Description: Target President Obama, Dr. Fauci, and Melinda Gates and promote conspiracy theories about the origin of COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Obama, Fauci, Gates, Wuhan, lab, deepstate
Summary: Social Mediaposts falsely claimed that a photo showed President Obama, Dr. Fauci, and Melinda Gates at a Wuhan lab in 2015 as part of a "deepstate" conspiracy. The photo is from the U.S., and Melinda Gates is not in it

Title: No, el informe médico del Hospital General Universitario Santa Lucía de Cartagena (Murcia) que diagnostica a una persona una infección por coronavirus no es actual: es de una cepa de un coronavirus anterior
Narrative_Description: An image was spread showing a report saying that in the hospital Santa Lucia in Cartagena (in the city of Murcia) a Covid patient was found
Motive_Description: Spread the news that the virus was found also in a big hospital in Spain to create fear among people
Key_Words: Coronavirus, patient, Santa Lucia, Cartagena, Murcia
Summary: An image showing a report was spread on WhatsApp saying that the first Covid-19 patient was found in the Santa Lucia Hospital in Cartagena, in Spain. However, this was not true and no case was found there.

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que higienizarse las manos con alcohol en gel influye en el test de alcoholemia
Narrative_Description: A video of a man saying that using alcohol to clean hands to fight the virus alters the alcohol test
Motive_Description: Spread the news probably by mistake
Summary: A video of a man saying that cleaning hands with alcohol to fight the virus alters the alcohol test was spread on Facebook

Title: El mapa de emisiones de dióxido de azufre en Wuhan muestra una previsión de la NASA, no índices actuales
Narrative_Description: Messages saying that an index of sulfur dioxide was very high above Wuhan because of the many cremated bodies due to the virus
Motive_Description: Spread the news many bodies were cremated in Wuhan because of the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, sulfur dioxide, cremated bodies, Wuhan
Summary: Messages showing NASA maps showing that in Wuhan there have been very high levels of sulfur dioxide due to the many cremated bodies due to the virus. However, these maps were created using previous data, thus not registering any increase in the bodies that were cremated

Title: No, en Sincelejo no han ‘confirmado’ caso de coronavirus (Covid-19)
Narrative_Description: Messages saying that the first case of Covid was found in Sincelejo, a city in Colombia
Motive_Description: Spread the news that the first Covid case was found in Sencelejo, in the city of Colombia.
Summary: Messages on Facebook said that the first case of coronavirus was found in the city of Sencelejo, in southern Colombia. Even a MP posted a video saying that, Yahir Acuña. However, this news was later debunked.

Title: El coronavirus y las teorías conspiratorias: las vacunas, los 'chemtrails' y el 5G
Narrative_Description: A message saying that Chinese people all got the vaccine during autumn thanks to the chemtrails emanated by 5G technology
Motive_Description: Spread the news to target the Chinese institutions and 5G technology
Summary: Message saying that all the Chinese people got the vaccine in autumn and this was emanated through chemtrails spread by the 5G technology.

Title: No, la Comunidad de Madrid no ha comunicado que las clases suspendidas por el coronavirus serán recuperadas en verano: es un montaje
Narrative_Description: An image showing that the Madrid authorities released an official document saying that classes that were suspended due to the lockdown will be recovered in July
Motive_Description: Spread a fake news about when school would start again to target the Madrid authorities
Summary: An image showing an official document released by Madrid authorities and saying that school classes will be recovered in July in Madrid. However, this official document was made up

Title: No, El Mundo no ha publicado un artículo que afirma que la Consejería de Educación de Madrid aplaza la convocatoria de la EvAU al 18 de junio: es un montaje
Narrative_Description: A message saying that the newspaper El Mundo wrote that the entry test for the university was postponed to June 18th, as Madrid authorities announced
Motive_Description: Spread the news to target Spanish authorities by saying they took an unpopular decision
Summary: A message saying that the EvAU, the entry test for the university, was postponed to July 18th, and saying that El Mundo, a newspaper, wrote that Spanish authorities took that decision. However, it was not true

Title: No, Cristina Pedroche no ha dicho que “si llegamos a mil infectados de Coronavirus en España os enseño una teta”: es un contenido 'satírico' que se viraliza como real
Narrative_Description: A message saying that Cristina Pedroche, a famous actress, said she was going to show her breast if Spain had reached 1000 Covid-19 cases
Motive_Description: Spread a fake news to target a famous actress
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Cristina Pedroche, actress, breast, thousand
Summary: A message saying that the Spanish actress Cristina Pedroche said that she was going to show her breast if Spain had reached 1000 cases.

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que Doria prohibió la cloroquina en los hospitales de San Pablo
Narrative_Description: João Doria, São Paulo's governor, banned chloroquine in São Paulo's hospitals
Motive_Description: Spread fake news about government action
Key_Words: Coronavirus, João Doria, chloroquine, São Paulo, banned
Summary: A message spread that João Doria, the governor of São Paulo, banned the use of chloroquine for Covid-19 patients in state hospitals

Title: Did Betsy DeVos Say COVID-19 Will ‘Only’ Kill .02% of US Students?
Narrative_Description: Claims Betsy DeVos said COVID-19 will kill .02% of U.S. students
Motive_Description: Target Betsy DeVos and the White House's stance on school reopenings
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Betsy DeVos, school, reopen, students, die
Summary: Facebook posts attributed a false quote to Betsy DeVos in which she said 'only' .02% of U.S. students would die as a result of COVID-19. The White House has advocated for schools to reopen, but DeVos never said this

Title: Don’t trust this comparison of daily coronavirus deaths with Other diseases
Narrative_Description: The daily COVID-19 death toll is far lower than Other diseases
Motive_Description: Give the impression that COVID-19 is far less impactful than Other diseases such as tuberculosis
Key_Words: Coronavirus, death, tuberculosis, hepatitis, collapse, economy
Summary: A bar chart circulated on social Mediashowing "disease deaths per day worldwide" with COVID-19 far behind tuberculosis and the seasonal flu, for example. The chart used a COVID-19 death toll from before the spike in global cases, and ignored many Other unique challenges associated with COVID-19

Title: Fact check: Trump did not tweet about South Dakota closing its border with California
Narrative_Description: Trump called on South Dakota to close its border with California
Motive_Description: Criticize President Trump
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Trump, tweet, South Dakota, California, border, losers
Summary: A fabricated tweet from President Trump circulated on social Mediain which he called on South Dakota to close its border with California in order to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Trump did not tweet this, and South Dakota is several states away from California

Title: Es engañoso que Ginés González García dijo que no había posibilidad de que exista el coronavirus en la Argentina
Narrative_Description: A message saying that the Argentinian Ministry of Health Gines Gonzalez Garcia said it is impossible Covid-19 would get to Argentina
Motive_Description: Spread fake statement to attack the Ministry of Health of Argentina
Summary: A post saying that the Argentinian Ministry of Health Garcìa stated that it is impossible that Covid gets to Argentina, while the first case was identified. However, he said it is impossible that autoctone cases will be found and not that Covid is not present in Argentina

Title: Coronavirus: es falsa la cadena de la doctora “González Ayala” que circula por WhatsApp
Narrative_Description: A message saying that doctor Gonzalez Ayala, a famous scholar in Argentina, gave several advice about how to prevent the virus
Motive_Description: Spread advice to help friends through a WhatsApp message saying a famous doctor gave them
Summary: A message was spread on WhatsApp saying that the famous doctor Gonzalez Ayala in Argentina listed several advice on how to prevent the virus. She denied it.

Title: #NoComaCuento: La CCSS no le pidió a las personas con síntomas de covid-19 que no vayan a hospitales
Narrative_Description: People with symptoms should not go to hospitals in Costa Rica
Motive_Description: Spread false claim and create confusion
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Costa Rica, CCSS, symptoms, hospitals
Summary: Fake claim circulated in Costa Rica that national health authorities (the CCSS) asked people not to go to hospitals in case they experienced symptoms relatable to coronavirus.

Title: Audio con recomendaciones sobre COVID-19 no es de voz de Rodolfo Llinás
Narrative_Description: An audio by the famous Colombian doctor Rodolfo Llinás giving adive on how to prevent the virus
Motive_Description: Spread an audio by a famous doctor to help friends and family members
Summary: A fake audio was spread saying it was by Rodolfo Llinás, a famous Colombian doctor, in which he gives advice on how to prevent the virus. He denied it was by him.

Title: Este video no es de bogotanos rompiendo la cuarentena, es del 21N

Title: Secondo un medico il Covid-19 è la più grande farsa della storia curabile con le vitamine. Non ci siamo!

Title: Coronavirus. Con la scusa della Pandemia i «satanisti» sdoganano la pedofilia? Ma per favore!

Summary: The news spread on Twitter that former MP Carlo Giovanardi was a Satanist and was using the emergency situation linked to the COVID-19 outbreak to pass a law that protects pedophiles

Summary: Video of a woman in a hospital bed describing her severe symptoms after being infected with COVID-19 and urging people to stay at home is circulated with captions alleging she is Canadian Prime Minister's wife, Sophie Trudeau, when in actuality she is a British waitress

Title: الادعاء القائل بأن منتج الإير دكتور يقي من فيروس كورونا المستجد هو ادعاء زائف

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, League, homeless, shelter, immigrants
Summary: A picture showing a homeless man in Milan, accompanied by the claim that he had suffered from COVID-19 but after healing his home had been occupied by illegal immigrants, gained momentum after being shared by a League party member, Edoardo Ziello. The news, however, was untrue and the man was never found.

Title: Coronavirus. Il video di Montanari e la «finta pandemia» tra «errori medici», trombosi e vitamina C

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, no-vax, Stefano Montanari, emergency, hoax
Summary: A video by anti-vax supporter Stefano Montanari spread on social media, claiming that coronavirus is a hoax, as the related disease is even less serious than common flu, and that emergency measures were wrong or exaggerated

Summary: The news was shared on social Mediain Ghana and then also in Italy that Congolese Nobel laureate Denis Mukwege had confessed that he was forced to declare every death and illness in the emergency period to be related to coronavirus, even though they were not, and that he could not lie any more. The claim never happened.

Title: Cek Fakta: Beredar Kabar WHO Sebut Vegetarian Belum Ditemukan Terinfeksi Covid-19, Simak Faktanya
Narrative_Description: Claim that vegetarians are immune to coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread idea that vegetariansor Hindus are immune to coronavirus
Summary: A FB post claimed that not a single vegetarian has contracted coronavirus, according to the WHO. The agency has never said that and there is no link between vegetarianism and coronavirus.

Title: Beredar Foto Obama, Fauci dan Melinda Gates di Laboratorium Wuhan pada 2015? Ini Faktanya

Summary: A photo of Fauci and Obama and a women claimed as Melinda Gates in a lab. It is said that they were visiting Wuhan lab in 2015 as part of the "bat project". In reality, the photo was taken in 2014 in National Institutes of Health di Bethesda, Maryland. And the woman is not Gates, but Nancy Sullivan.

Title: Beredar Flyer Tahapan Pilkada Terbaru, Ternyata Hoax

Motive_Description: Claim that all the election steps will only benefit the incumbent government.

Title: Video Penampakan Setiap Hari 30 TKA Tiongkok Tiba di Bandara Haluoleo? Ini Faktanya

But a FB post showing a photo of foreign workers from China filled Haluoleo airport in the island of Sulawesi. In reality, the photo was taken at least 2 years prior the pandemic. For context: There has been a growing aversion towards Chinese workers in Indonesia, as workers claimed that the Chinese steal their job.

Title: Hoaks Alat Rapid Tes Sengaja Memasukkan Virus Corona ke Tubuh Masyarakat

The false message was "corroborated' with a news article saying that rapid test from China falsely diagnosed patients.

Title: SALAH] Video “rezim memaksa para kyai utk di suntik dgn dalih utk ketahanan tubuh dari virus..kyai di banten ini tegas menolak!!”

The message falsely saying that the government is forcing Islamic preachers (shown in video) to take rapid test to tell the body's immunity. [Many people believe conspiracy theories that rapid test is actually spreading the virus] The video is actually a patient who's tested positive of covid 19 and refused to isolate, hence the force to put him into isolation.
