Title: فيديو لسيدة تدعي أنه لا يوجد شيء يدعى كورونا وما هو إلا مؤامرة من بيل جيتس – زائف

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que Atacadão donará canastas básicas durante la pandemia de Covid-19

Title: Misreported test data in Orlando does not explain Florida’s COVID-19 outbreak

Various social Mediaposts falsely said the numbers were intentionally inflated and showed that Florida's COVID-19 outbreak was not real. In fact, Florida has experienced a massive surge in cases

Summary: In an interview, President Trump falsely claimed that the U.S. has the lowest COVID-19 mortality rate, when in fact it is quite high. A Fox News ancor said Trump meant to refer to the case-fertality rate, but the U.S. does not have the lowest case-fertality rate either

The referenced drug is not a vaccine but may help critically ill COVID-19 patients, and it does not cause infertility

He thinks that covid-19 is not fatal if a photographer can enter a hospital room with covid patient in it. Also, he thinks that the reason the photo went viral is because some buzzers are posting the photo at the same time.

Summary: Ok Diario published story that a shipment of 5,000 kilos of masks was halted in Zaragoza because of the closure of their customs office at 3pm, and that the masks did not arrive in Madrid in a timely manner as a result.

Title: No, no hay hospitales en España inyectando MMS o clorito de sodio a los pacientes y este producto no es eficaz contra el coronavirus

Summary: Video spread in which Josep Pamiès, an alleged biologist, advised the use of MMS (Miracle Mineral Solution - a solution of sodium chlorite in water) against some diseases, including covid-19, and claimed that a hospital in Spain was intravenously injecting patients with MMS to fight/prevent covid-19.

Title: No, Bill Gates no dice que 770.000 muertes por la vacuna de Covid-19 sea un buen resultado

Summary: A few chain messages have spread that inhalation of hot eucalyptus vapor completely kills covid-19, falsely attributing these claims to doctors from the Univ. of Havana in one chain, and to those from the Univ. of Carabobo (Venezuela) in anOther

Summary: A long post in Facebook claiming that covid is made by the global elites as a response to the rise of Muslims all over the world. It also says that WHO is under the influence of the US and Israel and its Jewish population.

Motive_Description: Stoke fear about discrimination towards Africans in China
Summary: A video circulated on social Mediawith the claim that it showed Kenyans being attacked and discriminated against in Wuhan or Other Chinese cities. The video is actually from New York

Title: Tanzanian president drumming to celebrate ‘defeat’ of coronavirus? No, video from 2016

Motive_Description: Target Tanzania’s president John Magufuli
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Tanzania, Magufuli, defeat, celebrate, mask
Summary: Facebook posts claimed to show Tanzania’s president John Magufuli at a crowded event celebrating the defeat of COVID-19. The video is actually from 2016

Title: Health authorities did not say drinking water will prevent coronavirus
Narrative_Description: claim that drinking water can prevent coronavirus
Motive_Description: Believed that drinking water may help slow down the infection
Key_Words: drinking warm water, prevention, Canada, Phillipines, Department of Health
Summary: Facebook posts shared thousands of times in various countries claim that drinking water can prevent coronavirus. Many posts present the information as “health bulletins” from the officials in Canada or the Philippines. However, authorities have issued no such advice.

Title: Singapore denies it closed a subway station after novel coronavirus discovery
Narrative_Description: claims Singapore closed a subway station in January 2020 after discovering a case of novel coronavirus
Motive_Description: Warning people not to go to the said MRT station
Key_Words: train station, MRT, close, infected, outbreak, disinfect
Summary: A Facebook post claims Singapore closed a subway station in January 2020 after discovering a case of novel coronavirus. The claim is false; Singapore’s Ministry of Health and Ministry of Transport denied that any part of its mass rapid transit (MRT) network had been shut down for disinfection.

Title: Singaporean authorities refute hoax about 'spot fines' for people violating social distancing orders
Narrative_Description: claim that Singapore has started enforcing spot fines for people who flout certain social distancing regulations
Motive_Description: Warning people to comply to the social distancing rule or face the steep fine
Summary: posts on Facebook which claim that Singapore has started enforcing spot fines for people who flout certain social distancing regulations during the novel coronavirus pandemic. The claim is false; the Singaporean government agency overseeing the enforcement of the social distancing order refuted the claim; there is no mention of spot fines for offenders in the recently announced government regulations.

Title: This image has circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine that has not been approved by health authorities
Narrative_Description: An image claim that it shows China administering the "world's first new coronavirus vaccine"
Motive_Description: false claim that vaccine has been found
Summary: An image has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows China administering the "world's first new coronavirus vaccine" after the global outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The claim is misleading; the photos in this image have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

Title: These photos show victims of a deadly heatwave in 2015 that killed hundreds in Pakistan
Narrative_Description: photos showing dozens of body bags which claim they show the bodies of COVID-19 victims in Pakistan
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the mortality of the pandemic
Summary: Three photos showing dozens of body bags have been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim they show the bodies of COVID-19 victims in Pakistan. The claim is false; the photos in fact show covered corpses in Pakistan after a severe heatwave in 2015 that left hundreds dead.

Title: Misinformation about fines in Singapore circulated online before face masks made mandatory in public
Narrative_Description: Claim that Singapore introduced fines of up to SGD$150 for anyone not wearing a face mask outdoors during the COVID-19 pandemic
Motive_Description: Telling people to follow the rule and not get fine and where they can get free masks
Summary: Claim that Singapore introduced fines of up to SGD$150 for anyone not wearing a face mask outdoors during the COVID-19 pandemic. The claim is misleadin. However, on April 14, 2020, the Singaporean government announced fines of up to SGD$1,000 for those not wearing a mask outside during the pandemic

Title: This video actually shows a 2012 election victory parade in Singapore
Narrative_Description: A video claim it shows Singapore’s opposition Workers' Party holding a rally in July 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Motive_Description: Showing that oposition party and their supporter holding rally during Covid-19 pandemic
Key_Words: Worker's Party, rally, pandemic, election, Singapore
Summary: A video has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows Singapore’s opposition Workers' Party holding a rally in July 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic. The claim is false; the video actually shows a by-election victory parade in Singapore in 2012.

Title: Corrections and clarifications regarding falsehoods posted on HardwareZone Forum Post
Narrative_Description: HardwareZone Forum post claimed that a 66 year old man died in Singapore from a newly identified virus that caused him to develop severe pneumonia.
Motive_Description: Claiming that there's a death in Singapore
Summary: At 5.50pm on 26 Jan 2020, a HardwareZone Forum post claimed that a 66 year old man died in Singapore from a newly identified virus that caused him to develop severe pneumonia. As of 11pm on 26 Jan 2020, there have been no deaths among confirmed cases of the Wuhan coronavirus infection.

Title: Corrections and clarifications regarding falsehoods published by AB-TC City News' website
Narrative_Description: A website called 'City News' claimed that five Singaporeans have contracted the Wuhan coronavirus without going to China
Motive_Description: False report on local transmission
Summary: On 30 Jan 2020, a website called ‘City News’ published an article titled “BREAKING NEWS: Singapore records six more coronavirus case, total of 16 now” (https://ab-tc.com/singapore-coronavirus-cases/) claiming that five Singaporeans have contracted the Wuhan coronavirus without going to China. As of 9pm on 30 Jan 2020, there is no local transmission of the Wuhan virus in Singapore. All confirmed cases in Singapore to date are Chinese nationals who travelled from Wuhan.

Summary: An article derived from Fox News saying that Chinese virologist Li-Meng Yan fled China to testify that the US had covered the outbreak of covid-19 for a while. The article said that the virus is a result of evil conspiracy, while Fox news interview did not say anything about the origin of the virus, just how the Chinese governtment tried to cover up the virus.

Summary: There were false statements of fact contained in a Facebook post by user ‘超静’ (‘tifinnytara’) dated 29 Mar 2020, concerning Singapore's Resilience Budget (Supplementary Budget 2020) ("Resilience Budget"). SIA's S$15 billion capital raising exercise, announced on 26 March 2020, is distinct and separate from the Resilience Budget, and is not funded by the Government.

Title: Corrections and Clarifications Regarding Falsehoods Published by Singapore States Times on the Reporting of COVID-19 Cases in Singapore
Narrative_Description: ingapore States Times published a Facebook post on the COVID-19 situation in Singapore making several false claim, including on the number of cases, Health Minister allegedly ordered the reported numbers to be halved to minimise public panic, by reporting numbers in the afternoon instead of later at night, Singapore Government earlier covered up the number of uncontactable suspect cases.
Motive_Description: claiming the government is trying to cover up covid cases
Summary: The number of new confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection on 17 April was 1,146, and the total number of confirmed cases was 5,573; Health Minister Mr Gan Kim Yong ordered the reported numbers to be halved to minimise public panic, by reporting numbers in the afternoon instead of later at night; The Singapore Government earlier covered up the number of uncontactable suspect cases, then covered up the flight information and profiles of imported cases, and subsequently tried to cover up the total number of cases by reporting only the number of discharged cases and daily increases; and The States Times Review (STR) had called out the Government and Ministry of Health (MOH) on the cover up and MOH had to comply with STR’s post.

Title: Corrections and clarifications regarding falsehood on cross-border travel arrangements between Singapore and Malaysia

This is false. We wish to clarify that the telephone call between the two Prime Ministers was initiated at the request of Prime Minister Muhyiddin. As Prime Minister Muhyiddin has publicly stated, he proposed that the Singapore Government consider a daily cross-border commuting arrangement.

Title: Clarification regarding falsehood published by the National University of Singapore Society (NUSS), The Online Citizen Asia (TOC), CNA and New Naratif on MOM’s advisory on testing of migrant workers

Key_Words: Ministry of Manpower, Ministry of Health, foreign workers, testing,
Summary: The NUSS forum video, TOC’s Facebook post and videos, CNA online article and New Naratif audio recording featured the following claims by Dr Paul Tambyah: MOM issued a statement to all the employers that if they brought their foreign workers for COVID-19 testing, they would lose their work pass privileges. MOM actively discouraged the testing of workers. MOM made these decisions without consulting public health medical professionals or MOH.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Has a ‘COVID-19 tracker’ been secretly installed in your smartphone?
Narrative_Description: Claims that “COVID-19 Trackers Capability” have been added to Apple and Android smartphones "sneakily".
Motive_Description: Suggesting that the new tracking software on Apple and Android smartphone was done secretly, in fact there has been joint statement published by Apple and Google
Key_Words: tracking app, Apple, Google, Android, secret
Summary: The message claims that “COVID-19 Trackers Capability” have been added to Apple and Android smartphones. The message also includes instructions on where owners of Apple and Android smartphones will be able to find them. According to the author of the message, this was happening in the midst of “phone disruptions earlier this week”. It is uncertain where and when these phone disruptions happened. There is also an insinuation that this was a move done in a “sneaky” way by a certain group of individuals. There is nothing sneaky about the new tracking software. In a joint statement published by Apple and Google on 20 May, the firms revealed that they have worked together to build “Exposure Notifications technology that will enable apps by public health agencies to work more accurately, reliably and effectively across both Android phones and iPhones”.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Is ‘Phase 2A’ tentatively happening on 22 June?
Narrative_Description: In the message, we see two tentative dates being mentioned – 22 Jun 2020 and 29 Jun 2020. According to the message, these two dates indicate when ‘Phase 2A’ and ‘Phase 2B’ would be happening. The message also includes details on what Singaporeans could expect to be re-opened when these two phases occur. This message is false.
Motive_Description: The message intend to inform
Summary: In the message, we see two tentative dates being mentioned – 22 Jun 2020 and 29 Jun 2020. According to the message, these two dates indicate when ‘Phase 2A’ and ‘Phase 2B’ would be happening. The message also includes details on what Singaporeans could expect to be re-opened when these two phases occur. This message is false.

Summary: The message suggest that becasue the cases are increasing and has hit certain treshold, Singapore will go back to Phase 1 of lockdown. The ministry has said that the situation are being monitored but it is false to suggest that Singapore will go back to lockdown phase 1.

Summary: Claim that former French Health Minister Philippe Douste-Blazy stated that COVID-19 is a designed biological weapon that spreads through the air and has a 20 day incubation period

Title: العطسة في بلجيكا تقودك إلى السجن.. حقيقة الخبر
Narrative_Description: Exaggerated headlines claim sneezing in Belgium can send someone to prison
Motive_Description: Discredit Belgium for an exreme and unreasonable response to COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Belgium, laws, sneezing, prison, fine
Summary: Exaggerated allegations misrepresent Belgian laws to claim that in light of COVID-19, any infected person that sneezes or coughs intentionally will be imprisoned for 2-5 years

Title: كورونا مصر: هذه الصورة لممرضة برازيلية
Narrative_Description: Image of a woman with marks on her face circulated with claims that it is an Egyptian nurse after working for many hours at the COVID ward
Motive_Description: Praise and celebrate this Egyptian nurse, and by extension, Egyptian healthcare workers
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Egyptian, nurse, hero, isolation ward
Summary: Image of a woman circulated with claims she is an Egyptian nurse after working long hours in the COVID-19 isolation ward - photo was originally posted by a Brazilian nurse

Title: السودان خالية من كورونا والإصابات مجرد ادعاءات.. خبر زائف
Narrative_Description: The World Health Organization allegedly reveals that most of the COVID-19 cases in Sudan are not actually infected with the virus, revealing the lack of transparency in the government
Motive_Description: Undermines the transparency and reliability of the government in Sudan
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Sudan, chronic diseases, World Health Organization, transparency, government
Summary: Claim that the World Health Organization has revealed the coronavirus cases in Sudan to actually be cases of chronic diseases or kidney failure, promising to report the government's lack of transparency in reporting

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que el Gobierno dará $1 millón a empresa del científico Christian Marín para investigación sobre covid-19
Narrative_Description: Costa Rican government is granting $1 million to company Speratum to produce covid-19 tests
Motive_Description: Spread hope that ample investment into covid-19 testing is being done by govt
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Christian Marín, Speratum, million, Micitt
Summary: Story that MICITT (Costa Rican govt) will grant $1 million to company Speratum as part of an initiative to produce covid-19 tests in the country.

Title: #NoComaCuento: Video of alleged covid-19 patient who faints in Nicaragua is actually from a simulation in Colombia
Narrative_Description: A Nicaraguan man with covid-19 passed out in the street and was taken away in an ambulance
Motive_Description: Stoke fear over severity of the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, El Pital, Nicaragua, Department of Huila, simulation, forum theater
Summary: Video of a man coughing and collapsing in the streets of El Pital, Colombia, spread with false message that it happened in Nicaragua. The events in the video were actually part of a Covid-19 drill by the Colombian Department of Huila. Also spread in Guatemala with false message that it happened in Chiquimula.

Title: La Junta de Andalucía anunció el 12 de marzo que suspende las clases presenciales, pero antes circuló un bulo sobre el cierre de colegios en Málaga*
Narrative_Description: An article saying that schools in Malaga are going to close
Motive_Description: Spread fear by saying that schools are going to close
Summary: A fake article pretending to be by El Mundo and claiming that schools are going to be closed in Malaga from the following week. However, it was not true in Malaga but rather in Madrid and the article was not by El Mundo

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que Salud detectó siete focos de transmisión comunitaria en Costa Rica
Narrative_Description: Health authorities detected 7 foci of covid-19 community transmission in Costa Rica
Motive_Description: Spread fear about locations and magnitude of viral spread
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Costa Rica, community transmission, foci
Summary: Chain messages shared via Whatsapp spread that Costa Rican health auhorities detected 7 hubs of community transmission of covid-19 in the country, used as false evidence of extended community transmission of the virus

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que los termómetros infrarrojos ‘matan neuronas’
Narrative_Description: Infrared thermometers kill neurons
Motive_Description: Create fear of taking temperature with infrared thermometers
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Infrared thermometer, neurons, kill, brain
Summary: A video circulating Whatsapp spread that infrared thermometers kill neurons when used to take your temperature

Title: #NoComaCuento: Cadena de mensajes distribuye información falsa sobre distritos en alerta naranja y restricción vehicular
Narrative_Description: Falsely lists locations on "orange alert" in Costa Rica and spreads incorrect info. about vehicle restrictions in these locations
Motive_Description: Spread false information about public measures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, orange alert, vehicle restriction, CNE
Summary: A chain of messages shared via Whatsapp spread an incorrect list of the locations in Costa Rica that are on orange alert for Covid-19, and falsely claimed that in certain locations there is a vehicle restriction in place from 5am to 5pm, Monday-Sunday.

Title: #NoComaCuento: Audio de WhatsApp desinforma sobre restricción vehicular en Alajuelita y Desamparados
Narrative_Description: Misinformation about vehicle restrictions in Desamparados and Alajuelita
Motive_Description: Spread false information about public measures
Summary: An audio message circulated Whatsapp spreading misinformation that, in the coming days, in the two cantons of Desamparados and Alajuelita there would be several road closures and a prohibition of private car usage

Title: #NoComaCuento: Hospital Calderón Guardia no está en paro por falta de equipo de protección
Narrative_Description: Workers on strike at Rafael Ángel Calderón Guardia Hospital in San José, Costa Rica, due to lack of PPE
Motive_Description: Spread fear about strike at Hospital during a pandemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Hospital Rafael Ángel Calderón Guardia, strike, lack of equipment
Summary: False information spread via social Mediathat staff at the Rafael Ángel Calderón Guardia Hospital in Costa Rica were on strike due to a lack of personal protective equipment

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que el Gobierno decretó ley seca por emergencia del covid-19
Narrative_Description: Costa Rican Ministry of Health prohibited sale of liquor to contain covid-19 spread
Motive_Description: Spread false information about public measures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, liquor, prohibit, sale, Ministry of Health, dry law
Summary: An image spread via Whatsapp claiming that the Costa Rican Ministry of Health passed a law, meant to curb covid-19 spread, prohibiting the sale of alcoholic beverages and threatening any business that violates these new measures with indefinite closure.

Title: #NoComaCuento: Besos y abrazos sí incrementan riesgo de contagio de covid-19
Narrative_Description: Giving kisses on the cheek and/or hugs while greeting Others does not increase the risk of covid-19 contagion
Motive_Description: Encourage people to dismiss social distancing guidelines when greeting people by encouraging hugging and kissing
Key_Words: Coronavirus, kisses, hugs, Democracia en Acción
Summary: Democracia en Acción page spread, via Instagram and Facebook, a post claiming that the risk of covid-19 contagion through hugging and/or kissing anOther person on the cheek is 0%.

Title: ¿PUEDE EL IBUPROFENO EMPEORAR A PERSONAS CON COVID-19?
Narrative_Description: The use of Ibuprofen can accentuate symptoms of Covid-19
Motive_Description: Misuse of unsupported research hypothesis
Summary: Medical Journal Lancet published a study in which two authors hypothesized that patients who used ibuprofen suffered more covid-19 complications, although insufficient scientific evidence linked ibuprofen to accentuated symptoms. French Ministry of Health later acted on this hypothesis, and the claim that ibuprofen is linked to worsening covid-19 symptoms spread via social media.

Title: NINGÚN CRUCERO CON ENFERMOS DE COVID-19 DESEMBARCARÁ EN CUBA
Narrative_Description: Two cruise ships with passengers sick with covid-19 would dock in Cuba
Motive_Description: Create speculation over introduction of new infected individuals into the country
Key_Words: Coronavirus, cruise, Costa Mágica, Costa Favolosa
Summary: Speculation that two cruise ships containing sick passengers would dock in Cuba; the ships actually docked in Miami and transferred 13 sick covid patients to a local hospital.

Title: No hay vacunación a domicilio contra el coronavirus en Cuba
Narrative_Description: Fake health personnel are injecting people with covid-19 vaccines that are creating adverse reactions
Motive_Description: Sow distrust in medical personnel and create fear over dangerous vaccine scam
Key_Words: Coronavirus, home vaccination, Cuba, healing drops, curative pills
Summary: Panic spread throughout regions of Cuba over false information that individuals posing as health personnel were administering home-vaccinations to children and individuals in different territories, and that certain children who had gotten this "vaccine" were subsequently admitted in serious condition. Includes claims about vaccine injections, curative pill delivery, and adminitration of healing drops by fake health personnel claiming that these are defensive or curative measures.

Title: الممثل السوري فايز قزق لم يُصب بفايروس كورونا
Narrative_Description: Syrian actor Fayez Kazak has allegedly been diagnosed with COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spread fear that a well known celebrity has been diagnosed with COVID-19
Summary: False claim that Syrian actor Fayez Kazak has been diagnosed with COVID-19

Title: الزبيب يميع الدم ويمنع تجلطه وتخثره لذا يُمكن استخدامه في كورونا.. زائف
Narrative_Description: Claim that raisins prevent blood from clotting and thus can be used to treat COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spreads the False Hope that a household food item can treat COVID-19
Summary: Claim that the Prophet Muhammad gave a remedy of 21 raisins infused with water, which can be used to treat COVID-19 because raisins dilute blood and stop it from clotting

Title: No announcement on when Uganda’s schools will reopen
Narrative_Description: Ugandan schools will reopen in early 2021
Motive_Description: Spread false information about Ugandan school closures
Summary: Facebook posts falsely claimed that Ugandan officials announced plans to reopen schools in early 2021. A reopening timeframe has not been announced

Title: UN ‘not sure’ there’s Covid-19 in Africa, thinks leaders using crisis to make money? No, claim ‘fake indeed’
Narrative_Description: UN said they were 'not sure' if COVID-19 is in Africa
Motive_Description: Accuse Kenyan officials of using COVID-19 to profit
Key_Words: Coronavirus, UN, Kenya, Africa, money, truth
Summary: A graphic shared in Kenya falsely claimed that UN officials said they were 'not sure' if COVID-19 had spread to Africa. The posts claimed that Kenyan leaders were using the pandemic as an opportunity to profit

Title: Janet Museveni, wife of Ugandan president, has Covid-19? No, tweet is fake
Narrative_Description: Ugandan first lady tested positive for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Stoke fear about Uganda's president and first lady catching COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Uganda, first lady, president, test, positive
Summary: A screenshot shared on Facebook appeared to show a Tweet from Uganda’s NBS Television saying that the first lady tested positive for COVID-19. The story was fake

Title: 2005 chloroquine study had nothing to do with COVID-19 and the drug wasn’t given to humans
Narrative_Description: A 2005 chloroquine study found the drug to be effective against a COVID iteration
Motive_Description: Undermine the NIH, claim Americans are being lied to about COVID-19
Key_Words: COVID, NIH, study, chloroquine, effective, lie
Summary: Facebook posts falsely claimed that a 2005 NIH study found chloroquine to be effective against "COVID-1." There is no such thing as COVID-1, this study was not conducted by the NIH, and it tested primate cells infected with SARS

Title: No, CDC did not admit a mistake, did not reduce its COVID-19 Florida case count
Narrative_Description: The CDC admitted to dramatically overcounting COVID-19 cases in Florida
Motive_Description: Claim that COVID-19 cases were dramatically overcounted in Florida
Key_Words: Coronavirus, CDC, Trump, cases, pneumonia, flu
Summary: A Facebook post claimed that when Trump made hospitals start reporting COVID-19 cases to the White House, the CDC admitted that they vastly overcounted COVID-19 cases in Florida by including flu and pneumonia patients. This is not true

Title: No, the Trump administration hasn’t fulfilled every state request for coronavirus supplies
Narrative_Description: There have been zero unfulfilled equipment and supply requests from state governors
Motive_Description: Overstate the effectiveness of the Trump administration's response to COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, pandemic, state, governor, request, administration, fulfill
Summary: On a Fox News segment, Sean Hannity falsely claimed that the Trump administration had fulfilled every state governor's request for equipment and supplies related to COVID-19

Title: Anthony Fauci didn’t write this Facebook post about viruses
Narrative_Description: Attributes a statement about addressing COVID-19 to Dr. Anthony Fauci
Motive_Description: Attribute statements to Dr. Fauci
Summary: On Facebook, a statement about addressing COVID-19 was wrongly attributed to Dr. Anthony Fauci. The statement seems to have come from a Facebook user who's words were copied

Title: Video Misrepresents the Science Behind Face Masks
Narrative_Description: Claim that face masks are ineffective in preventing COVID-19 based on science
Motive_Description: Misrepresent the science behind use of face masks
Key_Words: Coronavirus, face mask, science, ineffective, Fauci, CDC
Summary: A viral video by TV journalist Ben Swann misrepresented the 'science' behind face mask usage to claim that masks were ineffective in preventing the spread of COVID-19

Title: COVID-19 Testing Truck Logo Depicts an Aardvark, Not Death Deity
Narrative_Description: Claim a COVID-19 testing truck bears a logo with an ancient diety of death
Motive_Description: Promote conspiracy theories about COVID-19 testing as deadly
Key_Words: Coronavirus, testing, truck, death, Anubis, logo
Summary: A conspiracy theory falsely claimed that a mobile COVID-19 testing truck bore the logo of an ancient god of death. In fact, the logo is an aardvark

Title: Alberto Fernández: “La OMS recomienda que uno tome muchas bebidas calientes porque el calor mata al virus”
Narrative_Description: Alberto Fernandez, president of Argentina, said that the WHO claimed that drinking many hot drinks helps killing the virus
Motive_Description: Help citizens by recommending preventative measures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Alberto Fernandez, WHO, hot drinks
Summary: Alberto Fernandez, president of Argentina, claimed on radio that the WHO recommended to drink hot drinks to kill the virus. However, this is false

Title: No han bautizado a un niño como 'Yair Coronavirus Mosquera'
Narrative_Description: A tweet saying that a kid was given the name of Yair Coronavirus Mosquera
Motive_Description: Spread the news just for the sake of it or for fun
Summary: A tweet saying that the Mediaoutlet Noticias Caracol reported the news that a kid was given the name of Yair Coronavirus Mosquera. However, the outlet never reported the news

Title: Detector: No, aún no se sabe si Jair Bolsonaro tiene coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A tweet saying that Bolsonaro was found positive to the virus
Motive_Description: Spread the news by mistake
Summary: A tweet by the Mediaoutlet Nexofin saying that Bolsonaro tested positive to the virus. However, he was still waiting for the results and thus the news was false

Title: "Hay 100 casos de niños con coronavirus [en el Hospital del Niño de Breña]"
Narrative_Description: Audio saying there are 100 children with covid-19 at Children's Hospital in Breña
Motive_Description: Spread of misinformation due to speculation
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Children's Hospital, Breña, 100 cases, children
Summary: An audio message circulated social Mediain which an anonymous adult woman claimed that 100 children with covid-19 were evacuated from the Breña market and were now at the Children's Hospital in Breña.

Title: Social Mediafires fictional “Dr Mujahid Hussain” from AYUSH Ministry over Coronil controversy
Narrative_Description: The health ministry of India fired an official for halting the promotion of an unproven ayurvedic medicine.
Motive_Description: Communalize the issue of the controversial ayurvedic medicine "Coronil"
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Coronil, Baba Ramdev, AYUSH Ministry, Mujahid Hussain
Summary: A false story targeting the Muslim community spread on Twitter and Facebook claiming that the official in the Health Ministry responsible for halting advertisements of an unproven ayurvedic "cure" to COVID-19 had been fired.

Title: Viral photo does not show Bharat Biotech’s VP taking first dose of COVID vaccine ‘Covaxin’
Narrative_Description: The first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine "Covaxin" was administered to the VP of the company helping develop it during the human trial phase.
Motive_Description: To make people think the vaccine was in human trial phase
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Covaxin, Bharat Biotech India Ltd, human trials, vaccine
Summary: A photograph of a routine procedural blood draw was shared with the false claim that it represents the first dose of Covaxin being administered to Bharat Biotech’s Dr V K Srinivas. Moreover, the route of administration of BBV152, as per the vaccine’s registration document, is intramuscular while the image shows blood drawn intravenously.

Title: Video from Pakistan shared as patients lying in beds outside hospital in Hyderabad and Mumbai
Narrative_Description: Several patients were lying on hospital beds apparently placed outside hospital premises in Mumbai and Hyderabad
Motive_Description: Criticize the response of the government and hospitals to the COVID-19 pandemic
Summary: A one-minute video that shows several patients lying on hospital beds apparently placed outside hospital premises is being shared on social Mediaas a video from Mumbai and Hyderabad, whereas it is from Lahore, Pakistan and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

Title: Old message of blood donation drive revived as ‘plasma donation’ in the wake of COVID-19
Narrative_Description: 64 individuals were willing to donate plasma for COVID-19
Motive_Description: To make people aware that there were Others willing to donate plasma to COVID-19 patients
Summary: An old list of blood donors was circulated as a list of potential plasma donors.

Title: Goat “arrested” for not wearing mask in Kanpur? Bizarre Mediamisreports
Narrative_Description: A goat had been "arrested" for not wearing a mask
Motive_Description: Mock the actions of the police in Kanpur
Source_Description: News18, Times Now, Orissa Post, National Herald, Republic, India Times
Summary: Multiple newspapers reported the frivolous headline that Kanpur (UP) police had arrested a goat for not wearing a mask, though the police claimed that it was the goat's owner that was not wearing a mask.

Title: Coronavirus: Photos, videos viral with false “organ trading of dead bodies” claim
Narrative_Description: The organs of a patient who had died due to COVID-19 had been traded
Motive_Description: To make people think that false positive COVID-19 cases were being deliberately taken from homes and upon their death, their organs were being traded.
Source_Description: IBN24x7 News, Sonipat News Live, general public
Summary: Videos and photos were falsely circulated with the claim that organs were being trafficked from the bodies of people who had died due to COVID-19.

Title: No, Nanavati Hospital does not recommend lemon, turmeric for COVID “treatment”
Narrative_Description: Mumbai's Nanavati Hospital had recommended warm water with lemon, ginger and jaggery mixed with ghee, hot milk with turmeric and steam once a day for COVID-19 patients.
Motive_Description: To make people think these home remedies were helpful in treating COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mumbai, Nanavati Hospital, lemon, turmeric, steam, ginger,
Summary: A false WhatsApp forward went viral with the claim that COVID experts at Mumbai’s Nanavati Hospital have informed that the following four “treatments” are given to coronavirus positive patients — warm water with lemon, ginger and jaggery mixed with ghee, hot milk with turmeric and steam once a day.

Title: Fake audio advising against COVID tests viral in the name of Maharashtra MLA Geeta Jain
Narrative_Description: An independent MLA advised people to not get COVID-19 tests
Motive_Description: Turn people against getting tested and creating a conspiracy against the central government and testing labs
Key_Words: Coronavirus, false positives, testing, Geeta Jain
Summary: A false audio claim, misattributed to a Maharashtra MLA Geeta Jain, was circulated on WhatsApp claiming that the central government was giving 1.5 lakh rupees per positive test to testing labs and so people should not get tested as they might be given false positive reports.

Title: WHO doesn’t claim asymptomatic patients cannot spread COVID, isolation is still advised
Narrative_Description: WHO claimed that aymptomatic people don't transmit the virus
Motive_Description: Make people think that asymptomatic cases of COVID-19 don't transmit the virus
Summary: A false claim spread on social Mediasaying WHO had said that asymptomatic transmission does not occur, whereas the WHO had said it was rare and more evidence was needed to see the extent of transmission.

Title: Russia’s Sechenov University has NOT ‘completed’ COVID vaccine clinical trials; Mediamisreports
Narrative_Description: Russia's Sechenov University had completed the clinical trials of its COVID-19 vaccine
Motive_Description: Give hope to people that a vaccine was almost ready
Source_Description: ANI, IANS, Times of India, India Today, Financial Express
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, Sechenov University, clinical trials
Summary: Multiple national and international Mediaoutlets falsely reported that Russia's Sechenov University had successfully completed clinical trials for its vaccine, whereas they have only completed the Phase I trials and are in Phase I/II according to the WHO.

Title: Old video of Amitabh Bachchan thanking Nanavati Hospital staff viral as recent
Narrative_Description: Amitabh Bachchan had thanked the staff of Mumbai's Nanavati Hospital for taking care of him while he was COVID-19 positive
Motive_Description: Boost support for Nanavati Hospital
Source_Description: Lokmat, Aaj Tak, MOJO, Outlook, Yahoo India, One India, Amar Ujala
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mumbai, Nanavati Hospital, Amitabh Bachchan
Summary: An old video of famous Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan thanking Nanavati Hospital in Mumbai was circulated across news outlets and Facebook as new, for their services while he was COVID-19 positive .

Title: Fake Graphic Claims Government Has Announced Reopening Of Schools, Colleges
Narrative_Description: In Phase 2 of unlocking, the Modi government had decided to reopen schools and colleges
Motive_Description: To make people think that schools and colleges were going to reopen
Key_Words: Coronavirus, schools, colleges, reopening, Phase 2, Aaj Tak, India News
Summary: Morphed graphics from Aaj Tak and India News were circulated with claims that Modi government had announced reopening of schools and colleges under Phase 2 of unlocking.

Title: Age-Old Home Remedy Peddled As COVID-19 Cure Found By Indian Student
Narrative_Description: An Indian student from Pondicherry had discovered a remedy for COVID-19 that has been approved by the WHO
Motive_Description: To make people think there is a cure
Key_Words: Coronavirus, remedy, Indian student, Pondicherry, WHO
Summary: A fake claim that an Indian student had found a remedy for COVID-19 and that it had been approved by the WHO was circulated on social media.

Title: Unrelated Photos Shared As COVID-19 Hospitals Flooded In Bihar
Narrative_Description: COVID-19 hospitals were flooded in Bihar
Motive_Description: Criticize Bihar government and hospitals for not having adequate facilities to take care of COVID-19 patients during floods
Summary: A set of old and unrelated photos is being shared claiming to show COVID-19 care hospitals in Bihar, are flooded and and inundated with water, leaving patients distressed. BOOM found that one of the photos is old and from the 2018 monsoons in Patna while the Other is from the Osmania Hospital in Hyderabad.

Title: AAP uses Mumbai’s COVID bed facility photos calming to be from Pragati Maidan, Delhi.
Narrative_Description: Pragati Maidan Complex was being set up with 2500 beds to treat COVID-19 patients
Motive_Description: Portray Delhi government and its efforts in positive light
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mumbai, Delhi, Aam Aadmi Party, Pragati Maidan
Summary: Images of Mumbai's isolation ward were shared as Aam Aadmi Party's efforts to set up an isolation ward in Delhi's Pragati Maidan.

Title: Viral Kawat dalam Masker Medis Disebut Antena 5G Pembunuh, Ini Faktanya
Narrative_Description: The wire in face masks is actually a 5G antenna
Motive_Description: Make people reluctant to wear masks
Summary: A video posted in facebook claiming that the wire used in surgical masks is actually a 5G antenna. It needs to be put on top of the nose so when a person breathes, the partciles inhaled will destroy the brain. I reality, the metal strip is to make the mask more comfortable

Title: Benarkah Siswa Secapa AD Bantah Positif Covid-19 di Depan Kasad TNI?
Narrative_Description: Students of an army school in West Java denies that they are tested positive with coronavirus even though the Mediaresported that 1300 of the students are positive. This makes the existence of the virus questionable
Motive_Description: Make people questioning the existence of the coronavirus
Key_Words: Secapa AD (army school), Kasad TNI (chief of army staff), tested positive, denies
Summary: Chief of the army staff visited an army school in West Java in which 1300 of the students are tested positive with coronavirus. When asking some students about their condition, most of the students say their fine (asymptomatic), but the FB post said that the students say that they are not contracted with coronavirus. This is a false claim.

Title: [SALAH] Gambar Jokowi Memanahkan Suntikan ke Ahok dalam Artikel CNBC Indonesia
Narrative_Description: President explains a vaccine trial, but the post disapproves if Indonesians become a guinea pig, instead of a real animals.
Motive_Description: Make people questioning government's decision on vaccine trial
Summary: A facebook post showing a clip of a CNBC Indonesia's article that the president is explaining the vaccine trial. An image then added to the clip of the president trying to inject ex Jakarta governor (shown as an animal bodied) with a text saying "where is your brain? Why make Indonesians as guinea pig, instead of real animals".

Title: Benarkah Jenazah Pasien Covid-19 yang Berdaster Ini Tak Dimakamkan Sesuai Syariat Islam?
Narrative_Description: Death patient of coronavirus did not get a proper islamic treatment before buried
Motive_Description: Make people doubt how hospitals treat coronavirus patient and that coronavirus is just a government's project
Key_Words: Daster (pajama), dead patient, Coronavirus, Islam burial
Summary: A facebook post showing a photo of a dead woman wearing a pajama in a casket. It says that the family doubted that the hospital already cleaned and treated the dead in Islamic way, they forced open the casket. Instead of covered with a white clothe as how Muslims should be, the dead woman was found wearing her pajama. The hospital claimed that they already treated her in Islamic way.

Title: Coronavirus: Sala de emergencias de Hospital de Liberia funciona con normalidad
Narrative_Description: The Hospital in Liberia, Costa Rica, closed its emergency room for a possible covid-19 case
Motive_Description: Spread false info. about a confirmed case and emergency room closure in local Hospital
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Hospital, Liberia, Costa Rica, emergency room, closed
Summary: Facebook page "Calles Guanacaste" published erroneous story that the Liberia Hospital in Costa Rica closed its emergency room for a confirmed case of Covid-19

Title: #NoComaCuento: Masxmenos de Novacentro no tiene empleados enfermos de nuevo coronavirus ni fue clausurado
Narrative_Description: Mas X Menos Supermarket closed because employees tested positive for covid-19
Motive_Description: Convince civilians that popular market is closed
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Novacentro, Goicoechea, Mas X Menos supermarket, closed
Summary: An audio message spread via Whatsapp, sharing that the Public Force and Ministry of Health closed Novacentro's Mas X Menos Supermarket because two associates of a store tested positive for covid-19

Title: #NoComaCuento: Ni la Cruz Roja ni Walmart están entregando comida o dinero por covid-19
Narrative_Description: Walmart and the Red Cross are delivering food and/or money to Costa Rican families during pandemic
Motive_Description: Phishing scam to acquire individual information and infect computers with malware
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Red Cross, Walmart, money, food, giving, data theft
Summary: Messages circulated Whatsapp and Other social Mediaplatforms claiming Walmart and the Red Cross were giving money or food to Costa Rican families during the pandemic

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que cuerpos de muertos por covid-19 no se le entregan a los familiares
Narrative_Description: The bodies of dead covid-19 patients are not delivered to relatives
Motive_Description: Uninformed
Summary: False claim spread around Whatsapp, FB, and Other social Mediathat the bodies of dead covid-19 patients are not delivered to relatives. Claims relatives will only be informed that their loved one is dead and that the State would consider eliminating the body.

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que un taxista con coronavirus se escapó del Hospital de Heredia y ahora maneje su vehículo
Narrative_Description: A taxi driver with covid-19 escaped from hospital in San José
Motive_Description: Spread fear that a sick patient escaped from a hospital
Key_Words: Coronavirus, taxi driver, escape, San Vicente de Paúl hospital, San José
Summary: Messages spread via Whatsapp that a taxi driver allegedly ran away from a hospital after being diagnosed witih covid-19 in San José, Costa Rica

Title: #NoComaCuento: La Municipalidad de San José no está construyendo una fosa común para muertes relacionadas con covid-19
Narrative_Description: The Municipality of San José is building a mass grave for those who die of covid-19
Motive_Description: Generating panic among Costa Rican citizens about severity of crisis
Key_Words: Coronavirus, mass grave, Municipality of San José
Summary: Facebook page "NotiGoico Le Informa" published false info. that the Municipality of San José was building a mass grave in Calvo Cemetery for deaths related to covid-19

Title: #NoComaCuento: Ministerio de Salud no brinda ubicación exacta ni identidades de pacientes con covid-19
Narrative_Description: Ministry of Health is publishing data on patients confirmed to have covid-19, such as home addresses and identities
Motive_Description: Generate fear over publishing of personal data if sick with covid-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, data on patients, publish, address, identity, Ministry of Health
Summary: Audio messages and publications circulated Whatsapp & Other platforms, spreading that the Ministry of Health was publishing personal data on patients confirmed to have covid-19

Title: #NoComaCuento: Ministro de Salud, Daniel Salas, no presentó renuncia por pandemia de covid-19
Narrative_Description: Costa Rican Health Minister, Daniel Salas, announced resignation amid pandemic
Motive_Description: Spread false info. about resignation of a political figure
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Daniel Salas, resignation, Health Minister
Summary: A chain of Whatsapp messages falsely spread that Costa Rican Health Minister Daniel Salas announced his resignation amid covid-19 pandemic.

Title: Cek Fakta: Hoaks Nama Covid-19 Berasal dari Bahasa Latin
Narrative_Description: Covid-19 is latin for "see a sheep surrender"
Motive_Description: Make people think that covid-19 is a man-made virus
Summary: A social Mediameme saying that "ovid" is latin for sheep, C in covid means see and 19 is the number of surrender in ancient times. So covid-19 means see a sheep surrender. A latin professor debunks the theory.

Title: Cek Fakta: Tidak Benar Foto Insentif Bagi Tenaga Medis Cuma Bacot
Narrative_Description: The government's commitment to give incentives to healthcare workers is said as a lie
Motive_Description: Make people doubt the government's commitment for healthcare workers
Summary: A photo showing six nurses holding a paper with the word of B-A-C-O-T-! (meaning lie). The facebook post insinuating that these nurses are claiming that the government's commitment to give monetary incentives to healthcare workers is merely a lie. Using a reversed imgae google, the photo of nurses are actually holding a paper urging people to stay at home and social distancing during the heigth of pandemic

Title: Cek Fakta: Tidak Benar Dalam Video Ini Petugas Memaksa Pasien Berstatus Positif Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Healthcare workers will coerce patients to positive with covid-19
Motive_Description: Make people doubt test results of coronavirus
Key_Words: Heathcare workers, coerce, patients, positive, covid-19
Summary: A video posted in Facebook of a woman being hysterical and dragged by an officer wearing a hazmat suit. The post claimed that the woman is forced to get a positve test result of covid-19. In reality, the woman is courted  by an officer because she refused to leave the hospital room where her husband, who's covid positive just died.

Title: Cek Fakta: Video Disinformasi Anies Baswedan Gubernur Terbaik Hadapi Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Jakarta governor is awarded as the best governor handling coronavirus in the world
Motive_Description: Make people think that Jakarta governor handles the pandemic very well
Key_Words: Anies Baswedan, Best governor, handle, Coronavirus, world
Summary: A video posted in Youtube and Facebook showed Jakarta governor take part in a global conference on cities facing pandemic. The disinformation claim that during the conference the governor is awarded as the best governor handling the pandmic. In reality he's only a participant.

Title: Cek Fakta: Hoaks Foto Jokowi Pegang Penghargaan dari YouTube karena Virus Corona
Narrative_Description: Indonesia's president get a silver button from Youtube as Indonesia has passed the 100,000 cases of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Sarcastically and misleadingly pointing the new milestone in Indonesia's case count
Key_Words: Jokowi, Award, Silver button, Youtube, Coronavirus case
Summary: A photo in Twitter of president Joko Widodo holding a Youtube's silver button. It claims that it's from coronavirus case count that just passed 100,000. After a reversed image heck, the photo is actually the president handing land certificate. Also, Youtube never gave out such awards.

Title: #NoComaCuento: Costa Rica no se encuentra en la ‘etapa máxima de infección’ del covid-19
Narrative_Description: Costa Rica has reached its "maximum stage of infection" of covid-19
Motive_Description: Stoke fear over severity of the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, maximum infection stage, peak, virus transmission
Summary: Several messages spread via Whatsapp and Facebook claiming that Costa Rica would experience its peak of covid-19 cases between March 23 and April 3, comparing the country's situation to that of Italy in its first weeks of covid-19 case reporting. Health authorities clarified this is erroneous

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que este miércoles entra a regir un toque de queda por 14 días en Costa Rica
Narrative_Description: A 14 day curfew will begin on April 1st
Motive_Description: Spread false info. about government measures
Summary: An audio message spread via Whatsapp claiming that a 14 day curfew would be imposed in Costa Rica beginning on Wednesday, April 1st.

Title: #NoComaCuento: No habrá un ‘apagón’ mundial del Internet durante Semana Santa
Narrative_Description: There will be a global Internet "blackout" during Easter week, during which mass arrests will be made
Motive_Description: Create fears about massive communications "blackout" and mass arrests
Key_Words: Coronavirus, global blackout, Internet, mass arrests, Easter
Summary: An image shared via Whatsapp and Facebook spread that a global "blackout" of Internet networks would occur for 3 days leading up to Good Friday, and that during this worldwide "blackout" mass arrests would be made.

Title: #NoComaCuento: Auto Mercado no está regalando cupones de $500, ni Papa John’s pizzas por pandemia de covid-19
Narrative_Description: Auto Mercado is giving away $500 coupons and Papa John's is giving away 2 large pizzas to each family during the pandemic
Motive_Description: Phishing scam
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Papa Johns, Auto Mercado, $500 coupon, pizza
Summary: Several mesages spread via Whatsapp and Facebook claimed that Auto Mercado, supermarket chain in Costa Rica, was giving away $500 coupons and that Papa John's was giving away 2 large pizzas to each family during the pandemic.

Title: Certificación de Inciensa que circula en redes habla de cantidad de pruebas y no de casos positivos de COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Certification from Inciensa claims there are 855 positive cases of Covid-19 in Costa Rica as of April 13th
Motive_Description: Uncertain
Summary: A Facebook page published erroneous information that Inciensa, a Costa Rican Institute for Research, claimed that there were 855 positive cases of Covid-19 in the counry as of April 13th. In actuality, the document released by Inciensa showed the laboratory had processed 855 tests that had tested positive, but this did not equate to the number of people tested due to repeat testing and Other variables.

Title: #Verificamos: Es antigua la foto de baile funk que habría incumplido la cuarentena de la Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Funk concert during the lockdown
Motive_Description: Spread fear of contagion
Key_Words: Coronavirus, funk, dance, concert, Brazil, lockdown
Summary: Old picture circulated claiming to show a funk concert/dance in Brazil during the lockdown.

Title: Ainda não existe cura para coronavírus; auto-hemoterapia não tem comprovação e pode ser perigosa
Narrative_Description: AutohemOtherapy cures coronavirus
Motive_Description: Reference to new cure/preventative measure
Summary: False claim circulated that autohemOtherapy (injecting one's blood in one's muscles) is an effective cure/preventative measure against coronavirus.

Title: Mesej Terdapat SOP Perjalanan/ Melancong Baharu Bermula 1 Ogos 2020 Adalah Palsu
Narrative_Description: False Reporting about a new SOP for trips/tourism in Malaysia
Motive_Description: Just general confusion
Summary: False Reporting about a new SOP for trips/tourism in Malaysia

Title: #NoComaCuento: Imagen divulga información falsa sobre fechas de depósitos del bono Proteger
Narrative_Description: Protect bonus deposits will be made based on ID numbers of their certificates
Motive_Description: Mistaken interpretation of procedure of deposits
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Protect bonus, ID number, dates
Summary: An image spread via Whatsapp claiming that the time at which recipients of the Proteger bonus in Costa Rica would receive aid depended on the ID number assigned to them. In actuality, the bonus is received based on the date that each beneficiary's aid was deposited for the first time.

Title: Detector: Ni el primer ministro de Italia dijo que perdió la batalla contra el Covid-19 ni es la persona que aparece en ésta foto
Narrative_Description: Italian PM said the country has lost the battle against coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread fear of the pandemic
Source_Description: Facebook account Giovanny Higuera, website Remedios Natural Hosting
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italian, Prime Minister, Giuseppe Conte, lost, battle, Bolsonaro
Summary: Picture of Bolsonaro circulated in Colombia claiming it was Italian PM Giuseppe Conte who had said that Italy has lost its battle against coronavirus.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Is this the situation at the Changi Exhibition Centre isolation facility?

Summary: A facebook post containing false suggestion that migrant workers at isolation facilities are not being isolated properly, not following isolation rules and intentionally remain sick to stay in Singapore.

Motive_Description: The message tried to warn people of a potential scam

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Is this an ankle tracker for individuals on Stay-Home Notice?

Motive_Description: Suggesting that Singapore's lokdown rule are being broken
Key_Words: ankle bracelet, tracking device, quarantine, break quarantine rule, Singapore, Malaysia,
Summary: A Facebook post in a group based in Malaysia showed a MRT rider in Singapore wearing an ankle bracelet suggesting that was for Covid-19 patient under quarantine. This is false as the ankle bracelet tracking device was only made compulsory for Covid patient under quarantine in Singapore some 2 weeks later.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Are checks being done at houses during Hari Raya by NEA and the Police?

Key_Words: Eid, visiting, spot checks, authorities, plain clothes
Summary: A whatsapp message warning people not to go visiting during Eid as there are authorities in plain clothes doing spot checks. This is not true.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Is Singapore Expo a new COVID-19 infection cluster?

The claim that none of the national servicemen deployed by the SAF at the Singapore Expo facility have experience in hospitals are also false, some of them are doctors and nurses with prior hospital experience
Motive_Description: The claims aim to blame the Singaporean government for their response, deploying untrained NSF conscript to help at the nation's Covid-19 facilities
Summary: An article from the States Times, alleging that Singaporean authorities are deploying untrained NSF conscript to work at covid-19 facilities to house recovering patients

Title: Nein, die US-Regierung unter Obama hat das Institut für Virologie in Wuhan nicht mit 3,7 Millionen Dollar unterstützt

Title: #NoComaCuento: Es falso que la prueba de covid-19 puede causar infección en el cerebro y la muerte

Title: Faux, Emmanuel Macron n’a pas menacé de refuser le visa aux africains qui n’auraient pas reçu un vaccin européen

Summary: The news went viral on Instagram in the DRC that French President Macron wanted to impose a travel ban on Africans going to Europe if they did not take the (European) vaccine against COVID-19, even though there exists no vaccine and Macron has no such power

The video that's also published in Facebook claimed that "the professor" has found a cure for covid-19. In reality, the person interviewed is not even a professor, have no idea about covid, and the cure is a fake.

Title: Cek Fakta: Tidak Benar Uji Coba Vaksin Corona di RI karena Laboratorium China Kehabisan Monyet

The post attaching "Scenarios for the Future of Technology and International Development" published by the Rockefeller Foundation on 2010.

Title: Cek Fakta: Foto Hoaks soal Presiden Jokowi Ambil Gaji Bulanan ke Bos China

Summary: A video was circulated with the claim that it showed Nigerians scrambling for food during the COVID-19 lockdown, but the video was actually from March 2019

Title: Madagascan president has not called on African states to quit WHO

Title: The money was to help Madagascar fight the outbreak, not to produce a cure

Motive_Description: Create False Hope about the efficacy of Madagascar's herbal COVID-19 remedy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Madagascar, Trump, COVID-organics, herbal, remedy
Summary: A news article and Facebook posts falsely claimed that President Trump approved a $2.5 million fund to help Madagascar develop COVID-organics, an herbal remedy for the virus. In fact, the fund was to help the country fight the pandemic

Title: No evidence robbers are using chemical-laced face masks on victims in South Africa

Summary: Facebook posts falsely claimed that criminals in South Africa were posing as police, giving out face masks laced with chemicals, and robbing people

Title: Experts reject conspiracy theories about ‘5G microchip implants’

Summary: Facebook posts falsely claimed that COVID-19 was designed so that people like Bill Gates could implant 5G microchips under the guise of a vaccine

Title: Article shared thousands of times uses false clickbait headline

Motive_Description: Attack Nigerian government for supposedly lying about COVID-19 aid programs

Summary: Facebook posts attached a fake headline to an article to falsely claimed that the Nigerian government lied about COVID-19 aid programs and was actually providing everyone with financial assistance

Title: Health ministry rejects online rumours of a herbal cure

Summary: Facebook posts falsely claimed that unlike Bill Gates or the WHO, people in Lestoho are immune to COVID-19 because they created a successful remedy

Summary: A fake Facebook page claimed that the Ugandan government was offering grants to local businesses in response to COVID-19 and encouraged people to fill out an application form

Summary: A video circulated in Nigeria and elsewhere with claims that it showed a Brazilian MP discovering an empty hospital, stoking conspiracy theories that COVID-19 is fake

Title: Experts say corpses infected with COVID-19 do not get more infectious over time

Summary: Facebook posts falsely claimed that the bodies of COVID-19 fatalities become most "toxic" after 72 hours and criticize the South African government's handling of bodies

Title: [SALAH] Tangkapan Layar Berita “RK Ajak ABU JANDA Jadi Relawan Uji Vaksin COVID-19 Buatan China”

Summary: A facebook post manipulating a headline of a news article that says the givernor of West Java is urging his people to partake in a Chinese vaccine trial. The manipulated post then used to attack an influencer known as a government supporter.

Title: [SALAH] Foto Presiden Jokowi Bersama Pelawak di Istana Negara Dikaitkan dengan Covid-19

Title: [SALAH] Virus ini punya obat Hydroxychloroquine, Zinc dan Zithromax
Narrative_Description: The virus has a cure that is hydroxychloroquine, zinc and Zithromax
Motive_Description: Urge people not to take mask as the virus has a cure
Summary: A video posted in instagram claims that cornavirus has a cure that is Hydroxychloroquine, Zinc and Zithromax. And so we no longer need to wear a mask. The video has been taken down in Other social Mediaplatform (Youtube, Twitter).

Title: [SALAH] Awas Hati-hati Apa Yang Disemprotkan FPI Adalah Virus Corona
Narrative_Description: A hardline Islamic organization called FPI is accused to spray  coronavirus in public spaces
Motive_Description: Spread fear that FPI, a hardline Islamic organization, is spraying coronavirus in public spaces
Key_Words: FPI (Islamic Defender Front), spray, Coronavirus, beware
Summary: A photo of two people spraying disinfectant is said to be spraying coronavirus in public spaces. The facebook post claims that a hardline Islamic organization (FPI, Islamic Defender Front) is spraying coronavirus  and that people should be aware. FPI reports that the organization has been actively spraying mosques with disinfectant to stop the spread of the virus.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Is the Singapore Government easing Circuit Breaker measures in 5 phases?
Narrative_Description: The WhatsApp message described the inaccurate 5-phase reopening strategy that is implied to be used by the Singaporean government
Motive_Description: The message intended to inform, albeit inaccurately
Summary: A WhatsApp message circulated in Singapore detailing the exact way and phases, and associated timing of Singaporean government easing of lockdown related to the pandemic. The content of the message is false.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Are “most foreigners” fined $10,000 for their first offence of Circuit Breaker measures?
Narrative_Description: WhatsApp message about how expats are fine $10000 SGD for first time offence in relation to breaking the Circuit Breaker Measures. This is not true.
Motive_Description: Message to warning people about repercussions of not abiding by the CB meaures.
Summary: A WhatsApp message in the Korean community living in Singapore falsely stated that the first time CB measures breach will rake a fine of $10000 SGD

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Is this ‘Social Distancing Ambassador’ job opening legitimate?
Narrative_Description: WhatsApp message offering a job as Social Distancing Ambassador, officers employed to make sure the social distancing rules are adhered to, asked for interested applicants to send their personal details. Ministry of Defence, while admitted has offered such job opportunities, has said that they have not asked for personal details.
Motive_Description: Asking for personal details potentially to sell them
Key_Words: Social distancing ambassador, hiring, job opportunities, personal information, fake
Summary: WhatsApp message offering a job as Social Distancing Ambassador, officers employed to make sure the social distancing rules are adhered to, asked for interested applicants to send their personal details. Ministry of Defence, while admitted has offered such job opportunities, has said that they have not asked for personal details.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Was this Grabfood rider fined for wearing the wrong mask?
Narrative_Description: Claimed that certain type of mask are not allowed and will attract fine
Motive_Description: Warning people of the allegedly strict mask wearing rule
Summary: Facebook post claiming that only a certain type of mask are approved to be worn in Singapore, Others will attract fine. An image of an individual giving a statement to a policeman was falsely used to support the false claim.

Title: [COVIDWatch]: Are you only allowed to exercise with a maximum of one family member?
Narrative_Description: False claim that Singaporeans are only allowed to exercise outdoor with one Other family member
Motive_Description: Telling people not to go out for recreation with more than one family members
Key_Words: fine, exercise, family, household, maximum, number
Summary: A WhatsApp message falsely claim that you can only exercise with one Other member of your household outdoor during the circuit breaker measures in Singapore

Title: The BBC did not say that the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation is planning to put microchips in Covid-19 vaccines
Narrative_Description: The BBC published a travel piece saying that there will be microchips in the upcoming vaccines funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation so they can track who has been vaccinated for coronavirus
Motive_Description: Promote conspiracies about microchips being included in COVID-19 vaccines
Key_Words: BBC, Coronavirus, Bill Gates, microchip, vaccine, track
Summary: A Facebook post falsely claimed that the BBC ran a piece saying the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation funded a vaccine that includes a tracking microchip. The article didn't say this, but speculated on the future of travel

Title: Misleading claims on pre-existing conditions and Covid-19 deaths go viral
Narrative_Description: Make misleading claims about COVID-19 amongst people with and without pre-existing medical conditions

It also says that the same mandatory vaccine will happen to make people as the "sheeps". In reality, the photo is actually taken in 2019 from a techno parade in Switzerland

Title: Cek Fakta: Tidak Benar Jokowi Menyebut Tak Tahu Penyebab Kasus Covid-19 Tembus 111 ribu

Motive_Description: Undermining the president's ability to lead
Key_Words: Jokowi, confuse, reason, Indonesia, 111 thousand cases
Summary: A doctored video of Indonesia's president saying he "does not know why". The caption on the video saying that he does not know why the covid case in Indonesia reach 111-thousand and therefore he does not have a solution to handle the pandemic. The original video is from a cabinet meeting when he says he does not know why people becoming more anxious lately, not why the number of cases is so high

Title: Cek Fakta: Tidak Benar Klaim soal Tingkat Kesembuhan Covid-19 Capai 99,9 Persen

Summary: A facebook post claimed that Covid-19 recovery rate is 99.9% while vaccination has 80% adverse reaction rate therefore we should not risk taking the vaccine which already killed 5 people so far. Each claim is misleading.

Title: Cek Fakta: Tidak Benar RI Harus Sediakan Rp 30 T untuk Uji Klinis Vaksin Covid-19 dari China

Summary: A facebook post claimed that Indonesia has to pay IDR 30 trillion or USD 2 billion to China only to become a guinea pig for a vaccine trial. The 30 trillion is the government's budget for nationwide vaccination f0r covid-19.

Summary: A facebook post claimed that spanish flu did not kill 50 milion people. The vaccine did. Flu vaccine was found 22 years after the 1918 spanish flu.
