Narrative_Description: 57 individuals had passed away due to COVID-19 after more than 80,000 students appeared for a competitive exam.
Motive_Description: Indicate that mass gatherings should be prohibited
Key_Words: Coronavirus, COMEDK, Ashutosh Kumar, AISA, 57 deaths
Summary: The VP of a student political organization tweeted false news stories claiming that over 5000 students had contracted COVID-19 and 57 people had died after sitting for the COMEDK exam.

Title: Old video from Pakistan shared as UP student tests COVID positive after B.Ed exam
Narrative_Description: Student had contracted COVID-19 after appearing for B.Ed. exam
Motive_Description: Suggest that a student had gotten COVID-19 due to appearing for an exam
Summary: An old video from Pakistan was shared again as a video of a student, who had appeared for a B.Ed. exam, having trouble breathing in the hospital due to COVID-19.

Title: COVID-19 is not a bacterial infection, false claim viral on social media
Narrative_Description: COVID-19 is a bacterial infection and can be cured in a day
Motive_Description: Make people think that the virus is a bacteria and not serious
Summary: Fake messages and Tweets were circulated suggesting that COVID-19 was a bacterial infection that could be cured in a day and did not require hospitalization.

Title: "القرار يعود للسلطات التونسية".. إير فرانس تنفى استنئناف رحلات الشركة بين فرنسا وتونس
Narrative_Description: False claim that AirFrance will resume flights to Tunisia after June 2020
Motive_Description: False information
Summary: False claim that AirFrance in Tunisia has declared that flights to Tunisia will resume in June 2020. The company refuted these allegations and said that the decision is up to the Tunisian authority

Title: وزارة التربية المغربية تكشف حقيقة الأخبار المتداولة حول إجراء الامتحانات (تفاصيل)
Narrative_Description: False claim that the Moroccon Minister of Education has stated that exams will take place
Motive_Description: False information
Summary: False claim by a Moroccan webiste that exams will take place. The claim was refuted by the government

Title: حقيقة توجه فرق من الصحة السعودية للمنازل للكشف المفاجئ عن كورونا
Narrative_Description: Rumors that the government will randomly do sweeps and test people in their homes
Motive_Description: False information
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Saudi Arabia, testing, random, homes
Summary: Rumors circulating on social Mediathat the government will do random sweeps snd tested people in their homes

Title: Falso: El dióxido de cloro aún no está autorizado para combatir el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: The Bolivian government has approved the sale and use of chlorine dioxide
Motive_Description: Put out a catchy headline
Key_Words: Coronavirus, chlorine dioxide, approved, sale, use, Bolivia
Summary: Online news outlet RTP Bolivia published a note on its Facebook page claiming that the national authorities had approved the sale and use of chlorine dioxide, whereas the proposal was only passed in the Health Committee in the House of Representatives (Comisión de Salud de la Cámara de Diputados).

Title: No, esta imagen de la intro de Futurama en la que prohíbe viajar en el tiempo a 2020 no es real, es un montaje
Narrative_Description: Futurama scriptwriter had predicted the ongoing pandemic
Motive_Description: Spread conspiracies
Key_Words: Coronavirus, travel, ban, Futurama, 2020, Matt Groening
Summary: Doctored image taken from cartoon show Futurama in which the author Matt Groening put up the heading "ALL TIME TRAVEL TO THE YEAR 2020 IS STRICTLY PROHIBITED", thus predicting the ongoing pandemic.

Title: Китайские власти приказали кремировать тела скончавшихся от коронавируса пациентов в специально отведенных крематориях
Narrative_Description: Claims that those who die of coronavirus will be burned in the same area as where they died
Motive_Description: Claim of mandatory cremations by Chinese government
Source_Description: A site for Russian expats in China
Summary: Claims that those who die in China will be burned in the same area as which they died; bodies can't travel between administrative regions

Title: Коронавирус COVID-2019 убивает стариков, не трогает детей и делает мужчин бесплодными
Narrative_Description: Claims COVID doesn't touch children, mainly targets the elderly and can leave men infertile
Motive_Description: Offer hope
Key_Words: Coronarivus, SARS, research, elderly, children, fertility
Summary: Claims that COVID doesn't touch children, mainly targets elderly and can lead to kidney and testicular damage in men, causing infertility

Title: No, Pedro Sánchez no ha recomendado a los españoles invertir en Bitcoin Era para generar ingresos mientras dure la pandemia del coronavirus: es un timo
Narrative_Description: Spanish PM Pedro Sánchez recommended investing in Bitcoin during the pandemic
Motive_Description: Scam
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, PM, Pedro Sánchez, invest, bitcoin
Summary: An article (disguised as by CNN) suggested that Spanish PM recommended investing in Bitcoin during the pandemic.

Title: No, el Comité Científico no es el mismo que el Comité Técnico para la Desescalada que decidió el paso de fases: el Comité Científico se creó el 21 de marzo y se reunía semanalmente
Narrative_Description: The Spanish government lied about the existence of a scientific committee in response to the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Discredit the government (perhaps also confusion between two different committees played a role in the making of this piece of fake news)
Source_Description: Facebook page Asociación Forja Hispánica, Other pages
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, committee, scientific, deescalation, lie, deny
Summary: A fake claim circulated about the Spanish government having lied about the existence of a scientific committee in the middle of the health crisis. Although this narrative is for sure politically motivated, it originated from a tweet by PM Pedro Sánchez with which he announced the creation of a new, different technical committee in August. This is unrelated to the Other scientific committee, which had been operative since late March.

Title: Cuidado con este vídeo difundido como si estuvieran haciendo pasar un maniquí por un paciente con coronavirus: es una simulación realizada en un tren medicalizado en Atocha (Madrid)
Narrative_Description: Video is shot so to hide that the patient is in reality a puppet
Motive_Description: Spread a fake claim
Source_Description: Facebook account Jorge Q-anon Trump, YouTube channel (not available)
Summary: A first aid simulation done in madrid was reported on video (done with a mannequin), alongside claims that who shot the video tried to hide the fact that they were using a mannequin and pretend they were treating a coronavirus patient.

Title: هل هذه "الجثث المعلقة" على جدار مشفى وسط موسكو لضحايا فيروس كورونا؟
Narrative_Description: Video shows bodies hanging from a building are claimed to be coronavirus patients in a russian hospital
Motive_Description: Scare people about Emergency Responses in Other countries
Key_Words: Coronavirus, MENA, patients, hanging, hospital, Russian
Summary: Video shows bodies hanging from a building are claimed to be coronavirus patients in a russian hospital. The bodies are actually mannequins and were used as a prob for a clip.

Title: Tradujeron mal frase de Tedros sobre solución a la pandemia de COVID-19
Narrative_Description: The WHO said there is no solution to coronavirus and never there will be one
Motive_Description: Misunderstanding of Ghebreyesus's words
Source_Description: Online newspapers El Tiempo, El Periódico, La Nacion, El Universo, RPP Noticias, Listín Diario, Univisión, Infobae
Key_Words: Coronavirus, solution, silver bullet, WHO, Ghebreyesus
Summary: Many nespapers in Latin America spread the misleading claim that WHO President Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said there is no solution for coronavirus and there will never be one (while he really said there is no silver bullet).

Title: No, esta foto no es de 500 pateras en Argelia a punto de zarpar rumbo a España con personas infectadas de COVID-19: es Mauritania en 2019 y son barcos de pesca
Narrative_Description: Boats full of infected people are ready to depart from Algeria to Spain
Motive_Description: Discredit immigrants
Key_Words: Coronavirus, immigrants, Algeria, Frontex, infected, Spain, depart
Summary: A picture (actually showing Fishing boats in Mauritania) circulated in Spain alongside the claim that it showed boats in Algeriafull of infected immigrants and ready to depart towards Spain.

Title: No, esta foto no es de la manifestación de Berlín contra las medidas de Alemania para frenar el coronavirus: es del festival 'Love Parade' de Berlín de 2003
Narrative_Description: People in Berlin marched against the anti-covid measures
Motive_Description: Encourage people to take action against anti-covid measures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Berlin, Love Parade, march, protest, measures
Summary: A picture (actually showing the Love Parade in 2003 in Berlin) claimed to show people in Berlin marching as a sign of protest against the anti-covid measures taken by authorities.

Title: Cuidado con el vídeo que dice que la carpa del Hospital Arnau de Vilanova de Lleida es una "mentira": funciona como una sala de espera para pacientes con síntomas de COVID-19, no como un hospital de campaña
Narrative_Description: A tent installed outside an hospital is 'a lie' since it's empty
Motive_Description: Discredit health authorities
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, tent, camp, empty, Hospital Universitario Arnau de Vilanova, Lleida
Summary: A picture of a tent outside the Hospital Universitario Arnau de Vilanova in Lleida, Spain (actually used to host patients while they wait for their test results) was spread around claiming it was proof that such "camp hospital" was a lie since the picture shows the tent was empty.

Title: Ministro de Gobierno da una cifra falsa sobre fallecidos en El Alto
Narrative_Description: 170 people died of coronavirus in three days in the city of El Alto
Motive_Description: Mistake
Source_Description: Minister of Government ('Ministro de Gobierno') Arturo Murillo
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Arturo Murillo, Boivia, El Alto, 170, cases, three, days
Summary: Bolivia's Minister of Government Arturo Murillo misleadingly claimed that 170 people had died in three days in the city of El Alto.

Title: Las recaídas del COVID-19 no se dan por consumir azúcar, tomar agua fría o bañarse por la noche
Narrative_Description: Relapse of coronavirus can happen if one eats sugar, drinks cold water or bathes at night
Motive_Description: Spread fear about possible sources of relapse
Key_Words: Coronavirus, relapse, sugar, cold, water, bath, night
Summary: Misleading WhatsApp chain circulated in Bolivia claiming that a relapse of coronavirus could happen if one eats sugar, drinks cold water, or bathes at night.

Title: No, este vídeo no muestra a un supuesto fallecido por COVID-19 levantando el brazo en Bolivia: lo que se ve en las imágenes es un simulacro
Narrative_Description: Video shows health workers dealing with actors rather than true bodies of victims
Motive_Description: Share funny video
Summary: Video of health workers collecting dead bodies (although the video shows a simulation with a puppet) was shared claiming that an actor was used as the victim since the body raises its arm at one point.

Title: La Policía no puede allanar espacios privados en Medellín por incumplimiento de Ley Seca
Narrative_Description: The police in Medellin is authorized to enter people's houses to enforce the ban on alcohol consumption
Motive_Description: Instill fear of consequences
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, Daniel Quintero, Medellin, ley seca, enter, police, house, enforce
Summary: The mayor of Medellin Daniel Quintero claimed that the police would be authorized to enter people's houses to enforce the ley seca, banning to drink alcohol during the weekends,

Title: La imagen muestra un vehículo futurista, no una predicción de cómo sería el 2022
Narrative_Description: An Italian magazine had predicted the post-covid way of life in 1962
Motive_Description: Spread intriguing story about the ongoing pandemic having already been predicted
Source_Description: Facebook accounts Francisco Gago Nieto, ADN Cultura, Dionisio Pulido, Erik Camacho Garcia, MultiMediaUPB, Sergio Donna, Mahendra Thami, Magno Gonçalves, Twitter accounts @IreneWais, @martinezmau, @UberCitizen, Instagram profiles gbp_sales_container, vuelodenoche.marta
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italian, magazine, Domenica del Corriere, 2022, 1962, predict
Summary: An illustration from Italian Magazine "Domenica del Corriere" in 1962, which shows people moving on the street in glass capsules, was spread claiming that the magazine explicitly linked the drawing to how life would be in 2022, thus anticipating the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: No, la Policía de Berlín no ha tuiteado que asistieron 3,5 millones de personas a la manifestación contra las medidas de Alemania para combatir el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Berlin's police tweeted that 3.5 million people participated in an anti-mask demonstration
Motive_Description: Push negationist theories
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Berlin, police, tweet, 3.5 million, demonstration
Summary: A fake screenshot of a tweet by Berlin's police containing the false claim that 3.5 million people took part in am anti-mask demonstration which really mobilized only about 17.000 people.

Title: ПАПА РИМСКИЙ ЗАРАЗИЛСЯ КОРОНАВИРУСОМ
Narrative_Description: Pope is infected with COVID
Motive_Description: Spread fear about COVID in Italy
Summary: Suggests that the Pope has COVID because he cancelled meetings for a 4th day in a row

Title: "Обезличить, обвалить рынок": в Армении выдвинули свою версию появления коронавируса
Narrative_Description: COVID is a strategy of hybird warfare to manipulate the world economy through fear
Motive_Description: Says that fear is a greater threat than the actual virus
Summary: Suggests that COVID is an example of hybrid warfare, and that fear is a greater threat than the virus itself

Title: Коронавирус может стать предлогом для провокаций к России в суде по MH17
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Netherlands will not allow Russians to participate in the MH17 trial because of coronavirus fears
Motive_Description: Question the impartiality of the Dutch courts
Key_Words: Coronavirus, MH17, Netherlands, Russia, Justice System
Summary: Claims that the Netherlands will use COVID as an excuse to not admit Russian evidence and allow Russian participation in the MH17 trial

Title: #NoComaCuento: Ni OIJ ni Fuerza Pública reportan casos de ladrones disfrazados de médicos o enfermeros
Narrative_Description: Members of the Red Cross are exploting the pandemic to assault people at home
Motive_Description: Push fake story about members of the Red cross to target that institution and spread distrust toward it
Summary: A fake story was pushed saying that doctors and nurses of the Red Cross are exploiting the pandemic to get into houses and assault people. This was done to spread distrust toward that institution

Title: País Vasco anunció el 12 de marzo la suspensión de clases, pero días antes se viralizó una captura falsa de El Correo cuando sólo se habían suspendido en Vitoria y Labastida*
Narrative_Description: Tweet saying that on March 12, schools will be closed across the whoile Basque country territory
Motive_Description: Push fake news probably by mistake
Summary: A fake news saying that schools are going to be closed since March 12 across the whole Basque country territory. This was a mistake since at that time, the measure had already been taken only for few schools.

Title: Вспышка коронавируса — все это вранье!
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus could easily have been fabricated
Motive_Description: Claim that coronavirus specifically isn't a threat
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Moldova, Misleading data, defective diagnostic tests
Summary: Claims that figures can be misleading and COVID attributed deaths could be from Other diseases

Title: Kicillof: “En este momento [hay] cuarentena estricta en Barcelona”
Narrative_Description: Barcelona was in a strict lockdown at the end of July
Motive_Description: Mistake
Source_Description: Governor of the Province of Buenos Aires Axel Kicillof
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Buenos Aires, Axel Kicillof, lockdown, strict, Barcelona
Summary: Axel Kicillof, governor of the Province of Buenos Aires, claimed on July 31st that, among Other cities in the world, Barcelona was subject to a strict lockdown (whereas the state of emergency had already been lifted by the Generalitat de Catalunya)

Title: #Verificamos: La OMS no dio marcha atrás y pasó a defender la “vuelta a la economía”
Narrative_Description: The WHO retreated on its previous statements and recommended reopening the economy
Motive_Description: Push anti-lockdown narrative
Key_Words: Coronavirus, WHO, retreat, recomment, open, economy, work
Summary: A fake claim circulated in Brazil about the WHO having retreated on their previous recommendations and suggesing that the economy should reopen and people get back to work.

Title: #Verificamos: La foto de “voluntario de vacuna china” que habría sufrido efectos colaterales es de 2017
Narrative_Description: Photo of Chinese nurse who experienced side effects from the coronavirus vaccine being tried on him
Motive_Description: Spread fear of possible side effects of vaccines in the course of being tested
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Coronavac, Chinese, nurse, side effects, Andrew Seely
Summary: A picture of a student who had been the victim of a prank in 2017 was shared in Brazil with the claim that it was a Chinese nurse who had experienced side effects from the coronavirus vaccine that had been tested on him.

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que CoronaVac se produzca a partir de “células de bebés abortados”
Narrative_Description: Chinese vaccine is being developed using cells from aborted fetuses
Motive_Description: Discredit China
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, CoronaVac, China, cells, fetuses, aborted
Summary: Fake claim circulated in Brazil claiming that Chinese company Sinovac is producing its coronavirus vaccine (CoronaVac) using cells from aborted fetuses.

Title: Después de tomar ivermectina hay ciertas restricciones, pero no como advierten en las redes
Narrative_Description: After taking ivermectin, there are a few restrictions
Motive_Description: Spread fake claim, help
Key_Words: Coronavirus, ivermectin, restrictions, meat, fish, beverages
Summary: Fake claim circulated on WhatsApp about some restrictions, suhc as meat, fish, and beverages, after taking ivermectin (the latter being a treatment for coronavirus still under study).

Title: O material jornalístico produzido pelo Estadão é protegido por lei. As regras têm como objetivo proteger o investimento feito pelo Estadão na qualidade constante de seu jornalismo. Para compartilhar este conteúdo, utilize o link: https://politica.estadao.com.br/blogs/estadao-verifica/vacina-cubana-contra-coronavirus-e-ficcao/#Versao_em_espanhol
Narrative_Description: Story saying that the Cuban government already has a vaccine to be delivered to people
Motive_Description: Spread the news the Cuban government has already a vaccine to generate False Hope among people
Summary: A fake claim circulated on social Mediasaying that the Cuban government already has a vaccine ready to be delivered. Yet, the Cuban government has partnered with China to deliver the drug interferon alfa 2B to treat patients, but it does not have a vaccine yet.

Title: Detector: No, Min.Salud no ha enviado ningún correo informando sobre el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A photo showing an email sent by the Ministry of Health informing citizens about the presence of the virus
Motive_Description: Spread fake photo to target the Colombian Ministry of Health
Key_Words: Coronavirus, email, Ministry of Health, informing
Summary: A fake photo showing an email sent by the Ministry of Health of Colombia to citizens and informing them of the presence of the virus. However, it was not true.

Title: Falso que personal de Salud realice pruebas de Covid-19 a domicilio
Narrative_Description: A story saying that the health workers are doing tests at people's houses and not in hospitals
Motive_Description: Spread fake news to undermine the credibility of the Health Department in Mexico
Summary: A fake chain of messages on WhatsApp claimed that in Mexico health workers are doing testing at people's houses and they are saying people shoudn't go to the hospital.

Title: zهذه الفيديوهات زائفة إذ لم تقدم الأمم المتحدة 1000 دولار كدعم مادي بسبب جائحة كورونا
Narrative_Description: The United Nations is offering $1000 for people to support with pandemic
Motive_Description: Attempt to spread a link to help people get money
Summary: Facebook post encouraging people to click on link to get $1000  from the United Nations.

Title: استعمال الكمامات بالطريقة الصحيحة، وشبكات الجيل الخامس لن يُسببا موجة ثانية لكورونا
Narrative_Description: Claim that 5G signals and weairing masks in a wrong way can lower iimmunity
Motive_Description: To advise people to wear masks properly
Summary: A translated video on Facebook is claiming that 5G signals lowers immunity and that wearing masks is risky for health

Title: Remdesivir ليس لقاحا تجريبيا ضد كورونا بل هو دواء مضاد للفيروسات يُسوّق فعليا في البلدان المتقدمة
Narrative_Description: Claim that Remedesivir is a vaccine and is being tested in developeing countries only and not in West
Motive_Description: To warn people about the vaccine being unsafe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, MENA, Remedesivir, vaccine, developing countries
Summary: Post on facebook with a picture of remedesivir drug and it says not in distrubtion in the US or Canada claims that the vaccine is tested on people from developing countries first.

Title: ¿Evo con coronavirus?
Narrative_Description: A story saying that Evo Morales, the former president of Bolivia, got the virus
Motive_Description: Spread fake news to spark fear about the spread of the pandemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, positive, Evo Morales, El Deber
Summary: A fake account of the newspaper El Deber tweeted that Evo Morales, the former president of Bolvia, tested positive to the virus. However, it was not true.

Title: En China no dieron por finalizada la epidemia del coronavirus; se han acumulado más de 80.000 casos
Narrative_Description: A story saying Chinese people are celebrating the end of the pandemic
Motive_Description: Spread fake news to generate False Hope that the pandemic is over
Summary: A fake story was spread saying that Chinese people are celebrating the end of the pandemic. However, in China there were already 80,000 cases and the pandemic was not over.

Title: Es falso que un buen aseo bucal destruya el coronavirus o evite su contagio
Narrative_Description: Mouthwash and oral hygiene in general help prevent infection
Motive_Description: Help people
Source_Description: Peruan doctor Stalin Vílchez Rivera (on online news outlet El Correo), Facebook account Aníbal Cruz Llacsahuanga
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Stalin Vílchez Rivera, mouthwash, oral hygiene, Peru, doctor
Summary: Peruan doctor Stalin Vílchez Rivera falsely claimed that mouthwash and oral hygiene in general can prevent coronavirus infections.

Title: No, no hay un plan diseñado para el COVID-19 desde 2017 en documentos del Banco Mundial
Narrative_Description: World Bank website proves that Covid-19 is not new
Motive_Description: Conspire
Key_Words: Coronavirus, World Bank, WITIS, products, before
Summary: The World Bank changed the categorization of some products (that have been sold for years) on one of its databases to make them relevant in coronavirus-related searches. This was misleadingly used as proof that coronavirus had existed even before 2019 since coronavirus-related products have been traded for so long.

Title: No, esta foto de Pedro Sánchez supuestamente sonriendo durante sus vacaciones en Lanzarote no es actual: fue tomada en 2018
Narrative_Description: Spanish PM Pedro Sánchez is seen smiling and on vacation during the pandemic
Motive_Description: Discredit Pedro Sánchez
Summary: A picture of smiling Spanish PM Pedro Sánchez (actually taken in 2018) circulated alongside allegations that it showed him on vacation while the country was suffering from the pandemic.

Title: No, este vídeo no es de una manifestación contra el confinamiento en Aranda de Duero (Burgos): fue grabado en Barcelona
Narrative_Description: Anti-covid-restriction protest in Aranda de Duero
Motive_Description: Push anti-lockdown narrative
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Aranda de Duero, Spain, Barcelona, protest, lockdown
Summary: A video of anti-lockdown protests shot in Barcelona was spread on social Mediawith the claim it showed protests in Aranda de Duero.

Title: Coronavirus : a-t-on déjà atteint une immunité de groupe, comme l'affirme un message partagé sur Facebook ?
Narrative_Description: Claim that the French population has reached herd immunity, so COVID-19 should not be a problem any more
Motive_Description: Accuse the Mediaof exaggerating the emergency while claiming that the coronavirus emergency is over
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, herd immunity, test, positive
Summary: A Facebook post went viral, claiming that the high number of people without symptoms testing positive for COVID-19 means that the population has reached a group immunity, and the virus should not be a problem anymore

Title: Désintox. La gratuité des masques à l'école est pratiquée dans d'autres pays et même en France
Narrative_Description: Claim that no country in the world has freely distributed masks to schools, for students to use during classes, due to the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Support the government's decision not to distribute masks to schools, for students to use for free
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Minister, Education, Jean-Michel Blanquer, France, schools, masks, reopening, students
Summary: To defend the government's decision not to distribute masks to schools, to be given to students for their reopening, the French Minister of Education Jean-Michel Blanquer claimed that no country in the world had taken a different decision, even though Greece, Italy and Switzerland have announced free distribution of masks to students.

Title: Désintox. Il n'est pas prouvé que la France vive une seconde vague de Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that France is facing a second wave of the COVID-19 epidemic, comparable to the first wave in March/April
Motive_Description: Spread fear that France will live again the situation it had to face in March and April
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, second wave, emergency, statistics, rate
Summary: Some statistics on the number of daily cases of COVID-19 at the end of August/beginning of September were interpreted on social Mediaas a sign that France is facing a second wave of the epidemic, even though the numbers cannot be compared in a simple way, as everything has changed: from the number and frequency of tests performed, to the capability of the healthcare system

Title: Désintox. Non, la Covid-19 n'a pas fait baisser les loyers parisiens
Narrative_Description: Claim that the rentals in Paris are decreasing, as less people are interested and the market is stagnating because of the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Have people believe that the price of a rental in Paris has decreased because of the emergency
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Paris, rental, price, apartment, emergency, decrease
Summary: Some French newspapers claimed that rentals in Paris have been decreasing, as less people are interested and the market is stagnating because of the coronavirus emergency. The conclusion, however, is not so simple and is not backed by any study. The only estimate on the average rent in Paris found that they remained unchanged with respect to last year (0% increase).

Title: Coronavirus : est-il vrai qu'il n'y a "pas de contrôle sérieux" et "pas d'exigence de tests" aux frontières françaises, comme l'affirme Marine Le Pen ?
Narrative_Description: Claim that France is not checking adequately people entering the country from abroad to make sure they are not carrying the new coronavirus, while Other European countries are
Motive_Description: Criticize the government by claiming it is not doing enough to control foreigners entering the country and make sure they do not carry the new coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, border, checks, test, list, countries, Marine Le Pen, Europe
Summary: During an interview, the President of French right-wing party Rassemblement National, Marine Le Pen, claimed that France does not make serious checks of people entering the country, and that this is why the numbers of the epidemic are increasing, even though France has a list of countries for which a test is required before crossing the border. Also, Le Pen does not show any evidence in support of the claim that it is foreigners that are bringing the virus to France.

Title: "L'épidémie de Covid-19 est une épidémie ordinaire" : pourquoi les chiffres donnent tort au message d'un médecin placardé dans son cabinet
Narrative_Description: Claim that the COVID-19 epidemic is "ordinary" and that mortality rates for March or April are not any higher than the same rates in previous years in France
Motive_Description: Claim that the way the epidemic is described is exaggerated, as it is just an ordinary disease that will fade away with time
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, doctor, hospital, poster, epidemic, mortality rates, hoax
Summary: A doctor in France nailed to his door a poster inviting people to "keep calm" as the COVID-19 epidemic is "ordinary" and mortality rates for March or April are not any higher than the same rates in previous years in France. A picture of the poster then went viral on Facebook, even though its content was fake news: mortality rates in March 2020 exceeded those of March 2018 and 2019 significantly, because of the epidemic

Title: Rentrée scolaire : non, les écoles ne testeront ni ne vaccineront vos enfants contre le coronavirus sans votre accord
Narrative_Description: Invitation for parents of children starting school to sign a document preventing schools from testing or providing vaccines to children without their authorization
Motive_Description: Spark the fear that schools might test, vaccine children or even bring them to the hospital, unless their parents sign a document explicitly preventing them from doing so
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, schools, test, children, parents, vaccine
Summary: A Facebook post, with a document attached, went viral in France: it invited parents to sign the document in order to prevent schools from testing and providing vaccines to their children, even though schools are already not legally allowed, nor do they have the intention or have received communication, to do so.

Title: Tour de France 2020 : des personnalités ont-elles omis de porter leur masque à Nice ?
Narrative_Description: Picture showing some French institutional figures attending the ceremony for the beginning of the Tour de France, without wearing masks
Motive_Description: Criticize French institutional figures for not respecting the emergency measures they have enacted themselves
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Tour de France, Nice, Jean-Michel Blanquer, institutional, figures, masks, wear
Summary: A picture, showing some French institutional figures, including the Minister of Education Jean-Michel Blanquer, attending the beginning of the Tour de France in Nice without wearing a mask, was taken out of context and became viral. It had been taken while the Minister and the Others were drinking, and had taken off the masks, while Other pictures show that they kept their masks on throughout the rest of the day.

Title: Désintox. Non, le gouvernement n'a pas oublié de compter des morts du Covid
Narrative_Description: Claim that the government has miscounted the deaths resulting from COVID-19, underestimating the actual toll of the epidemic
Motive_Description: Suggest the government has not performed well in terms of handling the epidemic, has it has miscounted the number of deaths caused by COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, emergency, death, mortality, count, government
Summary: The idea spread in France that the governmen had underestimated the number of deaths caused by COVID-19 (either by not counting those who died in their homes or those who died in nursing homes) even though there is no evidence in support of the claim and the count of deaths from COVID-19 in France is actually higher than the number of deaths "in excess" with respect to mortality rates of the previous years (differently from neighboring countries).

Title: Coronavirus : les tests PCR dangereux pour le cerveau ?

Motive_Description: Stoke fear by suggesting that the test for COVID-19 could be more dangerous than the virus itself
Key_Words: Coronavirus, PCR test, brain damage, swab, long, Canada, France
Summary: A YouTube video released by a Canadian user went viral, claiming that PCR tests used to detect coronavirus risk, because of their length, to pierce the membrane covering the brain and lead to everything from brain damage to cancer, autism and schizophrenia

Narrative_Description: Claim that 26 police officers have been infected with the new coronavirus by migrants arriving in the South Italy
Motive_Description: Spread fear and spark public outrage towards migrants, supposedly bringing the virus to Italy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South of Italy, police, officers, migrants, infected
Summary: Two news websites released the news that 26 police officers had been infected with the new coronavirus by migrants arriving illlegaly to the South Italy. However, the police officers had only been quarantined due to contact with an infected migrant, and had all tested negative afterwards.

Title: Coronavirus, un vaccino OGM per modificarci geneticamente? Le stranissime teorie di Cunial e Byoblu
Narrative_Description: Claim that through the new coronavirus vaccine, Bill Gates wants to "reprogram" the human immune system (for unclear purposes)
Motive_Description: Attack Bill Gates, spread mistrust for the new vaccine and support the anti-vax movement
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Sara Cunial, Parliament, interrogation, vaccine, Bill Gates, reprogram, immune system
Summary: MP Sara Cunial, during a speech in Parliament that was then shared and commented by anti-vax movements, accused Bill Gates of wanting to use the vaccine against coronavirus (which is still being experimented on) to "reprogram" the human immune system, for some obscure purposes

Title: Coronavirus. Bill Gates prevede e accetta 700 mila morti a causa del vaccino? Falso!
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that Bill Gates is predicting 700000 deaths due to the new coronavirus vaccine in the future, during an interview with CNBC
Motive_Description: Attack Bill Gates, spread mistrust for the new vaccine and support the anti-vax movement
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Bill Gates, CNBC, vaccine, deaths, 700000, predict, side effects
Summary: The conspiratory news website "Databaseitalia" translated, wrongly, in Italian, an interview of Bill Gates with CNBC Television, claiming he had predicted that about 700000 people would die because of the new coronavirus vaccine, after its distribution on a global scale, even though he never said anything like that

Title: Coronavirus creato in laboratorio? Le «incredibili» rivelazioni di un urologo a «Fatti e Misfatti»
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that the new coronavirus was artificially created in a laboratory in China
Motive_Description: Spark fear by claiming there exists some kinf of conspiracy for which the virus was created in a laboratory
Source_Description: Giuseppe Tritto (urologist and President of the World Academy of Biomedical Technologies)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Giuseppe Tritto, Television, Italy, laboratory, China, artificial, design
Summary: Giuseppe Tritto, a supporter of conspiracy theories on coronavirus, claimed on TV during a popular Italian news program that the new coronavirus had been artificially designed in a lab as, according to him, its structure could not have occurred through a natural process

Title: Nuance sur les propos de l’OMS : 80% d’Africains contractent le Coronavirus sans symptômes
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: Claim that the new coronavirus is not as strong against the African population (as 80% of Africans does not fall ill) and that WHO has confirmed it
Motive_Description: Spark pride by claiming that the African population is somehow "stronger" than the rest of the world and cannot be infected with COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Congo, sick, symptoms, WHO, infect, Africa, African population
Summary: The news was shared on a popular Facebook page in the DRC that WHO had recognized that 80% of the African population could not fall ill because of the new coronavirus. WHO, however, had just warned African governments, claiming that due to several factors their countries had a higher share of people still ill, but not showing symptoms, and thus potential carriers of the virus

Title: Non, les hôpitaux ne reçoivent pas une « prime » de 5 000 euros lorsqu’ils déclarent un décès dû au Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that the French government is giving 5000 euros to hospitals for each person that dies of COVID-19, and therefore hospitals re falsely declaring a higher number of deaths rather than the true one
Motive_Description: Criticize the government and hospitals and suggest that their statistics on the number of cases of COVID-19 are manipulated
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, government, hospitals, bonus, 5000 euros, death
Summary: The news spread on Facebook and Twitter in France that the French Government was giving 5000 euros to hospitals per death related to COVID-19, and that as a result hospitals were falsifying their figures, even though such a bonus does not exist and there is no evidence hospitals are falsifying anything. The fake news had appeared also in Belgium in August.

Title: Cette photo de députés sans masques n’a pas été prise en 2020
Narrative_Description: Picture of French MPs standing in the French Parliament's restaurant, talking, without wearing masks
Motive_Description: Criticize MPs by suggesting they do not respect those same rules they implemented themselves
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, MPs, Parliament, restaurant, stand, masks, rules
Summary: A picture of French MPs standing in the Parliament's restaurant, talking, dating back to 2010, was taken out of context to claim that it had been taken in 2020, and that MPs were not respecting the rules they had implemented themselves for the country, as they are seen not wearing a mask

Title: Non, il n’est pas prouvé que le vaccin contre la grippe augmenterait le risque d’attraper le Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that taking the normal influenca vaccine might raise the risk of being infected with the new coronavirus of 36%
Motive_Description: Support the anti-vax movement and spread mistrust towards the influenza vaccine
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, influenza, risk, 36%, study, France, US
Summary: The news spread on Facebook in France that a study had established how the vaccine against influenza might raise the risk of being infected with the new coronavirus by 36%, even though the author of the study himself has explained this is not the case. The narrative had already appeared April 2020 in the US.

Title: Ce gel hydroalcoolique à l’emballage dangereux n’est pas commercialisé en France
Narrative_Description: Picture of a hand sanitizer in a container that highly resembles those of beverages for children, accompanied by the warning that people should not buy the sanitizer as children might get confused and drink it
Motive_Description: Scare parents and buyers by suggesting that a hand sanitizer that might be confused by children as a beverage is being sold in France
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, hand sanitizer, container, supermarkets, sell, beverage, children, danger
Summary: The picture of a hand sanitizer in a container that highly resembles those of beverages for children was shared in France on Facebook, accompanied by the warning that people should not buy the sanitizer as children might get confused and drink it, and outrage that it was sold in French supermarkets. However, the product was never sold in France.

Title: « Le masque ne sert à rien » : la députée Martine Wonner contredite par les sources mêmes qu’elle avait citées à l’Assemblée
Narrative_Description: Claim that the new coronavirus is not transmitted through air, therefore masks are of no use in the fight against it, and that the American CDC has confirmed this
Motive_Description: Criticize governmental measures to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus by claiming that masks are useless and that the virus does not spread through air
Source_Description: MP Martine Wonner, former member of LRM
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, air, masks, American CDC, useless, hands
Summary: MP Martine Wonner, former member of LRM, claimed during a speech in Parliament that the American CDC has confirmed that the new coronavirus is not transmitted through air, but through people's hands, and that therefore masks are of no use in the fight against it. The CDC, however has never made such a claim, and the scientific community agrees that masks are essential.

Title: Non, l’inventeur du test PCR n’a pas dit que sa méthode était inefficace pour détecter les virus
Narrative_Description: Claim that swab tests are completely ineffective at trying to detect the presence of the virus, and that even the inventor of the tests has admitted to it
Motive_Description: Claim that the whole pandemic is a fraud, and swab tests are fake
Key_Words: Coronavirus, swab tests, ineffective, fake, hoax, fraud, epidemic, France, Kary Mullis
Summary: The news was shared on Facebook that even Kary Mullis, the inventor of swab tests who received the Nobel Prize for Chemistry, had admitted to the ineffectiveness of swab tests to detect the new coronavirus, even though Dr. Mullis died before the epidemic, in 2019, and never made such a statement anyway. The Facebook post also suggested that the entire COVID-19 epidemic is a hoax

Title: Ni el matarratón contiene ivermectina, ni la ivermectina se recomienda para prevenir el COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Leaves of Gliricidia sepium (tree) contain ivermectin, which supposedly prevents infection
Motive_Description: Spread news about a natural preventative measure
Key_Words: Coronavirus, prevent, Gliricidia sepium, matarratón, leaves, tree, Montería, Colombia
Summary: WhatsApp audio circulated in Colombia claiming that the leaves of Gliricidia sepium (a tree) contain ivermectin, which allegedly prevents infection from coronavirus.

Title: María Fernanda Cabal no trinó que 'vacuna rusa contiene nanobots'
Narrative_Description: Colombian senator María Fernanda Cabal tweeted that the Russian vaccine contains nanobots designed by China to make people communist
Motive_Description: Discredit the senator
Key_Words: Coronavirus, María Fernanda Cabal, Colombia, senator, Russian, vaccine, China, nanobots, communist
Summary: Doctored screenshot circulated in Colombia aiming to show that senator María Fernanda Cabal had tweeted that the Russian vaccine contains nanobots designed by China to make the people who take the shot communist.

Title: No, el video de una guardia colapsada no es de un hospital de José C. Paz sino de Guatemala
Narrative_Description: Video of hospital guard collapsed on the ground in a Hospital in the city of José C. Paz
Motive_Description: Spread fear of consequences of the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, José C. Paz, Argentina, hospital, guard, collapsed, Guatemala
Summary: Video (actually from Guatemala) of a hospital guard collapsed on the ground circulated in Argentina with the claim it was shot in the city of José C. Paz.

Title: Закат Европы: почему в эпоху пандемии ценности псевдодемократии оказались запрятаны в сейф
Narrative_Description: Poland refuses to give air corridors to Russia for bringing ventilators to Italy
Motive_Description: Undermine Poland and the EU
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Russophobia, Poland, Air Corridors, Italy
Summary: COVID is revealing the failures of the EU, Poland refused to allow Russian planes through their airspace to bring supplies to Italy

Title: Это биологическое оружие США разрабатывали в лабораториях на территории Армении
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus came from American labs in Armenia
Motive_Description: Undermine Armenia and U.S.
Summary: Claim that the U.S. is using Armenia as a springboard for attacking Iran by means of coronavirus

Title: Андрей Коршунов: За вымирание человечества
Narrative_Description: Claims that the Belarussian opposition will spread COVID to kill the Belarussian people
Motive_Description: Undermine Belarusian Opposition
Summary: Claims that the Belarussian opposition receieved COVID via George Soros to kill Belarussians as genocidal population-control

Title: Правда: Коронавирус не существует
Narrative_Description: Coronavirus doesn't exist
Motive_Description: To show that Belarus doesn't believe in the viurs
Summary: Video of President Lukashenko in hockey gear saying to a journalist, "Coronavirus doesn't exist, because I can't see it" (paraphrased)

Title: Врачи больницы в Мариуполе массово уволились из-за военнослужащих ВСУ с подозрением на COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claims that doctors resigned en-masse in Mariupol, Ukraine because they didn't want to treat infected soliders
Motive_Description: Undermine Ukrainian Medical system
Summary: Claims that doctors in the Ukrainian-controlled city of Mariopol resigned because they didn't want to treat infected soliders.

Title: لم تعلن تونس عن سنة دراسية "بيضاء" بسبب كورونا
Narrative_Description: Claim that Tusnisia will cancel the school year because of coronavirus
Motive_Description: False information
Summary: Facebook posts claim that Tunisia will cancel the academic year because of coronavirus

Title: فيديو قديم لوفد من وزارة الصحة السعودية قبل كورونا
Narrative_Description: Video claims that saudi officials are visiting hospitals without having masks on
Motive_Description: Critisize government officials for not following protocols
Summary: Old video is shared with false claim that Saudi officials are visiting hospitals without masks

Title: محافظة الجيزة تنفى غلق مدرسة مصر الدولية بسبب كورونا
Narrative_Description: Claim that Egypt International school in Giza was closed because of coronavirus cases in the school
Motive_Description: Claim that schools are being closed because of coronavirus
Summary: A false claim that Egypt international school was closed after fidning cases of coronavirus among the students was spread on social media. The government refuted the rumors.

Title: هذا الفيديو مصوّر عام 2018 ولا علاقة له بعودة العمرة بعد الإغلاق بسبب تفشّي كوفيد-19
Narrative_Description: Old video shows people celebrating is claimed to be of Meccans celebrating openning of Umrah after coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread hope that Umrah is now open again and people are celebrating
Summary: A video of people celebrating is claimed to be of Meccans celebrating the opening of Umrah. The video is originally from 2018

Title: هذه الفيديو لصلاة آلاف اليهود في القدس ملتقط قبل ظهور كوفيد-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that jews are praying in congregation in Jerusalem while mosques are closed
Motive_Description: To criticise the government for closing mosques
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Saudi Arabia, Jerusalem, jews, prayer
Summary: A video from 2018 is shared on Twitter and is claimed to be of jewish congregations in Jerusalem during the pandemic

Title: هذه الصورة ملتقطة منذ أشهر ولا علاقة لها بإصابة نائب لبناني بكورونا المستجدّ
Narrative_Description: Claim that people are distributing sweets celebrating the news of a politician getting coronavirus
Motive_Description: To express discontent with the politician
Summary: Posts claiming that people are distributing sweets in the street to celebrate the news of a politician getting coronavirus, but the photos are old

Title: هذه الصورة ملتقطة عام 2018 وليست لسيّدة مصابة بفيروس كورونا المستجدّ
Narrative_Description: A photo shows a woman who allegedly has coronavirus going to vote for the parliment
Motive_Description: False information
Summary: A photo shows a woman who is allegedly going to vote in the parlimentary elections. The photo is from 2018

Title: هذا الفيديو ملتقط في تركيا قبل أشهر من ظهور فيروس كورونا المستجدّ
Narrative_Description: A video is  showing a parade of ambulances to allegedly reassure the people that the government is ready to battle coronavirus
Motive_Description: To glorify the government
Summary: A video showing Turkish ambulances parade to reassure people that the government is able to counter the virus is from 2018

Title: WhatsApp message is old, no recent Covid-19 outbreaks in south city, Imtiaz, Chase up
Narrative_Description: A whatsapp message claiming that some areas are closed due to corona outbreaks
Motive_Description: To create fear of new outbreaks
Summary: Widely circulating messages claiming that South city Hospital, Imtiaz and Chase Up have been shut down due to coronavirus outbreak

Title: Old Video of lockdown violation in Pakistan shared as from Uttar Pradesh
Narrative_Description: Video of people being punished in Uttar Pradesh India
Motive_Description: Showing police punishing people for violation of social distancing
Key_Words: Coronavirus, police, punishment, social distancing, violation, India, Pakistan
Summary: Video of men being made to sit in chicken like position as a punishment in Uttar Pradesh. The video is from Pakistan

Title: Pakistan Government's Covid tracker does not show the entire J&K region as part of India
Narrative_Description: Claiming that Pakistan's Covid-19 tracker shows J&K as part of India
Motive_Description: Tensions between India and Pakistan over the issue of Kashmir - post claiming false claim that Pakistan's Covid-19 tracker shows J&K as part of India
Summary: Posts claiming that Pakistan has given up on Kashmir issue and the Pakistani Covid019 tracker includes entire J&K as part of India

Title: Коронавирус пожирает США, Россия шлёт помощь самолётом
Narrative_Description: Discusses Russian aid shipment to U.S. and aid to Italy
Motive_Description: Undermine European Union
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Humanitarian Aid, US, Italy, European Union
Summary: Discusses Russian aid to the U.S. and Italy; says that the E.U. has refused to help Italy, so Russia stepped up the task

Title: Misleading claims circulate in Indonesia that no one had died from Covid-19 alone
Narrative_Description: Claims that no one dies of coronavirus alone
Motive_Description: Gives False Hope that those without pre-existing conditions will not die due to corona
Summary: Video claiming that no one dies of coronavirus alone

Title: Video of Indian Health Minister slapping non-mask wearers? It is a Pakistani TV programme
Narrative_Description: Claims that Indian health minister is beating people who are not wearing masks
Motive_Description: Showing health minister is being active in making people wear masks
Summary: Claims that the video is showing Indian health minister is slapping people not wearing masks. The video from a Pakistani TV programme.

Title: Уралов: Беларусь "отжимают" от международной помощи на борьбу с COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claims that Lithuania is preventing Belarus from getting aid
Motive_Description: Undermine Lithuania, E.U., I.M.F and Other "Western" institutions
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Belarus, Lithuania, Aid, E.U., IMF
Summary: Claims that Lithuania wants to much of allocated aid from international organizations

Title: Коронавирус проверяет на прочность систему взаимоотношений между европейскими странами
Narrative_Description: E.U. refuses to help Italy
Motive_Description: Undermine the E.U.
Summary: The E.U. is refusing to help Italy sufficiently

Title: Коронавирус – отравленная корона человечества
Narrative_Description: Claims that fear and panic is the bigger issue than the virus itself
Motive_Description: Downplay severity and justify Belarus's inaction
Source_Description: Vladislav Volohovich, Social Media/News Forum site
Summary: Claims that the fear about COVID is a much bigger issue than COVID itself and that the WHO is trying to spark hysteria

Title: Удар в спину Прибалтике: США призывают НАТО объединиться с Россией
Narrative_Description: Claims that NATO is failing and cooperation between NATO and Russia is at the expense of the Baltic states
Motive_Description: Undermine NATO and critique Russophobia
Summary: Claims that NATO is incapable of fighting COVID without Russian help and that becasue of this cooperation, NATO is showing its true colors about how it values the Baltic countries of Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia only for their value in fighting the "Russian threat"

Title: СМИ нагнетают в Соединённых Штатах атмосферу страха и неуверенности
Narrative_Description: The U.S. is gripped with panic and uncertainty and the author presents various scenarious about possible scenarios of American collapse
Motive_Description: Undermine the U.S.
Source_Description: Professor Valentin Katasonov, "Fund for Strategic Culture"
Summary: Presents various scenarios of how the U.S. could fail due to the cataylst of coronavirus

Title: Пандемия выявила приоритеты, или Как флаги Евросоюза перекочевывают в итальянские чуланы
Narrative_Description: Questions the reputation and future of the European Union in light of 15,000 Italian deaths
Motive_Description: Undermine European Union
Summary: Questions the future of the European Union and European solidarity in light of deaths in Italy, Spain and France

Title: Detector: No, la OMS no felicitó a Duque por el manejo de la pandemia
Narrative_Description: The WHO congratulated Colombian president Iván Duque for his excelent management of the health crisis
Motive_Description: Boost support for the President
Key_Words: Coronavirus, WHO, president, Colombia, Entérate Cali, Iván Duque, congratulate, management
Summary: Colombian online news website Entérate Cali wrote an article claiming that the WHO had congratulated Colombian president Iván Duque for his excelent management of the health crisis.

Title: No, las fotos virales de médicos compungidos y llorando por los casos de coronavirus no son de la Argentina, sino de España, Italia, Estados Unidos e Irán
Narrative_Description: Pictures of supposedly Argentinian doctors crying for the hard situation
Motive_Description: Spread fear for the health emergency
Summary: Pictures of doctors crying for the coronavirus emergency (actually coming from Other countries) were shared claiming they showed doctors in Argentina.

Title: Les quatre erreurs majeures d’une vidéo qui minimise la pandémie de Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Video with claims on the mortality of the new coronavirus, describing it as weak and without potentially serious consequences
Motive_Description: Claim that the threat posed by the new coronavirus is actually made up by Mediaand institutions, and that emergency measures are pointless
Key_Words: Coronavirus, video, Reiner Fuellmich, hoax, masks, emergency measures, swab tests, Germany, France, Switzerland, dangerous
Summary: A video by German lawyer Reiner Fuellmich, claiming the COVID-19 epidemic is a hoax, that the virus is not as dangerous as it seems and that emergency measures (and tests) are completely useless, went viral in Germany and Switzerland and was also translated in French and shared on YouTube

Title: Le Covid-19 n’est pas devenu « 50 à 100 fois moins létal » qu’en mars, comme l’affirme le professeur Toussaint
Narrative_Description: Claim that the mortality associated to the new coronavirus, during the second wave of the epidemic, is from 50 to 100 times less deadly than it was in March
Motive_Description: Dismiss the seriousness of the new emergency associated to the second wave by claiming that the virus now is way less deadly
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Jean-François Toussaint, doctor, emergency, deadly, mortality rate, France
Summary: French doctor Jean-François Toussaint dismissed the new emergency situation in a video, by claiming that the virus is now from 50 to 100 times less deadly than it was in March, even though there is no evidence for this (the scientific community at the moment seems to agree that the mortality is unchanged) and the data he quotes as proof are very misleading

Title: Imbroglio autour d’un arrêté interdisant le transport d’instruments de musique dans le Morbihan
Narrative_Description: Rumors that the Government of the French region of Brittany has banned the transport of music equipment as a measure against the spread of COVID-19
Motive_Description: Criticise the regional government and spark social unrest
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Brittany, music, instruments, transportation, protest
Summary: The news spread that the French region of Brittany had banned transportation of music instruments as a measure against COVID-19, even though it was not true and only transportation of equiment for concerts with more than 500 people was forbidden

Title: Covid-19 : ces nombres montrant la « probabilité de survie » des personnes infectées sont trompeurs
Narrative_Description: Claims that the virus has a mortality that is lower than the true one, accompanied by suggestions that the Mediawant it to appear more dangerous than it actually is
Motive_Description: Claim the virus is not a serious a threat as people would be led to believe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, mortality rate, estimate, survival, dangerous, serious
Summary: A publication on Facebook went viral in France, showing that the mortality rate of the virus is very low and that the emergency situation is therefore unjustified, even though the estimates cited refer to a potential "best case scenario" and are very simplistic (i.e. they do not report mortality rates for older people)

Title: Une photo anachronique accuse Brigitte Macron d’enfreindre le port du masque
Narrative_Description: Picture showing French First Lady Brigitte Macron not wearing a mask and accusing her of violating the new governmental regulations on wearing masks in public
Motive_Description: Discredit the First Lady and the entire Government led by Macron
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, masks, public, Brigitte Macron, government, rules, emergency
Summary: A picture dating back to July 2020 was used to claim that Brigitte Macron was violating the rule, implemented in August, that masks are mandatory outdoors in Paris

Title: La comparaison approximative de Florian Philippot entre le Covid-19 et la grippe de 2017
Narrative_Description: Comparison between the new coronavirus and the seasonal flu in 2017, suggesting the two are very close to each Other as they have caused approximately the same number of deaths
Motive_Description: Claim that the virus is not as serious as the Mediawant people to believe, as it is comparable to a particularly strong flu
Source_Description: Florian Philippot (member of French party RN)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, influenza, mortality rate, serious, emergency, Florian Philippot
Summary: In a televised intervention, the former close collaborator of Marine Le Pen, Florian Philippot, claimed that the new coronavirus is not different from the virus linked to influenza in 2017. However while influenza caused more deaths than usual that year, the figure he quotes is slightly biased upwards and is still not comparable to the deaths caused by COVID-19, which have led to a big increase in mortality in France for 2020, despite emergency measures that were not even taken in 2017

Title: Israel não descobriu cura ou vacina para o coronavírus
Narrative_Description: Documentary video claiming that Israel already has a vaccine
Motive_Description: Give False Hope of a cure
Summary: Documentary footage from February to claim that the vaccine was already available in Israel in  March. The original footage, however, stated that it would be ready for trials in May.

Title: Cuba não desenvolveu vacina para o novo coronavírus
Narrative_Description: News article stating that Cuba already has a vaccine
Motive_Description: Give False Hope of a vaccine
Summary: Article that claims cuba has already developed a vaccine. Uses real images of Cuban and Chinese scientists and officials to justify their claims.

Title: Nobel de Medicina não disse que novo coronavírus foi criado pela China
Narrative_Description: WhatsApp message saying that Tasuku Honjo, Nobel Prize in Medicine, claimed that Coronavirus was created by the Chinese government.
Motive_Description: Blame China
Summary: A whatsapp message chain saying that the Coronavirus was purposefully created by China.

Title: Vídeo de militares correndo na praia é antigo e não tem relação com isolamento social
Narrative_Description: The government had sent the military to enforce lockdowns in Rio
Motive_Description: Exaggerate the severity of government/military measures to enforce lockdowns
Summary: A facebook post claiming that the military had come to enforce enforce the lockdown in Rio de Janeiro, while in reality the video is from years ago.

Title: La scomposta reazione e la disinformazione del medico NoVax su Covid-19 e vaccini: «Bastardi! Assassini!»
Narrative_Description: Claims that the new coronavirus is carried inside the vaccine against influenza, and it is therefore being spread on purpose
Motive_Description: Support the anti-vax movement and have people believe that governments and pharmaceutical companies alike are part of some kind of conspiracy
Source_Description: Roberto Petrella (Doctor and member of the anti-vax movement)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, influenza, Italy, doctor, Roberto Petrella, video
Summary: The video of a member of the anti-vax movement, Dr. Roberto Petrella, screaming and accusing members of government and companies to sell vaccines against influenza that contain the new coronavirus and therefore infect people, was shared on social Mediaand went viral in Italy, despite complete lack of evidence in favor of Petrella's claims

Title: Le mascherine sono uno strumento di morte? Il video del complottista e il misuratore di anidride carbonica
Narrative_Description: Claim that masks are a preventative measures against COVID-19 that is actually harmful, as it causes people to breathe too high levels of CO2
Motive_Description: Spark fear that masks could be harmful for people's health
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, masks, AttivoTV, CO2, harmful, health, breathe
Summary: A video went viral on Facebook in Italy, with a man attempting to measure the levels of CO2 near the mask he was wearing and suggesting masks might actually kill people, by exposing them to too high levels of CO2

Title: Giorgio Gori e Cristina Parodi volano a Formentera? La narrativa tra foto datate e titoli ingannevoli
Narrative_Description: Pictures showing Bergamo's mayor, Giorgio Gori, on vacation with his girlfriend in Formentera, accompanied by claims that he's on vacation abroad despite Italy's situation related to COVID-19
Motive_Description: Criticize Giorgio Gori and deligitimize his position as Bergamo's mayor
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Bergamo, Giorgio Gori, Cristina Parodi, Formentera, vacation
Summary: Pictures dating back to 2014 were shared on social Mediaand by Italian newspaper "Libero", showing Giorgio Gori, the mayor of Bergamo (one of the Italian cities worst-hit by coronavirus) on vacation in Formentera, accompanied by claims that he had left the city for summer vacation despite the situation. The major was actually in Bergamo, working.

Title: Quanti manifestanti a Berlino? La Polizia dice 17 mila, i sostenitori 1 o 3 milioni con le foto false
Narrative_Description: Pictures showing huge crowds attending a march in Berlin protesting against COVID-related emergency restrictions and denying the existence of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Show that there is big political and popular support for movements denying the existence of coronavirus, but institutions are trying to silence it
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Berlin, Italy, march, protest, deny, existence
Summary: Pictures of successful marches in Berlin (e.g. in 2001 and 2004) were pushed on social Mediaand accompanied by claims that they were showing the march, on August 1, of protesters denying the existence of coronavirus, whose officials accounts claim was attended by about 17000 people, while the promoters of this kind of narratives claim it was attended by about 1 million people

Title: «Volevo segnalare “situazioni di affollamento” create da Giuseppe Conte», ma la foto è del 2018
Narrative_Description: Picture showing Italian PM Giuseppe Conte in the midst of a crowd, despite the new rules of social distancing due to the coronavirus emergency
Motive_Description: Undermine the Italian government's authority and criticize the PM for not respecting the rules he implemented himself
Source_Description: Francesca Totolo (collaborator for a far-right Mediaoutlet)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Prime Minister, PM, Giuseppe Conte, social distancing, mask, emergency

Covid-19 is new strain of coronavirus that's considered more contagious and lethal than Other coronavirus.

Summary: A German lawyer maintains in a video posted on social networks that during the pandemic there has been no excess mortality.

Motive_Description: False information about the spread and severity of the virus
Summary: A rumor that first semester exams will be cancelled was debunked by the Egyptian Cabinet Facebook page

Title: شائعة: تداول منشور يزعم إقرار خصومات على رواتب المعلمين المتغيبين جراء إصابتهم بفيروس كورونا

Title: الطفل حافي القدمين يمين الصورة ليس “أوغور شاهين” مؤسس شركة BioNTech التي تستعد لإطلاق لقاح ضد كوفيد-19.
Narrative_Description: A photo is claimed to be of Uğur Şahin the researcher who established BioNtech that is found an effective vaccine against coronavirus and his family when he was child
