Summary: A photo of a Turkish family is claimed to be of Uğur Şahin, the scientist behind the covid vaccine

Title: Coronavirus, intubati pazienti dializzati perché positivi al tampone? La bufala sull’ospedale Scarlato di Salerno
Narrative_Description: A tweet saying that in hospitals in Salerno, a city in the south of Italy, doctors are following wrong medical procedures that would lead to many deaths as they did in Bergamo, the worst-hit Italian city during the first wave
Motive_Description: Claim that the situation in hospitals is terrible to spark fear among people
Summary: A tweet saying in hospitals in Salerno, an Italian city in southern Italy, doctors are following the wrong medical procedures that are leading to many evitable deaths. This was done to spread fear and panick among Italian citizens

Title: Coronavirus. Giornalisti italiani confezionano servizi fake sulle mascherine in Olanda? La bufala valanga
Narrative_Description: A fake video saying that Italian journalists in the Netherlands were shooting a video to show that there everybody was wearing a mask, but this was a made up video to make Italians believe what was not true in reality, that is people were not wearing masks
Motive_Description: Spread insults against Italian journalists and support the claim that masks are not necessary
Summary: A video by some Italian journalists showing people in the Netherlands wearing a mask to protect themselves from the virus, and claiming that this was a fake vide made up by journalists to let Italians believe this to push them to wear masks. The entire video pushed on Facebook was in the end fake, and no such thing happened in reality

Title: Coronavirus. Bambini morti a causa della mascherina? Sono arrivati in Italia i fake dei NoMask tedeschi
Narrative_Description: A tweet saying that in Germany a kid died because he wore a mask for too long
Motive_Description: Spread this news to support the idea that masks are bad and we should not wear them
Summary: A tweet saying that in Germany a kid died because he wore a mask for too long. However, the fact is not true and this was spread to support the anti-mask campaign

Title: Secondo Matteo Salvini, il governo ha deciso di chiudere negozi e locali. Ma l’ordinanza non dice questo!
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Italian Government has decided to close shops and restaurants again, in the middle of summer and despite the relatively low number of cases
Motive_Description: Criticize the Italian Government for supposedly taking too restrictive measures against COVID-19, damaging the economy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, League, Matteo Salvini, shops, restaurants
Summary: Matteo Salvini, leader of The League (Italian right-wing political party) posted a video on Facebook criticizing the government for taking too restrictive measures against COVID-19 during summer, accusing it of closing shops and restaurants again, even though no such measure had been taken (bars, restaurants and shops could remain open, but "dancing" was forbidden to avoid crowdings)

Title: Coronavirus. Esauriti i posti letto al Cotugno di Napoli? L’ospedale smentisce, indagine sul documento
Narrative_Description: Rumor that the intensive care unit of the "Cotugno" hospital in Naples has no more spots available for patients infected with the new coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spark fear that the coronavirus-related situation in Naples has quickly worsened, so much so that one of the city's hospitals is already out of space for patients
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Naples, Cotugno, Hospital, intensive care, patients, space, emergency
Summary: The rumor spread in Naples, through Facebook posts and chain messages on WhatsApp, that the intensive care unit of the city's Cotugno hospital had run out of spots for patients, and the hospital was not accepting people infected with the new coronavirus. The rumor was made up, however, as the hospital confirmed it still had space and the situation was under control.

Title: Pazienti Covid-19 uccisi a pancia in giù? Li sedavano perché volevano girarsi? Altra falsità contro i medici
Narrative_Description: Claim that doctors in some hospitals were killing patients infected with the new coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spark fear that people in hospitals are actually killed by doctors' neglicence, rather than cured
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, hospitals, patients, killed, position, bed, sedate
Summary: Some Facebook posts and websites in Italy claimed patients infected with the new coronavirus were actually being killed in some hospitals, with doctors placing them in such positions that it became hard for them to breathe and then sedating them so that they could not move. A similar procedure was instead executed to facilitate breathing in patients.

Title: La foto del compleanno di Conte: niente mascherine o distanziamento. Peccato sia del 2018
Narrative_Description: Claim that Italian PM Giuseppe Conte was celebrating his birthday in August without respecting social-distancing rules
Motive_Description: Discredit PM Giuseppe Conte by accusing him of violating the preventative measures against COVID-19 he enacted himself, during his birthday
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Prime Minister, PM, Giuseppe Conte, social distancing, birthday, mask, emergency
Summary: The news spread, right after Italian PM Giuseppe Conte's birthday, that he had celebrated with Other MPs without wearing a mask, and pictures dating back to 2018 were taken out of context to provide counterfait evidence for the claim

Title: La teoria di complotto del vaccino che modificherà il nostro DNA e il canale tv dell’antisemita svizzero
Narrative_Description: Video suggesting a vaccine against COVID-19 has been created and it will modify people's DNA (Bill Gates knows about it)
Motive_Description: Support the anti-vax movement and spread distrust towards pharmaceutical companies, institutions and Bill Gates
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, Bill Gates, DNA, modify, Italy, Switzerland, conspiracy
Summary: The news spread (starting out in a Swiss website and then going viral in Italy as well) that a new vaccine against COVID-19 was ready, and would modify people's DNA, despite complete lack of evidence for the claims

Title: Coronavirus, contagiato e spacciato per morto, la brutta bufala circolata via social tra i cittadini di Porcari (Lucca)
Narrative_Description: Claim that a person in the Italian town of Porcari, near Lucca (Tuscany) had died of COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spark fear and uncertainty by claiming a person died of COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Porcari, Lucca, patient, death, died
Summary: The news spread in the province of Lucca that a person in Porcari (a local town) had died of COVID-19, even though this was untrue (as members of the family and a local newspaper confirmed)

Title: Coronavirus. La «simpatica» burla del volontario per i primi test del vaccino russo a Milano, Torino…
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Russian vaccine is ready in Italy and some people are taking it at the Russian consolate
Motive_Description: Spread False Hope about the virus
Summary: A message saying that the Russian vaccine is ready and some people are taking it at the Russian consolate in Italy. This was spread to generate False Hope

Title: Coronavirus. La bufala dei 10 bambini ricoverati a Vienna per un’infezione fungina dovuta alla mascherina
Narrative_Description: Claim that ten kids are at the hospitals in Vienna after they got an infection because they were wearing masks
Motive_Description: Spread this news to support the claim that masks are bad and we should not wear them
Summary: A tweet saying that ten kids were in the hospitals in Vienna since they wore masks for too long and they got an infection because of that. The motive was to push an anti-mask campaign.

Title: Coronavirus, «Serve l’esercito in strada»: il falso virgolettato attribuito a Piero Angela
Narrative_Description: An article attributed to Piero Angela, a famous TV presenter, the claim that using the army to make people respect the rules in this emergency should be done
Motive_Description: Wrongly attribued this sentence to Piero Angelo probably as a mistake
Key_Words: Coronavirus, army, Piero Angelo, respect of the rules
Summary: An article attributing to Piero Angela, a famous TV presenter, the claim that we should use the army to make people respect rules during this emergency. However, he never said that. This was probably a mistake by the journalist who wrote the article, with no Other motive behind it.

Title: Coronavirus, violano il coprifuoco e la polizia di Berlino ricompensa con 500 euro i delatori? Bufala!
Narrative_Description: A message saying that in Berlin the police is ready to give 500 euros to whoever reports some violations of the curfew.
Motive_Description: Discredit the German Police by spreading fake news about policemen's behavior
Summary: A message saying that the Police in Berlin is giving 500 euros to whoever reports violations of the curfew. This message is spread to undermine the credibility of this body in Germany

Title: Coronavirus. Vaccino antinfluenzale omeopatico? Non è affatto un vaccino, attenti alla truffa!
Narrative_Description: A message saying that a homeopathic anti-flu vaccine could be usuful also to fight coronavirus
Motive_Description: Advertisement saying that this homeopathic vaccine is useful to fight Covid-19 to make profits by pharmacies
Summary: Advertisement saying that an anti-flu homeopathic vaccine is useful to fight the virus. This was posted by many pharmacies in Italy. However, there is no scientific evidence of that.

Title: Coronavirus. La falsa notizia dei 13 neonati positivi all’Umberto I di Roma
Narrative_Description: An article saying that in a hospital in Rome 13 babies were born already having the virus
Motive_Description: An article written to spark panick among Italian people
Summary: An article saying that in the hospital Umberto I in Rome, 13 newborns had the virus right after the childbirth. However, this news was immediately debunked

Title: Coronavirus. Il volontario deceduto in Brasile non aveva ricevuto il vaccino, ma fate attenzione!
Narrative_Description: A post saying that a volunteer in the Oxford-AstraZeneca trial died because he was given the vaccine
Motive_Description: Spread an anti-vaccine campaign
Summary: A post saying that a Brazilian volunteer in the Oxford-AstraZeneca was given the vaccine and died because of it. However, he was in the placebo group, and he died because of Other reasons unrelated to the trial

Title: Coronavirus. Secondo Palù il 95% dei positivi è asintomatico, ma i dati dell’ISS dicono altro
Narrative_Description: A famous Italian virologist claimed that more than 95% of people who got the virus don't show symptoms
Motive_Description: Spread this news to support some political positions against harsh lockdown measures
Summary: In an interview, the famous Italian virologist Giorgo Palù claimed that more than 95% of the positive cases are asymptomatic. However, the official data from the Ministry of Public Health show completely different information.

Title: Coronavirus. Focolaio in casa di riposo a Trieste, 28 positivi a causa del vaccino antinfluenzale? Falso!
Narrative_Description: A comment on Facebook saying that 28 people in a nursing home in Trieste got the virus because they were given the anti-flu vaccine
Motive_Description: Spread an anti-vaccine campaign
Key_Words: Coronavirus, nursing home, Trieste, 28 cases, anti-flu vaccine
Summary: A message saying that 28 people in a nursing home in Trieste got the virus because they were given the anti-flu vaccine. This was pushed as part of an anti-vaccine campaign

Title: Coronavirus. Virus mai isolato, tampone inutile e asintomatici non contagiosi? Le teorie di un pediatra
Narrative_Description: An Italian virologist claimed that Kary Mullist, a Nobel Laureate, argued that it is impossible to make a diagnosis of the virus
Motive_Description: Spread the conspiracy theory that the virus has never been isolated
Summary: A video where an Italian virologist reporting Nobeal Laureate Kary Mullis' statement saying that it is impossible to make a diagnosis of the virus. However, he never said that

Title: Defunto per morte naturale classificato come Covid-19? No! Non riguarda i bollettini, ma la prevenzione!
Narrative_Description: Rumor that deaths in Italy are classified as due to COVID even without evidence supporting the claim (i.e. a positive result of a PRC test)
Motive_Description: Spread doubt that the high number of cases of COVID-19 is actually due to a wrong classifications of deaths
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Corriere della Sera, Italy, article, death, dead, case, test
Summary: An article by famous Italian newspaper "Corriere della Sera" was shared by many on Facebook and interpreted as if it was suggesting that the deaths of many people during the epidemic were classified as COVID-19 even without positive test results confirming it. The narrative was based on a recommendation for funeral services (thus having nothing to do wit official covid statistics in Italy) banning funerals in case it is unsure whether the victim had COVID, even without a test, to prevent contagion

Title: Coronavirus. «Non autorizzo a isolare e prelevare mio figlio in mia assenza». La bufala che spaventa i genitori
Narrative_Description: Criticism towards governmental measures according to which children should be taken from schools by healthcare workers if they show coronavirus symptoms and isolated
Motive_Description: Spark fear that children will be traumatized after the reopening of schools if they show coronavirus symptoms, thus inviting parents to have them stay home
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, schools, children, isolate, healthcare workers, hospitals, trauma
Summary: The news spread on Facebook and was shared by many angry parents that children would be picked up from school by healthcare workers in case they showed covid symptoms and isolated (even though governmental guidelines established that children should be picked up by parents and isolate at home in such cases). These were accompanied by a self-made declaration that the parent would deny consent for such a practice

Title: Coronavirus. Tu queste domande te le sei fatte? Il video dello youtuber «osservatore» che disinforma
Narrative_Description: Claim that the coronavirus epidemic is nothing but an influenza epidemic, the virus is not as serious as the Mediaare having people believe and the lockdown in Italy was just an excuse to control people
Motive_Description: Spark doubt that the virus is similar to a common influenza and that the emergency situation is unjustified and exaggerated
Summary: A YouTuber shared a video with an interview with self-defined "observer" Silver Nervuti, containing a series of misinformation about the coronavirus epidemic, all revolving around the fact that the virus is similar to influenza and not actually serious, and that the Italian lockdown was implemented only in an effort to start a sort of military dictatorship and control people

Title: Coronavirus. Vuoto l’ospedale Sacco di Milano? Emergenza inventata? No! Ecco cosa è successo!
Narrative_Description: Video showing an empty hospital in Milan saying that they are not in an emergency
Motive_Description: Video claiming that hospitals are not full to support the idea that this is not an emergency
Summary: A video showing the hospital Sacco in Milan empty and claiming that there was not an emergency. However, the video was not showing the right places, and the hospital was under emergency. This is part of an no-vax campaign to downplay the severity of the virus

Title: Coronavirus. Consiglio Supremo di Difesa senza distanziamento e mascherine? No! Foto del 2019
Narrative_Description: A photo showing the Defence Council meeting where politicians don't wear masks
Motive_Description: Effort to undermine the government's credibilty
Summary: A photo showing politicias at the Defense Council meeting not wearing masks. However, the photo was taken in 2019.

Title: Coronavirus. Bertolaso e gli infondati 2000 euro a paziente Covid19 che hanno scatenato i complottisti
Narrative_Description: An article saying that Bertolaso, an Italian politician, claimed that hospitals receive 2000 euros for each positive case as a "productivity reward"
Motive_Description: Effort to discredit hospitals by saying they are making profit out of positive cases
Summary: An article saying that Bertolaso, an Italian poltician, claimed that hospitals receive 2000 euros for each Covid patient as a "productivity reward". However, Bertolaso said that they receive that kind of money on average to cope with additional expenses due to the pandemics. This message was spread to undermine hospitals.

Title: I kit test Covid-19 venduti nel 2018? La teoria del complotto nata dall’errore informatico del sito WITS
Narrative_Description: Rumors that PRC tests for coronavirus were being sold as early as 2018
Motive_Description: Undermine WHO's authority by suggesting it was involved in the sale of PRC tests for COVID-19 2 years before 2020, the outbreak of the coronavirus epidemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, 4Chan, PCR tests, import, sale, WHO, 2018, conspiracy
Summary: The rumor developed on 4Chan and started to become viral that PCR tests were being sold already in 2018, two years before the actual outbreak of the coronavirus epidemic, and that COVID-19 was therefore the result of some kind of conspiracy. The baseless claim provided as evidence a mistake in a website showing sales of PCR tests in 2018, even though it was easy to understand it was untrue, as an Italian fact-checking platform explains.

Title: Coronavirus. La foto bufala di Silvio Berlusconi ricoverato al San Raffaele con la maschera per l’ossigeno
Narrative_Description: Picture of former Italian PM mask wearing an oxygen mask, while in hospital after testing positive for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spread the idea that Silvio Berlusconi, who tested positive for coronavirus in September, was also in serious conditions
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Silvio Berlusconi, hospital, oxygen mask
Summary: A picture of Silvio Berlusconi in serious conditions at a hospital in Milan, after testing positive for COVID-19, went viral on Facebook and Twitter, but a later more careful analysis proved it was counterfait and taken from the picture of anOther person

Title: Coronavirus. Manerbio, tampone agli studenti senza il consenso dei genitori rimasti fuori dai cancelli? No!
Narrative_Description: Claims that in a school in Manerbio (near Brescia, Lombardy) after a child was found with fever, children were tested for coronavirus without their parents' consensus (with the parents watching behind the school's gates)
Motive_Description: Spark fear in parents, by suggesting there has been an episode were children were tested without asking for their consensus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Manerbio, school, children, fever, test, parents
Summary: The rumor spread in Manerbio, a town near Brescia (Lombardy) that in a local school children were tested without the consensus of their parents and with the parents actually watching from the school's gates, locked out, because one of their classmates had been found with fever. The news was fake and the city's mayor had to officially clarify that parents had been able to accompany children while they were tested.

Title: La pandemia di Spagnola fu causata dal vaccino? Ma per favore! Il primo anti-influenzale arriva solo nel 1936
Narrative_Description: Claims that the Spanish flu epidemic in 1918 was actually caused by vaccines, implying that so is the current one
Motive_Description: Spread distrust towards vaccines and pharmaceutical companies, by claiming that already in the past an epidemic was caused by vaccines
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spanish flu, influenza, vaccine, soldiers, war
Summary: The rumor spread, in Italy and abroad, that the fact that during the Great War for the first time all soldiers were vaccinated (which is untrue, it was not the first time) actually caused the Spanish flu in 1918 (also untrue), suggesting a potential similarity with the coronavirus epidemic (implying it could either be caused or worsened by vaccines)

Title: Il video degli studenti che giocano all’autoscontro con i banchi a rotelle non è del 2020
Narrative_Description: Videos of high schoolers playing with the new desks (provided with wheels) bought by the Italian Ministry of Education to guarantee social distancing, showing they're defeating their initial purpose
Motive_Description: Criticize the Italy Minister of Education, Lucia Azzolina, and the government's handling of the coronavirus epidemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, schools, desks, wheels, social distancing, Minister of Education, Lucia Azzolina, Matteo Salvini
Summary: A video dating back to 2017, showing high schoolers playing with desks provided with wheels, was taken out of context and went viral in Italy, accompanied by criticism and the claim that the desks shown where those bought by the Ministry of Education to make social distancing easier during the epidemic. The video was also posted by Matteo Salvini, leader of The League.

Title: Coronavirus. Secondo Fauci gli asintomatici non possono contagiare? Il video fuori contesto che disinforma
Narrative_Description: Translation in Italian of an interview by Anthony Fauci, supposedly claiming that those who show no symptoms of COVID-19 cannot infect Others
Motive_Description: Suggest that the emergency situation in Italy is exaggerated, as even an authoritative source like Anthony Fauci has claimed that those with no symptoms cannot infect Other people
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Anthony Fauci, symptoms, infect
Summary: A video of Anthony Fauci saying that those with no symptoms cannot infect Other people with coronavirus, dating back to January 2020 when many characteristics of COVID-19 were still unknown, was taken out of context and shared in Italy in September to suggest that the current emergency situation is exaggerated

Title: Coronavirus, «Chiedete per quale virus vi fanno i test»: il post Facebook ingannevole che inculca il dubbio
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that PCR test results are not only positive in presence of the new coronavirus, but would be positive also for Other types of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Criticize the healthcare system and undermine its authority, by suggesting PCR tests fail to actually detect COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, PCR test, influenza, positive, results
Summary: Some Facebook posts in Italy were shared several times and went viral, suggesting that PCR tests detect positivity with respect to all types of coronavirus and not just Sars-Cov-2, inviting people to ask healthcare workers for which virus they're positive and underlining that there is some kind of ongoing positive. This is untrue, however, as people positive to COVID-19 are clearly told "for which virus" they're positive.

Title: Il nuovo Coronavirus è stato previsto in un libro sul dark web del 2019?
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that the existence of the new coronavirus was predicted by a someone as early as 2016, as a book would show
Motive_Description: Suggest that some kind of obscure conspiracy is in place, as someone knew about the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, book, dark web, sell, Wuhan, publish, 2016, 2019
Summary: The news spread in Italy and abroad that a book published in 2016, detailing some episodes happened on the dark web, had predicted the existence of the new coronavirus as it described someone trying to sell a virus named "Wuhan-corona" on the dark web. The book, however, whose source is unclear, was not published in 2016 as claimed, but rather in 2019, and the paradox is not explained by any conspiracy, but by the fact that in Wuhan there exists a lab for virological research (or it might have been modified later)

Title: El virus está exagerado
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that the virus is overexagerated
Motive_Description: Criticize the Colombian government
Summary: Posts on facebook from fake accounts presented as aligned with Bolsonaro spreading the message that the virus is exagerated

Title: Il vaccino antinfluenzale favorisce il Coronavirus? L'intervento di Sara Cunial che disinforma in Parlamento

Motive_Description: Support the anti-vax movement and spread distrust towards vaccines and pharmaceutical companies
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, influenza, vaccines, Sara Cunial, MP, distrust
Summary: During one of her interventions in Parliament, MP Sara Cunial (already known for her position in the Italian no-vax movement and for spreading misinformation) claimed that vaccines against influenza might actually increase the chances of being infected with the new coronavirus, despite complete lack of evidence supporting her claim

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que mortos infectados pelo novo coronavírus sempre têm Covid-19 como causa do óbito

Summary: The news spread on social Mediathat people can just refuse to comply with lockdown measures implemented in Italy, as they are of no legal value

Title: Coronavirus. L’Oms vuole “deportare” i vostri familiari infetti entrando con la forza nelle vostre case? No!

Motive_Description: Discredit WHO by suggesting it is conspiring to deprive people of their freedom

Key_Words: Coronavirus, USA, Fox News, Tucker Carlson, WHO, emergency, home, test, positive, deport
Summary: Fox News journalist Tucker Carlson falsely reported a WHO Official's interview as suggesting to deport people testing positive for coronavirus away from their homes and families for safety purposes, even children: the news went viral and was also reported by an Italian youTube channel known for spreading misinformation

Title: Coronavirus. I video e le foto delle auto in coda per la Pasqua tra bufale, disinformazione e realtà
Narrative_Description: Pictures, either taken out of contexts or exaggerated, and false claims, about supposed long queues of cars during Easter holidays in Italy
Motive_Description: Have people believe that a lot of people are probably violating lockdown measures to go on vacation for Easter
Source_Description: Several newspapers ("La Repubblica" and "Corriere" among them)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, emergency, Easter, lockdown, queues, road, car
Summary: At the beginning of Easter holidays in Italy, several newspapers posted pictures of long queues on the roads accompanied by comments that people were not following the national lockdown implemented by the government and were instead leaving their homes to go on vacation. The queues were instead caused by the many police controls, but most people were respecting rules, and some of the pictures were actually older, resulting in most newspapers correcting their headlines.

Title: Coronavirus. L’eparina è la risposta al Covid-19? No! Fate attenzione!
Narrative_Description: Claims that heparin will probably be the one drug that will save people from the new coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread the word that a drug has been found (heparin) that is extremely promising against COVID-19
Source_Description: Newspapers "La Gazzetta del Mezzogiorno" and "La Nazione"
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, heparin, drug, save, people
Summary: It was reported in Italy that heparin, a drug, would save most people from the coronavirus emergency, due to its promising result in treating those infected. The claims, however, were baseless, as it was already known that heparin could be used to help those infected, but with no important role that could change the course of the emergency.

Title: Coronavirus. Le teorie di complotto negazioniste e antivacciniste del fantomatico Dr. Ayyadurai Shiva
Narrative_Description: Claims the virus is not as strong as the Mediaand institutions want people to believe
Motive_Description: Claim the virus is not as dangerous as Mediaand politicians want people to believe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Ayyadurai Shiva, MIT, Doctor, severity, vitamins
Summary: Dr. Ayyadurai Shiva (MIT graduate), known for supporting Donald Trump in terms of downplaying the severity of the new coronavirus, claimed in an interview that there is a conspiracy, the virus is not as serious as people believe because of the Mediaand the claims of politicians, and that it can actually be cured with vitamins. The news went viral also in Italy and was reported by several local news channels.

Title: Coronavirus. Meno morti rispetto al 2019? Ecco i dati dell’Istat pubblicati il 31 marzo 2020
Narrative_Description: Claims mortality for Italy in 2020 is actually lower than in 2019 even with coronavirus
Motive_Description: Downplay the severity of the virus by suggesting it has not caused an increase in the mortaity rate
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, mortality rate, lower, 2019, 2020, comparison
Summary: An Italian blog posted pictures of figures for the mortality rate in Italy in the first three months of 2019 and 2020, claiming deaths in 2020 were actually less than in 2019. The data, however, were cherrypicked from different sources to substantiate their claims, even though actual figures from ISTAT proved the opposite (regions where the virus hit harder showed a much higher mortality rate with respect to the same period in 2019)

Title: Coronavirus. I falsi documenti del Governo, Regione Lombardia e Inps che circolano su Whatsapp

Title: Hospital Geral de Fortaleza ainda tem pacientes com covid-19 em UTI
Narrative_Description: Nurses celebrate at Hospital Geral de Fortaleza because they have no more covid patients in ICUs
Motive_Description: Give a sense of hope
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Hospital Geral de Fortaleza, nurses, celebrate, ICU
Summary: A video, taken from a slightly different context, was shared in Brazil claiming it showed nurses celebrating at Hospital Geral de Fortaleza because they have no more covid patients in ICUs.

Title: No hay pruebas de que la voz de este vídeo que habla de teorías conspiratorias sobre el coronavirus sea del presidente de Ghana ni de que el virus haya sido creado en un laboratorio
Narrative_Description: Ghana's president Nana Akufo-Add revealed that coronavirus was created in a laboratory and spread through the world
Motive_Description: Spread fear and anger
Source_Description: Facebook account Alejandro Soler Castro (on group named NUESTRA VERDAD)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Nana Akufo-Add, Ghana, laboratory, reveal
Summary: An audio by an unidentified person was attributed to Ghana's president Nana Akufo-Add, claiming that he revealed that coronavirus is a plot and was created in a laboratory.

Title: Coronavirus. Il Governo manda i Nas a Mantova per chiudere il reparto che cura i pazienti con il plasma? No!
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Government has sent police forces to a hospital in Italy, to interrupt cures using plasma to treat COVID-19
Motive_Description: Undermine trust in the Italian government by suggesting it is trying to hinder progress in finding a cure for COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Mantova, hospital, plasma, blood, cure, treatment, police, government
Summary: A Facebook post went viral in Italy, suggesting the government had sent police forces to a hospital in Mantova (in Lombardy) to interrupt cures using plasma to treat patients, suggesting that it might be because plasma was proving too effective and the government thus wanted to stop its use

Title: Coronavirus. Il video dei complottisti «Le bare di Bergamo non erano vere?»
Narrative_Description: Claim the virus in Bergamo, Italy, did not lead to many deaths, as the pictures of coffins circulating on Italian social Mediawere counterfait
Motive_Description: Suggest the coronavirus emergency in Italy was not that serious, as the pictures of coffins in Bergamo were not real
Source_Description: Tommaso Minniti ("Tommix") and Pamela Carminati ("Pam Morrigan")
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Bergamo, Tommaso Minniti, Pamela Carminati, coffins, fake
Summary: A video by Tommaso Minniti and Pamela Carmitano (the latter claiming to be an entrepreneur in the field of funeral services) went viral in Italy: they claimed that pictures of coffins in Bergamo were either counterfait or staged, as the epidemic did not cause so many deaths in the Northern Italian city

Title: Coronavirus. Morti di polmonite o trombosi? Colpa del virus oppure no? Ecco cosa è cambiato in un mese
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that the cause of death of people with coronavirus has nothing to do with pneumonia, but rather with trombosis
Motive_Description: Give people that the actual cause of deaths linked to coronavirus, has been found, and therefore cures will be very easy from this moment on
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, pneumonia, trombosis, doctor, hospital, cure
Summary: A claim started circulating on Italian social Mediaand WhatsApp: it claimed that the actual cause of deaths linked to coronavirus had been found and had nothing to do with pneumonia, but rather with trombosis, and that the finsing was from a Doctor working for the Humanitas hospital group. However, while the cause of death might also be trombosis, pneumonia remains one major complication and cause of death of coronavirus cases.

Title: Coronavirus. I calcoli del Comitato tecnico scientifico sono sbagliati? Abbiamo qualche dubbio
Narrative_Description: Claims that the Italian Government's Technical-Scientific Committee ("Comitato Tecnico-Scientifico") has gotten the calculations and predictions leading to the implementation of the national lockdown in the country completely wrong
Motive_Description: Suggest that the predictions on the future evolution of the epidemic in Italy, which led to the national lockdown, are wrong, and that therefore the situation is much less serious than people would think
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Techincal, Scientific, Committee, calculation, computation, wrong, lockdown, emergency, prediction, statistics
Summary: A website in Italy released an article accusing the Italian Government's Technical-Scientific Committee ("Comitato Tecnico-Scientifico") og getting the calculations and predictions leading to the implementation of the national lockdown in the country completely wrong. The article was widely criticized and then debunked by the Committee itself explaining the data and calculations during a press conference

Title: Coronavirus. Il Metodo di Bella, già dimostratosi inefficace per i tumori, non funziona nemmeno col Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Suggestion to use some methods (involving keeping control of anxiety and keeping a healthy diet) to keep coronavirus at bay
Motive_Description: The methods promoted are associated to the so-called "Di Bella" method to cure diseases and suggested by the son of the method's author, so it is legitimate to think they might be a way to make profit
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Di Bella method, cure, healthy diet, fear, panic
Summary: Some websites and YouTube videos released interviews with Giuseppe Di Bella, son of famous Italian professor Luigi Di Bella (who developed a method to cure cancer that was never approved by the scientific community) suggesting some techniques, associated to the same method (such as keeping control of panic and fear and engaging in a healthy diet) to fight coronavirus, even though such cures have not proven to be effective to avoid being infected

Title: Coronavirus. Primo maggio 2020, migliaia di cittadini manifestano davanti a Montecitorio? No! Video del 2019
Narrative_Description: Rumor that a big rally on May 1st was held in Rome to protest against the Italian government's lockdown measures, but the Mediaare hiding it
Motive_Description: Discredit the ruling coalition in Italy by showing it lacks political support and support movements denying the severity of the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, May 1st, march, rally, protest, lockdown, emergency
Summary: The video of a protest in Rome on May 1st, 2019 started circulating again in 2020 on WhatsApp and Telegram in Italy, accompanied by claims it was showing people protesting against the government's lockdown measures. The diffusion of the out-of-context video was traced back by a fact-checking platform to a Telegram groupchat collecting anti-semitic and far-right content.

Title: Coronavirus. Prestigiosi giornali americani svelano la pandemia inventata? I complottisti sono alla frutta
Narrative_Description: Claim that coronavirus is a hoax, and that famous American newspapers are "finally waking up"
Motive_Description: Deny the severity of the virus and suggest people are part of a big conspiracy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, USA, New York Times, Washington Times, Washington Post, newspapers, headlines, hoax, vaccine
Summary: Some blogs in Italy reaffirmed the claim that coronavirus is a hoax and that people are part of a big conspiracy (possibly set up in order to sell vaccines), by saying that a famous American newspaper, the Washington Times, had denounced this. The blogs were not only spreading misinformation, but also playing with Italian readers confusion about the difference between the Washignton Times and way more authoritative sources such as the New York Times and the Washington Post, who never said coronavirus is a hoax

Title: Coronavirus. Mascherine e guanti ci fanno ammalare? Non filtrano il virus? Non è proprio così
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that masks and gloves are of no use to prevent the spread of the virus and might actually cause people to get sick
Motive_Description: Encourage people not to use masks and gloves, but rather avoid them
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Stefano Montanari, no-mask, gloves, sick
Summary: Some websites reported interviews with Stefano Montanari, an Italian writer, suggesting not to use neither masks nor gloves as measures against contagion, because they are of no use and might actually cause people to get sick by attracting Other dangerous microbes and dirt

Title: Coronavirus. I poteri forti e Facebook hanno oscurato i profili di De Donno? No e non c’è la mano di Bill Gates
Narrative_Description: Rumor that the Facebook account of Giuseppe De Donno, an Italian researcher experimenting with the use of plasma to treat COVID-19, was shut down as someone is trying to silence him, possibly in order to keep the epidemic spreading and sell more vaccines in the future
Motive_Description: Support the anti-vax movement and movements supporting conspiracy theories and spread mistrust towards the government and Bill Gates, accusing them of being part of some kind of conspiracy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, cure, plasma, blood, Giuseppe De Donno, vaccine, Bill Gates, facebook, account
Summary: The rumor spread on facebook in Italy, and was amplified initially by a post on Matteo Salvini's Facebook page, that the Facebook account of Giuseppe De Donno, an Italian researcher experimenting with the use of plasma to treat COVID-19, was shut down in an attempt to to silence him, possibly in order to keep the epidemic spreading and sell more vaccines in the future. However, screens show he has deactivated the account himself.

Title: Recreación del levantamiento de un cadáver por coronavirus es mal interpretada en las redes sociales
Narrative_Description: A video allegedly showing a dead patient raising an arm to imply virus is a hoax
Motive_Description: Imply the virus is a hoax
Summary: A video allegedly showing a dead covid patient raising their arm is misleading as the original video is recreation video from homicide division

Title: Médico tem autonomia para prescrever tratamento contra a covid-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that a doctor could have their license revokes if they refused to prescribe hydroxychloroquine to covid patients
Motive_Description: Spread fear about consequences of refusing to take a medication
Summary: A post on Facebook claims that a doctor could have their license revokes if they refused to prescribe hydroxychloroquine to covid patients. The claim was refuted by the Ministry of Health

Title: Anvisa classificou ivermectina como remédio controlado para 'coibir compra indiscriminada'
Narrative_Description: Claim that ivermectin is a cheap drug that is effective in curing coronavirus because the regulatory agency Anvisa has labeled it as a controlled substance
Motive_Description: Cast doubt on the regulatory agency and claim that the rule is politically-motivated
Summary: The regulatory agency Anvisa labeled a drug controlled subtance because there was minsinformation that it cured coronavirus, an act that fueled more misinformation about the integrety of the agency

Title: #Verificamos: Voluntária que relatou febre e dores no corpo não tomou vacina chinesa, e sim vacina de Oxford
Narrative_Description: Claim that a volunteer for the chinese vaccine reported severe fevers after taking the vaccine
Motive_Description: suggest that the vaccine isn't safe
Summary: Claim that a volunteer for the chinese vaccine reported severe fevers after taking the vaccine, but the volunteer actually took the Oxford Vaccine

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que cloroquina e ivermectina estejam presentes na casca da laranja e do limão
Narrative_Description: Claim that chloroquine and ivermectin are present in the orange and lemon peel
Motive_Description: claim that cure is available in orange and lemon peel
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, chloroquine, ivermectin, orange, lemon
Summary: Video of a man claiming that chloroquine and ivermectin are present in the orange and lemon peel

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que Ziraldo comemorou ‘cura de Bolsonaro pela cloroquina’
Narrative_Description: Cartoonist and writer Ziraldo, creator of popular works of children's literature, circulates on social networks, in defense of the use of chloroquine against Covid-19.
Motive_Description: Supporting Bolsonaro in using chloroquine against Covid-19
Summary: A Facebook post claimed that Ziraldo, a famous Brazilian cartoonist, healed from Covid-19 with chloroquine. It also questioned how many lives could have been saved if Other politicians do not politicized the drug. Ziraldo's publicist denied any such comment was made by the cartoonist.

Title: Es falso el audio que denuncia la falsificación de certificados de defunción en el Hospital de Clínicas para aumentar los muertos por coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A hostpital director was allegedly forced to modify a certificate of death of a patient who died from a heart attack to be listed as deceased "by COVID".
Motive_Description: Mistrust the data from Ministry of Health as it wants everyone to die from COVID
Key_Words: Audio, falsification, death certificates, Hospital de Clínicas, increase, deaths
Summary: An audio is circulating on Facebook in which a woman explains that she did not go to work because “Dr. Pérez de la Hoz”, whom he recognizes as the “director of the Hospital de Clínicas and head of Cardiology”, allegedly forced to modify a certificate of death of a patient who died from a heart attack to be listed as deceased "by COVID". This decision would respond to an “order from above” since “the Ministry of Health wants everyone to die from COVID”. The mentioned doctor assured that "there was never any request of this type from anyone." Also, the hospital explained that the area in which the doctor works does not treat infected patients, so it is impossible for a death certificate from coronavirus to come from his division.

Title: No, la OMS no ha admitido que "nunca hubo motivos para el confinamiento"
Narrative_Description: WHO admitted that" perhaps "there were never grounds for the lockdown
Motive_Description: Discredit the decision to lockdown
Key_Words: WHO has not admitted that "there were never grounds for confinement"
Summary: An opinion piece in rge Washington Examiner publication titled "Infuriating: We may have closed the country for nothing" refers to a statement by Maria Van Kerkhove, director of the WHO's zoonoses and emerging diseases unit, about the spread of COVID-19 in asymptomatic people, during a press conference on June 8. However, none of the statement made by Van Kerkhove or the WHO on the lockdown

Title: É falso que mais mortes foram registradas no primeiro semestre de 2019 que no de 2020
Narrative_Description: More deaths were recorded in the first half of 2019 than in 2020
Motive_Description: Covid is not lethal and it shown with the number of deaths recorded
Summary: A Facebook post claimed that more deaths were registered in the first six months of 2019 than in the same period this year. The numbers presented in the posts do not match those of the Civil Registry platform

Title: Inhalar eucalipto no previene ni elimina el nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Inhaling eucalyptus prevents or eliminates the new coronavirus
Motive_Description: Imply that covid is treatable withh Eucalyptus
Summary: Images and texts spread in social networks saying that using eucalyptus helps prevent and eliminate the new coronavirus. Neither the World Health Organization nor any Other official body has recommended its use. Also, there is still no cure for Covid-19

Title: Es falso que el presidente de Ghana se adhiera a teorías conspirativas sobre el origen de la pandemia
Narrative_Description: An audio attributed to the President of the Republic of Ghana, Nana Akufo-Addo, defends the involvement of billionaires Bill Gates and George Soros in a plan of "world depopulation" through the mandatory nature of the future vaccine against COVID -19.
Motive_Description: Supporting the conspiracy that vaccine is used for world depopulation
Key_Words: President of Ghana, Nana Akufo-Addo, adheres, conspiracy theories, origin of the pandemic
Summary: An audio attributed to the President of the Republic of Ghana, Nana Akufo-Addo, defends the involvement of billionaires Bill Gates and George Soros in a plan of "world depopulation" through the mandatory nature of the future vaccine against COVID -19. The Ghanaian government has already denied it.

Title: Post inventa que OMS recomendou a cmpra de 'vacina chinesa de US$ 10 mil' contra a covid-19
Narrative_Description: The WHO recommended to immediately buy Chinese vaccine at a cost of $10,000 per dose
Motive_Description: Implying that WHO and China are profiting from the pandemic
Summary: Rumours in Facebook saying that the WHO recommended to immediately buy Chinese vaccine at a cost of $10,000 per dose. The claims were made up

Title: Por qué el biomagnetismo no te va a curar ni proteger del coronavirus (ni de ninguna otra enfermedad): es una pseudoterapia
Narrative_Description: "Biomagnetism" can cure coronavirus
Motive_Description: Spread false claim on alternative cures
Source_Description: General public (but reference to Twitter account @Garcia28Iris on the picture)
Summary: False claim that biomagnetism (a pseudOtherapeutic method based on the use of magnets to accect one's body pH) can cure coronavirus.

Title: #Verificamos: Estafadores ofrecen por WhatsApp una falsa tarjeta de compras de Carrefour para robar datos personales
Narrative_Description: As part of a campaign to fight Covid-19, a message said that the new Carrefour shopping card could help families to cope with the economic crisis produced by Covid-19
Motive_Description: Rob personal banking data
Summary: Message on WhatsApp saying that the new Carrefour shopping card could help families to cope with the economic crisis but it was an attempt to steal personal banking data

Title: #Verificamos: El número de muertes en Brasil aumentó, y no disminuyó, entre abril de 2019 y 2020
Narrative_Description: The number of deaths because of Covid-19 in Brazil decreased
Motive_Description: Claiming the curve is flattening to downplay the severity
Summary: A tweet by a politician saying the number of deaths because of Covid-19 in Brazil has decreased

Title: #Verificamos: “Pastor” que ofrece máscara invisible por R$ 300 es, en verdad, humorista
Narrative_Description: A video of an evangelic clergyman selling an invisible mask to protect against Covid-19 for 300 dollars
Motive_Description: Selling an invisible mask for 300 euros
Summary: A video of an evangelic clergyman selling an invisible mask to protect from Covid-19 for 300 dollars

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que el STF prohibió a los hospitales militares que atiendan pacientes civiles con Covid-19
Narrative_Description: The Supreme Court in Brazil denied the possibility to use military hospitals to host covid-19 patients
Motive_Description: Undermine the credibility of the Supreme Court
Summary: A message saying that the Supreme Court denied the possibility to use military hospitals to host Covid-19 patients

Title: #Verificamos: El dinero confiscado en la foto publicada por la PF no viene de hospitales de campaña contra la Covid-19 en Río
Narrative_Description: A photo showing cash apparently confiscated by the police in a building where the governor of Rio de Janeiro works, and it is related to hospitals built to treat covid-19 patients
Motive_Description: Target the governor of Rio de Janeiro and the administration
Summary: A photo showing cash confiscated by the police and saying it was found in a builing where the governor of Rio de Janeiro works and that this cahs is connected to hospitals to treat covid-19 patients

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que el PT busca “prohibir la adquisición de cloroquina por el gobierno” en el STF
Narrative_Description: A story saying that the justice of the Supreme Court Alexandre Moraes could block the government from spending money to buy hidroxicloroquine to treat covid-19 patients
Motive_Description: Discredit the Supreme Court
Summary: A story saying that a justice of the Supreme Court, Alexandre Moraes, could block the government from buying more hidroxicloroquine to treat covid-19 patients

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que Teich dijo que Bolsonaro pone su ‘mediocridad’ por delante de la ciencia
Narrative_Description: Message saying that Neilson Teich, an ex-Ministry of Health, claimed that it is impossible to be the Ministry of Health right now since Bolsonaro doesn't care about covid-19 victims
Motive_Description: Discredit both Teich and Bolsonaro
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Teich, Bolsonaro, Ministry of Health
Summary: A message saying that Teich, a previous Ministry of Health in Brazil, said that nowadays it is impossible to be Ministry of Health since Bolsonaro does not care about covid-19 victims

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que Doria dijo que la gente tiene que elegir entre confinamiento y comida
Narrative_Description: A message saying that Doria, the governor of Sao Paolo, said that people need to choose between confining themselves and food
Motive_Description: Discredit Doria, the Sao Paolo governor
Summary: A message saying that the governor of Sao Paolo Doria said that people have to choose between confinement and food

Title: #Verificamos: El mensaje en WhatsApp que promete “ayuda gas” del Ministerio de la Ciudadanía es un engaño
Narrative_Description: A message saying that through the program Ayuda Gas the government will help people by giving them between 70 and 210 dollars
Motive_Description: Create the False Hope of further economic relief
Summary: A message on WhatsApp saying that through the program Ayuda Gas the government will give families between 70 and 210 dollars

Title: #Verificamos: Video de profesionales de la salud dándole la espalda a un auto no se grabó en Brasil
Narrative_Description: Doctors and nurses protesting against the mayor of Sao Paolo, Bruno Covas
Motive_Description: Discredit the mayor of Sao Paolo
Key_Words: Coronavirus, doctors, nurses, Covas, Sao Paolo
Summary: A video showing doctors and nurses protesting on the street against the mayor of Sao Paolo. However, the video was recorded in Belgium

Title: #Verificamos: Execução em vídeo viral não é de jornalista que denunciou superfaturamento na pandemia
Narrative_Description: A video circulates on social Mediathat would show the recent execution of a journalist in Brazil for his work revealing overprice during the Covid-19
Motive_Description: Incite fear that journalists can be executed
Summary: A video circulates on social Mediathat would show the recent execution of a journalist in Brazil, during the Covid-19 pandemic. According to the text, reporter Bruno Rodrigues, from RedeTV! 's National Alert program, was reportedly killed after reporting overpricing in a work done by the city of Moju, in Pará, on July 17. In his Instagram account, Bruno Rodrigues published a video to deny it.

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que imagem ‘prova’ que primeira voluntária não tomou vacina contra Covid-19 em SP
Narrative_Description: Volunteer is pretending to get the vaccine produced by Chinese pharmaceutical company Sinovac, in partnership with the Butantan Institute
Motive_Description: Questioning if vaccine trial is real
Key_Words: First volunteer, pretend, vaccine, São Paulo, Governor João Doria
Summary: A video circulates on social Mediathat shows the first volunteer is receiving the dose of the Covid-19 vaccine. Attending during the vaccination was São Paulo governor, João Doria and the post questioning if it's fake because there isn't any needle shown. Although the video circulating on the networks is, in fact, an act, there are Other records that show the moment when the vaccine is applied.

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que vacinas contra Covid-19 podem criar seres humanos geneticamente modificados
Narrative_Description: Vaccines against Covid-19 would be able to transform people's genetic code, transforming them into “genetically modified organisms”.
Motive_Description: Incite fear from taking vaccine
Summary: Circulated through social networks that vaccines against Covid-19 would be able to transform people's genetic code, transforming them into “genetically modified organisms”.

Title: Es falso el posteo del centro de virología ruso que recomienda una dieta alcalina para combatir el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Post claims that a virology center in Moscow reccomends eating more alkaline foods to counteract the virus
Motive_Description: Claim there is a cure to virus
Summary: Post claims that a virology center in Moscow reccomends eating more alkaline foods to counteract the virus

Title: Detector: No, estos medicamentos no previenen el Covid
Narrative_Description: Photos of drug which claim to prevent covid
Motive_Description: Claim there is a cure to virus
Summary: image has been circulating on Facebook that shows some drugs with which the new coronavirus is supposedly prevented

Title: Detector: el presidente de Ghana no dijo que el Covid se creó en un laboratorio
Narrative_Description: Post claims that the President of Ghana said the virus was created in a lab
Motive_Description: Attack WHO, UN and billionaires
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, lab, WHO, UN, Ghana
Summary: Post claims that the President of Ghana said the virus was created in a lab

Title: Luis Arce no tiene Covid-19 como lo sugirió Arturo Murillo
Narrative_Description: Claim that Luis Arce Catacora is infected with coronavirus.
Motive_Description: To urge the candidates supporters to not mobolize to avoid more cases of covid
Summary: the Minister of Government, Arturo Murillo, falsely claimed that Luis Arce Catacora is infected with coronavirus.

Title: No, los japoneses no están adquiriendo plantas de interior para curar males mentales causados por la pandemia
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Japanese are tutning to indoor plants to help with mental illness reulting from the pandemic
Motive_Description: False information
Summary: Photo shows people on train with indoor plants claims that the Japanese are tutning to indoor plants to help with mental illness reulting from the pandemic

Title: Foto de algeria a amendoime é compartilhada como se fosse reacao a vacina contra covid-19
Narrative_Description: Photo of a boy with peanut allergy reaction is shared as if it were a reaction to the covid-19 vaccine
Motive_Description: Spread fear of vaccine
Summary: Photo of a boy with peanut allergy reaction is shared as if it were a reaction to the covid-19 vaccine

Title: É falso que CoronaVac usa células de bebês abortados
Narrative_Description: Claim that CoronaVac vaccine uses cells from aborted babies
Motive_Description: Spread false information about vaccine
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Vaccine, cells, aborted fetus
Summary: Posts claim that CoronaVac vaccine uses cells from aborted babies

Title: Es falso el mensaje que asegura que el infectólogo Pedro Cahn no presentó “un trabajo ni fue reconocido
Narrative_Description: A tweet claims that Pedro Cahn is not recognized as a welll known infectious disease expert and has not presented work
Motive_Description: Attack the advsior to the president and his credinentials
Summary: A tweet claims that Pedro Cahn is not recognized as a welll known infectious disease expert and has not presented work

Title: La cadena de mascarillas gratis para mayores de 60 años que se mueve por varias comunidades: en Madrid y Andalucía se reparten a los mayores de 65 años; en la Comunidad Valenciana, Cataluña, Castilla y León y País Vasco no se están repartiendo de forma gratuita*
Narrative_Description: Free masks for people over 60 in several communities in Spain
Motive_Description: Make people think that they're going to get free masks
Key_Words: Free masks, people over 60, Madrid, Andalusia, people over 65, Valencian Community, Catalonia, Castilla y León, Basque Country
Summary: A WhatsApp chain saying that free masks are given to people over 60 in Madrid in the Valencian Community, Catalonia, Castilla y León and the Basque Country and Andalusia. Authorities in Andalucía have confirmed that these three masks will be delivered "to people over 65 years old" not 60 years old as mentioned in the WhatsApp chain. While the rest of the counties do not give free masks.

Title: No hay pruebas de que se estén dando casos de pleuresía por el uso de la mascarilla
Narrative_Description: Hypoxia-induced pleurisy is occurring while using the mask
Motive_Description: Convincing people for not using mask
Summary: Content in Facebook circulated stating that "hypoxia-induced pleurisy is occurring due to the use of the mask". The text is accompanied by a chest x-ray in which the lungs of a person can be seen. But there is no evidence that these cases are occurring. Also, the image he uses has nothing to do with the coronavirus and there is no evidence that the masks cause hypoxia.

Title: Natalia Prego Cancelo y sus afirmaciones falsas sobre las PCR y el coronavirus en este vídeo
Narrative_Description: PCR gives many false positives because it amplifies the genetic material of the virus and is nonspecific.
Motive_Description: Casting doubt on PCR
Key_Words: Natalia Prego Cancelo, doctors for the truth, video, PCR, false positives
Summary: Natalia Prego Cancelo is one of the leaders of the coronavirus denial group " doctors for the truth. She criticizes PCR, the test used to detect the coronavirus in active infections, with false claims. According to Prego, "PCR gives many false positives" because it "amplifies the genetic material of the virus" and is "nonspecific". But it's not like that.

Title: Es falso el posteo que presenta a una doctora santiagueña que lucha contra el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A woman called "Daniela Villa", is said to be "fighting tirelessly to find a cure for Covid-19, but as she is from the interior no one will share it."
Motive_Description: Create  hope that cure is on the way
Key_Words: Daniela Villa, Santiago, doctor, cure, interior
Summary: A post on Facebook indicates that the woman in the photo is "Daniela Villa", who "is fighting tirelessly to find a cure for Covid-19, but as she is from the interior no one will share it." The woman in the photo is the Lebanese porn actress Mia Khalifa, who posted that image with a doctor on her Instagram account in January 2018. The same photo had already been falsely associated with a Mexican doctor.

Title: Es engañoso el posteo que tiene una lista recomendaciones para prevenir y tratar el nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Consuming an alkaline diet to combat COVID-19 and consume paracetamol as an effective measure against the virus for an infected person.
Motive_Description: Create flase hope that the virus can be prevented or cured
Key_Words: Alkaline, paracetamol, list of recommendations, prevent, treat, Coronavirus
Summary: A chain circulates on Facebook that includes a list of recommendations regarding how to avoid becoming infected, what to do once you contract COVID-19 and what are the symptoms of the disease. The text is misleading as it contains some true information and some false information. Such as consuming an alkaline diet to combat COVID-19, consuming paracetamol as an effective measure against the virus for an infected person.

Title: ES FALSO QUE ENFERMERAS EN RUSIA “NO UTILICEN UNIFORME” PARA ATENDER A PACIENTES COVID-19
Narrative_Description: In Russia "nurses do not use a uniform in COVID-19 wards", as a study affirms that this way "patients feel happy", which would help their immune system.
Motive_Description: Make poeple think that Russia go "too far" in handling coronavirus
Summary: According to a post that circulates on social networks, in Russia "nurses do not use a uniform in COVID-19 wards", as a study affirms that this way "patients feel happy", which would help their immune system. Although the photographs are real, they come from a different case than the one claimed by the publication. The health professional, identified as Nadezhda Zhúkova , declared on that occasion that she took off her clothing due to the heat she felt, but that she did not expect that it would be noticeable what she was wearing under the special overalls used to treat infectious diseases.

Title: Governo não demitiu 396 mil servidores por fraude em auxílio emergencial
Narrative_Description: The federal government laid off 396,000 civil servants who illegally received emergency aid
Motive_Description: Make people think that taking stimulus means corruption
Key_Words: Fire, 396 thousand, public servants, fraud, emergency aid
Summary: Facebook post claimed that the federal government laid off 396,000 civil servants who illegally received emergency aid. CGU (Comptroller General of the Union) identified 396,316 payments of the benefit in May to public agents. However, the agency said the cases are analyzed individually and did not say whether anyone had ever been fired for that reason.

Title: No, estos niños de Sierra Leona no sufren el resultado de las “pruebas de vacunación”

While there are lawsuits againts the mentioned figures, the reason of the lawsuits is mismanagement of covid, not because they vetoed the distribution of the antiviral. Brazilian president Bolosonaro has defended the use of the antiviral.

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que Doria tomou ‘vacina chinesa’ contra a Covid-19 sem usar máscara
Narrative_Description: The governor of São Paulo, João Doria, being vaccinated with the nurse administering it without a glove and the two without a mask

Summary: A photo circulates in Facebook of the governor of São Paulo, João Doria, being vaccinated with comment saying: “Dória's lunatic taking the Chinese vaccine, a nurse without a glove and the two without a mask. Imagine if it was Bolsonaro?” The photo was taken on March 23 and shows the governor of São Paulo, João Doria having a flu vaccine. The record was published by the governor himself on his Twitter account .

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que CoronaVac seja produzida a partir de ‘células de bebês abortados’

Summary: A post circulates on social Mediathat says cells from aborted babies are being used in the production of the CoronaVac vaccine, by Chinese pharmaceutical Sinovac. This vaccine is being tested in Brazil in partnership with the Butantan Institute.

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que la prensa brasileña “se calló” después que Lula dijo que “qué suerte que la naturaleza creó este monstruo de coronavirus”

Summary: The claim went viral on social Mediain Brazil that the mainstream Mediahad sort of "kept hidden" the claim by the country's former President Lula that the covid epidemic is actually a positive thing. Truth was that Lula had never said exactly those words, and the press had actually widely reported and discussed the interview containing the disputed claim

Summary: A picture of Pedro Sanchez and some members of his government talking, in close proximity to each Other, went viral in Spain together with criticism for their apparent lack of respect for social distancing measures. The picture, however, was dating back to January, before the beginning of the health emergency

Summary: The news went viral in Brazil that a Brazilian doctor, Gaspar de Oliveira Vianna, had discovered chloroquine as a remedy for malaria, back in the beginning of the XXth century (implying that, during the coronavirus epidemic, the discovery might save even more lives as a remedy). Chloroquine, however, was discovered by an Austrian doctor.

Summary: A viral social Mediapost claims that Covid-19 is a curable, seasonal indection and all precautions to limit spead are unnecessary

Title: #Verificamos: Itaperuna no tuvo el 99% de los pacientes con coronavirus recuperados

Motive_Description: Give hope that a cure to COVID-19 might finally have been found

Summary: The news went viral in Brazil that 99% of people positive to the new coronavirus, in the city of Itaperuna (near Rio de Janeiro) had been cured with chloroquine and successfully so. The claim, however, was completely fabricated: even though treatments with chloroquine were being experimented on in the city, no such high success rate was reported

Title: #Verificamos: Es falso que un estudio con 60.000 personas en España muestre la “ineficacia de las cuarentenas”

Key_Words: Coronavirus, emergency, lockdown, social distancing, useless, study, Spain, Brazil
Summary: The news went viral in Brazil on social Mediathat a study carried out in Spain had shown how social distancing measures and lockdowns are useless at containing the spread of epidemics such as the coronavirus one. While a study is being carried out in Spain, it is not about the effectiveness of social distancing, and results have not been released yet, so the news is untrue.

Title: #Verificamos: É falso que ‘estudo Henry Ford’ provou eficácia da hidroxicloroquina contra a Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Henry Ford study' proved hydroxychloroquine efficacy against Covid-19
Motive_Description: Make people believe that hydroxychloroquine is the cure for coronavirus
Key_Words: Henry Ford Health System, efficacy, hydroxychloroquine, treatment
Summary: A post circulated in Facebook stating that a study carried out in the Henry Ford Health System, in the US, proved the efficacy of hydroxychloroquine in the treatment of Covid-19. The text says that the survey was carried out by the International Society of Infectious Diseases with 2,451 patients, using a randomized, double-blind procedure - best suited to prove whether a drug, in fact, works. Recent studies using these two approaches have concluded that hydroxychloroquine is not effective against Covid-19.

Title: Detector: La recomendación engañosa de Raul Salazar para el Covid
Narrative_Description: dr. Raul Salazar Restrepo says that ventilators are not needed and that the quarantine can be ended with a treatment that is worth less than $ 30 thousand in a pharmacy.
Motive_Description: Make people think that covid can be cured
Key_Words: dr. Raul Salazar Restrepo, ventilators, acetaminophen, aspirin, ibuprofen, azithromycin, corticosteroid
Summary: dr. Raul Salazar Restrepo says that ventilators are not needed and that the quarantine can be ended with a treatment that is worth less than $ 30 thousand in a pharmacy. He also says that patients should not receive acetaminophen and labels the medical union as "kneeling" of the EPS. Salazar insists on self-medication and advises taking a blood thinner (aspirin), an anti-inflammatory (ibuprofen), an antibiotic (azithromycin) and a corticosteroid ( prednisone). The drug recommendation is misleading because while they may help, they can also have negative and dangerous side effects for some people. That is why they are for controlled use and doctors only prescribe them in certain clinical conditions.

Title: Morales: “En el AMBA el 20% de los contagiados es personal de salud”

Summary: Governor of Jujuy, Gerardo Morales claimed that in the Metropolitan Area of Buenos Aires 20% of those infected are health personnel. But data shows that both in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires and in the 40 Buenos Aires municipalities that make up the AMBA, similar percentages are recorded, between 7% and 8%.

Key_Words: Coronavirus, USA, Oklahoma, contagion, curve, epidemic, ralllies, Mike Pence, Donald Trump
Summary: During a roundtable, US Vice-President Mike Pence praised the state of Oklahoma for managing to flatten out the curve of coronavirus cases, thus supporting Donald Trump's decision to hold in-person rallies in the state. The curve, however, was seeing an increase in cases precisely in that period.

Title: Offer for free horses is from 2011, not tied to COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that a man wants to freely offer about 50 horses to any buyer willing to take care of them, since his father (who owned them) has died of COVID-19
Motive_Description: The viral post includes a number to be called, so it is safe to assume it is some kind of fraud whose purpose is profit
Key_Words: Coonavirus, USA, horses, 52, sell, free, man, father, die
Summary: A post whose narrative was first seen in 2012, went viral again with a twist: it suggested a man wanted to get rid of 52 horses his father had left him after dying from COVID-19, by freely giving them away. The post included a number to be called and was probably a fraud rather than just a joke.

Title: No, this photo doesn’t prove coronavirus is a hoax
Narrative_Description: Picture of a woman carrying a body bag with just one hand in Miami, accompanied by claim that the coronavirus epidemic is being staged
Motive_Description: Have people believe that COVID-19 is a hoax
Key_Words: Coronavirus, USA, Miami, body, bag, carry, hand, woman
Summary: A post showing the picture of a woman in Miami, carrying a body bag with just one hand, went viral and was presented as evidence that the coronavirus epidemic is being staged and that the virus does not exist.

Title: Two “Doomsday Planes” took flight because of President Donald Trump’s COVID-19 diagnosis.
Narrative_Description: Claims that "Doomsday Planes" took flight after Trump's positive COVID diagnosis
Motive_Description: Spread fear about potential instability or war
Source_Description: General Public, Tim Hogan, Laura Wells
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Donald Trump, positive, airborne nuclear command center, U.S. Strategic Command
Summary: A circulated theory that Trump's positive COVID diagnosis caused "Doomsday"  E6B-Mercury planes took off on the order of the U.S. strategic command

Title: “No prominent Democrats have had the virus but the list of Republicans goes on and on.”
Narrative_Description: Supposes that many Republicans have had COVID, but not prominent Democrats
Motive_Description: Suggest a Democrat party cover-up of COVID infections
Summary: A tweet claims that no prominent Democrats have had COVID, while many Republicans have

Title: Says Donald Trump is not at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, “he is on AF1.”
Narrative_Description: Claim that Trump did not go to Walter Reed Hospital, but instead he is on Air Force One, because of an alleged inconsitency with tie colors
Motive_Description: Cast doubt on U.S. government's response to Trump's health
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Donald Trump, Air Force One, Walter Reed Hospital, QAnon
Summary: QAnon conspiracy theory that alleges that Trump never actually went to Walter Reed, and instead it's a double

Title: Trump “needed a ‘reset'” for his campaign and therefore the diagnosis may be a “con.”
Narrative_Description: Claims that Trump getting COVID is a political stunt to "reset" his campaign
Motive_Description: Cast doubt about Trump campaign
Summary: A facebook post hypothesizes that Trump could be lying about having COVID and is saying he has it for political gain

Title: Désintox. Non, ce n'est pas grâce au Brexit que le Royaume-Uni peut bénéficier en avance du vaccin contre la Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Claim's that the UK swift approval of the new coronavirus vaccine was made possible by Brexit
Motive_Description: Support pro-brexit movements and the UK Conservatve party
Source_Description: Matt Hancock (UK Health Minister) and Other members of the Conservative Party
Key_Words: Coronavirus, UK, Conservative Party, Brexit, vaccine, approval
Summary: The British Health Minister and Other members of the Conservative Party claimed that the swift approval of the new coronavirus vaccine in the country was only made possible by Brexit, while the information was untrue and the UK was still following EU rules. It had used a clause for pre-approval that was available to all EU member states

Title: Désintox. Remdesivir : non, la France n'a pas dépensé des millions pour un médicament inutile
Narrative_Description: Claims that France and the EU spent 1 billion euros on Remdesivir, a treatment for coronavirus that had later turned out to be useless
Motive_Description: Discredit the French Government or, alternatively, EU institutions
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, EU, buy, 1 billion euros, money, spend, Remdesivir, treatment
Summary: The news spread on social Mediasuch as Twitter that the EU had spent 1 billion euros on Remdesivir, a treatment for COVID-19 that had later turned out to be ineffective. EU member states, however, had only bought the treatment for 200 million euros, and France was not even one of them

Title: Covid-19 : est-ce que les hommes politiques vont simuler leur vaccination, comme l'affirment plusieurs messages sur les réseaux sociaux ?
Narrative_Description: Rumor that public figures who receive the coronavirus vaccine in public are actually faking it either using tricks or body doubles
Motive_Description: Support no-vax movements, spread mistrust towards political figures encouraging people to get vaccines
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, USA, public, vaccine, fake, double figure
Summary: Several posts went viral on social Mediain the US, UK and France, containing rumors that public figures who receive the coronavirus vaccine in public are actually faking it either using tricks or body doubles. The photos and videos used to provide evidence, however, were either misplaced or had a clear explanation

Title: Désintox. Covid-19 : non, les vaccins ne modifieront pas notre ADN
Narrative_Description: Claim that the vaccines by Moderna, and Pfizer could modify people's DNA, thus turning them into GMOs
Motive_Description: Spread fear by suggesting that people's DNA could be modified if they do get the coronavirus vaccine
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Christian Perronne, vaccine, DNA, RNA, GMO, Pfizer, BioNTech, Moderna, modify
Summary: French Doctor Christian Perronne, already known for spreading misinformation concerning COVID-19, warned people of the risk posed by the new vaccines by Pfizer and Moderna: he claimed the vaccines can modify human DNA, thus turning people into GMOs.

Title: Les lieux culturels sont-ils fermés partout en Europe, comme l’affirme le Premier ministre ?
Narrative_Description: Claim that all European countries have closed cultural spaces (cinemas, theatres, museums) as a measure to contain the spread of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Support the government's decision of closing theatres, museums and cinemas
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, PM, Prime Minister, Jean Castex, close, museums, theatres, cinemas, culture, emergency, measure
Summary: French PM Jean Castex confidently claimed that all European countries closed cultural spaces (cinemas, theatres, museums) as a measure to contain the spread of coronavirus, even though this is not the case (if we take the example of several countries, including Ireland, Spain and Portugal)

Title: Mauricette M., la première personne vaccinée en France contre le Covid-19, avait-elle donné son consentement ?
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that the first woman in France to receive the coronavirus vaccine was used (as she was elderly and did not understand well what was happening) without asking for her consent
Motive_Description: Support no-vax movements and criticize the government's handling of the vaccine distribution
Source_Description: Right-wing French politicians François Asselineauand Jean Messiha
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, vaccine, distribution, elderly, consent, Mauricette M., François Asselineau, Jean Messiha
Summary: Two right-wing French politicians, François Asselineau and Jean Messiha, suggested in their tweets that Mauricette M., the first woman to receive the coronavirus vaccine, had not given her consent and had been exploited because of her age and the fact that she did not understand properly what was happening. The hospital, however, had confirmed she had given her consent

Title: Stations de ski : les cas de Covid-19 sont-ils deux fois plus élevés en Suisse qu’en Haute-Savoie ?
Narrative_Description: Claim that the rate of people infected with the new coronavirus in Switzerland is twice the rate in the neighboring region of France (High-Savoy)
Motive_Description: Criticize the governemnt's decision of shutting down ski stations as an emergency measure against the spread of coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Switzerland, infection, rate, twice, Savoy, ski stations
Summary: Jean-Luc Boch (representing mayors of town in skiing destinations) criticized the government's decision of shutting down ski resorts by claiming that those same resorts are open in Switzerand, where the infection rate by coronavirus is twice higher than in Savoy (the French region near the Alps). The claim, however, was untrue as the infection rate in Switzerland iss actually much slower

Title: Trump being diagnosed with COVID is about the best thing that could have happened to him right now.
Narrative_Description: Claims that Trump's COVID diagnosis could be for free publicity and a way for him to easily get out of the October 15th presidential debate
Motive_Description: Cast doubt about Trump campaign
Key_Words: Coroavirus, Trump, campaign, diagnosis, publicity, debate
Summary: A facebook post claims that Trump getting COVID is good for him for free publicity and a way to save face by getting out of the next presidential debate and planned rallies

Title: Fact Check: Donald Trump Did NOT Blame "Forgetting" To Wear A Mask (At A KKK Rally) For Contracting Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Claims that Trump got COVID from a KKK rally
Motive_Description: Make fun of Trump
Summary: A comedy article claims that Trump blames forgetting to wear a mask at KKK rally for getting COVID

Title: 北京进入“战时”状态？不实!
Narrative_Description: Bejing enters wartime state
Motive_Description: Undermine China's capital, Beijing
Summary: Web circulates rumor that Beijing has entered wartime state

Title: “武汉一公司数千人发热”？不实！
Narrative_Description: "Thousands of people in a Wuhan company have fever"? false!
Motive_Description: Claims thousands of people in Wuhan have a fever
Summary: Web circulates rumor that thousands have a fever in Wuhan company

Title: 辽宁省汽车客运站停运是假消息
Narrative_Description: The suspension of Liaoning's bus terminal is false news
