Motive_Description: Claims Lioning bus terminal is suspended
Summary: WeChat users spread rumor that Lioning bus terminal was suspended

Title: 山西太原晋源区新冠肺炎患者共计13名？
Narrative_Description: A total of 13 patients with new coronavirus in Jinyuan District, Taiyuan, Shanxi?
Motive_Description: Claims new coronavirus cases in Shanxi
Key_Words: Coronavirus, patients, Jinyuan District, Taiyuan, Shanxi?
Summary: Web circulates rumor that a total of 13 patients has new coronavirus in Jinyuan District, Taiyuan, Shanxi

Title: 非常时期，大连自来水中加大氯气注入？
Narrative_Description: During the extraordinary period, increase the injection of chlorine into the tap water in Dalian?
Motive_Description: Claims to inject more chlorine into tap water in Dalian
Key_Words: Coronavirus, inject, chlorine, tap, water, Dalian
Summary: WeChat rumors recommend people to inject more chlorine into tap water in Dalian

Title: 河北保定中小学寒假提前？
Narrative_Description: Early winter vacation in Baoding elementary and middle schools in Hebei?
Motive_Description: Claims early vacation in Hebei schools due to the coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, elementary, middle, school, Hebei, early, vacation
Summary: Weibo post debunks WeChat rumor that there's early vacation in early and middle schools in Hebei

Title: 上海中小学提前放寒假？
Narrative_Description: Shanghai elementary and middle schools have winter vacation early?
Motive_Description: Claims Shanghai schools have winter vacation early
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Shanghai, elementary, middle schools, early, vacation
Summary: Mediasites spread rumors that Shanghai elementary and middle schools will start vacation early

Title: 天津部分小学提前一周放寒假？
Narrative_Description: Some primary schools in Tianjin have winter vacation a week in advance?
Motive_Description: Claims schools have vacation earlier than expected
Key_Words: Coronavirus, primary school, Tianjin, early, vacation
Summary: Mediareports on Weibo account that some primary schools in Tianjin have winter vacation a week in advance

Title: 湖南邵东某成都返邵人员核酸检测阳性？
Narrative_Description: A person returning to Shao from Chengdu in Shaodong, Hunan has a positive test?
Motive_Description: Claims a traveler is spreading the coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Shao, Chengdu, Shaodong, Hunan, positive, test
Summary: Woman spreads rumor that a person returning to Shao from Chengdu in Shaodong, Hunan has a positive test

Title: 山西临汾市场一次性筷子呈阳性？谣言
Narrative_Description: Disposable chopsticks in Linfen market in Shanxi are positive? rumor
Motive_Description: Claims chopsticks are positive for the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, disposable chopsticks, Linfen market, Shanxi, positive
Summary: Rumor circulates online claim disposable chopsticks in Linfen market in Shanxi are positive

Title: 海南出现本土病例？谣言
Narrative_Description: Cases appear in Hainan
Motive_Description: Claims cases appear in Hainan
Summary: Mediaspreads rumors that coronavirus cases appear in Hainan

Title: 成都一小区又出现一例确诊病例？谣言
Narrative_Description: AnOther confirmed case in a community in Chengdu? rumor
Motive_Description: Claims anOther confirmed case in Chengdu
Summary: WeChat users spread rumor of a coronavirus case in Chengdu

Title: 成都低风险地区回遂宁需隔离14天？谣言
Narrative_Description: Is it necessary to quarantine for 14 days when returning to Suining from a low-risk area in Chengdu? rumor
Motive_Description: Asks if quarantine is necessary
Summary: Neighborhood notice spreads rumor that people from Suining have to quarantine for 14 days in low-risk area in Chengdu

Title: 浙江舟山要求外来人员返乡？谣言
Narrative_Description: Does Zhoushan, Zhejiang require foreigners to return home? rumor
Motive_Description: Suggests Zhejiang government requires foreigners to return home
Source_Description: General public, People's Government of Zhoushan City, Zhejiang
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Zhejiang, require, foreigners, return, home
Summary: Individuals spread government notice that claims Zhejiang is requiring foreigners to return home

Title: Says Gov. Tony Evers “removed the American flag from the Capitol building”
Narrative_Description: Says Gov. Tony Evers “removed the American flag from the Capitol building”
Motive_Description: Claims Gov. Tony Evers wanted to remove the American flag from the Capitol
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Governor, Tony, Evers, remove, American, flag, Capitol
Summary: Facebook users spread rumor that Gov. Tony Evers wanted to remove American flag from Capitol

Title: “Four kids who took the coronavirus vaccine died immediately.”
Narrative_Description: Says four kids who took the coronavirus vaccine died immediately
Motive_Description: Undermines the efficacy of the vaccine
Summary: Viral image on Facebook post claims four kids died from vaccine

Title: If you are licensed to carry a concealed weapon, wearing a face covering for coronavirus "removes your conceal carry ability."
Narrative_Description: Says wearing a face covering conceals a person with a weapon
Motive_Description: Undermines the use of a face covering
Summary: Viral image on Facebook claims wearing a face covering conceals a person holding a weapon

Title: In North Carolina, “you can be charged with a class H felony for wearing a mask and concealed carrying.”
Narrative_Description: In North Carolina, “you can be charged with a class H felony for wearing a mask and concealed carrying.”
Motive_Description: Undermines use of a face mask and spreads rumors about carrying a weapon
Key_Words: Coronavirus, weapon, conceal, face, cover, North Carolina, felony
Summary: Facebook post claims you get a felony in North Carolina for wearing a face covering and concealed carrying

Title: A “face mask exempt card” allows you to cite the ADA and not wear a mask.
Narrative_Description: A “face mask exempt card” allows you to cite the ADA and not wear a mask.
Motive_Description: Doesn't enforce teh use of a face mask
Key_Words: Coronavirus, face mask, exempt, card, ADA
Summary: Instagram post claims a face mask exempt card means a person can cite the ADA and not wear a face mask

Title: Nos 36 réponses à vos questions sur la pandémie de Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Viral Facebook post containing a series of questions (36) concerning the coronavirus epidemic, many of which referring to false or exaggerated claims such as the fact that the mortality from coronavirus is the same as from common flu, or that Bill Gates has something to do with the epidemic, etc.
Motive_Description: Claim that the threat from the virus is not as serious as Mediaand institutions want people to believe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, 36 questions, epidemic, emergency, mortality
Summary: A Facebook post went viral in France, containing a series of questions (36) concerning the coronavirus epidemic, many of which were drawn from conspiracy theories or were referring to false or exaggerated claims (such as the fact that the mortality from coronavirus is the same as from common flu, or that Bill Gates has something to do with the epidemic)

Title: La vidéo du « semblant d’injection » de la première ministre du Queensland est truquée
Narrative_Description: Video of Annastacia Palaszczuk, Prime Minister of Queensland (Australia) seemingly pretending to receive the vaccine against influenza in April
Motive_Description: Support no-vax movements and spread mistrust towards political institutions and pharmaceutical companies
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Australia, Queensland, Annastacia Palaszczuk, vaccine, influenza, fake
Summary: A video dating back to April and showing Queensland's PM Annastacia Palaszczuk receiving the vaccine for influenza went viral again in France, through a different version cut in a way that seemed to show the PM only pretending to receive the vaccine (the full video, however, is available on the internet). The cut video was used to support conspiracy theories against the coronavirus vaccine

Title: Une vidéo prouve que le britannique William Shakespeare a bien reçu le vaccin contre le Covid
Narrative_Description: Claim that William Shakespeare, the second British citizen to receive the coronavirus vaccine, did not really receive it
Motive_Description: Support no-vax movements and spread mistrust towards political institutions and pharmaceutical companies
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, UK, William Shakespeare, vaccine, receive, fake
Summary: A picture of William Shakespeare, the second British citizen to receive the coronavirus vaccine, where the nurse is not actually giving him the jab was used by some to claim that the man did not actually receive the vaccine, and went viral in France. The full video where Mr. Shakespeare receives the vaccine, however, is available on the internet

Title: Silvano Trotta, un de ces théoriciens du complot à « l’arrogance déstabilisante »
Narrative_Description: Claim that the coronavirus epidemic is the result of a global conspiracy, of which Bill Gates and national governments are partially responsible, that masks are useless
Motive_Description: Discredit Bill Gates and national governments of the countries hit by the coronavirus epidemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, plandemic, epidemic, Silvano Trotta, businessman, Bill Gates, governments, conspiracy
Summary: Silvano Trotta, French businessman and manager of several accounts on social Mediasuch as Facebook, Twitter and Youtube where he spreads conspiracy theories, claimed the coronavirus epidemic is actually a "plandemic" (i.e. an orchestrated epidemic) and among Other things, he suggested masks are useless to fight coronavirus

Title: Nanoparticules et vaccins contre le Covid-19 : cinq questions pour démêler le vrai du faux
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that the use of nanoparticles in some coronavirus vaccines is extremely dangerous, and could be used for tracing people against their will or knowledge
Motive_Description: Have people fear that vaccines for COVID-19 are dangerous and might lead to authorities being able to trace their moevements without their consent
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Louis Fouché, doctor, nanoparticles, vaccines, tracing, people, movements
Summary: In a video flagged by Facebook, French doctor Louis Fouché warns of the dangers of nanoparticles used in some vaccines against COVID-19, claiming these particles can be used to trace people's movements without their consent

Title: Facebook a-t-il interdit d’affirmer que le vaccin contre le Covid-19 contient des nanoparticules ?
Narrative_Description: Claim that Facebook will delete any post claiming that vaccines for COVID-19 contain nanoparticles
Motive_Description: Criticize facebook for enacting censorship and support no-vax movements
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, BFM TV, Facebook, censorship, nanoparticles, vaccines
Summary: The news went viral in France that Facebook had decided to erase any post mentioning links between vaccines and nanoparticles, even though such particles are indeed contained in some vaccines for COVID-19. The claim was untrue, has Facebook had made a different announcement.

Title: Says Donald Trump boarded Marine One "with a portable oxygen concentrator in his pocket with the nasal cannula going up his back, hidden in his hair and tucked under his mask."
Narrative_Description: Claims that Trump was appraoching his helicopter while hiding a portable oxygen concentrator in his suit
Motive_Description: Cast doubt about Trump's health
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Donald Trump, Marine One, Oxygen
Summary: Circulated post and tweet that claims that Trump had a portable oxygen concentrator secretly under his suit and through his hair and hidden under his mask

Title: “President Trump is in great danger. Evidence is mounting that he’s being deliberately killed at Walter Reed Military Hospital.”
Narrative_Description: Claims that Trump's doctors want to assasinate him
Motive_Description: Spread fear that people want to kill Trump as a catalyst for chaos in the US
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Donald Trump, assasination, experimental treatment, Walter Reed Hospital
Summary: Alex Jones supposes that the doctors at Walter Reed Hospital want to kill trump

Title: L’intox du Rivotril et de l’euthanasie des personnes âgées
Narrative_Description: Claim that the government has legalised eutanasia for elderly people during the coronavirus epidemic, through legalization of the use of Rivotril on old patients
Motive_Description: Depict the government and the healthcare system as ruthless institutions, not interestead in the health of elderly people
Source_Description: Meyer Habib (MP for the UDI Group) and Other sources
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, emergency, elderly, people, old, euthanasia, Rivotril
Summary: A rumor that had already gained momentum around April in France gained strength again in November, so much so that a Minister had to publicly deny it. The rumor suggested the Government had basically legalized euthanasia on elderly people during the epidemic by guaranteeing the use of Remdesivir, a palliative drug (while the procedures that were being followed for elderly people were always the same, with or without the epidemic or Remdesivir)

Title: Covid-19 : la fin de l’illusion du « zéro mort » en Suède
Narrative_Description: Claims that the COVID-19 situation in Switzerland in November is extremely good, with very few cases and deaths
Motive_Description: Discredit the French Government for failing to contain the coronavirus epidemic, despite taking more restrictive measures than those in Switzerland
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Switzerland, curve, cases, mortality rate, comparison, measures
Summary: Some posts on social Mediain France, in November, kept comparing the situation in the country with that of Switzerland, suggesting that despite far less restrictive measures taken to contain the epidemic, the neighboring country had almost no cases and deaths. That was untrue, as in November Switzerland had a rising cases curve (with a peak of 8000 per day) and had thus started taking more restrictive measures.

Title: Une étude danoise utilisée de travers pour prouver l’inefficacité des masques
Narrative_Description: Tweet reporting the results of a Danish study which, according to the tweet's author, proves that masks are of no use to protect people from COVID-a9 (and might actually be dangerous)
Motive_Description: Invite people not to wear masks
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Silvano Trotta, businessman, masks, Danish, study
Summary: French business Silvano Trotta tweeted what he believed to be the results of a Danish study, supposedly proving that masks are useless and might actually be dangerous. However, the study has not received approval by the scientific community (having a very high p-value) and Mr. trotta misreported both the data and the results.

Title: Coronavirus. Slittamento della tredicesima dei dipendenti pubblici ad aprile 2021? Bufala!
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Italian Government has decided to postpone salary payments to public employees in the country in December, in order to raise funds and use them to tackle the coronavirus epidemic
Motive_Description: Undermine the government's authority by claiming it is taking money away from public employees to face the coronavirus emergency
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, salary, payments, government, newspaper, Il Sole Ventiquattro Ore
Summary: A fake newspaper article was artificially created to make it look like it came from "Il Sole ventiquattro Ore" (a famous Italian newspaper dealing with economic issues). It accused the government of deciding to deny public employees their salary payments in December in order to raise funds to tackle the coronavirus emergency

Title: Coronavirus. Ancora rimedi omeopatici su Facebook?
Narrative_Description: Post suggesting that so-called "Eupatorium perfoliatum", a homeopathic remedy, has properties that can heal patients from COVID-19 and should therefore be used for that purpose
Motive_Description: Give people hope that a cure for COVID-19, in the form of a homeopathic remedy, has been found and yields miraculous results
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, homeopathy, homeopathic, cure, traìeat, Eupatorium perfoliatum
Summary: A Facebook post which went viral in Italy suggested that "Eupatorium perfoliatum", a homeopathic treatment, has miraculous effects on COVID-19 and should therefore be used to treat patients with coronavirus. The treatment, however, has not been found by the scientific community to have effects and companies producing homeopathic treatments have in general denied their utility for treating COVID-19

Title: Sanità in Calabria, quando il nuovo commissario Zuccatelli disse: «Le mascherine non servono a un ca**o» – Il video
Narrative_Description: Claim that masks should not be considered a preventative measures against the spread of coronavirus, as they are of no use
Motive_Description: Invite people not to wear masks (claiming they are useless in the fight against the virus)
Source_Description: Giuseppe Zuccatelli (Health Commissioner for the Calabria region in Italy)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Calabria, Giuseppe Zuccatelli, Health, Commissioner, masks, useless
Summary: A video dating back to May of Italian Giuseppe Zuccatelli claiming that masks are of no use in the fight against coronavirus resurfaced in November (after he was named Health Commissioner for the Calabria region) and went viral on social media. Mr. Zuccatelli later claimed the video containing the fake news was shot at the beginning of the epidemic in Italy, but it actually dated back to May.

Title: Un amuleto contro il Coronavirus: alla Camera la surreale proposta del presidente di InnovaPuglia – Il video
Narrative_Description: Invitation to wear a medal/talisman designed in Israel that, through advanced technology, would clean the air around those who wear it and thus prevent them from being infected with coronavirus
Motive_Description: Invite people to wear a talisman to protect themselves from coronavirus (no clear profit or political intent detectable through the story)
Source_Description: Giuseppe Tiani (National Secretary of the Police Union)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Giuseppe Tiani, talisman, medal, technology, Israel, clean, air
Summary: Giuseppe Tiani, National Secretary of the Police Union in Italy, proposed to a Parliamentary Committee to have police forces wear a medal/talisman that, according to him, was designed in Israel and through technology could clean the air around people wearing it and thus protect them from coronavirus. The claim, however, was clearly nonsensical and not supported by facts

Title: HISTÓRIA SOBRE O ARROZ DANA ESTAR CONTAMINADO POR UM VÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: A WhatsApp chain that claims a brand of rice called «Dana» is contaminated with COVID-19. The rice is commercialized in Venezuela, but (according to the message) it is imported from Pakistan
Motive_Description: Get people to stop buying Venezuelan rice
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Dana, rice, Venezuela, Pakistan, UAE
Summary: A message chain claiming that a brand of rice commercialized in Venezuela is contaminated with COVID-19. The message also claims that the rice came from Pakistan, but Dana rice is imported from the United Arab Emirates. The Brazilian Health Ministry has claimed that the rice is safe for consumption and has advised not to share that message.

Title: CHÁ DE ERVA DOCE E O TRATAMENTO DO NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: A WhatsApp chain that claims making Anise tea would serve as a treatment for Coronavirus.  The message also claims that it had been used for Swine flu.
Motive_Description: Spread a false remedy
Summary: A message chain clamining that Anise tea can be used a treatment for Coronovarius. The Brazilian Health Ministry fact-checked it and advised not to share it as Anise tea has not been proven to be an effective treatment or medicine for Coronavirus.

Title: Non, le média Mbote.CD n’a pas reçu le prix de la Merck Foundation pour la sensibilisation contre le Coronavirus
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Congolese Media"Mbote.CD" has received the prize "Stay at Home" by the country's First Lady for its efforts in raising awareness in the fight against coronavirus
Motive_Description: The news was probably shared by the Congolese Mediafor publicity
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Congo, DRC, Mbote.CD, First Lady, Stay at home, prize, awareness
Summary: Congolese Media"Mbote.CD", focusing on culture, music and entertainment, claimed on Facebook that it had received the "Stay at Home" prize by the country's First Lady for efforts in raising awareness against the new coronavirus. The news was untrue, as the Mediachannel never received that prize.

Title: Aucune preuve scientifique n’atteste l’homologation de « Manacovid® » comme médicament contre la Covid-19
Primary_Country: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Narrative_Description: Press release by Luozi's Center of Pharmaceutical research claiming that "Manacovid" (an African remedy based on traditional medicine) has been approved by the Health Ministry and can be commercialized
Motive_Description: Spark national pride by claiming that a remedy based on African traditional remedy is now being marketed in the DRC
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Congo, DRC, Center, Pharmaceutical, Research, Luozi, Manacovid, treatment, traditional medicine, Africa
Summary: A press release by Luozi's Center of Pharmaceutical research announced the approval by the Congolese Ministry of Health of "Manacovid", a remedy for COVID-19 based on African medicine, claiming it would be marketed. The news was untrue.

Title: SOPA DE MORCEGO E O CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Claim that eating bat soup in China led to the first cases of Coronavirus Disease.
Motive_Description: Blame Chinese people's food and cultural pratices for the origin of coronavirus
Summary: A facebook post that claims bat soup was the cause of the first COVID-19 cases. The post itself uses a picture from 2016, and the World Health Organization has claimed that there is not enough evidence to link bat soup and coronavirus cases.

Title: FOTO DA CHINA E O NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Photo circulated on whatsapp that shows people with COVID-19 lying on the ground.
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the situation of COVID-19 in China
Summary: A whatsapp chain that claims there are several people lying on the streets of Chinese cities due to COVID-19, which implies China may not be accurately reporting the severity of the virus. In reality, the picture of people lying on the ground is from a 2016 flash mob in Germany commemorating Holocaust victims.

Title: PESQUISADORES DA UFRJ E O NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: A facebook post claiming that the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro has released information about new symptoms and methods of infection.
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the severity of COVID-19 symptopms and transmission
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Rio de Janeiro, UFRJ
Summary: Researchers at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro had found that COVID-19 may cause confussion, memory loss, among Other symptoms. This claim was false at the time because researchers at the UFRJ had not isolated the virus at the time of the post, so they had not made such claims.

Title: GOVERNO ESCONDE NÚMEROS SOBRE NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: A whatsapp chain from someone who was allegedly living in China, saying that the Chinese and Brazilian governments are hiding information. There are many closed cities, deaths (without fever), and that bat soup, along with Other "exotic foods" had caused the transmission of the virus, as well as A-H1N1.
Motive_Description: Blame the Chinese government for hiding information
Summary: False Reporting of the situation regarding the status of COVID-19 in China at the time, as well as attributing the origin of the virus to "exotic foods"

Title: PARAR O CARNAVAL POR CONTA DO NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: A whatsapp chain claiming that the Carnaval of Rio has been cancelled due to Brazil being on a red alert for COVID-19.
Motive_Description: Discourage people from attending Carnaval
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Rio de Janeiro, Carnaval
Summary: False Reporting stating that Brazil is on red alert due to COVID-19, and advises people not to go to the Rio Carnaval. The reporting was false because there were no confirmed Coronavirus cases in Brazil at the time the message chain was being spread. The health ministry had only advised handwashing and social distancing.

Title: NOTIFICAÇÃO EMERGENCIAL DO MINISTÉRIO DA SAÚDE SOBRE NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Whatsapp chain claiming that the Health Ministry has issued an emergency alert for Coronavirus, laying down several protocols and procedures. It also stated that letting one's throat dry would cause the virus to infect them, and that one should drink 30-80 mL of hot water to prevent the spread of Coronavirus.
Motive_Description: Discourage people from going outside, and encourage people to attempt (fake) remedies
Summary: False Reporting stating that the Brazilian government had issued an emergency alert as well as several procedures to avoid infection, allegedly backed by Chinese authorities. At the time of this reporting, the Ministry of Health of Brazil had not issued any alerts, and the guidelines they had issued were compliant with WHO standards (handwashing, social distancing, etc.)

Title: VITAMINA D E O NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS
Narrative_Description: Whatsapp chain claiming that taking Vitamin D grants immunity for Coronavirus
Motive_Description: Make people believe Vitamin D grants immunity to diseases such as the Coronavirus or A-H1N1
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Health Ministry, Vitamin D, remedies
Summary: False Reporting stating that Vitamin D would grant immunity for coronavirus as well as Other diseases. At the time of the reporting, there was no know treatment or remedy that would prevent infection.

Title: Couvre-feu : non, la police n'a pas lancé d'appel à la délation à Antibes
Narrative_Description: Picture of a document, supposedly coming from the police department of the town of Antibes (near the French Alps), inviting citizens to report Other citizens seen in violating the curfew
Motive_Description: Attack the police for supposedly turning the citizens one against each Other (the post were accompanied by strong criticism)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, Antibes, Police, curfew, report, citizens, violate, violation
Summary: A photomontage started circulating in France, showing a (non-existent) document by the Police Department of the Southern town of Antibes, inviting citizens to report Other citizens seen in violation of the curfew imposed by the Government

Title: Coronavirus. La Glaxo possiede Pfizer e il laboratorio di Wuhan? No! Le solite teorie di complotto
Narrative_Description: Claim that Wuhan's lab on virus research is property of Glaxo, and that Glaxo owns Pfizer, the company producing the currently used vaccine against COVID-19, accompanied by the final suggestion that the virus has been artificially designed in the lab in order to sell vaccines
Motive_Description: Attack pharmaceutical companies, Michael Soros, Matteo Renzi (Italian politician) and politicians around the world, accused of knowing about the design of the virus,
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Michael Soros, Matteo Renzi, politicians, laboratory, Wuhan, Pfizer, Glaxo, vaccine, design
Summary: A chain message was shared on Facebook in Italy, claiming that the laboratory on virus research in Wuhan is actually owned by Glaxo, a company which also owns Pfizer (the company currently producing the coronavirus vaccine). The post ended by suggesting the virus was artificially designed (with the participation of figures such as Michael Soros and Italian politician Matteo Renzi) in order to sell vaccines and make money

Title: Coronavirus. La messinscena del finto malato in pronto soccorso, un caso di disinformazione dall’estero
Narrative_Description: Claim that the virus does not exist, accompanied by a video showing a man pretending to be sick while he's caught on camera, but then turning out to be an actor
Motive_Description: Suggest the virus threat does not exist, since the epidemic is being staged
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, video, actor, emergency, fake, scene
Summary: A video was shared on Facebook in Italy as proof that the coronavirus epidemic is being staged. It showed a man pretending to be sick while he was caught on camera, but then turning out to be an actor. The original video, however, was made somewhere else than Italy and, although its nature is unclear, it was taken out of context to link it to coronavirus

Title: Le teorie di complotto sul servizio di “La vita in diretta” nel reparto Covid e il paziente senza protezioni
Narrative_Description: Claim that the new coronavirus is not as big a threat as the Mediaand institutions want to show, and that footage of a hospital department hosting positive patients that aired on an Italian TV program was largely exaggerated on purpose
Motive_Description: Suggest the virus threat is being exaggerated by mainstream media
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, video, TV, hospital, sub-intensive care, patients, positive
Summary: A video that aired on an Italian mainstream TV program was criticized on social etworks such as Twitter and Facebook, especially by conspiratory pages suggesting it was greatly exaggerating the condition of positive patients. Most of the critiques contained false claims on the video itself and on the conditions of patients testing positivie with coronavirus in hospitals

Title: Coronavirus, il vaccino di Pfizer e l’ossessione complottista per la Fondazione di Bill & Melinda Gates
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that there is some kind of conspiracy behind the creation of the coronavirus vaccine by Pfizer, involving Bill Gates and Joe Biden
Motive_Description: Attack the pharmaceutical company Pfizer, Bill and Melinda Gates and Joe Biden
Key_Words: Coronavirus, italy, USA, Bill Gates, Joe Biden, Pfizer, vaccine
Summary: A series of posts were shared on social Mediain Italy, all suggesting links between the fact that the Gates Foundation supports the pharmaceutical company Pfizer, the election of Joe Biden and the creation of the vaccine, implying that the vaccine was only created for money and is not effective, and that Mr. Gates and President Biden agreed Biden would make vaccination mandatory once in office

Title: “Bikers show up to The Walter Reed Hospital to pray for President Trump.”
Narrative_Description: Claims that Bikers are praying for Trump outside of Walter Reed Hospital
Motive_Description: Show that Trump's supporters come from diverse backgrounds
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Donald Trump, prayer, Walter Reed Hospital, Bikers
Summary: Using a video of South African bikers, a claim circulated that these bikers were praying for Trump's recovery from COVID

Title: Fact Check: The White House Doctor Did NOT Say Trump Is Virus-Free
Narrative_Description: There is no live virus in Trump
Motive_Description: Cast doubt on Trump's health
Summary: A Facebook post claims that Ttrump is not infected with COVID

Title: "Many people every year, sometimes over 100,000, and despite the vaccine, die from the flu "
Narrative_Description: Overestimates flu death rate as a justification to downplahy severity of COVID
Motive_Description: Downplay the severity of the epidemic + Politics
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Donald Trump, flu, mortality, rates
Summary: Claims from Trump that the flu has been more deadly than COVId

Title: Says Donald Trump said, “The doctors said they’ve never seen a body kill the coronavirus like my body. They tested my DNA and it wasn’t DNA. It was USA.”
Narrative_Description: Claim that Trump said that scientists didn't find DNA in his body but USA
Motive_Description: Downplay severity of COVID
Summary: Alleged quote circulated on Facebook of Trump saying that scientists found USA not DNA in his body

Title: Chris Christie is in the ICU and put on a ventilator
Narrative_Description: Claim that Chris Christie is in the ICU and on a ventilator from COVID
Motive_Description: Incite uncertainty and fear
Summary: A circulated tweet saying that Chris Christie was in the ICU and on a ventilator

Title: Democrats Want to Shut Churches Down
Narrative_Description: Claims that Democrats want to shut churches down permanently
Motive_Description: Incite fear about religious freedom and undermine Democrats
Key_Words: Coronavirus, US, Trump, Democrats, Churches, Idaho
Summary: Retweeting a September 27th tweet from Cliff Maloney in Idaho, Trump claims that Democrats want to shut down churches permanently

Title: No one under 20 has died of COVID-19, and "it has not actually been determined yet" that anyone under 20 can spread it to an older person
Narrative_Description: A Wisconsin state senator claims that nobody under the age of 20 has died from coronavirus
Motive_Description: Downplay severity so to discourage a mask mandate
Summary: In a video interview, a Wisconsin state senators claims that nobody under the age of 20 has died from coronavirus, he then later rephrases his statement to the more accurate of around 0.3%

Title: 影片宣稱「怪不得台灣人染新冠病毒人很少，現在終於找到原因了」、「澳洲的研究，香蕉的成分能有效破壞新冠病毒的組織」？
Narrative_Description: Video describes that number of peope who contract the coronavirus in Taiwan are low because Australia discovered that bananas can kill COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spread that Taiwan's number of COVID-19 are low due to bananas can kill COVID-19
Summary: A video circulated online whose subtitles read ‘Australian research has proven that bananas can kill COVID-19’

Title: 圖片宣稱「川普說：醫生們從來沒有見過一個人的身體像我這樣，能夠如此迅速地殺死新冠病毒。他們檢查了我的DNA，發現那不是DNA，而是USA」?
Narrative_Description: A subtitled image of U.S. president Trump circulated online with words supposedly from Trump which read “The doctor said they’ve never seen a body kill the coronavirus like my body. They tested my DNA and it’ wasn’t DNA. It was USA.”
Motive_Description: Spread rumors that what kills COVID-19 is not a person's DNA but USA
Summary: A subtitled image of U.S. president Trump circulated online with words supposedly from Trump which read “The doctor said they’ve never seen a body kill the coronavirus like my body. They tested my DNA and it’ wasn’t DNA. It was USA.”

Title: 網傳「川普被發現背著便攜式氧氣背包」？
Narrative_Description: Images spread rumors that U.S. president Trump uses an oxygen tank backpack
Motive_Description: Spread fear that Trump is using an oxygen tank
Summary: Several images purport to show U.S. president Trump carrying an oxygen tank backpack.

Title: 網傳「長庚醫院朋友傳來...北榮的院長、台大的院長、亞東的急診主任說最近的數值怪怪的，出門在外最好口罩帶著，警覺性要提升至一、二月時的態度...」？
Narrative_Description: Posts on social Mediaclaim that several presidents of Taiwanese hospitals have warned to keep up vigilance and wear masks due to some uncommon data
Motive_Description: Spread fear to wear masks due to uncommon data ab
Summary: Posts claim that several presidents of Taiwanese hospitals have warned to wear masks due to some uncommon data that the coronavirus spreads when temperature raises higher than 20 degrees

Title: 訊息指稱「平常沒事口罩不要戴，戴了血液酸化造成心血管病，然後肺炎細菌叢生超高」？
Narrative_Description: Posts say that wearing face masks leads to acidemia and cardiovascular disease
Motive_Description: Spread fear that wearing face masks leads to acidemia and cardiovascular disease
Summary: Posts say that wearing face masks leads to acidemia and cardiovascular disease

Title: 網傳「台灣研發中藥清冠一號，飲片：每日1劑，1000 cc水煎成300cc藥汁...」？
Narrative_Description: Post says that Chinese medicine‘Qing Guan No.1’ which is developed by Taiwan can cure COVID-19
Motive_Description: Claim that a medicine developed by Taiwan called Qing Guan No. 1 can cure the coronavirus
Summary: A post reveals the formula of Chinese medicine‘Qing Guan No.1’which is developed by Taiwan to cure COVID-19

Title: VÍDEO - VITAMINA D E A PREVENÇÃO DO NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Facebook Video with stating that Vitamin D would gran immunity from Coronavirus
Motive_Description: Make people believe that Vitamin D will grant them immunity.
Summary: False Reporting stating that Vitamin D would grant immunity for coronavirus as well as Other diseases. At the time of the reporting, there was no know treatment or remedy that would prevent infection.

Title: 澳门正追寻一名来自大连的身体不适人士？谣言
Narrative_Description: Macau is looking for an unwell person from Dalian? rumor
Motive_Description: Claims Macau is searching for a person from Dalian
Summary: Rumors spread online that Macau is finding someone from Dalian

Title: 网传“301医院出现疫情，100余小区被封”？北京海淀回应来了
Narrative_Description: It is reported on the Internet that "the 301 hospital has an epidemic, and more than 100 communities have been closed" Beijing Haidian responded
Motive_Description: Undermines China's hospital system
Summary: Rumors spread online that 301 hospitals has an epidemic and more than 100 communities have been closed

Title: Video of former China CDC director criticising China-made vaccines in 2010 is recirculated in misleading social Mediaposts
Narrative_Description: A news clip has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Twitter in December 2020 alongside a claim it shows the former Director of the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention (China CDC) criticising the quality of China-made vaccines.
Motive_Description: Undermines vaccines that China made
Key_Words: Coronavirus, China, vaccine, Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention
Summary: A news clip has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Twitter in December 2020 alongside a claim it shows the former Director of the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention (China CDC) criticising the quality of China-made vaccines.

Title: Korean social Mediaposts share false claim that drinking pepper stem tea can prevent or cure Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook claim that drinking tea made with pepper stems is effective in preventing or curing Covid-19.
Motive_Description: Claims that drinking tea with pepper stems can help cure the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Korea, tea, pepper, stem, prevent
Summary: Korean social Mediaposts share false claim that drinking pepper stem tea can prevent or cure Covid-19

Title: Old photo of South Korean president’s son shared alongside misleading mask claim
Narrative_Description: A photo of South Korean President Moon Jae-in’s son has been shared repeatedly in multiple posts on Facebook in December 2020 alongside a claim that it shows him violating social distancing measures by attending an art exhibition without wearing a mask.
Motive_Description: Undermines South Korean President Moon Jae-in’s son
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South Korean President Moon Jae-in, son, social distancing
Summary: Old photo of South Korean president’s son shared alongside misleading mask claim

Title: This video shares a misleading claim from an Austrian politician that 'Coca-Cola tested positive for Covid-19'
Narrative_Description: A video of an Austrian politician purporting to show that a glass of Coca-Cola tested positive for Covid-19 in a rapid antigen test has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. T
Motive_Description: Claims a glass of coca cola can test positive for the virus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, coca cola, glass, positive, rapid, antigen, testing
Summary: A video of an Austrian politician purporting to show that a glass of Coca-Cola tested positive for Covid-19 in a rapid antigen test has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

Title: Social Mediaposts share false claim that South Korea’s Covid-19 frontline workers are paid $13 daily wage
Narrative_Description: Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook claim that South Korean frontline health workers are paid US $13.35 (14,600 South Korean won) per day during the coronavirus pandemic.
Motive_Description: Claims South Korean frontline workers are paid $13.35
Summary: Social Mediaposts share false claim that South Korea’s Covid-19 frontline workers are paid $13 daily wage

Title: Pelosi, Pence did not fake Covid-19 vaccinations using capped needles
Narrative_Description: Social Mediaposts claim US Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi and US Vice President Mike Pence pretended to receive Covid-19 vaccines using syringes that had caps over the needles. T
Motive_Description: Undermines leading American politicans
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Pence, Pelosi, syringes, vaccine, cap
Summary: Social Mediaposts claim US Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi and US Vice President Mike Pence pretended to receive Covid-19 vaccines using syringes that had caps over the needles.

Title: FEIRA DOS IMPORTADOS EM BRASÍLIA E NOVO CORONAVÍRUS
Narrative_Description: Claim that two Chinese workers in a shopping mall in Brasilia ("Feira dos Importados") have been infected with Coronavirus.
Motive_Description: Spreading fear against local Chinese-owned businesses in Brasilia
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Brasilia, Feira dos Importados, Chinese
Summary: Whatsapp chain claiming that two Chinese workers/vendors in a shopping mall in Brazil's capital (Brasilia) have tested positive for COVID-19. They were excluded from the count of cases because they did not fit WHO criteria. At the moment of the reporting, there were zero coronavirus cases reported in Brazil.

Title: MÉDICO FALANDO SOBRE PREVENÇÃO DO NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Claim, supported by a "Chinese doctor", that one could improve their immune system against COVID-19 by consuming Vitamins C&D, drinking special teas, and inhaling steam.
Motive_Description: Claim that fake remedies could improve one's immune system.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, China, Vitamin D, Vitamin C, Steam
Summary: Whatsapp chain sharing a video of an alleged doctor from China stating that taking Vitamins, drinking tea and inhaling steam would cause one's body to gain immunity against coronavirus. However, the source is not reliable, and at the time no medical organization had found that taking those measures cuould prevent infection or severe symptoms.

Title: CARNAVAL SERÁ PORTA DE ENTRADA PARA O NOVO CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Carnaval of Rio will be the "gate" for coronavirus to enter Brazil. It also states guidelines regarding how to prevent it.
Motive_Description: Claim that the carnaval will have great impact in the number of cases of COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Brazil, Carnaval, Rio de Janeiro
Summary: Whatsapp chain reporting that the carnaval will bring Brazil's COVID-19 cases up and discouraging people from attending. At the time of the reporting, there were zero confirmed cases in Brazil.

Title: Coronavirus. Un tribunale portoghese ha reso inaffidabili i tamponi e la quarantena illegale? Non è così!
Narrative_Description: Claim that a Court in Portugal has established that PCR tests are unreliable when it comes to detecting the new coronavirus, and that quarantine measure based on test results are unlawful
Motive_Description: Question the credibility of government's lockdown measures, and more in general of the use of PCR tests
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Portugal, Italy, ruling, Court, PCR tests, results, quarantine, illegal
Summary: The news spread in Italy on social media, after the release of an article, that a Court in Portugal had established the unreliability of PCR tests when it comes to detecting the new coronavirus, and that quarantine measure based on test results had therefore become unlawful there. The rumors suggested this could consitute an important legal precedent for Other countries as well, but the actual ruling by the Portuguese Court simply questioned a specific instance of PCR tests not carried out by medical stuff and with results presented without the proper documentation.

Title: Coronavirus, questa è la foto della famiglia turca dello «scopritore» del vaccino Pfizer? Non risulta!
Narrative_Description: Picture of a family of Turkish migrants in Germany, accompanied by the claim that they're the family of Ugur Sahin, one of the researchers responsible for finding the coronavirus vaccine now being produced by Pfizer
Motive_Description: The authors claimed the false statement was shared by mistake and corrected it. Nonetheless the original intent was to criticize right-wing parties and accuse them of racism
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Pfizer, Germany, Turkish, migrants, Ugur Sahin, vaccine
Summary: Several Facebook pages in Italy, mainly led by political activists criticizing right-wing parties and accusing them of racism, started posting the picture of a family of Turkish migrants in Germany, accompanied by the claim that they were the family of Ugur Sahin, one of the researchers responsible for finding the coronavirus vaccine now being produced by Pfizer. The photo, however, had nothing to do with Dr. Sahin.

Title: Coronavirus. Paziente intubato ad Asti salvato da un’associazione? La disinformazione contro i medici
Narrative_Description: Claim that the new coronavirus is not as dangerous as people believe, and that this is proved by the fact that a patient entering in a hospital in the Italian town of Asti was forcibly led to the intensive care even though he was well and was later "saved" by a local NGO that "freed" him from the hospital
Motive_Description: Suggest the virus threat is being greatly exaggerated
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Rinascimento Italia, intensive care, hospital, doctors, patient, force
Summary: The Italian NGO "Rinascimento Italia" claimed that a patient entering a hospital in the Italian town of Asti was forcibly led to the intensive care unit, supposedly because he was infected with coronavirus, even though he was well and was later "saved" by the NGO that intervened through its lawyers and "freed" him from the hospital. The doctors later clarified that after medical analysis, it was clear the patient did not need intensive care and was never carried to that unit of the hospital

Title: Coronavirus. Il video «Trova il negazionista» e il paragone tra Covid19 e le influenze stagionali passate
Narrative_Description: Claim that the new coronavirus is actually comparable to common flu and that its threat is being greatly exaggerated
Motive_Description: Suggest the virus threat is being greatly exaggerated
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, influenza, threat, exaggerate, Silver Nervuti
Summary: Italian YouTuber Silver Nervuti, already known for several videos denying the threat posed by the new coronavirus, released a new YouTube video where he showed newspaper articles dating back to the years before 2020 and discussing the gravity of past influenza epidemic, and using them as evidence that 2020's epidemic is just anOther influenza epidemic and that the threat posed by coronavirus is being greatly exaggerated

Title: L’origine della bufala di Lilli Gruber e Giuseppe Conte senza mascherina e le accuse infondate della Lega
Narrative_Description: Picture of Italian journalist and TV Presenter Lilli Gruber, together with PM Giuseppe Conte, shaking hands wile standing in close proximity to each Other, supposedly in blatant violation of social distancing measures implemented by the Government
Motive_Description: The picture was shared by several Facebook pages supporting right-wing parties in Italy (especially the League) with the intent of discrediting journalist Lilli Gruber and PM Giuseppe Conte
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Prime Minister, Giuseppe Conte, Lilli Gruber, Journalist, picture, social distancing, violation, handshake
Summary: A picture of Italian journalist and TV Presenter Lilli Gruber, together with PM Giuseppe Conte, shaking hands wile standing in close proximity to each Other, was taken out of context (it dated back to before the epidemic) to claim the couple was blatantly violatinge the social distancing measures implemented by the Government. Mrs. Gruber later exposed the fake news and announced legal action against those responsible.

Title: Coronavirus. Il video di Margaret Keenan e il vaccino Pfizer è di ottobre 2020? No, non è una crisis actor
Narrative_Description: The screenshots of a CCN article dating back to October, but showing pictures of Margaret Keenan (the first woman to receive the vaccine in the UK in December), were used as evidence that Mrs. Keenan did not actually receive the coronavirus vaccine
Motive_Description: Support no-vax movements and suggest that the vaccination campaign has not really started
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, UK, Margaret Keenan, vaccine, campaign
Summary: Screenshots of an article by CNN dating back to October 2020, but showing a video of Margareth Keenan receiving the vaccine in the UK (which happened in December 2020) were used as evidence in Italy to claim that the vaccination campaign did not really start and that it was staged, as part of some obscure conspiracy. The issue, however, was simply due to a misdating of the article on the CNN website.

Title: Coronavirus. Hanno ucciso i pazienti italiani per espiantare i loro organi? La nuova teoria del complotto
Narrative_Description: Claim that the virus does not exist, and that the people that were delcared dead because of COVID-19 were actually killed to take their organs and export them
Motive_Description: Undermine the government's authority by accusing it of voluntarily staging an epidemic and killing people to sell their organs
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, epidemic, staged, kill, people, bodies, organs, export
Summary: A particularly bleak conspiracy theory surfaced in Italy on a Facebook page affiliated to the QAnon conspiracy theory: it suggested that the government had voluntarily staged the coronavirus epidemic in order to kill people (and declaring the deaths linked to COVID-19) and then export their organs. The claims are fabricated, and the videos used to prove them date back to at least 2014.

Title: Coronavirus. Il Governo compra TV e Radio con 50 milioni di euro per parlare di contagi? No!
Narrative_Description: Claim that the government has destined 50 Million euros to buying Italian radio channels in order to force them to "talk about coronavirus"
Motive_Description: Undermine the Italian Government's authority by claiming it is undermining freedom of information in Italy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Government, radio, channels, buy, 50 million euros, messages
Summary: The news spread in Italy that the government had spent 50 Million euros to buy Italian radio channels in order to force them to "talk about coronavirus" in April, at the peak of the first wave of the epidemic. While the Government had spent 50 million euros, it dind't buy any channel, but rather used the funds to help local radio channels that were struggling because of the epidemic and also asked them to launch messages about social distancing and the use of masks, if they were to receive the funds

Title: Fact Check: White House Doctors Have NOT Said Trump Recovered From COVID In Four Days
Narrative_Description: Claims that Trump got well from COVID in four days
Motive_Description: Undermine Trump's privileges
Summary: A Facebook post claims that Trump has recovered from COVID in only four days

Title: La OMS dijo que “no hay solución y quizás nunca la haya” para el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Mistranslation of a statement by Tedros Adhanom, director of WHO, to say that there would never be a solution to COVID-19
Motive_Description: Claim that vaccine efforts may not be able to stop the virus
Summary: Several LATAM Mediaoutlets shared an incorrect translation of a remark made by WHO director Tedros Adhanom in which he stated that a vaccine was not a 'silver bullet.' However, it was translated to say that there would never be a solution to COVID-19 and that the vaccine efforts were irrelevant.

Title: Клятва верности несуществующей вакцине: Зеленский отказал Украине в защите от COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Zelensky denied Ukraine protection from COVID-19
Motive_Description: Undermine Ukraine and Zelensky
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Ukraine, Zelensky, Russia, Russophobia, Western vaccine, Sputnik V
Summary: Ukrainians are dissapointed that President Zelensky is refusing the Russian vaccine, but Russia wants to help Ukraine. Ukrainians are used to the failures, so they are ordering vaccines directly from Russia.

Title: Desde ratones hasta alpacas: el aporte de los animales en la búsqueda de una vacuna
Narrative_Description: Claims that vaccine developers have been using numerous animals in efficacy trials and that thousands of these have subsequently died
Motive_Description: Claim that animal rights are being disregarded at the expense of searching for a vaccine
Summary: Article claiming that vaccine developers have been using thousands of animals, including alpacas and pigs, as trial pacients to test COVID-19 vaccines at the expense of the animal rights and ethical regulations, with many animals dying as a result of such work

Title: Detector: No, no se ha probado que el interferon cure el covid
Narrative_Description: Facebook video claims that interferon is a proven cure for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Claim that interferon cures COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, interferon, Colombia, cure, Nariño, Julio César Klinger, Jhon Rojas
Summary: A video spread throughout Facebook in which it claimed that a local Colombian doctor had discovered a cure to COVID-19 which was said to be an interferon mixture. The video shows Dr Julio César Klinger, the Governor of Nariño Jhon Rojas, and the mayor of Barbacoas Adams Rincón explaining how the treatment works even though no studies have proven that interferon can indeed cure COVID.

Title: Detector a publicación falsa sobre protestas en Berlín por el COVID
Narrative_Description: Picture of protests in Berlin against government lockdowns along with post that states that information is being manipulated by officials and that there is a cure
Motive_Description: Question lockdown policies and claim there is a cure
Key_Words: Coronavirus, lockdowns, cure, Bill Gates, protest, hydroxychloroquine, zinc, azithromycin
Summary: Shows a picture of protests against lockdown policies in Berlin that did actually occur (but the amount of people present is exaggerated) and urges for Others to join. Claims that government officials and Others such as Bill Gates are manipulating data and censuring those who are trying to share information about a cure which already exists. The cures are said to be hydroxychloroquine, zinc, and azithromycin although this has not been proven.

Title: No ha sido probada le efectividad de las recetas que comparte esta imagen
Narrative_Description: Facebook post shares a recipe that claims to help cure COVID-19
Motive_Description: Claim that mixture of aspirin, lemons, and hot water will cure one of COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, cure, Colombia, recipe, aspirin, lemon
Summary: A photo of a recipe claiming that aspirin, lemons, and hot water can be used as a cure to COVID-10 was quickly shared throughout Facebook and later through WhatsApp chain messages. These items have not yet been proven to help cure COVID-19.

Title: Coronavirus. Il certificato medico contro l’uso delle mascherine ricco di disinformazione
Narrative_Description: Claim that masks cause a series of respiratory problems and increase the risk of Other diseases, including cancer
Motive_Description: Criticize the government for implementing mandatory mask wearing in public
Source_Description: Cesare Sacchetti (Italian Journalist) and Roberto Santi (Doctor)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy mask, wear, public, respiratory, breathe, cancer
Summary: A medical certificate signed by Italian doctor Roberto Santi went viral on social Mediathrough posts and tweets (including by Journalist Cesare Sacchetti, already known for no-mask positions): it exempted a woman from wearing a mask in public, claiming that masks cause a series of respiratory problems and increase the risk of Other diseases, including cancer

Title: Coronavirus. Dietro ai vaccini Covid-19 ci sono i feti abortiti? Facciamo il punto sulla disinformazione
Narrative_Description: Claim that behind research for the new coronavirus vaccine there is a traffic of aborted foetuses, and that parts of DNA might contaminate the vaccine, and those who receive it
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the new vaccine might be dangerous and that there might be some obscure traffic behind it
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, vaccine, aborted, foetus, DNA, traffic
Summary: In an article on the Italian newspaper "Panorama", journalist Francesca Romana Poleggi claimed not to support no-vax positions, all the while suggesting that behind research for the new coronavirus vaccine there is a traffic of aborted foetuses, and that parts of DNA might contaminate the vaccine and those who receive it. None of this is true

Title: Coronavirus. In 30 anni nessun vaccino per l’Hiv e in un anno è pronto quello per la Covid19? Ecco perché
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that the fact that the new coronavirus vaccine was created in just one year and that in over 30 years no vaccine against HIV has been found is strange, and that probably some kind of conspiracy is going on
Motive_Description: Support no-vax movements and spread distrust towards the new vaccine
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, vaccine, HIV, AIDS, cure, discover, 30 years
Summary: A post by Italian journalist Gianluigi Nuzzi went viral on Facebook: it suggested that the fact that the new coronavirus vaccine was created in just one year and that in over 30 years no vaccine against HIV has been found is strange, and that probably some kind of conspiracy is going on and the coronavirus vaccine is not to be trusted. However, the differences between the two viruses make this comparison absurd.

Title: Coronavirus. Il vaccino sperimentale Moderna provoca una vittima ed è un sacerdote? No!
Narrative_Description: Claim that there exists a link between the death of a priest who was participating to the experimental phase of the Moderna coronavirus vaccine in the US and the vaccine itself (which is therefore potentially dangerous)
Motive_Description: Support no-vax movements and spread distrust towards the new vaccine
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, USA, vaccine, Moderna, priest, experimentation, phase, die, death, Philadelphia
Summary: Several websites in Italy discussed a non-existent link between the death of a priest who was participating to the experimental phase of the Moderna coronavirus vaccine and the vaccine itself (the priest had actually died of cardiac arrest, which had nothing to do with the vaccine)

Title: Coronavirus. Le false prove usate per sostenere la «morte» dell’infermiera svenuta dopo il vaccino Pfizer
Narrative_Description: Claim that Tiffany Pontes Dover, a nurse who was seen fainting in a viral video after receiving the coronavirus vaccine, had died shortly afterwards
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the new coronavirus vaccine might even lead to death
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, UK, Tiffany Pontes Dover, nurse, faint, video, die, death. vaccine
Summary: The news of the death of Tiffany Pontes Dover (a nurse who was seen fainting after receiving the coronavirus vaccine in a video that quickly went viral on social media) started circulating on Facebook in Italy, but also in English-speaking countries. While her death was attributed to the dangers of the vaccine, the nurse is alive.

Title: Coronavirus. La burla del bonus «Io resto a casa» da 120, 150 o 250 euro al giorno per Natale e Capodanno
Narrative_Description: Claim that the government will give a bonus of 150 euros (or 250, depending on the version) to those who stay at home for Christmas
Motive_Description: The news was initially spread as a prank
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, government, measure, bonus, 150, 250, euros, stay at home, Christmas
Summary: A prank which went viral on social media, suggesting the government would give a bonus of 150 euros (or 250, depending on the version) to those who would remain at home for Christmas, was believed to be true by many. No such measure was ever implemented in Italy

Title: Coronavirus. Le foto dei camion a Bergamo erano una fake news? Le dichiarazioni della consigliera leghista
Narrative_Description: Claim that the dramatic pictures of lorries bringing coffins away from the Italian city of Bergamo circulating on social Mediain April were fake
Motive_Description: Downplay the severity of the epidemic and of the consequences it had back during the first wave
Source_Description: Eleonora Lencini (city council member in Tuscany for the League)
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Bergamo, Eleonora Lencini, League, coffins, Bergamo, first wave, epidemic
Summary: During a speech, the member of a city council in Tuscany, Eleonora Lencini (from the League) declared that the pictures of lorries carrying coffins away from the Italian city of Bergamo in April were fake news. However, the photos were true and were not manipulated.

Title: Son falsas las afirmaciones de un nuevo video del grupo Médicos por la Verdad
Narrative_Description: Claim that COVID-19 has always existed and that it was genetically created in a lab
Motive_Description: Suggest that coronavirus is a normal occurrence and that officials are stoking fear
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, Chinda Brandolino, Médicos por la Verdad, chlorine dioxide
Summary: In a Facebook video, Chinda Brandolino of the group Médicos por la Verdad claimed that coronavirus has always existed and that it was actually created in a lab suggesting that social distancing measures are not effective; argues that COVID-19 is cured by chlorine dioxide and that PCR tests give 50% false positive results.

Title: Ministerio de Educación no reanudará clases el 7 de septiembre
Narrative_Description: Claim that Guatemala's Ministry of Education had announced a return to in-person classes when it had not done so
Motive_Description: Digital security experts belive the false information was spread as spam
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Guatemala, Ministry of Education, schools, lockdowns
Summary: A Facebook post spread throughout social Mediain which it stated that the Ministry of Education of Guatemala had officially decided to re-open schools to in person learning as of September 2020. Government officials have said that virtual learning would continue for the rest of the year.

Title: Es falso afirmar que en Estados Unidos admitieron que sólo un 6% de las muertes informadas fueron "realmente" por coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claim that the CDC admitted that only 6% of reported deaths were actually caused by coronavirus
Motive_Description: Suggest that the amount of deaths was being exaggerated
Summary: Several people shared an article from TierraPura.org which mislead readers by stating that the CDC had released a report admitting that only 6% of US reported deaths were caused by COVID-19. The report actually remarked that 6% of deaths were caused exclusively by coronavirus.

Title: Es engañosa la publicación con una ilustración del artista italiano Walter Molino
Narrative_Description: Facebook post of a painting by Walter Molino from 1962 which features people in individual cars and states that the title of this work was "Life in 2022"
Motive_Description: Suggest that the coronavirus pandemic was predicted by artist  Walter Molino
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, Walter Molino, art, Italy
Summary: In a Facebook post, an image of a 1962 painting done by Walter Molino in which people are depicted in individualized cars was said to be titled "Life in 2022" suggesting that Molino had predicted the COVID-19 epidemic. However, the image was cropped to remove the description from the original magazine publication which said that Molino had depicted a future solution to traffic issues and that it made no reference to 2022.

Title: Twitter removed this tweet from Donald Trump: “My blood IS the vaccine!!!!!”
Narrative_Description: Claim that Donald Trump's blood is the COVID vaccine
Motive_Description: Undermine Trump
Summary: A fake Donald Trump tweet circualated on Facebook saying that Twitter removed a tweet saying that the vaccine was Trump's blood

Title: Says Kamala Harris said, “The American people aren’t equipped to make these decisions for themselves.”
Narrative_Description: Kamala Harris said that Americans cannot make their own decisions
Motive_Description: Undermine Kamala Harris
Key_Words: Coronavirus, facebook, Kamala Harris, debate, Pence
Summary: A false summary claims that Harris wants to take away freedom, by saying that Americans can't take care of themselves

Title: Es falsa la cadena viral que indica que una vacuna contra el COVID-19 genera un "daño genético irreversible"
Narrative_Description: Post claimed to be from Robert F. Kennedy Jr. in which it states that the mRNA vaccines can cause irreversible damage to one's genetic makeup
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the coronavirus vaccines are dangerous and can lead to genetic damage
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., mRNA vaccines
Summary: A post said to be from Robert F. Kennedy Jr. circulated on social Mediain which it stated that the mRNA vaccines against COVID-19 can cause genetic damage and lead to Down syndrome, Turners, etc; Robert F. Kennedy Jr. did not share the message and multiple health experts have stated the mRNA vaccines are safe.

Title: Es falso que los protagonistas de la quema de barbijos en el Obelisco militan en La Cámpora
Narrative_Description: Claim that two members of an anti-lockdown protest are militants of the political group La Campora
Motive_Description: Suggest that anti-lockdown protest are being infiltrated by La Campora at the order of its secretary general and the Minister of Community Development of Buenos Aires Province, Andrés Larroque
Key_Words: Coronavirus, La Campora, Andrés Larroque, protests, lockdown, militants
Summary: A social Mediapost claimed that two individuals at an anti-lockdown protest that burned masks were actually militants from the left-leaning political group La Campora and that they were ordered to go to the event by the group's secretary general and the Minister of Community Development of Buenos Aires Province, Andrés Larroque. The individuals identified are not associated with La Campora and Andrés Larroque denied that they were directed to go to the event.

Title: No, no hay un plan diseñado para el COVID-19 desde 2017 en documentos del Banco Mundial
Narrative_Description: Claim that COVID-19 had been planned since 2017 according to documents from the World Bank and that it would end in 2025
Motive_Description: Suggest that the pandemic had been a planned event by numerous countries and international agencies
Key_Words: Coronavirus, World Bank, World Health Organization, World Customs Organization, World Integrated Trade Solution, conspiracy
Summary: A post circulated on social Mediawhich showed screenshots from the World Integrated Trade Solution (WITS)'s website with information about the trade of COVID-19 test kits worldwide. These kits were placed under the column 'HS 2017' which led many to conclude that several countries had known about coronavirus since 2017 and that the pandemic had been planned. WITS, a World Bank initiative, and the World Heath Organization clarified that the equipment had been in place for years, but that it was not until April 2020 that it was distributed solely for COVID-19 purposes. In addition, these social Mediaposts also shared the World Bank's published strategy to combate the virus stating that it outlined a plan to have COVID-19 spread until 2025; this date was meant to be the deadline by which the World Bank expected its coronavirus efforts end.

Title: Says Dr. Anthony Fauci said of Trump’s pandemic response, “I can’t imagine that … anybody could be doing more.”
Narrative_Description: Out of context quote of Fauci essentially saying that Trump was doing the best he could
Motive_Description: Used to elevate Trump's image
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Anthony Fauci, Trump, task force, response
Summary: An out of context quote from Fauci in a Trump campaign ad has Fauci saying ""I can’t imagine that … anybody could be doing more" but he was referring to the task force, not Trump himself

Title: In May, Wisconsin had its own test of mask effectiveness, when "we went from masks, to no masks, and there (was) no significant difference in cases."
Narrative_Description: Undermine mask mandates in Wisconsin, which didn't actually exist on a state-wide level in Wisconsin until August
Motive_Description: Undermine those who want mask mandates
Summary: In a news interview, a Wisconsin state senator claims that the effectiveness of masks was disproven in May in Wisconsin when a mask order was struck down

Title: Il Tribunale Civile di Roma rende illegittimi i Dpcm? Non funziona così
Narrative_Description: Claims that the Italian Government's decrees enforcing a national lockdown were declared illegal and unconstitutional by a Court in Rome
Motive_Description: Undermine the Italian government's authority by claiming its decrees during the epidemic are unconstitutional and therefore void
Source_Description: Italian newspaper "Libero", "Il Giornale" and news website "AffariItaliani.it"
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Government, decree, Prime Minister, PM, Giuseppe Conte, unconstitutional, illegal, Court
Summary: Some newspaper and news websites in Italy reported the news that the Decrees issued by the Government and enforcing national lockdown had been declared "illegal" and "unconstitutional" by a Court in Rome. The ruling by the Court, however, concerned something different and in any case, the only Court to have the power of declaring a law unconstitutional is the Italian Constitutional Court

Title: Coronavirus. Lo schema del nanochip 5G del vaccino Pfizer scoperto dai russi? I complottisti se le suonano
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that a microchip will be put into people's bodies when receiving the vaccine (with a picture of the supposed microchip itself)
Motive_Description: Spark fear that the coronavirus vaccine will be used as an excuse to put a microchip into people's bodies and control them
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Russians, pedal, electric guitar, microchip, vaccine, bodies
Summary: The picture showing the workings of a pedal for an electric guitar went viral on social Mediain Italy, among suggestions it was actually showing the microchip that would be inserted into people's bodies when receiving the vaccine. The posts also suggested "the Russians" had made the discovery.

Title: Coronavirus. Anche il kiwi positivo alla Covid19? Lo strano esperimento sui tamponi rapidi che disinforma
Narrative_Description: Video suggesting that quick swab tests for coronavirus are the cause official coronavirus statistics have gone up, as they are no effective diagnosis procedure and seem to detect coronavirus on everything (even kiwis, since an experiment on a kiwi is carried out in the video)
Motive_Description: Claim that the coronavirus epidemic is not as serious as it seems, given that test are unreliable to and tend to overdetect it
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, quick, swab, test, unreliable, statistics, kiwi
Summary: A video on YouTube showing that a quick swab test gave a positive results when carried out on a kiwi was used to claim that the official coronavirus statistics have gone up since this kind of tests are unreliable and are being used to count the official number of people testing positive. This is not true as in Italy only PCR tests are used official statistics, and it is actually well known that test results are unreliable when not performed on people but, for instance, on fruit such as that in the video

Title: Coronavirus. La falsa confezione del vaccino Pfizer «Made in China»
Narrative_Description: Picture of a package supposedly containing the coronavirus vaccine, with the sign "made in China"
Motive_Description: The picture was initially spread as a prank, but was then believed by many to be true
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Pfizer, vaccine, made in China, prank
Summary: The picture of a pharmaceutical by Pfizer was photoshopped so that it carried the signs "Coronavirus Vaccine" and "made in China" and was spread on social Mediainitially as a prank. It was, however, believed by many to be true among criticism towards the company

Title: Coronavirus, il trasporto del vaccino Pfizer con delle scatole di cartone è una farsa? No, ecco perché
Narrative_Description: Claims that the vaccination campaign is a scam, as it was said that the vaccine had to be conserved at -80 degrees Celsius, while videos show healthcare workers carrying it in cardboard boxes
Motive_Description: Criticize pharmaceutical companies, institutions and political leaders for supposedly lying to citizen about the vaccination campaign, as part of some kind of conspiracy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Italy, Pfizer, vaccine, -80 degrees Celsius, cardboard, boxes, vaccination, campaign
Summary: Several Facebook posts with pictures or videos went viral in Italy: they claimed the vaccination campaign is a scam, as it was said that the vaccine had to be conserved at about -80 degrees Celsius, while the videos show healthcare workers carrying it in cardboard boxes. The boxes, however, are made in a special termic cardboard that can keep temperatures at up to -70 degrees for transportation.

Title: Ce reportage ne montre pas un homme faire un malaise après un vaccin contre le Covid-19
Narrative_Description: Video showing a man fainting in a hospital, accompanied by the suggestion he had just received the new coronavirus vaccine
Motive_Description: Spark fear that the new coronavirus vaccine is dangerous
Key_Words: Coronavirus, France, hospital man, faint, vaccine, simulation
Summary: A video went viral on social Mediain France: it showed a man fainting in a hospital and was accompanied by claims he had just received the new coronavirus vaccine and was suffering the consequences. The man, however, was simply taking part in a simulation in the hospital in view of the future vaccination campaign, and was pretending to faint as part of the simulation

Title: Es falso que el decreto que establece la cuarentena fuera planeado para durar 1 año
Narrative_Description: Claim that pandemic was planned and that government officials directed that lockdowns should be in place for a year
Motive_Description: Undermine Argentinian government and the credibility of lockdown procedures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, lockdown, laws, health emergency
Summary: A post spread on Facebook which shows a picture of a decree from the Argentine government and claims that it ordered a lockdown for an entire year as of March 2020, also suggesting that the coronavirus pandemic was planned. Although the decree depicted was real, it actually stated that COVID-19 would be a public health emergency for a year.

Title: Pichetto: "Al año se te mueren 20 mil personas por neumonía, sin COVID"
Narrative_Description: Interview with Miguel Ángel Pichetto where he compares COVID-19 death rates to that of pneumonia
Motive_Description: Suggest that coronavirus less dangerous than Other common diseases and that lockdown procedures are an exaggerated response
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, Miguel Ángel Pichetto, pneumonia, lockdowns, death rate
Summary: Former Argentine senator and vice-presidential candidate for Juntos por el Cambio Miguel Ángel Pichotte gave an interview with RM where he compared the minimal coronavirus death rates to the 20 million from pneumonia in order to make a point that the lockdown procedures were not worth it as they led to unemployment. Health officials have stated that it is premature to compare COVID death rates with that of Other diseases.

Title: Son falsas las declaraciones de la doctora Madrid sobre la vacuna contra el COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that mRNA vaccines modify one's genetic material and that the vaccine is part of a plot (that Bill Gates is a part of) to kill members of the population; COVID is easily treated with chlorine dioxide and is not lethal
Motive_Description: Spread fear that vaccines are harmful and that the coronavirus is part of a conspiracy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Bill Gates, mRNA vaccine, chlorine dioxide, Argentina, Karina Sarno, Lucila Madrid
Summary: Karina Sarno (pseodonym is Lucila Madrid) who claims to be a health expert posted a video on Facebook saying that mRNA vaccines are harmful and can modify one's genetic material, suggesting that they are part of a plot (which Bill Gates is a part of) to reduce the world population. She also claims that COVID-19 is not as lethal as it is being made out to be and that it can be cured by chlorine dioxide.

Title: Es falso que Alberto Fernandéz dijo: "Con Macri hubiésemos tenid0 10 mil muertos por coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Picture that claimed President of Argentina Alberto Fernandéz had said that if former President Mauricio Macri were in charge there would be 10,000 deaths in Argentina which was posted alongside the then death toll of 11,000
Motive_Description: Undermine pandemic response of President Alberto Fernandéz
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Alberto Fernandéz, Mauricio Macri, death toll
Summary: A September 2020 post shared a picture with a quote from President Alberto Fernendéz where he said that if former President Mauricio Macri was still in office, there would be 10,000 deaths which was shared alongside the then death toll in Argentina of 12,000 which suggested that Fernandéz was faliing in the pandemic response. However, the actual quote made no mention of Macri but instead said that if Argentina had followed Brazil its death toll would have been 10,000. This was said on June 26, 2020 when Argentina's death toll was still only 1,184.

Title: Es falso que el Gobierno boliviano haya publicado una receta para eliminar de forma definitiva el nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Post that claims to be from the Bolivian government which details a recipe with would completely eliminate the coronavirus from one's body
Motive_Description: Suggest that the Bolivian government has developed a cure
Summary: Images were shared on WhatsApp which claimed to be official documents from Bolivia's government health experts and detailed a recipe that would completely eliminate coronavirus from one's body. The Bolivian government has released a statement stating that the documents did not come from any official source and that the ingredients mentions have not been proven to treat the disease.

Title: Es falso que la Argentina ya tenga la vacuna contra el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claim that Argentina has already developed a vaccine in a post with a video of a health export which at no point says that a vaccine has been made
Motive_Description: Claim that a vaccine has already been developed
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mexico, vaccine, cure, Lujan Hugo Daniel
Summary: Numerous people shared a video with the title claiming that Argentina has already developed a vaccine. The video shows Lujan Hugo Daniel who is part of a team that is working to create a vaccine, however in the interview he never states that a treatment has been completed as the work was still in pre-clinical stages at the time.

Title: Anthony Fauci no dijo que los asintomáticos no contagian COVID-19, este video se saco de contexto
