Narrative_Description: Video suggests that Anthony Fauci claimed that asymptomatic patients could not spread COVID-19
Motive_Description: Suggest the asymptomatic people cannot transmit COVID-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mexico, Anthony Fauci, asymptomatic patients, trasmission
Summary: A video circulated on social Mediawhich showed Anthony Fauci stating that the probability that asymptomatic carriers of coronavirus could transmit the disease to Others was low. However, these comments were taken out of context since at no point did Fauci say asymptomatic patients could never spread COVID and these comments were made in January 2020 when information about this was scant.

Title: No, la COVID-19 no es un pretexto para vacunarnos 'con inteligencia artificial'
Narrative_Description: Video from Italian doctor translated to Spanish that claims the coronavirus vaccines are part of a plot to insert artificial intelligence in people and reduce the population by 80%
Motive_Description: Spread fear about a conspiracy plot related the vaccines
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, Mexico, Italy, artificial intelligence, conspiracy, population
Summary: A video shared in social Mediashowed a translation of an Italian video which claimed that the coronavirus vaccine was part of a plot to insert artificial intelligence into the public and reduce the population by 80%.

Title: Es falso que Gaddafi predijo la pandemia de COVID-19 en un discurso de 2009
Narrative_Description: Claim that Muammar Gaddafi predicted that a the world would fabricate a lethal virus during a 2009 speech at the UN
Motive_Description: Suggest that Gaddafi predicted COVID-19 and that the virus was created in a lab
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Muammar Gaddafi, H1N1, United Nations, prediction, laboratory, Mexico
Summary: A post on social Mediaclaimed that Muammar Gaddafi predicted in a 2009 speech at the United Nations that the world would manufacture a virus, suggesting that he predicted the COVID-19 pandemic and that it was intentianally made. However, in the 2009 UN speech, he is actually referring to the H1N1 disease which he says may have been made in a lab.

Title: Diosdado Cabello: "Venezuela tiene los más bajos índices de mortalidad de COVID-19 por millón de habitantes"
Narrative_Description: Venezuelan President of the Constituent Assembly claimed that Venezuela had the lowest death rate from COVID-19 by a million people
Motive_Description: Suggest that Venezuala and its government are doing exeptionally well at handling the pandemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Venezuela, Diosdado Cabello, Constituent Assembly, death rate
Summary: During an interview with 'Con el mazo dando', the president of the Constituent Assembly and a member of the National Assembly of Venezuela, Diosdado Cabello, stated that Venezuela has the lowest death rate from COVID-19 by a million. At the time of the interview, 57 countries had lower death rates than Venezuela.

Title: Forense alemán Klaus Püschel no nego que la COVID-19 puede provocar muerte
Narrative_Description: Claim that German scientist Klaus Püschel stated that COVID-19 could not lead to death
Motive_Description: Suggest that coronavirus is not lethal and that it is being overblown
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mexico, Klaus Püschel, death, pandemic, Germany
Summary: A video circulated on Facebook which contained an interview with German doctor Klaus Püschel along with subtitles in Spanish. The video was posted along with titles that stated Püschel had uncovered the truth which was that COVID-19 is not lethal. However, his comments were taken out of context since he stated that death was usually caused by underlying conditions as well as coronavirus.

Title: No es cierto que el Gobierno quiere importar una nueva cepa de coronavirus como lo afirmó un diputado del MAS
Narrative_Description: Claim by a member of the Movement for Socialism Party (MAS) that Bolivia's government is opening its national borders in order to allow new strains of coronavirus to enter the country and postpone the elections
Motive_Description: Suggest that the government is attempting to affect the 2020 election by opening national borders
Key_Words: Coronavirus, 2020 elections, Bolivia, Movement for Socialism, borders, strains
Summary: A member of the Movement for Socialism party claimed that the Bolivian government was opening its national borders in order for a new coronavirus strain to enter the country and lead to the postponing of the 2020 elections.

Title: Es falso que Bolivia no gestiona el accesa a una vacuna de coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claim that Bolivia's government is not purchasing vaccines against coronavirus
Motive_Description: Claim that the Bolivian government is not taking measures to purchase vaccines for its citizens
Summary: Bloque Jema posted on Facebook a claim that the Bolivian government is not purchasing vaccines for its citizens; at this point, the government had made an agreement that would secure enough vaccines to vaccinate 20% of the population.

Title: No hay aviones ni planes para fumigar las ciudades
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Bolivian government is using planes to fumigate the streets against coronavirus and that these can cause bodily harm
Motive_Description: Spread fear that there are fumigations against coronavirus which are poisoning the public
Summary: A WhatsApp chain shared an image which claimed that the government was using planes to fumigate the streets against coronavirus and that these were poisoning the public. The post had the image of a body along with a list of symptoms from these fumigations. There are no fumigation plan in Bolivia.

Title: Tarija: Oliva dice que 10% de la población hizo pruebade Covid-19, los datos no coinciden con proyección del INE
Narrative_Description: The Governor of Tarija stated that that had tested 10% of the population making it the area with most testing in Bolivia; this does not coincide with national data
Motive_Description: Suggest that the government of Tarija is excelling in its testing
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Bolivia Tarija, Adrián Oliva Alcázar, testing, PCR
Summary: In a televised interview, the Governor of Tarija in Bolivia, Adrián Oliva Alcázar, claimed that his government had tested 10% of the population of Tarija, making is the area with the most successful testing in the country. Official data from the Instituto Nacional de Estadística has numbers that contrsdict this statement.

Title: No, la foto de Alberto Fernández en San Juan 'sin barbijo ni distanciamiento social' no es actual, es de 2019
Narrative_Description: Post with photo of Argentine President Alberto Fernández without mask with several people which claims that it was taken in a recent trip to San Juan
Motive_Description: Suggest that President Alberto Fernández of Argentina is not following his government's own coronavirus guidelines
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, Alberto Fernández, social distancing, masks, lockdown
Summary: Numerous people shared an image on Facebook of Argentine President Alberto Fernández maskless and not social distancing with several Other individuals which claimed to be from a September 2020 trip to San Juan. However, the image was actually taken in 2019.

Title: Usar tapabocas correctamente no causa ni hipoxia ni hipercapnia ni neumonía
Narrative_Description: Claim thats face masks cause pneumonia, hypercapnia, and hypoxia
Motive_Description: Spread fear that masks can cause health problems
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, face masks, pneumonia, hypoxia, hypercapnia
Summary: A post on Facebook claimed that wearing face masks can lead to health risks such as pneumonia, hypoxia, and hypercapnia. If worn correctly, masks will not do this.

Title: No hay pruebas que prueben que el jarabe Supal 20 cure el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claim that a medicinal syrup from Ecuador called Supal 20 can cure Covid-19
Motive_Description: Claim that Supal 20 is a cure to Covid-19
Summary: A company that sells the Ecuadorian medicinal syrup Supal 20 claims on its Facebook posts that it can cure one of coronavirus. No test have proven that this is true.

Title: Metrosalud no está pidiendo a las farmacias de Medellin no vender vacunas contra la influenza
Narrative_Description: Claim that local government of Medellin is asking pharmacies not to sell the influenza vaccine because it is causing disease
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the influenza vaccine is unsafe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, Medellin, Metrosalud, influenze, vaccine
Summary: A WhatsApp chain claimed that Medellin's Metrosalud was telling pharmacies not to sell the influenza vaccine anymore because it was actually infecting people and making them sick. Officials contradicted this statement.

Title: Falsa cadena de WhatsApp ofrece pruebas gratis de Covid-19 en Cali, tras entregar datos personales
Narrative_Description: WhatsApp chain offers free Covid-19 testing in return for personal information
Motive_Description: Obtain one's personal data in return for coronavirus test
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, Cali, testing, scam, data
Summary: A message circulated on WhatsApp which claimed that one could receive a free coronavirus test in Cali, but that one needed to share personal data in order to receive it. It was later discovered to be a scam.

Title: No, este vídeo de una sala vacía no es una UCI de un hospital de Valencia
Narrative_Description: Video that claims to be of an empty ICU floor in a hospital in Valencia
Motive_Description: Suggest that the virus is not as deadly and serious
Summary: A video spread on social Mediawhich showed an empty floor of a hospital and claimed that it was was the ICU unit in Valencia, suggesting the Covid-19 was not as deadly. Although the video was of a hospital in Valencia, it was not actually the ICU unit.

Title: No hay patente en Países Bajos de una métedo para "testear el COVID-19" desde 2015
Narrative_Description: Claim that tests for Covid-19 were patented in 2015 by the Rothschild family
Motive_Description: Suggest that there was knowledge of the disease since 2015 and that the pandemic was planned
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, tests, Rothschild family, conspiracy
Summary: Social Mediaposts show a photo along with a caption claiming that a patent had been made in 2015 for a Covid-19 testing kit and that the Rothschild family had a role in this.  Although the photo was real, it showed 2015 patents for tests that were not originally designed for coronavirus and were only now being used for the pandemic.

Title: No, no han muerto 97 ancianos en una residencia "madrileña" a cause de la vacuna de la gripe que se les puso "a principios de septiembre"
Narrative_Description: Claim that the flu vaccine killed 97 people in a nursing hime
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the flu vaccine is dangerous
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, flu vaccine, deaths, nursing home
Summary: Posts on social Mediaclaimed that 97 people in a nursing home had died as a result of receiving the flu vaccine in September. Officials clarified that this was not true as none of the nursing home residents had been vaccinated before mid-October.

Title: Says since he and President Trump took office, their policies "led to an unemployment rate of 3.1% in Wisconsin and 61,000 Wisconsin jobs, including 15,000 manufacturing jobs."
Narrative_Description: Pence claims since the start of his Administration, Wisconsin has added new manufacturing jobs and has a 3.1% unemployment rate
Motive_Description: Uplift Trump campaign
Summary: Citing data from March, in October, Pence claimed that Wisconsin has an unemployment rate of 3.1%

Title: Fact Check: Nancy Pelosi Was NOT Escorted Drunk And Maskless From A Building
Narrative_Description: A photo of Nancy Pelosi leaving a building without a mask seemingly drunk
Motive_Description: Undermine Nancy Pelosi
Summary: A photo circulated on Facebook from 2016 shows Pelosi leaving a building without a mask and seemingly drunk

Title: A CDC report found that “people who wear masks, are actually ‘collecting’ the virus in their masks.”
Narrative_Description: Claims that 70% of those testing positive according to the CDC always wore masks
Motive_Description: Undermine CDC and dowplay need for masks
Summary: A facebook post falsely says that people with masks are more likely to get infected with coronavirus because masks are supposedly "collecting" the virus

Title: “CDC just cancelled Halloween for kids.”
Narrative_Description: Claims that the CDC has cancelled Halloween for kids but condones BLM and Antifa protests
Motive_Description: Undermine CDC and bring to light sentiments alleging hypocrisy
Summary: A facebook post claims that the CDC has cancelled Halloween while allowing protests

Title: “The World Health Organization just admitted that I was right. Lockdowns are killing countries all over the world. The cure cannot be worse than the problem itself.”
Narrative_Description: Trump claims that the WHO agrees that lockdowns were ineffectiveness
Motive_Description: Undermine lockdown policies
Summary: In a tweet, Trump falsely alledges that the WHO is against a lockdown policy

Title: CNN reported, “Due to COVID-19, President Donald Trump passes away at 74.”
Narrative_Description: Claims that Trump died from COVID
Motive_Description: Undermine Trump
Summary: A fake circulated CNN tweet says that Trump died at 74

Title: No hay pruebas de que el laboratorio de Wuhan sea de Glaxo ni que esta empresa sea dueña de Pfizer
Narrative_Description: Claim that Wuhan's virology lab is property of Glaxo, and that Glaxo in turn owns Pfizer.
Motive_Description: Suggest China's role in the origin of the virus and its efforts to make profits through vaccine campaigns.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, vaccine, Wuhan, Pfizer, China, CoronaVac
Summary: Posts on social Mediaclaiming that there are connections between the Wuhan virology lab and Glaxo, which in turn owns Pfizer.

Title: Es falso que murió la enfermera que se desmayó tras ponerse la vacuna contra la COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that the American nurse Tiffany Dover died after having fainted upon being vaccinated.
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the COVID vaccine is potentially lethal.
Summary: Various posts on Facebook claiming that a nurse who fainted upon receiving the Pfizer vaccine died shortly thereafter.

Title: Es falso que Estados Unidos admitió que no está probada la existencia del nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claim that the coronavirus has not been isolated by the CDC and therefore its existence can still not be proven.
Motive_Description: Suggest that the Coronavirus might not actually exist, thus introducing doubt about its effects.
Summary: Based on a misread CDC report, the blog claimed that the Coronavirus had not been isolated in laboratories. However, it misunderstood or misrepresented the lack of quantifiable concentrations with which to comapre the virus.

Title: Es falso que el director general de la OMS haya dicho que se viene "otra pandemia y sera una tragedia"
Narrative_Description: Claim that Tedros Adhanom, director general of WHO, said that anOther pandemic is coming and that it will be a tragedy
Motive_Description: Spread fear that anOther deadly pandemic with hit
Key_Words: Coronarirus, Argentina, World Health Organization, Tedros Adhanom, pandemic
Summary: A post on Facebook from Noticias Proféticas claimed that director general of WHO Tedros Adhanom cried and said that we must prepare ourselves for anOther pandemic that is coming which will be a tragedy. This is misleading since the actual statements Adhanom made at a WHO conference were that the organization needed to look into how the coronavirus is spreading in order to avoid a future epidemic.

Title: No, COVID-19 no significa "ved a una oveja rendirse" en latín
Narrative_Description: Claim that "COVID-19" is a latin translation of "see a sheep surrender"
Motive_Description: Suggest that the pandemic is a biblical prophesy
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, Latin, Bible, Christianity, pandemic, sheep
Summary: Several social Mediaposts claimed that the name "COVID-19" is a Latin translation of the words "see a sheep surrender", suggesting that the pandemic is a bliblical prophesy. However, the name of coronavirus has no origin in Latin and does not have any relation to these words.

Title: No, una prueba PCR mal hecha no ha perforado el cerebro a una paciente: la mujer que perdió líquido cerebral tenía un defecto previo en la base del cráneo
Narrative_Description: Claim that PCR tests done incorrectly can puncture the brain and lead to death
Motive_Description: Spread fear that PCR tests are dangerous
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, PCR tests, brain, US
Summary: Many websites posted a story claiming that after submitting to a PCR test, a woman in Iowa began to see liquid coming out of her nose which was later concluded to be from the cerebral area, suggesting that the test had punctured her brain. Although this did occur, the liquid was due to a previous defect at the base of the brain, not the PCR test.

Title: No, Ecuador no encontró la cura para el COVID-19 ni 'mandó al carajo a la OMS'
Narrative_Description: Social Mediaposts claim Ecuadorian doctors have discovered in an autopsy that death is caused by bacteria and not a virus, and argues that antibiotics will cure one of Covid
Motive_Description: Claim that Covid is easily cured with antibiotics
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, autopsy, Ecuador, bacteria, virus, antibiotics
Summary: WhatsApp chain claimed that an autopsy done by Ecuadorian doctors found that bacteria cause COVID-19, not a virus, suggesting that only antibiotics are needed to cure the disease. The post also said that Ecuador told WHO to 'go to hell.' None of these claims have been proven.

Title: No hay evidencia de que 'un correcto aseo bucal' cure la COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that cleaning one's mouth will cure one of coronavirus
Motive_Description: Suggest that a mouthwash will cure Covid-19
Summary: Social Mediaposts claimed that a thorough mouthwash will cure one of coronavirus. This has not been proven.

Title: Nueva York no está 'en las mismas circunstancias' ni 'mucho peor' que Madrid
Narrative_Description: President of the Communty of Madrid Isabel Díaz Ayuso claimed that New York City is doing just as bad and even worse that Madrid at containing the virus
Motive_Description: Suggest that Madrid is handling the pandemic better then NYC without the severe lockdown measures
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, Madrid, New York City, positivity rate, lockdowns
Summary: The President of the Community of Madrid Isabel Díaz Ayuso claimed that Madrid was handling the pandemic just as well if not better than the city of New York without the strict guidelines that NYC has. This is not true since at the time of this statement, Madrid had 238 cases per 100,000 people while NYC had 47 per 100,000 people.

Title: No, la OMS no ha pedido ahora a los paises que no usen los confinamientos, ni los ha declarado 'ilegítimos': pide que no sea el método principal pero los considera justificados para ganar tiempo
Narrative_Description: Claim that the WHO has said that countries should no longer use lockdowns and that they are 'illegitimate'
Motive_Description: Undermine use of lockdowns as adequate protection measures
Summary: Several Mediasources quoted the WHO as saying that countries should no longer use lockdowns as prevention measures and that they were considered 'illegitimate.' WHO actually said that lockdowns should not be the principle solution and that they are justified in containing the spread.

Title: No, no hay una vacuna contra la gripe "con coronavirus de perro" que "abre las puertas celulares para la COVID-19"
Narrative_Description: Claim that there is a flu vaccine that uses coronavirus from dogs and that it makes one more vulnerable to COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the use of flu vaccines
Summary: A WhatsApp chain claimed that there is a type of flu vaccine that uses dog coronavirus and that it can make one more vulnerable to COVID-19. These claims are unproven.

Title: Es falso que toda la populación tenga SARS-CoV-2 por respirar el aire de la calle
Narrative_Description: Claim that one can get COVID-19 by going on the street for five seconds and breathing twice
Motive_Description: Spread fear that one can catch coronavirus by going outside
Summary: A video circulated on WhatsApp which claimed that one can get coronavirus simply by stepping outside for five seconds and breathing in twice. The WHO disproved this.

Title: Киев поставил русофобию выше здоровья граждан Украины
Narrative_Description: Ukraine cares more about russophobia than human lives
Motive_Description: Undermine Ukraine
Key_Words: Coroanvirus, Ukraine, Russia, Russophobia, Zelensky, vaccine, Sputnik V
Summary: Ukrainian elites are secretly hunting for the Russian vaccine, even though Zelensky said he'd only get it from a Western manufacture

Title: Шарий рассказал, как Киев намерен нажиться на вакцине из России
Narrative_Description: Ukraine may actually get the Russian vaccine through the guise of Europe
Motive_Description: Undermine Ukraine
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Ukraine, Russia, EU, vaccine, Sputnik V
Summary: Claims that Ukraine will end up getting the Russian vaccine, just through the European Union, so it can be claimed as a "European vaccine", not a "Russian" one

Title: Almost everyone — 85% — who got the coronavirus in July was wearing a mask,
Narrative_Description: Tucker Carlson claimed that a CDC study that the majority of those infected in July worse masks
Motive_Description: Undermine masks
Summary: In a news piece, Carlson misrepresents the CDCs data to say that those who wear masks were getting infected, rather than it being that those who go out to eat were getting infected

Title: Says Democratic senators were missing “masks” as they huddled close together at the Judiciary Committee hearing for Amy Coney Barrett.
Narrative_Description: A Texas senator retweets of senators not wearing masks during the Amy Coney Barrett hearing
Motive_Description: Undermine Democratic party senators
Key_Words: Coronavirus, judiciary committee, senators, masks, hearing, Barrett
Summary: In a retweet, Senator Cornyn of TX claims that Democratic senators were not wearing masks a Barrett's hearing

Title: No hay vacuna contra COVID-19 que sea más mortal que la enfermedad
Narrative_Description: Claim that COVID-19 vaccines have a 33% mortality rate, making them more deadly than the disease
Motive_Description: Spread fear that COVID-19 vaccines are dangerous and can lead to death
Summary: Numerous tweets claimed that vaccines against COVID-19 have a 33% mortality rate, making them more deadly than the disease itself. At this point, no vaccines had been approved and the WHO assured that those in trials were safe.

Title: Existe la enfermedad X, pero no es un nuevo virus como desinforma este video
Narrative_Description: Claim that individuals have seen evidence that a new 'virus X' is coming by the end of the year and that it will be 5x more deadly than the current epidemic
Motive_Description: Spread fear that anOther worse pandemic will come
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Mexico, virus X, pandemic, mortality, Florida
Summary: A video on social Mediashowed a man claiming that he had heard from Florida health workers that a new 'virus X' was coming by December 2020 or January 2021 and that it would be 5x more deadly than COVID-19. Although there are official accounts of a 'virus X', this is used as a broad term to refer an unknown disease that could become a worldwide epidemic and there is no concrete knowledge that such a virus already exists.

Title: Coronavirus: son falsas las afirmaciones de un médico "por la verdad" sobre el proyecto de ley de vacunas
Narrative_Description: Claim that Argentina's government has passed a law that would require all citizens to take the COVID-19 vaccine and would allow manufacturers to be immune from legal repurcussions if the treatment harms citizens
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the COVID-19 vaccine will be forced on to citizens and can harm them
Source_Description: Mariano Arriaga, Médicos por la Verdad
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, Mariano Arriaga, Médicos por la Verdad, vaccine, laws
Summary: Oftalmologist Mariano Arriago from Médicos por la Verdad (Medics for the Truth) claimed on Canal 7 de Salta that the Argentine government has passed a law that would require all citizens to take the COVID-19 vaccine and would give manufacturers legal immunity if the vaccines harm citizens. He also suggest that the vaccine is dangerous. No such law has been passed.

Title: La OMS no ha confirmado que la gripe es "más letal" que la COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that WHO said that COVID-19 is no more lethal than gripe
Motive_Description: Suggest that COVID-19 is not as dangerous as any Other common disease
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, gripe, mortality, World Health Organization
Summary: A post on social Mediaused quotes from the director of the WHO Emergency Health Programme, Michael Ryan, in which he stated that approximately 10% of the world population had been infected with Covid-19. This estimate was used to suggest that coronavirus only had a 0.14% mortality rate, which is significantly less than that of gripe. However, this data is incorrect since WHO has stated that their data is still early.

Title: No, esta imagen de un maniquí en una camilla no es un montaje de la pandemia de la COVID-19, es un simulacro de de la Marina de los Estados Unidos
Narrative_Description: Post with a photo of a mannequin in a stretcher along with individuals in masks claims to be a staging of a COVID-19 death; it was actually a photo of a simulation done by US Marines
Motive_Description: Suggest that the pandemic is being staged and is not real
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, pandemic, fake, US Marines, simulation
Summary: A post circulated on social Mediawhich showed a photo of a mannequin in a stretcher with masked individuals surrounding it and claimed that it proved that the pandemic was being staged and was not in fact real. This is untrue since the photo is actually from a simulation done by US Marines.

Title: Sahra Çölü'nden gelecek toz bulutu yüzünden virüsün Türkiye'de daha da yayılacağı iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that coronavirus will be spreading fastly with the dust cloud that is coming from the Sahara Desert
Motive_Description: Spread fear, to discourage from people going outside
Summary: A facebook user claimed that coronavirus will be spreading fastly with the dust cloud that is coming from the Sahara Desert. It has no scientific bases.

Title: Bahçelievler’de bir camide 45 dolara Covid-19 aşısı satıldığı iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that vaccines are sold in a mosque in Bahçelievler district of Istanbul
Motive_Description: No clear motive, probably was a joke
Summary: Claim that vaccines are sold in a mosque in Bahçelievler district of Istanbul circulated on social media, bases of which was a writing on a A4 paper in a mosque. There was indeed a paper on which it was claimed vaccines are sold for 45 USD but it is unknown who wrote it. It was probably a bad joke

Title: Dünya Sağlık Örgütü'nün vaka sayısına göre aşı dağıtacağını söylediği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that WHO will distribute the vaccines according to number of cases in each country that is why the Turkish government has started to publish actual number of cases instead of patients
Motive_Description: To criticize the turkish government
Summary: Claim that WHO will distribute the vaccines according to number of cases in each country that is why the Turkish government has started to publish actual number of cases instead of patients. The WHO did not have such a statement

Title: Aziz Sancar'a ait olduğu iddia edilen Twitter hesabı
Narrative_Description: Claim that Aziz Sancar, a Turkish citizen has a Nobel Prize in Chemistry, tweeted a series of tweets indicating that coronavirus is designed organism
Motive_Description: To spread conspiracy theories
Summary: Claim that Aziz Sancar, a Turkish citizen has a Nobel Prize in Chemistry, tweeted a series of tweets indicating that coronavirus is designed organism. They were published by face accounts, which was then used by Other users to spread their conspiracy theories

Title: Türkiye'nin Çin'den aşı siparişi veren tek ülke olduğu iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that Turkey is the only country that bought Chines vaccine
Motive_Description: To criticize the turkish government
Summary: Claim that Turkey is the only country that bought Chines vaccines. It criticizes the government for buying the Chinese vaccine whose efficiancy is yet to proven

Title: Wuhan laboratuvarı ve Pfizer’ın Glaxo adlı ilaç şirketine ait olduğu iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that the lab in Wuhan is owned by Prifzer Glaxo
Motive_Description: To spread conspiracy theories
Summary: Claim that the lab in Wuhan is owned by Prifzer Glaxo. But it also includes many more theories a mix of conspiracy theories

Title: The Simpsons dizisinin koronavirüsü ve aşıyı önceden bildirdiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that Simpson has predicted the coronavirus and the vaccine
Motive_Description: To spread conspiracy theories, by indicating that it was "known"
Summary: Claim that Simpson has predicted the coronavirus and the vaccine cirulated on social media, to push their conspiracy theories

Title: Dünya Bankası'nın karantina uygulamalarını 2025'e kadar sürdürmeyi planladığı iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that the World Bank is planning to continue with the quarantine regulations until 2025
Motive_Description: To spread fear about the severity of the pandemic and future
Summary: Claim that the World Bank is planning to continue with the quarantine regulations until 2025. It is manipulation and mistranlation of a World Bank document that states the future strategies of the Bank

Title: Kapağı açılmamış şırıngalarla yapılan aşı iddiaları
Narrative_Description: In two different photos Annastacia Palaszczuk and Sadiq Khan are getting vaccinated, however, it was claimed that the caps of the syringes are still on which indicates that they were not vaccinated
Motive_Description: To spread the anti-vaccine agenda
Summary: In two different photos Annastacia Palaszczuk and Sadiq Khan are getting vaccinated, however, it was claimed that the caps of the syringes are still on which indicates that they were not vaccinated. The photos were taken when they were getting flu vaccines and not coronavirus

Title: Sylvia Brown’ın kitabını Covid-19 salgınıyla ilişkilendiren iddialar
Narrative_Description: Claim that Sylvia Brown predicted the pandemic in her book End of Days
Motive_Description: No particular motive
Key_Words: Turkey, prediction, End of Days, Sylvia Brown
Summary: Claim that Sylvia Brown predicted the pandemic in her book End of Days. It was shared in many different languages at different stages of the pandemic.

Title: Muammer Kaddafi’nin koronavirüs salgınını 11 yıl önceden tahmin ettiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that Gaddafi predicted the coronavirus that he warned the capitalist corporations and countries will spread it to benefit from it
Motive_Description: To push anti-Western conspiracy theories forward
Summary: Claim that Gaddafi predicted the coronavirus that he warned the capitalist corporations and countries will spread it to benefit from it. The video was from the UN Security Council meeting in 2009 was about anOther virus

Title: Bill Gates’in aşılarla dünya nüfusunu azaltmayı amaçladığı iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that Bill Gates will use vaccines to decrease the world population
Motive_Description: To spread conspiracy theories
Key_Words: Bill Gates, Turkey, vaccine, population, decrease
Summary: Claim that Bill Gates will use vaccines to decrease the world population was shared on social Mediaby manipulation of parts of his various statements

Title: Aşının içindeki luciferase enziminin genlerimizi değiştireceği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that the vaccines will alter people's DNA's through an enzyme called luciferase
Motive_Description: To spread conspiracy theories
Summary: Claim that the vaccines will alter people's DNA's through an enzyme called luciferase. Typical conspiracy theory.

Title: Pfizer & BioNTech’in geliştirdiği Covid-19 aşısının gönüllülerde yüz felcine neden olduğu iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that Pfizer BionTech vaccine resulted in facial paralysis in several volunteers in the US
Motive_Description: To spread fear about Pfizer's vaccines
Key_Words: Turkey, Pfizer, Biontech, vaccine, facial paralysis
Summary: Claim that Pfizer BionTech vaccine resulted in facial paralysis in several volunteers in the US. There was no evidence the facial paralysis was caused by the vaccine, the photos that were shared in those tweets are not those of volunteers

Title: 12 aşı gönüllüsü koronavirüse yakalandığından aşının etkisiz olduğu iddiası
Narrative_Description: It was claimed that Sinovac vaccine is not effective since 12 volunteers who were vaccinated caught the virus
Motive_Description: No information
Summary: It was claimed that Sinovac vaccine is not effective since 12 volunteers who were vaccinated caught the virus. The story does not include who spread the the misinformation but indicates social Mediausers

Title: AstraZeneca’nın Covid-19 aşısına 14 haftalık erkek fetüs DNA’sı eklendiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that  Oxford AstraZeneca's vaccine has the DNA of 14 weeks old male fetus
Motive_Description: To spread fear about vaccines, discourage people from using it
Key_Words: Turkey, Oxford, vaccine, Astra, fetus, DNA
Summary: Claim that  Oxford AstraZeneca's vaccine has the DNA of 14 weeks old male fetus. This is not true fetus' are only used in the development phase

Title: Araştırmaların maskenin etkisiz olduğunu kanıtladığı iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that masks are ineffective based on a study in Denmark
Motive_Description: No particular motive, wants the reopening of the country
Summary: Claim that masks are ineffective based on a study in Denmark. The study is not conclusive and has many methodological flaws.

Title: DSÖ Başkanı Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus’un silahlı örgüt yöneticisi olduğu iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus is a senior member of an armed organization
Motive_Description: Undermine WHO
Summary: Claim that Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus is a senior member of an armed organization  circulated on social media. It is a translation to Turkish from various languages. The claim itself seems to be more related to domestic politics of Ethiopia

Title: CHP'nin 2019 yılında Covid-19 aşısının zorunlu olması için kanun teklifi verdiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that the main opposition party CHP wanted the government to proposed a legislation to make vaccination compulsory for everyone already in 2019
Motive_Description: To target the opposition
Summary: Claim that the main opposition party CHP wanted the government to proposed a legislation to make vaccination compulsory for everyone.  The original proposal is about Other crucial vaccine not coronavirus

Title: Kolayla yapılan Covid-19 testinin pozitif çıktığı iddiası
Narrative_Description: An Austrian member of the parliament claims that coronavirus tests' results are unreliable
Motive_Description: To push conspiracy theories about the virus
Summary: An Austrian member of the parliament claims that coronavirus tests' results are unreliable. He uses cola instead of blood and tests results but he does not follow the right  procedure which damages the test kit thus results in change of color in the substance, thus, it looks like as if it gave a positive test result.

Title: Covid-19 aşısı olan hemşirenin bayılarak hayatını kaybettiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that the American nurse Tiffany Dover died after having fainted upon being vaccinated.
Motive_Description: Spread fear about vaccines
Source_Description: Yeni Akit, Beyaz Gazete, Referans Medya
Key_Words: Turkey, USA, Tiffany Dover, vaccine, death
Summary: Claim that the American nurse Tiffany Dover died after having fainted upon being vaccinated was shared on Twitter and by several websites

Title: Kendini doktor olarak tanıtan Ben Tapper'ın PCR testiyle ilgili iddiaları
Narrative_Description: Ben Tapper, who claims to be a medical doctor, claims that PCR tests are not reliable for diagnosis of coronavirus, thus, argues coronavirus is not serious threat
Motive_Description: He argues the pandemic is a profit-making tool for drug companies to push the government to make vaccines compulsory for everyone. It undermines the freedom of health in the US etc. Typical conspiracy theories
Key_Words: Turkey, USA, Ben Tapper, compulsory, vaccine, freedom
Summary: Ben Tapper, who claims to be a medical doctor, claims that PCR tests are not reliable for diagnosis of coronavirus, thus, argues coronavirus is not serious threat. He argues compulsory vaccination will undermine freedom of the American people, it is profit-making tool for drug companies etc.

Title: İvermektin adlı ilacın Covid-19’un bulaşmasını tamamen engellediği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that a drug called ivermectin prevents spread of the coronavirus
Motive_Description: asks why it is not used and calls people to question why it is not being used. Not a clear motive
Summary: A video in which a doctor praises the drug ivermectin. This video was shared on Twitter.

Title: Ümit Aktaş’ın Covid-19 aşıları hakkında iddiaları
Narrative_Description: Dr. Ümit Aktaş has various claims about the vaccines, and points out possible long-term side effects
Motive_Description: Spread fear about mRNA vaccines
Summary: Dr. Ümit Aktaş basically claims there are so many unknowns about the mRNA vaccines and no pandemic ever was ended thanks to the vaccines but herd immunity. Discourages people from getting vaccinated

Title: Pfizer ve BioNTech aşısının deneylerinde altı kişinin hayatını kaybettiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that 6 of the volunteers in the Pfizer BionTech vaccine trial died and the company had no explanation for this
Motive_Description: Clickbait or stoking fear about vaccine
Summary: Claim that 6 of the volunteers in the Pfizer BionTech vaccine trial died and the company had no explanation for this was shared on Twitter. Whereas it is factually true that 6 people died, there is no evidence to indicate that it was related to the vaccines and 4 of the people who died were actually in the plasebo group

Title: Videonun Covid-19 aşısı sırasında şırınganın iğnesinin kaybolduğunu gösterdiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that health care worker faking giving the COVID-19 with a disappearing needle.
Motive_Description: Spread fear about vaccines
Summary: Claim that health care worker faking giving the COVID-19 with a disappearing needle. The needle is designed so to ensure safety.

Title: DSÖ’nün aşıların hastalığa karşı etkili olmadığını söylediği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that there WHO stated that there is no evidence for the efficiency of vaccines
Motive_Description: Misinterpretation/translation, clickbait
Source_Description: Independent Türkçe, T24, YeniÇağ, Tele1, Ümit Aktaş
Summary: Claim that there WHO stated that there is no evidence for the efficiency of vaccines was shared by established Mediain Turkey, it was misinterpretation/clickbait. WHO tried to warn that the covid measures should continue until the pandemic is over.

Title: Aşı üreticilerinin aşı olmasının yasak olduğu iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that Uğur Şahin, the CEO of BionTech, is not allowed to get vaccinated
Motive_Description: To indicate that that vaccines are not safe are and are weaponized
Summary: Claim that Uğur Şahin, the CEO of BionTech,  is not allowed to get vaccinated circulated on social media, which was used as a tool to spread conspiracy theories such as people being  used as guinea pigs for the vaccine or it will turn them to robots. In reality, he is just waiting his turn to get vaccinated like everyone else

Title: Türkiye’ye ulaşan Sinovac aşısının Çin’de yasak olduğu iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Chinese Sinovac vaccine, which Turkey bought, is forbidden in China
Motive_Description: Spread fear about Sinovac vaccine
Summary: In a video Chine ambassador to Turkey talks about Sinovac vaccine and says it is approved for emergency use in China. However, rumors claimed that it is forbidden in China.

Title: İsrail’de bir kişinin Covid-19 aşısı nedeniyle hayatını kaybettiği iddiası
Narrative_Description: Claim that a person had a heart attack and died after getting vaccinated
Motive_Description: To spread fear about vaccines, clickbait
Source_Description: HABERLER.COM, Internet Haber, haber7.com, Sözcü, akit tv, Yeni Şafak
Summary: Claim that a person had a heart attack and died after getting vaccinated was shared on websites and several twitter accounts to spread fear. It naturally has a clickbait component

Title: No, este vídeo de una aguja retráctil no demuestra que se está vacunando a la población con jeringuillas falsas
Narrative_Description: Claim that retractable syringes  used for vaccination seen in a BBC video are false or that the needle stays in the patient's body.
Motive_Description: The claims spread doubt concerning the vaccination efforts by the National Institute of Health in countries including Spain and the UK.
Summary: Based on a misunderstanding of the retractable syringes, viral claims spread on unnamed social Mediasources suggest that the syringes used by government health institutions are false or stay in the patient's body.

Title: La revista científica The Lancet no ha negado la pandemia de la  COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that cientific journal The Lancet admitted that COVID-19 is not a pandemic
Motive_Description: Claim that COVID-19 is not a pandemic and downplay its severity
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, The Lancet, Richard Horton, pandemic, syndemic
Summary: Richard Horton posted an article in the scientific journal The Lancet which was titled "COVID-19 is not a pandemic." This title was taken out of context by many on social Mediato prove that coronavirus is not a serious epidemic. However, in the article, Horton suggests that Covid-19 is a syndemic, which highlights health responses' correlation with social interactions such as inequality; it does not downplay the health severity of coronavirus.

Title: Las infusiones y nebulizaciones de distintas hierbas no curan el nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Facebook posts lists number of homemade remedies to coronavirus using herbs
Motive_Description: Suggest one can make a homemade cure to Covid-19
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, herbs, cure, nebulizations, eucalyptus
Summary: Post on Facebook claims that one can made homemade cures to coronavirus using herbs, such as eucalyptus, and nebulizations. Although these might alleviate symptoms, there is no proof that they cure individuals.

Title: Las afirmaciones falsas y engañosas del médico español que llama a usar en forma experimental el dióxido de cloro
Narrative_Description: Spanish doctor Luis Prieto Valiente urges for the experimental use of chlorine dioxide as a treatment for COVID-19
Motive_Description: Claim that chlorine dioxide can cure coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, Luis Prieto Valiente, chlorine dioxide, cure
Summary: Spanish doctor Luis Prieto Valiente claims that chlorine dioxide can be used as a cure for coronavirus and negates its possible health threats. Officials have warned againsts the use of chlorine dioxide and stress the danger of using it.

Title: No, Países Bajos no ha rechazado vacunar contra la COVID-19: empezarán en enero
Narrative_Description: Post from Las voces del pueblo claims that the Netherlands is not vaccinating against COVID-19
Motive_Description: Undermine EU member nation whose plan diverges from the majority of European nations, thus bringing into question the plan of the majority.
Source_Description: Spanish independent newspaper, Las voces del pueblo
Summary: A Spanish independent newspaper claims that the EU member nation the Netherlands is not vaccinating its population due to the safety concerns. While the title is more eyecatching, the body of the text better elaborates its campaign's potential January start dates that are delayed and not cancelled.

Title: Por qué la OMS ha cambiado en su web la definición de inmunidad de rebaño frente a la COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claim that the WHO has changed its definition of herd immunity to encourage the massification of vaccinations.
Motive_Description: The claims make WHO's health based definition appear to function for a certain cause that has serious political ramifications.
Summary: Social Mediahas spread the false conclusion that the WHO changed its definition of herd immunity in order to bring about a massive vaccination campaign, while the WHO actually claims that it did so because of the risks posed to individuals that acquire the virus and become sick.

Title: La OMS no dijo que no sabía que el confinamiento podía afectar la economía
Narrative_Description: Claim that World Health Organization director general Tedros Adhanom stated that it did not know lockdowns would affect the economy and now urged people to go out and consume
Motive_Description: Undermine use of lockdowns as prevention measure
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, World Health Organization, Tedros Adhanom, lockdowns, economy
Summary: Facebook posts claims that director general of WHO Tedros Adhanom said that he did not know that lockdowns would affect the worldwide economy and now urged people to go out and consume. However, Adhanom said that countries could not pretend the pandemic was over in order to help the economy; although he wants the business to resume, it cannot be at the expense of the health of the community.

Title: “We saved 2 million people” from dying of COVID-19.
Narrative_Description: Trump claimed that his Administration prevented 2 million COVID deaths
Motive_Description: Uplift Trump campaign
Summary: Citing a model that accounted for no behavior changes, Trump claims that he saved 2 Million lives from COVID

Title: The coronavirus "was constructed in the Wuhan Institute of Virology.”
Narrative_Description: Pa. Rep. Scott Perry airs debunked claim that Wuhan lab ‘constructed’ coronavirus
Motive_Description: Undermine China
Summary: In an interview, Congressman Perry of Pennsylvania claims that the coronavirus originated in a lab in Wuhan, China

Title: Fact Check: America's Frontline Doctors Did NOT Prove Their Claims That Masks Don't Work
Narrative_Description: An alleged group of doctors claimed that masks don't work
Motive_Description: Undermine masks
Key_Words: Coronavirus, mask, doctors, American Frontline Doctord
Summary: A group called "American Frontline Doctors" has a photo of doctors in D.C. saying that masks don't work in blocking COVID

Title: Says Dr. Anthony Fauci wrote a paper blaming 1918-19 flu deaths on masks
Narrative_Description: Claims that Fauci wrote a paper claiming that masks were ineffective during the Spanish flu pandemic
Motive_Description: Undermine Fauci
Key_Words: Coronavirus, masks, Anthony Fauci, Spanish Flu
Summary: A Facebook post of a tweet saying that Fauci wrote a paper in 2008 saying that masks were ineffetive during the Spanish flu pandemic

Title: Политика вместо спасения людей: США уничтожили подаренные Россией аппараты ИВЛ, соврав о поломке
Narrative_Description: The U.S. cares more about politics than saving people
Motive_Description: Undermine U.S.
Summary: Russian ventilators were destroyed by Americans because allegedly because they didn't have the right adapters, but really because they were manufactured at a sanctioned Russian lab, so the U.S. destroyed them because politics is more important than human life

Summary: An instagram post claimed that Turkey was producing 17 different vaccines in 1937, whereas it cant produce a single one

Summary: An instagram post claimed that the unofficial government partners AKP and MHP rejected a proposal that would  pay the workers damages for wrongful death during the coronavirus that were caused by  the lack of measures in the work place

Motive_Description: It is shared by an account called 5G virüs news, I interpret this as conspiracy theory spreading
Summary: A screenshot of a tweet that claims masks are more threatening than the virus itself

Title: Eksi 80 Derecede Saklanan Aşının Gerçek Bir Aşı Olmadığı ve Genetik Materyali Transfer Eden Bir Patojen Olduğu İddiası
Narrative_Description: A facebook post claims that vaccines which need to be stored under -80 degrees are not vaccines but pathogens that will transfer genetic material

Summary: A facebook post claims that vaccines which need to be stored under -80 degrees are not vaccines but pathogens that will transfer genetic material

Summary: A facebook post claims that people who die due to the coronavirus will be cremated

Title: “Aşı Pasaportu” Olduğuna Dair İddialar
Narrative_Description: It was claimed that vaccine passport will be introduced and compulsory to enter malls, buses and for air-travel
Motive_Description: No particular reason, probably to create awareness or criticize such a measures
Summary: It was claimed that vaccine passport will be introduced and compulsory to enter malls, buses and for air-travel. The malls and buses part was not true

Title: Yalova Valiliği’nin Bazı Meslek Gruplarına COVID-19 Aşısı için Yaptırım Uygulayacağı İddiası

Summary: It was claimed that if people  in selected occupational groups refuse to get a vaccine, they will be fined by the government. In reality the document that was the bases of the claim was the document that explains government's vaccination strategy (which groups will get vaccinated first etc.)

Title: İngiltere Sağlık Bakanı’nın Yeni Koronavirüs Mutasyonunun Çok Daha Ölümcül Olduğunu Açıkladığı İddiası

Title: The government has awarded a contract to develop technology that proves you’ve recently had a negative Covid-19 test
Narrative_Description: Several posts on Facebook have pointed to a government contract to create a “Covid-19 Certification/passport” as evidence that the government is introducing passports that will grant greater personal freedoms to those who have received a Covid-19 vaccine.

Summary: Several posts on Facebook have pointed to a government contract to create a “Covid-19 Certification/passport” as evidence that the government is introducing passports that will grant greater personal freedoms to those who have received a Covid-19 vaccine.

Summary: Facebook post says the needles in some syringes are supposed to disappear

Summary: Facebook posts claim that the covid vaccine will led to infertility

Title: A post about coronavirus vaccines gets facts about their safety, ingredients, and legality wrong

Title: Cambridge Covid-19 test results don’t mean PCR tests are inaccurate

Key_Words: Coronavirus, test, Cambridge University, false positive
Summary: In the past few days, claims about Covid-19 testing at the University of Cambridge have been spreading on Twitter and Facebook, specifically relating to the number of “false positive” results.

Title: False claims about first vaccine recipients spread on social media
Narrative_Description: The same nurse was pictured vaccinating the first two recipients of the Covid-19 vaccine in the UK, despite them being 20 miles apart.

Summary: False claims about first vaccine recipients spread on social media

Title: Vaccine approval isn’t quicker because of Brexit

Motive_Description: Claims UK approved vaccine because of Brexit
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Matt Hancock, UK, vaccine, faster, Brexit
Summary: In an interview on Times Radio, the health secretary Matt Hancock incorrectly claimed that the UK was able to approve the use of the Pfizer/BioNTech coronavirus vaccine more quickly because of Brexit.

Title: Telegraph wrong on Whitty and Vallance statements
Narrative_Description: Last week Sir Patrick Vallance and Prof Chris Whitty presented a graph which cherry-picked several hospitals on course to run out of beds, despite falling or flat rates of Covid-19 bed occupancy across the country.
Motive_Description: columnist Allison Pearson claimed that last week Sir Patrick Vallance and Professor Chris Whitty warned about specific hospitals at risk of running out of beds, despite the fact that Covid-19 bed occupancy had peaked or was falling in most regions
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Sir Patrick Vallance, Chris Whitty, graph, hospital, cherry pick, occupancy, bed
Summary: In Wednesday’s Daily Telegraph, columnist Allison Pearson claimed that last week Sir Patrick Vallance and Professor Chris Whitty warned about specific hospitals at risk of running out of beds, despite the fact that Covid-19 bed occupancy had peaked or was falling in most regions.

Title: Mersey Care has only had five Covid-19 deaths because it is not an acute trust
Narrative_Description: Mersey Care NHS Foundation Trust have had five deaths related to Covid-19 and all patients that passed away had pre-existing conditions.
Motive_Description: Says Mersey Care Foundation Trust only had five covid deaths
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Meresey Care Foundation Trust, five, deaths
Summary: A post on Facebook with over 1,000 shares shows a Freedom of Information (FOI) request to Mersey Care NHS Foundation Trust, which says that there were only five deaths related to Covid-19 in that trust, and that those patients all had pre-existing conditions.

Title: Covid-19 is an infectious disease, and a video claiming it isn’t is wrong

Motive_Description: Claims the pandemic is caused by radiation
Summary: Facebook video claims pandemic is casued by radiation

Summary: Tweet claims COVID-19 vaccine isn't qualified to be a vaccine

Narrative_Description: The Covid vaccine is an RNA vaccine. This will actually change your DNA.
Motive_Description: Claims the covid vaccine will change DNA
Summary: Facebook post claims COVID-19 vaccine will change DNA

Title: This is a real letter from an NHS trust that dealt with no Covid-19 deaths

Motive_Description: Claims a hopsital hans't been recording covid deaths
Key_Words: Coronavirus, South West Yorkshire NHS partnership, record, deaths
Summary: Facebook posts claim South West Yorkshire NHS partnership has not recorded any deaths due to Covid-19 between February and September 2020.

Title: The Lancet no dijo que Colombia es uno de los países que peor trató la pandemia
Narrative_Description: Colombian senator Gustavo Petro claims that scientific journal The Lancet named Colombia as one of the worst three countries that has handled the pandemic
Motive_Description: Claim that Colombian government is not handling pandemic well
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, Gustavo Petro, The Lancet, case count
Summary: Colombian Senator Gustavo Petro retweeted a story published by medical journal The Lancet and claimed that it named Colombia as one of the three worst countries handling the coronavirus pandemic. However, the report said nothing about mitigation procedures and simply listed countries by their number of cases per a million habitants, of which Colombia was third to last.

Title: Otra vez, el covid sí se puede transmitir en ambientes cálidos
Narrative_Description: Facebook post claim that Chinese medic asserts that the virus cannot be trasnmitted in warm climate
Motive_Description: Claim virus cannot travel in warm environments
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, China, doctor, warm climate, transmissibility
Summary: A post on Facebook shared a photo that claimed that a Chinese medical professional had found that the coronavirus cannot be transmitted in warm environments. The World Health Organization has disproven such claim.

Title: No, con el Decreto 497 de 2020 el gobierno no ordenó cuarentena obligatoria a partir del 1 de noviembre
Narrative_Description: Claim that the newly passed law 'Decreto 497' will make quarantine mandatory as of Novermber 1st
Motive_Description: Claim that quarantine will be madatory for 19 days
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Colombia, quaratine, laws, government, Decreto 497
Summary: A WhatsApp chain circulated in which it stated that Colombia's new Law 497 of 2020 will made quarantines mandatory for all citizens as of November 1st for a period of 19 days. The Ministry of Health denied this claim.

Title: No ha fallecido una menor de 13 años en Portugal por una parada cardiorespiratorria "asociada al uso de mascarilla"
Narrative_Description: Claim that a thirteen year old girl died as a result of wearing a mask
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the dangers of using a mask and discouraging its use
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, Portugal, masks, risk, death, minor
Summary: A Facebook post claims that a thirteen-year-old girl in Portugal died from cardiorespitory arrest caused by wearing a face masks. However, officials have asserted that the girl had ongoing health conditions that led to her death and that there is no correlation between her wearing a mask and her death.

Title: Es falso que la COVID-19 ya apareciera en un estudio financiado por la Comisión Europea en 2008
Narrative_Description: Claim that a 2008 study financed by the European Commission and written by Chinese officials mentioned COVID-19 suggesting that officials knew about the disease before 2020
Motive_Description: Spread fear that disease was known about and even fabricated
Summary: Facebook post shows images of a 2008 study published by Chinese scientists and financed by the European Commission and uses these to claim that COVID-19 was known about since then. Although the study mentions a SARS-CoV-2, this term was used to describe a portion of the large genomic material of SARS-Cov-1 which causes gripe and not COVID-19.

Title: Nein, Abstrichstäbchen von Corona-Schnelltests sind nicht „verseucht“

Motive_Description: Spread fear about rapid test tools by claiming that they are dangerous
Key_Words: Germany, rapid test, biological hazard, sick
Summary: A facebook  user claimed that the rapid test tools have biological hazard sign on their package and are contaminated with the virus thus will make you sick if you put them into your nose or throat

Title: Nein, Nasenabstriche für einen Corona-Test gleichen nicht einer „Strafe für Sklaven“ im Alten Ägypten
Narrative_Description: A facebook post claims that nasal corona tests  are like the slave punishments in ancient Egypt which can damage your health
Motive_Description: Spread fear about nasal swab corona tests by claiming that they are dangerous
Summary: A facebook post accompained by an Egyptian drawing claims that that nasal swab corona tests are like the slave punishments in ancient Egypt which can damage your health and can have lasting effects

Title: Nein, an der Universität Cambridge wurden nicht 9.000 Studierende falsch-positiv auf Corona getestet
Narrative_Description: Of all the positive Covid tests of the 9,000+ students at Cambridge University tested in the week to 6 December, every single one was found to be a false positive after a second test.
Motive_Description: To spread fear about reliability of the
Summary: A British journalist tweeted that  f all the positive Covid tests of the 9,000+ students at Cambridge University tested in the week to 6 December, every single one was found to be a false positive after a second test, which was then shared by German speaking Twitter users

Title: „Dauer-Lockdown“? Angela Merkels Aussage wird irreführend interpretiert

Summary: A facebook post claims that the German prime minister Angela Merkel has said that the lockdowns will be permanent unless everyone gets vaccinated, the bases of which is a statement/video of Merkel. However, the statement is quoted out of its context

Title: Video: Keine Belege, dass ein Corona-Schnelltest positiv auf Fruchtsaft reagierte
Narrative_Description: A facebook post claims that the coronavirus test has reacted positive to fruit juice
Motive_Description: It tries to undermine reliability of the coronavirus tests, but nothing to indicate it is to push conspiracy theories so I coded it as Other
Summary: In a video a Polish man uses fruit juice on a coronavirus test and a facebook post tries to undermine reliability of the coronavirus tests through that. It was shared both in Poland and in Germany

Title: Pfizer no ha descrito la encefalitis como efecto adverso de la vacuna contra la COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Viral claims spread that Pfizer vaccine causes encephalitis.
Motive_Description: Raises fears regarding the vaccine, undermining the broader campaign.
Summary: Following a statement from the Spanish physician Pedro Cavadas regarding potential encephalitis resulting from taking a vaccine in the third stage of its trials, misinformation has spread that has stated that Pfizer's vaccine could cause such a reaction. However, Pfizer's vaccine has surpassed all such trials.

Title: Araceli Hidalgo, la primera vacunada en España contra la COVID-19, no ha muerto 24 horas después: es un fotomontaje
Narrative_Description: False claim that the first person vaccinated in Spain died within 24 hours following vaccination.
Motive_Description: Raises fears regarding the vaccine, undermining the broader campaign.
Summary: A false news story has been spread using the format of the Spanish newspaper El Mundo's headlines that states the first person in Spain to have received the COVID-19 vaccine died within 24 hours of vacciation.

Title: Augosto Costa: "Los sistemas centrales de acondicionamiento de aire son elementos demostrados de propagación del  virus
Narrative_Description: Director of Buenos Aires' Ministry of Production, Science, and Technology Innovation Augosto Costa claimed that all air conditioners should be left off because they help spread the virus
Motive_Description: Suggest that turning off air conditioners can help stop the spread of coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, Buenos Aires, Augosto Costa, air conditioner, spread
Summary: The manager of Buenos Aires' Ministry of Production, Science, and Technology Innovation, Augosto Costa, claimed that individuals would not be allowed to enter retaurants or hotels that had air conditioners because they spread coronavirus. Although officials said that air conditioners used wrongly can help propagate the virus, there is no scientific proof that says that they help transmit the disease to Others.

Title: No, la vacuna de Pfizer no ha sido elaborada en China y esta foto es de un inhalador
Narrative_Description: The Pfizer vaccine has been manufactured in China.
Motive_Description: Chain messages spread the false claim that Pfizer's vaccine is an  inhalant and manufactured in China, not in its labs in Belgium, Germany and the US, propagating the China's connection to the virus's origin and profits from the vaccine.
Summary: A manipulated WhatsApp image shows the Pfizer vaccine coming out of China ("made in China") and in the form of an inhalant, not an injection. It also calls Pfizer "maker of the boner pill," following the company's design of Viagra.

Title: Son falsas varias afirmaciones del médico Luis Martínez que circulan en videos virales
Narrative_Description: Medical professional Luis Martinez posted videos which claim that the mRNA vaccines will alter one's genetic make up
Motive_Description: Spread fear about mRNA vaccines
Key_Words: Coronavirus, mRNA vaccines, Argentina, Luis Martínez
Summary: Luis Martínez, a medical professional, posted a video which circulated on social Mediain which he claimed that mRNA vaccines will alter one's genetic material and change the way genes are expressed. This is not true.

Title: San falsas las afirmaciones sobre el proyecto de ley de vacunas de la médica Pamela Mas
Narrative_Description: Claim that the government can vaccinate one with anything and that we do not know what exactly is it in; also, pharmaceuticals have complete legal immunity
Motive_Description: Spread fear about vaccines
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Argentina, vaccines, Pamela Mas, risk
Summary: A video circulated on Facebook and WhatsApp where Dr. Pamela Mas claimed that one can have no clue what is actually in the COVID-19 vaccine and that it could inject individuals with anything. She also argued that pharmaceuticals had legal immunity if anything went wrong. There is no law that provides vaccine distributers with legal immunity.

Title: Las afirmaciones falsas del video de María José Martínez Albarracín, miembro del grupo negacionista 'Médicos por la Verdad España', sobre la vacuna de la gripe y la COVID-19
Narrative_Description: "Doctors for the Truth" member María José Martínez Albarracín claims that the flu vaccine will make one more susceptable to COVID-19
Motive_Description: Spread fear about the flu vaccines

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Spain, flu vaccine, Medicos por la verdad, María José Martínez Albarracín
Summary: In a video posted by Medicos por la verdad (Medics for the Truth), Dr. María José Martínez Albarracín claimed that getting the flu vaccine can make one more susceptable to getting COVID-19 and becoming severely sick. This is unproven.

Title: No, no es cierto que no haya ninguna vacuna autorizada en Europa frente a la COVID-19: la web del Ministerio de Sanidad estaba desactualizada
Narrative_Description: Claims made that the Spanish Health Ministry had not approved any vaccine.
Motive_Description: Antivaccine groups spread anticuated information detailing the lack of approval of vaccines.
Summary: Antivaccine groups spread anticuated information detailing the lack of approval of vaccines by sharing screenshot of the Spanish Health Minstry's page prior to the vaccine's approval.

Title: No, no se está vacunando a niños en un colegio de Villamartín (Cádiz) sin el permiso de sus padres y tampoco se está vacunando en España contra el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claim that a school in Cádiz has been vaccinated children without parent's permission
Motive_Description: Spread fear about vaccinations without consent and flu vaccines in general

Summary: A woman posted a video on social Mediain which she stated that a friend claimed her daughter was given the flu vaccine at the Virgen de las Montañas de Villamartín school in Cádiz without parental permission. The school has issued a statement saying no no vaccinations have been done.

Title: No, la Junto de Andalucía no ha suspendido las clases por la segunda ola de COVID-19 a fecha de 29 de octubre de 2020
Narrative_Description: Claim that officials in Andalucía are ordering for the suspension of clases as of October 29, 2020 because of a wave of second infections

Summary: A post circulated on social Mediawhich said that the Board of Andalucía will be suspending all classes as of October 29, 2020 because of a second wave of infections. The Board issued a statement claiming this was not true.

Title: "Covid-19 es un plan internacional para el control y reducción de las poblaciones, planeficado hace décadas y lanzado en el 2020"
Narrative_Description: Claim by Italian doctor Roberto Petrella that coronavirus was a planned event by the international community to use vaccines in order to diminish the world population
Motive_Description: Spread fear about vaccines and the nature of the virus in general
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Ecuador, Italy, Roberto Petrella, vaccine, population control
Summary: A post on social Mediaclaimed that Italian doctor Roberto Petrella had discovered that the coronavirus had been planned for decades and that they released the disease in 2020 in order to use vaccinations as a way to diminish the world population.

Title: Ecuador descubre la cura para el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Claim that Ecuador has discovered the cure to coronavirus since they discovered that bacteria, not a virus, causes the disease which means that it can be cured with antibiotics
Motive_Description: Claim that a cure has been discovered
Summary: A WhatsApp chain claims that Ecuadorian doctors did an autopsy and discovered that it was bacteria and not a virus that causes COVID-19; therefore, they said that the cure was an antibiotic. This is not true.

Title: Pennsylvania “never opened.”
Narrative_Description: In a campaign rally, Trump claimed that Pennsylvannia had never opened
Motive_Description: Support Trump campaign
Summary: In a rally, Trump exaggerrates by sayitng that Pennsylvania hasn't opened at all

Title: А, может быть, нашествие коронавируса - это такая террористическая атака?
Narrative_Description: MP Gennady Onishenko makes a lot of sensational claims
Motive_Description: downplay pandemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Russia, flu, informational warfare, exploit fear, stress
Summary: Claims that the flu is a bigger issue than coronavirus; pandemic is an example of a preplanned informational terrorism attack

Title: "Generally the deaths are still pretty flat because we've flattened the curve.”

Truth is, however, that Korea has changed its position on quick swab tests: they are only used for people having, for instance, to travel, and not for the domestic calculation of infection rates

Summary: After an article from the website "Cashkurs", which exaggerated an Other article from the Reuters news agency, the idea spread in Germany that the companies producing vaccines had signed contracts with countries preventing them from being legally prosecuted in case of serious side effects. This is not true as the companies can be prosecuted, even though many contracts impose that the country should pay for potential financial compensations.

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Switzerland, PCR, test, swab, efficacy
Summary: The words of a leaflet on PCR tests coming from the Federal Office of Public Health (FOPH) in Switzerland were misinterpreted and went viral on social Mediaand websites in Germany, with claims that PCR tests are useless and completely ineffective for detecting coronavirus

Title: Nein, in den USA sind nicht nur sechs Prozent der Corona-Toten an Covid-19 gestorben
Narrative_Description: Claim that in the USA only 6% of people who tested positive for coronavirus and later died actually died of COVID-19
Motive_Description: Claim that the coronavirus threat is much less serious than people believe
Source_Description: AfD Facebook page, Other Facebook accounts
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, USA, CDC, mortality rate, die, cause of death
Summary: The news went viral on social Mediain Germany, and was also shared by a Facebook page belonging to far-right party AfD, that in the USA only 6% of people who tested positive for coronavirus and later died actually died of COVID-19. This is not true, as 92% of the deaths of people testing positive were caused by coronavirus, even though in many cases additional illnesses developed

Title: Corona-Demo: Nein, der Polizist vor dem Reichstag ist kein Schauspieler
Narrative_Description: Claim that the policeman holding crowds back from storming the German Bundestag at a rally to protest against COVID restrictions is actually an actor
Motive_Description: Have people believe that the attempted storming of the German Bundestag at a rally against COVID restrictions was staged
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Berlin, rally, storm, Bundestag, stage, policeman, actor
Summary: The news went viral on social Mediain Germany that the policeman seen in a video holding back crowds from storming the German Bundestag, during a rally to protest against COVID restrictions, was actually an actor and so the events had been staged

Title: Virales Video: Darum führt die „Zerstörung des Corona-Hypes“ in die Irre
Narrative_Description: Video containing several false claims on the coronavirus epidemic: that the virus is not dangerous, PCR tests are ineffective and lockdown measures are completely useless
Motive_Description: Suggest that the virus threat is not as serious as people believe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Sebastian Götz, mortality, influenza, lockdown, measures, useless
Summary: A video published by a young psychology student and YouTuber, Sebastian Götz, went viral in Germany: it claimed that lockdown measures implemented by the German government are completely useless in fighting the epidemic, since COVID is no more dangerous than influenza

Title: Nein, die Polizei darf nicht auf Corona-Infizierte schießen, weil sie sich nicht an die Quarantäne halten
Narrative_Description: Claim that police is allowed to use firearms to shoot people who do not comply with quarantine procedures
Motive_Description: Criticize the German government and its police forces for supposedly enacting extreme methods to force people to stay home
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, SFR, shoot, firearms, quarantine, stay at home
Summary: An old article with FAQ on quarantine by the SFR news website contained the false claim that policemen are explicitly allowed to use firearms to shoot people that violate quarantine measures. Even though the news was false, it was shared by several Facebook users and went viral

Title: Gefälschter Tweet: Nein, Markus Söder hat Kritikern der Corona-Maßnahmen nicht mit Gefängnis gedroht
Narrative_Description: Claim that Bavarian Prime Minister Markus Söder has threatened people criticizing COVID restrictions implemented with legal action
Motive_Description: Criticize Bavarian Prime Minister Markus Söder for not accepting criticism and possibly being anti-democratic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Bavaria, Prime Minister, PM, Markus Söder, CSU, legal action, criticize, lockdown, restrictions
Summary: A counterfait tweet by Bavarian Prime Minister Markus Söder (it even exceeded the normal word limit for tweets) started circulating on social Mediain German. It threatened those who criticized the government's handling of the epidemic, especially lockdown measures, with legal action

Title: Irreführender Vergleich von Todesfällen durch Influenza und Covid-19 im Umlauf
Narrative_Description: Post with comparison of coronavirus and influenza deaths, claiming influenza is more deadly
Motive_Description: Downplay the severity of the coronavirus epidemic
Summary: A post went viral in Germany, comparing the deaths due to coronavirus to those of influenza and suggesting that the current epidemic is less serious than common, seasonal influenza epidemics. However, the figures quoted are from Austria, they are partially wrong, and a comparison of influenza and coronavirus cases makes no sense

Title: Keine Belege, dass dieser Berliner Polizist nach der Corona-Demo gekündigt hat

Summary: The news went viral through a chain message and on Facebook in Germany that a policeman who had joined protests in Berlin against COVID restrictions later received a warning as a consequence

Motive_Description: Highlighting research that says immunity is real

Summary: In a tweet, Sen. Rand Paul misleadingly suggested that immunity from “naturally acquired” COVID-19 was better than that from a vaccine.

Summary: A Facebook post claims the covid-19 is just a simulation

Summary: Conservative radio host Rush Limbaugh falsely claimed that the AMA rescinded a previous statement and came out in support of hydroxychloroquine

Narrative_Description: A volunteer recipient of the Pfizer vaccine is said to have experienced severe reactions.
Motive_Description: Spread fear with regards to the vaccine during its trial period.

However, at the time the story was released, then volunteer did not know if she had received the placebo or the vaccine and the symptoms did not qualify as severe, but rather as typical and to be expected even in patients with the placebo.

Title: No, el niño de la camiseta amarilla que aparece en la foto de esta familia de inmigrantes turcos en Alemania no es Ugur Sahin, el cofundador de BioNTech, la empresa que ha desarrollado la vacuna de la COVID-19 con Pfizer
Narrative_Description: A Turkish immigrant family arrived to German in 1969, and the boy in the photo is said to be the founder of BioNTech, Ugur Sahin.

Summary: A photo of a Turkish family that had recently immigrated to Germany has circulated, as the young boy was believed to have been the founder of BioNTech, the company that owns Pfizer. However, the company itself has clearly established that it is not Ugur Sahin nor his family.

However, the CNN image is falsified, as it corresponds to a video broadcast by the network after Keenan received the vaccine on December 8, although it appears in Other publications on its website, both previous and newer.

Title: Bill Gates no 'apagará tu chip' para matarte de hambre, eso es falso

Summary: A photograph of Bill Gates was edited to be published on social Mediawith a text that says: “Digital economy? We ditch the cash. We give you a chip. We put all your money on a chip. If you reject the vaccine, we pay for the chip and you die of hunger " Digital economy is misunderstood here, it is just a general term to refer to human activities that occur and are facilitated online.

Title: Covid-19: Nein, AstraZeneca musste seinen Impfstoff nicht wegen Nebenwirkungen zurückziehen
Narrative_Description: Claim that pharmaceutical company AstraZeneca has had to withdraw its coeonavirus vaccine because of very serious adverse effects on patients
Motive_Description: Spread fear that the coronavirus vaccine developed by AstraZeneca can cause serious adverse effects

Summary: The claim went viral on facebook in Germany that AstraZeneca had to withdraw its coronavirus vaccine, since after tests it had caused very serious adverse effects on a patient. The claim was untrue as AstraZeneca did not have to withdraw the vaccine and no link had been established between the vaccine and the patient's health conditions

Title: Nein, Markus Söder hat einer Zehnjährigen nicht gesagt, sie müsse Abstand halten, sonst würden ihre Eltern sterben
