Source_Description: AfD Chairman in the Bavarian Parliament, Other Facebook users
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Bavaria, Markus Söder, Prime Minister, 10-year-old, girl, social distancing, grandparents, die
Summary: A fake quote by Bavarian Prime Minister Markus Söder went viral on social Mediaand was especially pushed by the Bavarian section of far-right party AfD. In it, Söder said to a 10-year-girl that her parents would die, if she did not respect social distancing. In reality, even though the PM had carried out an interview with a girl, he never said those words

Title: Nein, dieses Video aus einem Behandlungszentrum beweist nicht, dass die Corona-Pandemie für die Medien inszeniert wird
Narrative_Description: Video showing a woman filming herself, pretending to have COVID-19, in a hospital, used as evidence that the coronavirus epidemic is being staged
Motive_Description: Have people believe that the coronavirus epidemic is not real and is being staged, or greatly exaggerated, by the Mediato stir panic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, hospital, woman, pretend, video, film
Summary: An Instagram story where a woman is seen filming herself, pretending to have COVID-19 while in a hospital, went viral on social Mediaand was used by many to claim that the epidemic is actually being staged by the media. However, the woman was simply part of a simulation destined to medical staff, and no press had used her images to spark fear among the population as the claims suggested

Title: Wirksamkeit von Mund-Nasen-Schutz: Zitat von Christian Drosten irreführend interpretiert
Narrative_Description: Fake claim by German virologist Christian Drosten that masks are of no use to prevent coronavirus infections
Motive_Description: Have people believe masks are useless to prevent the spread of the epidemic

Summary: The rumor went viral on social Mediathat famous German virologist Christian Drosten had said that masks are of no use in stopping the spread of the epidemic. He had actually said that there is no scientific evidence that the form of COVID-19 developed by a person is milder, if the person is infected while wearing a mask.

Title: Dieses Foto eines Babys wurde bearbeitet – das Kind trug im Original keine Maske
Narrative_Description: Picture of a new born baby wearing a mask in a hospital
Motive_Description: Initially spread with satirical purposes, was then believed by many
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, hospital, baby, mask, wear, picture
Summary: A photomontage by the satirical website "Der Postillon", showing a newborn child wearing a mask in a hospital, was believed by many to be true and went viral on Facebook, accompanied by strong criticism

Title: Nein, es sind nicht 90 Prozent aller positiven PCR-Tests in den USA falsch-positiv
Narrative_Description: Claim that 90% of all PCR tests carried out in the USA are wrong
Motive_Description: Suggest that the coronavirus epidemic is a hoax
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, PCR test, results, false positive, wrong, scam
Summary: Several Facebook posts in Germany claimed the coronavirus epidemic is a scam, by quoting a newspaper article by The New York Times and saying it claimed that 90% of all PCR tests carried out in the USA were actually wrong in detecting infections. The article was actually about the sensitivity of such PCR tests, and the claims that the epidemic is fake are obviously falls.

Title: Nein, unter einem Mund-Nasen-Schutz steigt die CO2-Konzentration nicht auf einen gesundheitsgefährdenden Wert
Narrative_Description: Video of a woman measuring the level of CO2 while breathing in a mask and claiming it is excessively high
Motive_Description: Have people fear that wearing a mask might dangerously increase the level of CO2 they breathe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, video, woman, measure, CO2, dangerous, high, level, mask, breathe
Summary: The video of a woman using a device to measure the level of CO2 around her while breathing in a mask and claiming it is dangerously high was widely shared on Facebook in Germany. The video, however, is meaningless, as the scientific community has disproven such a claim and the volume of air under the mask is too small to effectively use that kind of device

Title: Nein, ein Nasenabstrich beim PCR-Test verursacht bei korrekter Durchführung keine Verletzungen
Narrative_Description: Claim that swab tests are a dangerous diagnosis procedure for COVID-19, as they can lead to serious injuries and inflammations
Motive_Description: Have people believe that swab tests are dangerous and might cause inflammations and injuries
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, swab test, PCR, injuries, inflammations, danger, child
Summary: The stylized picture of a PCR test performed on a child, accompanied by claims that it might cause serious injuries and inflammations, went viral on Facebook in Germany. However, the test is absolutely harmless when carried out the right way, and the picture shows a wrong way to carry it out

Title: Nein, ein Dokument der Weltbank beweist nicht, dass die Quarantänemaßnahmen bis 2025 andauern
Narrative_Description: Claim that, according to a document by the World Economic Forum, quarantine measures will last until 2025
Motive_Description: Spark fear that quarantine measures will last four more years
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, World Economic Forum, quarantine, last, 2025
Summary: A Facebook post which went viral in Germany warned users about a document by the World Economic Forum, claiming it stated that quarantine measures would be implemented by countries until 2025. The document screenshotted, however, came from the World Bank and contained no such statement: it discussed economic relief measures, with a plan up to 2025.

Title: Nein, das RKI verstößt mit seiner Zählweise von Fällen aufgrund von PCR-Tests nicht gegen das Infektionsschutzgesetz
Narrative_Description: Claim that the German government's COVID restrictions violate the country's Infection Protection Act as they're based on wrong COVID statistics provided by the Robert Koch Institute
Motive_Description: Criticize the German government and health institutions by suggesting their measures to tackle the epidemic are unlawful
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, RKI, Robert Koch Institute, Government, unlawful, PCR test, Infection Protection Act
Summary: Several Facebook posts which went viral in Germany suggested that the country's COVID restrictions are unlawful, as they're based on positive PCR test results provided by the Robert Koch Institute which are incapable on truly detecting infectiousness and therefore violate the Infection Protection Act. The country's measures, however, do not violate the law

Title: Nein, Covid-19 ist keine „Laborpandemie“, sondern eine gefährliche Krankheit
Narrative_Description: Video suggesting COVID-19 is a harmless disease and the pandemic has been a "laboratory epidemic" since March
Motive_Description: Downplay the severity of COVID-19 as a disease and of the entire epidemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, urologist, Yves Oberndörfer, laboratory, epidemic, PCR test
Summary: A video by German urologist Yves Oberndörfer went viral in Germany and was also shared in Austria and on social media. It suggested COVID-19 is a harmless disease and that the epidemic has been a "laboratory epidemic" since March (in the sense that it exists because pCR tests continue to detect it, even though it then has no consequences)

Title: Manipulativ gewähltes Bild suggeriert, dass die Corona-Regeln beim Festakt zur Einheitsfeier nicht befolgt wurden
Narrative_Description: Picture showing German politicians (including Chancellor Angela Merkel and Federal President Frank-Walter Steinmeier) supposedly not respecting social distancing measures during the celebrations for the 30th anniversary of German unity
Motive_Description: Criticize German politicians such as Angela Merkel and Frank-Walter Steinmeier for supposedly violating social distancing measures they implemented themselves

Summary: A Facebook account posted a picture of German politicians (including Chancellor Angela Merkel and Federal President Frank-Walter Steinmeier) supposedly not respecting social distancing measures during the celebrations for the 30th anniversary of German unity. The picture, however, was in an angle that made the figures look close, while more footage of the ceremony shows that the politicians were actually keeping their distance and wearing masks as soon as they were not seated

Title: Nein, Polizei Berlin ruft Bevölkerung nicht dazu auf, Corona-Verstöße von Gaststätten zu melden

Summary: The picture of a fake leaflet by the Berlin police went viral on Facebook in Germany: it called on citizens to report restaurants violating the curfew in place, and sparked widespread criticism.

Title: Keine Hinweise auf vermehrt Fälle von Borkenflechte bei Kindern durch Masken
Narrative_Description: Suggestion that wearing masks can cause ringworm (a parasitic skin infection) in children
Motive_Description: Have parents fear that their children might catch ringworm if they wear masks

Summary: Picture of children having ringworm (a parasitic skin rash) were shared on social Mediain Germany, accompanied by claims that wearing masks increases the likelihood that children catch this type of disease. However, there is no evidence for this, nor has an increases in the cases of ringworm since mandatory mask wearing has been implemented

Title: Vienna: No evidence that children with lung infections are in hospital because they were wearing a mask
Narrative_Description: Claim that several children are in hospital in Vienna after developing pulomnary fungal infections due to wearing masks
Motive_Description: Have parents fear that their children might suffer from pulomnary fungal infections if they wear masks
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, infection, pulmonary, lungs, masks, wear, children, Vienna
Summary: The claim spread on Facebook in Germany that several children had ended up in hospital in Vienna after developing pulmonary fungal infections due to wearing masks. This is untrue, as hospitals in Vienna denied the claim and there is no evidence masks cause such infections.

Title: UÍSQUE E MEL CONTRA CORONAVÍRUS - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Claim that drinking Whiskey and honey will help cure/fight COVID-19
Motive_Description: Have people try a Fake Remedy in hopes of curing COVID-19
Summary: The claim states that whiskey and honey would help fight coronavirus was spread on Whatsapp. At that moment, there were no known cure or treatments besides hospitalization.

Title: SUSPEITA DE CORONAVÍRUS NO HOSPITAL DE SANTA MARIA (DF) - É FAKE NEWS!
Narrative_Description: Claim of a positive COVID-19 case in the federal district of Brazil.
Motive_Description: Have people believe that someone had a positive case of COVID-19 after interacting with Chinese people/products.
Summary: The claim states that there is a supected positive case in the Federal District of Brazil, who contracted it after interacting with "Chinese products and/or people." At the moment there were no positive cases in the federal district. The claim also seems to be racialized.

Title: Former Pfizer employee wrong that coronavirus pandemic is ‘effectively over’ in UK
Narrative_Description: Claims the coronavirus pandemic is effectively over in the U.K., and that there is absolutely no need for vaccines to extinguish the pandemic
Motive_Description: Downplaying the pandemic

Narrative_Description: Claim the speed of the vaccines' development is too fast

Summary: A Facebook post question the safety of vaccine because they claim the speed of the vaccines' development is too fast

Narrative_Description: Claim there's possibility of infertility caused by the COVID-19 vaccine

Summary: A blog post claims the head of Pfizer Research claim Covid vaccine is female sterilization

Summary: Gov. Greg Abbott claims shutdowns are ineffective and that we now know that COVID-19 is not commonly spread by someone going to work

The OMS, however, based its reasoning on the productionof the sensation of asfixia, known as shortness of breath or Dyspnea.

Title: Nein, die WHO hat nicht bestätigt, dass Covid-19 weniger schlimm als eine Grippe sei

Title: Nein, der Corona-Sonderfonds wurde in Bayern nicht schon 2019 beschlossen

Title: Nein, es wurde kein Immunitätsausweis beschlossen

Motive_Description: The article about the immunity card accused Chancellor Angela Merkel of wanting to control the population, so it can be assumed its goal was to discredit the Chancellor
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Angela Merkel, Parliament, law, pass, immunity card, exempt, restrictions
Summary: The news was released by a German website, and suddenly went viral, that the German Parliament had passed a law creating an "immunity card" to exempt people from COVID restrictions in case they are immune to coronavirus. The article also accused Merkel of wanting to control the population, but was baseless: no such law was ever passed

Title: Nein, dieses Foto von Merkel, Spahn, Laschet und Söder stammt nicht von Oktober 2020

Summary: A picture taken before the implementation of social distancing measures in Germany, showing German politicians Merkel, Spahn, Laschet and Söder standing in close proximity to each Other and talking, was taken out of context to criticize them and accuse them of not respecting the restrictions. In the fake claims, it was said the photo had been taken in October.

Title: Nein, eine hohe Sterblichkeitsrate war bei der WHO nie Voraussetzung für „Pandemie“-Definition

Motive_Description: Undermine the credibility of the World Health Organization, by suggesting that strangely enough it changed the definition of "pandemic" the year before coronavirus
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, WHO, World Health Organization, mortality, rate, 2019, change, definition, pandemic
Summary: The news spread on social Mediain Germany that in 2019, the World Health Organization changed its definition of pandemic excluding the requirement of a high mortality rate. According to the claims, without those changes the coronavirus epidemic would not be considered a pandemic. This is not true, however, as the definition has remained the same for a long time

Title: Nein, eine US-Forschungsorganisation hat nicht die Wirkungslosigkeit der Corona-Maßnahmen bestätigt

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, NBER, USA, Government, restrictions, measures, research, paper, AfD, useless
Summary: A German blog released an article which was quickly shared by Other websites and went viral on Facebook, where it was also shared by a member of far-right political party AfD. It claimed a study carried out by the American NBER had proved the ineffectiveness of all government restrictions implemented to stop the spread of the coronavirus epidemic. The study, however, never came to those conclusions.

Title: Nein, das Tragen eines Mund-Nasen-Schutzes führt nicht zu Zahnproblemen

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Richard Rothschild, Bodo Schiffman, patent, test, 2015, submit
Summary: The news spread on social Mediain Germany that Richard Rothschild had submitted to the European Patent Office a patent for a test to detect COVID-19, in 2015 (implying that he must have known about the incoming epidemic all along). This is untrue, as the said patent was only submitted in May 2020

Title: No hay evidencias que vinculen la vacuna de Pfizer con la causa de la muerte de seis personas que participaron en sus ensayos clínicos

Motive_Description: The publications make people think that the vaccine introduces an overt risk.

Summary: The publication shares that six of the human volunteers participating in Pfizer's experimental vaccine have died and that four were part of the control group and two received the vaccines. However, the statistics of the trials reported reflect typical death rates at large in society and do not indicate.

Title: Según Gollán, un estudio publicado en Nature dice que “los pacientes asintomáticos tienen bajísima o casi nula capacidad de contagio”
Narrative_Description: Asymptomatic patients are not contagious and therefore negative PCR tests should not be required to enter the Buenos Aires province.
Motive_Description: Gollan makes people have a false sense of security and take lesser measures if they are not exposing symptoms.
Summary: The Argentine politician incorrectly interperts an article from the magazine Nature suggesting that asymptomatic individuals with Coronavirus are not contagious. The study The study tested more than 10 million people in China, including only 300 people who had a positive PCR and who did not show symptoms. Additionally, 1,174 close contacts were tested and all were negative. However, the article does not conclude that the virus cannot be transmitted this way and that its results are not transferable.

Title: Detector a imagen engañosa sobre las vacunas

Summary: The image featuring a baby receiving various injections, casts doubt on the Coronavirus vaccine's efficacy, as vaccines for Cancer and AIDS have taken much longer to produce.

Title: Nein, Statistiken für Corona-Tote in Europa werden nicht auf Anweisung der EU gefälscht

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, EU, statistics, epidemic, count, deaths, month
Summary: The claim spread on social Mediain Germany, after being initially pushed by news websites, that according to EU regulations (by a non-specified "European Disease Protection Authority") the deaths of people who had tested positive for coronavirus at any point during the month before their death, have to be counted as "coronavirus deaths". This is not true

Title: Irreführender Beitrag von „Servus-TV“: Nein, mit der 7-Tage-Inzidenz wird die Corona-Fall-Statistik nicht „manipuliert“

This news was shared on social Mediasuch as Twitter and Facebook, also in Germany, together with accusations of "statistical manipulation" of the data. However, the data usually presented on TV for COVID are not manipulated and transparent.

Title: Dieses Foto von Angela Merkel zeigt keinen Verstoß gegen die Corona-Regeln – es stammt von 2018

Summary: The picture of German Chancellor Angela Merkel, drinking beer in a pub with Other European leaders (including, for instance, French President Macron) went viral on Facebook in Germany, accompanied by criticism as they were in blatant violation of social distancing measures. Title: Bild-Collage von Protesten weltweit: Nicht in jedem dieser Länder wurde gegen die Corona-Maßnahmen demonstriert

Summary: A collage showing pictures of rallies in different countries went viral on Facebook in Germany. It was accompanied by claims that those rallies had been held to protest against COVID restrictions and that the Mediawere keeping it a secret. However, those rallies that were indeed protesting against the restrictions had been reported by the media, and many Others in the photomontage did not have anything to do with COVID in the first place

Title: Nein, die Polizei ist nicht auf „Netzmasken“ umgestiegen, weil man damit besser atmen könne
Narrative_Description: CLaim that the German police has now switched to wearing "net masks" (i.e. sort of lighter face coverings) when in public, as they make it easier for them to breathe
Motive_Description: Suggest that the police is wearing lighter face coverings to protect themselves against coronavirus

Summary: A picture dating back to May 2020 was taken out of context to claim that the police in Bavaria had switched to wearing "net masks" (i.e. sort of lighter face coverings) in public, as they make it easier for them to breathe. However, being from May, the picture was taken at a time where face masks where still not mandatory in Germany.

Title: Detector: eI Instituto de Virología de Wuhan no tiene relación con las farmacéuticas GSK y Pfizer
Narrative_Description: Suggests a connection between the Virology Laboratory in Wuhuan and Glaxo, the owner of Pfizer.

Title: Las afirmaciones falsas de Arturo Vinuesa sobre el coronavirus y la COVID-19

He also elaborates how HIV genomic sequences are found in that of the Coronavirus and how the virus is being used to create 5g atennas.

Title: Es falso que hayan muerto 42 de los primeros 100 vacunados en la Argentina
Narrative_Description: 42 of the first 100 vaccinated Argentines have died.

Title: Nein, die Ehefrau von Markus Söder erwirtschaftete nicht 242 Millionen Euro mit Masken

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Markus Söder, wife, Karin Baumüller-Söder, Bavaria, Prime Minister, PM, masks, sell, earn, money
Summary: The claim spread on social Mediain Germany that Markus Söder's wife, Karin Baumüller-Söder, earned a great amount of money by selling masks online during the pandemic, due to the mandatory mask requirements implemented by her husband. It was also pushed by members of far-right opposition party AfD, but it was untrue.

Title: Covid-19: Nein, die US-Gesundheitsbehörde CDC hat nicht die Öffentlichkeit über die Rolle von Aerosolen „getäuscht“

Title: Nein, dieses Video zeigt nicht, wie französische Polizisten gegen die Corona-Maßnahmen protestieren
Narrative_Description: Videos and pictures of policemen protesting in france, accompanied by claims that they are protesting against COVID restrictions in the country
Motive_Description: Show that in Other countries, political support for movements against COVID restrictions are gaining momentum
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, France, police, protests, restrictions
Summary: The news went viral on social Mediain Germany that in neighboring France, the police was protesting against coronavirus restrictions, defining them "corona dictatorship". No such protest took place, however, and the photos and videos used were from anOther protest

Title: Rechte Youtuberin verbreitet irreführende Behauptungen zu Coronavirus und PCR-Tests
Narrative_Description: Claim that PCR tests are a fake diagnosis procedure for coronavirus , as they can be manipulated to be positive, and the virus has never even been isolated
Motive_Description: Suggest that the epidemic is probably being staged, as PCR tests are unreliable
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, AfD, PCR tests, isolate, epidemic
Summary: German YouTuber Naomi Seibt claimed, in a video, that PCR tests are unreliable and can actually be manipulated to make them be positive. She also added that coronavirus has never actually been isolated. The video with the fake content was pushed on the Facebook page of the AfD parliamentary group.

Title: Nein, das RKI hat nicht bestätigt, dass Covid-19 „gleich gefährlich“ wie die Grippe sei
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Robert Koch Institute (RKI) has confirmed that coronavirus is as dangerous as seasonal flu
Motive_Description: Suggest that the new coronavirus is low risk and actually comparable to influenza
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Austria, Germany, RKI, Robert Koch Institute, influenza, seasonal, epidemic
Summary: An Austrian website reported the news, which went viral also in Germany, that the Robert Koch Institute had confirmed the equivalence of coronavirus and seasonal flu in terms of mortality rate. However, the comparison doesn't make sense and the RKI never made it.

Title: „Servus-TV“ verbreitet unbelegte Aussage zur Quote falsch-positiver PCR-Tests
Narrative_Description: Claim that PCR tests returns false-positive results in 1% of the cases
Motive_Description: Suggest that among the coronavirus case count, there are more false-positives than people believe
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Austria, Germany, Servus-TV, PCR test, false positive, 1%, cases
Summary: Austrian TV channel "Servus-TV" posted on his Facebook profile the news that PCR tests return false-positives, when performed on healthy people, in 1% of the cases. While PCR tests are deemed by experts to be extremely precise, there is absolutely no evidence for their claim.

Title: Nein, diese Fotos beweisen nicht, dass die Corona-Pandemie angeblich inszeniert sei
Narrative_Description: Picture of the same man posing for pictures in different coronavirus related contexts (e.g. looking at an X-ray, being tested, etc.) accompanied by claims that he's an actor and the epidemic is being staged, as the virus does not exist
Motive_Description: Have people believe the epidemic is a hoax
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, old man, photos, pictures, contexts, actor, model, hoax, epidemic, staged
Summary: A collage of pictures of the same man in different coronavirus related contexts (e.g. looking at an X-ray, being tested, etc.) spread on social media, accompanied by claims that he's an actor and the epidemic is being staged, as the virus does not exist. While the man is actually a model phor a photo agency, those photos were never used by the media, according to an internet research, and they certainly do not prove the epidemic is being staged

Title: Nein, die Gesetzliche Unfallversicherung behauptet nicht, dass Schulen und Arbeitgeber für das Masketragen haften
Narrative_Description: Video of a man showing a document by the German Social Accident Insurance, stating that masks should be worn for a maximum of 2 hours, and that whoever employer orders people to keep them on for more that will be held liable for the potential consequences
Motive_Description: Spark fear that masks could be dangerous, and scare employers by suggesting the consequences of this danger will fall on them
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, German Social Accident Insurance, masks, 2 hours, maximum, liable, consequences, employers
Summary: A video went viral on social Mediain Germany: in it, a young man, was showing a document by the German Social Accident Insurance, stating that masks should be worn for a maximum of 2 hours, and that whoever employer orders people to keep them on for more that will be held liable for the potential consequences. However, the document was fake, and the Social Accident Insurance has announced legal action against the author.

Title: Covid-19: Nein, die Infektionssterblichkeitsrate in Deutschland liegt nicht bei 0,014 Prozent
Narrative_Description: Picture of a document containing data on the epidemic in Germany and stating that in the country the mortality rate is 0.014%
Motive_Description: Suggest the epidemic is less dangerous than it seems, as it has a mortality rate of only 0.014%
Summary: The picture of a document, showing a mortality rate for coronavirus in Germany of 0.014%, went viral in Germany, where it was accompanied by suggestions that that was the true mortality rate. However, the mortality rate for COVID-19 in the country is estimated to be significantly higher than that number

Title: Genua: Dieses Video zeigt keine „Corona-Demo“, sondern Proteste von Arbeitern eines Stahlwerks
Narrative_Description: Video of a protest in Genoa with police clapping in support of protesters, accompanied by claims the protest was against COVID restrictions
Motive_Description: Show that the movement protesting against covid restrictions is gaining momentum across countries
Key_Words: Coronavirus, demonstration, rally, Germany, Italy, Genoa, restrictions
Summary: The claim spread on social media, initially from Italy but then mostly in Austria and Germany, that a rally was being held in Genoa to protest against COVID restrictions (and that the police had clapped at protesters). This is not true however and the video used to substantiate the claims was actually from a different protest in the city (of a union of workers).

Title: Trump Misleads on Reasons for Falling COVID-19 Fatality Rate
Narrative_Description: Trump claims we are pretty close to a cure
Motive_Description: Praise his effort to fight the virus
Summary: Trump has wielded the impressive-sounding statistic in press briefings, playing up the effectiveness of existing therapies and claiming credit for those discoveries

Title: Biden’s Early Statements About the Coronavirus
Narrative_Description: Biden claims in January he wrote an op-ed saying "we’ve got a pandemic. We’ve got a real problem.”
Motive_Description: Criticize Trump and praise himself
Summary: Biden claims in January he wrote an op-ed saying "we’ve got a pandemic. We’ve got a real problem.” Which is way before Trump did anything

Title: Most high-risk counties in Missouri don’t have mask mandates, despite Parson’s claim
Narrative_Description: Parson claims all Missouri’s high-risk areas have mask mandates in place
Motive_Description: Suggest Missouri is doing its job
Summary: Parson claims all Missouri’s high-risk areas have mask mandates in place when they don't

Title: YouTube video takes Bill Gates out of context on coronavirus vaccinations
Narrative_Description: Claims Bill Gates supports mandatory coronavirus vaccinations. ​
Motive_Description: Suggest Gates is supporting mandatory vaccination
Summary: A Youtube video claims Bill Gates says you don't have a choice to be vaccinated or not

Title: People have died of COVID-19 at home
Narrative_Description: Claims that people don’t die of COVID-19 at home
Motive_Description: Suggest COVID death are due to poor medical care
Summary: A Facebook post claims that people don’t die of COVID-19 at home, and suggest COVID death are due to poor medical care

Title: Tucker Carlson guest airs debunked conspiracy theory that COVID-19 was created in a lab
Narrative_Description: Claims the virus is a man-made virus created in the lab
Motive_Description: Suggest COVID is man made
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Tucker Carlson, lab, man made
Summary: Yan, a virologist,  claims that the Chinese government created the coronavirus in a Wuhan lab and released it intentionally

Title: Mun Choi’s numbers are off when it comes to ICU beds around Mizzou and UNC
Narrative_Description: Claims the number of ICU beds is larger in Boone County by a factor of three compared to Orange County
Motive_Description: Suggest why Mizzou’s campus is still while UNC is not
Summary: Mizzou Chancellor Mun Choi compared available ICU beds between his county and the county that’s home to the University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill.

Title: North Carolina's Dan Forest cherry-picks data on kids, COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claims kids are 17 times more likely to have ill effects from the seasonal flu than they are from the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Downplay severity of COVID
Summary: Dan Forest claims kids are 17 times more likely to have ill effects from the seasonal flu than they are from the coronavirus

Title: Joe Biden mistook Michigan’s COVID-19 numbers for military toll
Narrative_Description: Biden claims military COVID infected: 118,984. military COVID deaths: 6,114
Motive_Description: Criticize Donald Trump
Summary: Joe Biden’s campaign said he referred incorrectly to “military” when he meant to say “Michigan” in discussing the number of COVID-19 infections and deaths.

Title: No, the CDC hasn’t stopped calling COVID-19 a pandemic
Narrative_Description: Claims CDC has stopped calling COVID-19 a pandemic
Motive_Description: Criticize CDC
Summary: A Facebook post claims CDC has removed the ‘Covid-19 Pandemic’ and replaced it with ‘Covid-19 Outbreak’ on their website

Title: Joe Biden wrong about how early he called to invoke the Defense Production Act
Narrative_Description: Biden claims to be the first person to call for invoking the Defense Production Act.
Motive_Description: Praise his own action
Summary: Biden claims to be the first person to call for invoking the Defense Production Act when he's not

Title: Trump repeats false claim about COVID-19 deaths on Fox News
Narrative_Description: Trump claims only 6% of the people actually died from COVID
Motive_Description: Downplay severity of COVID
Summary: On a Fox News interview Trump claims only 6% of the people actually died from COVID while the Others died from Other reasons

Title: McEnany says Trump never downplayed the virus. He did, and Woodward’s tape explains why
Narrative_Description: McEnany claims Trump never downplayed the virus
Motive_Description: Stand up for Trump
Summary: In a White House press briefing, McEnany says Trump never downplayed the virus

Title: Politicians have died from COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claims not one politician has died from the virus, lost their job, or had their business looted
Motive_Description: Criticize USA politician
Summary: A Facebook post claims no politician has died from the virus

Title: People are dying from COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Claims Covid-19 is not killing people. Weak immune systems and bad doctors are.
Motive_Description: Suggest Covid does not kill you
Summary: A Facebook post claims Covid-19 does not kill people. Instead, weak immune systems and bad doctors are.

Title: Cooper overstates ventilator access problem
Narrative_Description: Claims Covid deaths can be attributable to ICU bed or a ventilator problem
Motive_Description: Overstates ventilator access problem
Key_Words: Coronavirus, ventilator, ICU bed, Roy Cooper
Summary: North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper said some COVID-19 patients have died because they couldn't access a ventilator or bed in an Intensive Care Unit.

Title: Las vacunas que utilizan adenovirus, como Sputnik V, no se integrarán a tu genética
Narrative_Description: Vaccines that use adenovirus will modify DNA
Motive_Description: Misrepresent vaccine science to cause fear and resistance to vaccination.
Summary: Doctor María Eugenia Barrientos misrepresents vaccines that use the adenovirus, noting that they modify DNA. However, the adenovirus only serves as a vector to guide the vaccine's information to the cells.

Title: Las falsedades de la infografía que vincula las radiaciones de alta frecuencia con la COVID-19 persistente
Narrative_Description: Prolonged radiation exposure leads to what is known as Persistent Coronavirus
Motive_Description: Suggest that radiation released by 5g caused coronavirus
Summary: The article falsely reports that "high-frequency electromagnetic radiation" is related to COVID-19. As WHO notes, viruses do not travel through electromagnetic waves. It is also false that radiation from the environment is the cause of the "cytokine storm."

Title: Declaraciones de la ‘Coalición Mundial por la Salud y la Vida’ sobre COVID-19 son engañosas
Narrative_Description: COVID-19 is not a lung disease, it enters the body through the ears and has a fatty layer that is strengthened when consuming fatty foods.
Motive_Description: The WhatsApp audio contains many false claims designed to primarily spread misinforamtion and confusion regarding the virus. The motive is not entirely clear, as there are so many claims but appears generally to undermine national scientific efforts related to COVID-19.
Summary: The article contains many false or partially false claims made by the doctor Claudia Cepeda, a doctor who believes in promoting consciousness concerning altenrative medicine. One of the notable claims is that the virus can enter through the ears and consists of a fatty tissue that increases in viscosity when consuming fatty foods.

Title: No es necesario verificar los datos del padrón electoral para recibir la vacuna contra el coronavirus
Narrative_Description: The census/ voter registry will be used for vaccination campaigns
Motive_Description: Confuses people with respect to the government's use fo their data.
Summary: A chain message circulates inviting people to review their voter data, as that list would be used for the COVID-19 vaccination campaign. Until December 15, the provisional registry/census could be consulted and the voter data verified, but the current publication of the registry by the National Electoral Chamber was arranged without any relation to a possible vaccination campaign.

Title: No, la decisión de un tribunal portugués en Azores no ha supuesto “levantar el confinamiento” del paí
Narrative_Description: Portugal demands that the border closure be lifted, as PCRs are not reliable.
Motive_Description: Inspire doubt in the PCR tests and the border closures.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Portugal, Spain, tourists, borders, PCR
Summary: The story conflates various problems. A court in Lisbon had revoked the ban on four tourists from Germany, as a PCR test could not be used soley to detain people, but this decision did not make any change on the national level with respect to the necessity of having a negative PCR test.

Title: Es falso que un documento del Banco Mundial pruebe que el COVID fue planeado desde 2017
Narrative_Description: A video ensures that there is a document from the World Bank that proves that COVID was planned since 2017.
Motive_Description: Makes people think that the government created COVID
Summary: A World Bank document refers to COVID in 2017 in the context of medical supplies that were being stored but that do not have any relationt the current virus that has caused the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Las afirmaciones falsas del audio negacionista que dice que la pandemia fue creada por “un programa de activación de patógenos por campos magnéticos” y no por un virus
Narrative_Description: The pandemic was created by magnetic fields and not by a virus.
Motive_Description: Makes people misunderstand the origin of Coronavirus
Summary: An auido from an unnamed source shared on WhatsApp  says the pandemic was created by “a program of activation of pathogens by magnetic fields” and not by a virus.

Summary: In an interview with Fox News Donald Trump made several false claims

Title: Opening Ads in the Perdue-Ossoff Runoff
Narrative_Description: Democratic challenger Jon Ossoff accused his opponent of downplaying the coronavirus
Motive_Description: Criticize David Perdu
Summary: In the first TV ads of the runoff campaign Jon Ossoff accused his opponent of downplaying the coronavirus

Title: Fact Check: President Trump Invoking The Impoundment Control Act Does NOT Force Congress To Repeal Section 230, Cut Wasteful Spending, Add $2k Stimulus Checks

Narrative_Description: Claims MTHFR gene variants cause disease and increase the likelihood of vaccine reactions
Motive_Description: Spread fear about getting the vaccine if they have MTHFR
Summary: Claims MTHFR gene variants cause disease and increase the likelihood of vaccine reactions

Title: Fact Check: 'New Stimulus Bill' Does NOT Include Funding For The Smithsonian, Kennedy Center And More -- That Funding Is Part Of $1.4 Trillion Government Spending Deal
Narrative_Description: Claims the "new stimulus bill" include funding for the Smithsonian, Kennedy Center and more
Motive_Description: Criticize US government
Key_Words: Coronavirus, stimulus bill, Smithsonian, Kennedy Center
Summary: An Instagram post claims funds for the Smithsonian and Other cultural institutions were a part of the $900 billion COVID stimulus and relief package

Title: Fact Check: Post-Thanksgiving COVID-19 Surge Is NOT A 'No-Show': Numbers Increased In Most U.S. States
Narrative_Description: Claims the post-Thanksgiving surge in COVID-19 cases end up being a 'no-show'
Motive_Description: Discredit health experts
Summary: Article claims 'Thanksgiving Surge' predicted by health experts who warned against traveling for the holiday is a no show.

Title: Fact Check: Blue Cross Blue Shield Does NOT Pay Doctors A Bonus Only For Number of Children Vaccinated
Narrative_Description: Claims Blue Cross Blue Shield pay doctors a bonus based on the number of children they vaccinate
Motive_Description: Discredit Blue Cross Blue Shield
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Blue Cross Blue Shield, bonus
Summary: An Instagram post claims Blue Cross Blue Shield pay doctors a bonus based on the number of children they vaccinate

Title: Detector: No, la vacuna de ARN mensajero no es para esterilizar a la humanidad
Narrative_Description: Claims that messenger RNA based vaccines are sterilizing.
Motive_Description: Conspiracy theory based facebook groups promote fear of the vaccine to lower participation.
Summary: The conspiracy-based facebook groups shared how messenger-RNA "will sterilize humanity." Although the vaccine does not alter DNA and does not cause men's infertility.

Title: La foto de sanitarios trasladando un “cadáver ultraligero” no revela el “engaño” de la pandemia: es una representación para un banco de imágenes
Narrative_Description: A photo shared shows an extremely light cadaver that doctors do not struggle to lift on a sheet.
Motive_Description: Make people think that COVID is not real and the government response is a bluff.
Summary: A photo from a site of stock images has been associated with the falacy of COVID-19, as the doctors are not lifting an actual cadaver but rather "an ultralight" one.

Title: Detector: El azúcar no potencia el covid ni el dióxido de cloro es la solución al virus
Narrative_Description: Sugar causes the virus to grow stronger and chlorine is its solution.
Motive_Description: Makes people think that there are facile solutions and causes to the virus, downplaying its severity
Summary: A video shared on facebook falsely claims that sugar strengthens the coronavirus and that clorine dixoide is its solution.

Title: Es falso que las pruebas PCR encuentren “cualquier cosa” y no sirvan para detectar el nuevo coronavirus
Narrative_Description: A video that ensures that PCR tests find "anything" and are not used to detect the new coronavirus
Motive_Description: Introduces doubt regarding COVID testing
Summary: A video shared on Facebook and Youtube takes out of context a line from the inventor of the PCR tests stating that they do not detect viruses. However, the PCR tests while not used in themselves for diagnosis are used to amplify molecules and can lead to effective diagnosis.

Title: Detector: Bill Gates no dijo que 770 mil muertes por la vacuna de covid sea un buen resultado
Narrative_Description: Bill gates claimed that 770 million thousand death from the vaccine would be a good outcome.
Motive_Description: Makes people more concerned about the vaccine than the virus
Summary: A story shares a prediction allegedly by Bill Gates that predicts a very high death rate from vaccines. However, Gates referred to "side effects" of which death is only one of the many (and much less probable)

Title: Las afirmaciones falsas y negacionistas de Ana María Oliva sobre el SARS-CoV-2 y la pandemia por COVID-19
Narrative_Description: Ana María Oliva makes various claims, notably that the body's pH and toxicity will determine Covid infection. She also notes that COVID deaths are not caused by the virus but rather by involuntary medical error.
Motive_Description: Discredit scientific consensus on COVID-19.
Key_Words: Coronavirus, PCR, pH, deaths, medical, error
Summary: A self-described doctor in biomedicine, Ana María Oliva, makes various false claims regarding the inaccuracy of PCRs, pH as a determing factor for COVID, and that COVID deaths result from involuntary medical errors.

Title: Nein, Christian Drosten hat 2014 nicht gesagt, dass er PCR-Tests für „untauglich“ halte
Narrative_Description: Claim that German doctor Christian Drosten defined PCR tests as "unreliable" in a 2014 interview
Motive_Description: Discredit the validity of PCR tests, and therefore of the official coronavirus statistics, downplaying the severity of the epidemic
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Christian Drosten, PCR test
Summary: German website "Info-Direkt" released the news that famous German doctor Christian Drosten had defined PCR tests "unreliable" in an interview in 2014. The doctor had never made such a claim

Title: Privater „Demosanitäter“ verbreitet unbelegte Aussagen über Verletzte bei Corona-Protest in Berlin
Narrative_Description: Video of a man dressed as a paramedic, claiming he witnessed about 40 people being injoured and 7 seriously injured during a rally held in Berlin to protest against Covid restrictions
Motive_Description: Discredit German police forces and the German government for supposedly repressing protests against Covid restrictions
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, rally, injured, seriously, paramedic, Berlin
Summary: A video went viral on YouTube and Telegram in Germany: it showed a man dressed like a paramedic, claiming he had witnessed about 40 people being injured and 7 seriously injured during a rally against Covid restrictions held in Berlin. However, such figures were invented and the man was not even an actual paramedic.

Title: Nein, Georg Nüßlein hat nicht bestätigt, dass das dritte Bevölkerungsschutzgesetz zur Einführung einer Impfpflicht gedacht war
Narrative_Description: Video of Georg Nüßlein (deputy chairman of the CDU/CSU parliamentary group in the German Bundestag) supposedly claiming that a law passed by Parliament had made vaccination mandatory
Motive_Description: Attack the German government by suggesting it had made vaccination mandatory by law
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Bundestag, Georg Nüßlei, CDU/CSU, mandatory, vaccination, law
Summary: A video of Georg Nüßlein (deputy chairman of the CDU/CSU parliamentary group in the German Bundestag) discussing a law in Parliament was edited in a way that it made it seem like he was saying mandatory vaccination had been introduced by law in Germany. The video went viral and was believed to be true by many, despite no mandatory vaccination was ever introduced

Title: Vergleich von Todesfällen durch Covid-19 mit Krankenhauskeimen oder Behandlungsfehlern ist irreführend
Narrative_Description: Claim that the mortality rate from Covid-19 is actually lower than that caused by "hospital malpractice" and "hospital germs"
Motive_Description: Suggest the virus is low consequence

Summary: A picture circulating on facebook in Germany suggested that more people died of "hospital malpractice" or "hospital germs" than of Covid-19. The comparison is baseless as there are no reliable estimates of the numbers quoted, and is aimed at downplaying the severity of the epidemic

Title: Video irreführend geschnitten: Nein, Jens Spahn kündigte keine Geldstrafe von 25.000 Euro für Nicht-Geimpfte an

Summary: A video of German Minister of Health Jens Spahn was edited in a way that made it seem like he was claiming a fine of 25000 had been established for those who refused to receive the coronavirus vaccine

Title: Nein, die IHK Köln hat im November keinen Empfang für 250 Gäste mit Jens Spahn veranstaltet
Narrative_Description: Claim that the Chamber of Commerce of Cologne held a reception with Jens Spahn in November 2020, without complying with the distance regulation
Motive_Description: Discredit German Minister of Health Jens Spahn for supposedly violating the social distancing measures he implemented himself
Key_Words: Coronavirus, Germany, Jens Spahn, COlogne, Chamber of Commerce, reception, violate, social distancing
Summary: A newspaper article dating back to January 2020 was manipulated and pushed on social Mediain Germany again in November, to claim that the Chamber of Commerce of Cologne had held a reception with Jens Spahn in November 2020, without complying with the distance regulation

Title: Übersterblichkeit: Nein, diese Studie belegt nicht, dass 45 Prozent der zusätzlichen Todesfälle durch den „Lockdown“ verursacht wurden
Narrative_Description: Claim that 45% of the excess mortality during the coronavirus epidemic was due to the implementation of lockdown measures, rather than to the virus itself
Motive_Description: Suggest the virus is low consequence, while it was lockdown measures that caused a significant share of the deaths during the epidemic

Summary: A German news website misreported a research carried out in Baden-Württemberg, claiming the results of the study had established that a big share of excess mortality during the epidemic (45%) had actually been caused by lockdown measures

Title: No, la vicepresidenta de Venezuela, Delcy Rodríguez, no ha dicho en un vídeo que se va a «pausar» el coronavirus en su país
Narrative_Description: The virus could be temporarily paused

Summary: A recording of the vicepresident of Venezuela has been altered to suggest that when meeting in Russia over the Sputnik vaccine that she had mentioned pausing the virus.

Title: No, ni las comunidades autónomas ni los hospitales reciben 2.500 euros cada vez que un paciente da positivo en COVID-19 en una prueba PCR como dice este vídeo
Narrative_Description: Each time that someone is diagnosed with COVID a autonomous government receivews 2500 euros.

Summary: A conspriacy theorist alleges that patients staying in the hosptial for COVID or receiving PCR tests generate significant profits the autonomous regions. However, such costs are not accurate.

Title: ｢WHOが方向転換『感染者の隔離は不要』｣は誤り

Motive_Description: Discredit WHO organization for changing their directives to not isolating infected COVID individuals

Title: 安倍首相、国会も出ずに昭恵夫人と日曜大工？ ネットで拡散の動画に注意
Narrative_Description: Video spreads that Prime Minster Shinzo Abe did a DIY project without wearing a mask and encouraged people that if they do not want to follow coronavirus protocols then they should resign

Key_Words: Coronavirus, Prime Minister Abe, DIY, masks
Summary: A video on twitter claimed that Prime Minister Shinzo Abe and Mrs. Akie enjoyed a do-it-yourself project without wearing a mask and captions "If you want to live a mediocre life without corona measures and without going to the Diet, you should resign."

Title: 中国国旗を掲げる人たちの動画を引用し「このような方達が入国可能に」拡散した投稿はミスリード
Narrative_Description: Video spreads showing people holding Chinese flag and claiming that from today, 88,000 people like this can enter Japan due to immigration easing.
Motive_Description: Claiming that Chinese people can enter Japan since Japan eased their immigration borders
Summary: Video shows people raising the Chinese flag and saying "These people can enter the country"

Title: ｢FAXの制約で東京都内の感染者数は1日300人を超えない｣との情報は誤り 中国で拡散
Narrative_Description: Chinese SNS message claims that the number of newly infected people in Tokyo does not exceed 300 per day due to fax function restrictions
Motive_Description: Claims that the number of people infected with coronavirus does not exceed 300 in Tokyo due to fax restrictions
Summary: Chinese SNS weibo posts spread information that "the number of infected people in Tokyo does not exceed 300 people a day due to fax restrictions"

Title: 大阪の重症者増の理由は｢早めに気管切開し､人工呼吸器をつけている｣
Narrative_Description: Video shows Governor Hirofumi Yoshimura claiming that the number of severely injured new corona in Osaka Prefecture increased, so they wanted to reduce the death toll as much as possible and performed a tracheostomy as soon as possible
Motive_Description: Claims that early tracheostomy and ventilators were used to reduce the number of cases in Osaka
Summary: Claims that the reason for the increase in the number of seriously ill people in Osaka is "early tracheostomy and ventilator" enforced by Governor Hirofumi Yoshimura

Title: Es falso que en Alemania ya no haya camas disponibles para atender a víctimas de COVID
Narrative_Description: An image in which Mexico is compared with Germany, ensuring that in the latter  they no longer have beds for covid patients, while in the former no one has lacked a hospital bed.
Motive_Description: Claims that Germany is underprepared for the pandemic
Summary: An image shows that Mexico has more available beds than Germany, which as of November 24th was not true. 21% of hospital beds were still available.

Title: Es falso que el tapabocas cultive hongos y bacterias que bloquean el oxígeno y provocan neumonía
Narrative_Description: Masks develop fungi and Other bacteria that prevent oxygen consumption and cause pneumonia.
Motive_Description: Claims that one of the most common prevention mechanisms, the mask, is actually dangerous to decrease usage.
Summary: An image shows a man claiming that masks cause decreased oxygen intake,increased chances of getting pneumonia and that they breed fungi and Other bacteria.

Title: El Índice Nacional de Defunciones no está notificando menos muertes que en 2019
Narrative_Description: The number of deaths in 2020 decreased.
Motive_Description: Makes 2020 seem less severe with respect to virus related mortality
Summary: Misunderstanding the data, they could not be used for the pandemic as they are often lagged due to delayed data updates.

Title: No, no se están haciendo pruebas de coronavirus 'a cualquier voluntario que quiera hacérsela' en Motril (Granada) a fecha de 24/11/2020
Narrative_Description: Everyone would be given a PCR test to any volunteer that wanted one on the upcoming Sunday.

Summary: A news source falsely claimed that all the interested volunteers would be able to get tested due to increased availability.

Title: Fact Check: Searches For Vaccines For HIV, Cancer, The Cold And COVID-19 Each Present Distinct Challenges
Narrative_Description: Claims the Covid vaccine came out to fast, compare to vaccines for HIV, cancer and the common cold

Motive_Description: Have people believe China will halt all shipments.
Summary: A whatsapp chain claiming that China will halt all shipments until March of 2020 because they may contain the virus, and that they will resume shipments by May or June. This is not true because the virus may only be passed from animals to person or person to person, and it can only stay on surfaces for up to 24 hours.  Additionaly, there was no evidence that the Chinese government had stopped shipments due to it containing Coronavirus particles.

Title: Chá de erva doce e coronavírus - É FAKE NEWS!

Title: Coronavírus vem do morcego - É FAKE NEWS!

Title: Coronavírus pode ser curado com tigela de água de alho recém-fervida - É FAKE NEWS!

Title: E-mail com informações de que chá de erva doce cura coronavírus - É FAKE NEWS!

Title: Coronavírus veio dos animais - É FAKE NEWS!

Title: Utilizar álcool em gel nas mãos para prevenir coronavírus altera bafômetro nas blitz - É FAKE NEWS!

Summary: A video of a person explaining that using hand sanitizer would affect the readings of an alcohol breath test. While inhalation of hand sanitizer's fumes do affect the readings of a ABT, they would be back to normal after 2 minutes. Additionally, the police do not use the kind of device shown in the video to measure alcohol concentration.

Title: Vitamina C cura coronavírus, que veio dos animais, e água com limão que cura câncer

Title: Caso de coronavírus confirmado no Piauí - É FAKE NEWS!
